I’m wondering are they going to take the movies and shows off, because if they are I’m going to be highly disappointed I want to keep these movies and shows for the times I want to rewatch them. But know that I found out there is a time limit I’m a bit upset. 

Especially ‘Wonder Woman’, and ‘Us’. Can you please answer back to my review to explain some things a bit clearer than before.

title: WOW 🤯😍
review:
I recently resubscribed to HBONow. And let me say that the transition from Now to Max has been so seamless and so smooth that you couldn’t ask for anything better. 

I love the “HUBS” feature and look forward to more of them for content that can be grouped. I also love the addition of all the classics like Yogi and Scooby-Doo and The Jetsons(!!!??) which I had no clue would be on here! 

So far, from what I’ve browsed and used of the interface, I’m extremely impressed with what WB/HBO/AT&T have put together with this. I can’t wait for more content and most importantly: THE SNYDER CUT.

title: App terrible since today
review:
Barely works. I watch one episode and it’s just stuck on loading. Reinstalled. Rebooted phone. Removed sim the whole nine yards. Nothing. App is terrible on iPhone as of late. This isn’t the first time this has been happening.

I can’t see the develop response. But I’ll say after restarting my phone it worked. But it still happens. There’s an issue with playback and after leaving the app it does fully reopen to the episode it was on. But if you guys allowed backup app data to run I wouldn’t have to wait 2 minutes. Or the 6 minutes it takes me turn my phone off and on. Please help.

title: Solid streaming app
review:
The newest of the HBO streaming app and it comes with plenty of stuff to. The studio Ghibli selection is one I enjoy, tho they could do with more choices as they only currently have a fraction of the movies. The app on the IPhone on the computer are easy to use and visually appealing. They currently still support Now and Go however I would imagine they will eventually discontinue these as if you have GO you have Max  as well and possibly offer Max with adds for the price of now. 

Overall Solid streaming platform.

title: Well Done HBO!
review:
First off, this app was well worth the wait! Being someone who is invested in the Apple Ecosystem, the application works amazingly on Apple TV.

I can enjoy the cartoons that I watched as a kid and so much more. I get this free through my cable subscription and had no issues getting it to work.

Ignore the people complaining that there's no support for Roku or Firestick. It takes time to roll out to multiple platforms. Also, the lack of 4K is not an issue. The platform just launched today, so I am sure that 4K content is in the pipeline.

title: Potential, but
review:
The app for the most part is decent. I have two technical issues with it. 
1) How do you turn auto play off. If there’s not a way yet it needs to be added ASAP. 
2) Like with HBO GO before it, the app has a tendency to drag when loading content. I used to think it was my connection but it’s not. 

Regarding content, for the price point I would have expected more content accessibility for the sister channels to be there. It makes it more compelling to keep if you know you can have a favorite niche content access and broader content overall. HBOMAX has the potential to be great but it has a way to go.

title: Glitches galore
review:
I love that I can watch Friends again, but is it worth it on an app this undeveloped? It’s only available on mobile devices and can only cast to some other screens, but it can’t be downloaded on fire stick, roku, or smart TV’s. The shows glitch and buffer a lot, sound quality is poor, AND THERES no way to skip thru the intro like Netflix does. 

It’s definitely NOT worth the $15/month price tag. It looks, feels, and behaves more like a free app. Also that price is way too high to still have to sit thru commercials. Probably going to cancel my subscription unless they update it and make it downloadable on all steaming devices and as well as better sound and video quality.

title: Great App, Subtitles Don’t Work
review: I just want to say that the content on this app is absolutely amazing. So many movies and shows I’ve always wanted to see or never had the chance, or shows I wanted to see again that just disappeared (oh god how I missed Doctor Who). But, subtitles stopped working. They worked in the beginning, but then one day they just weren’t showing up. I had subtitles on. I tried closing out and going back in. Turning subtitles off and on. This app is amazing, but I kinda need subtitles to help me understand what’s happening over the sound of my chewing.

title: Love the content, hate the user experience
review: HBO has the best programming around, but what good is it if you can’t manage it or find it?  It’s also very pricey and would be nice if the app maximized you’re ability to enjoy it. Simply put, I don’t understand this user interface and it seems like a big step back from HBO Go.  There’s no ability to organize your preferences, no watchlists, no individual profiles, no way to set reminders for upcoming programs (based on trailers offered in advance).  They have a long way to go to catch up to the UX being offered by other streaming services, but I’m confident they can do it with some effort!

title: Yep, content is solid, needs some updates.
review: My biggest peeve with the computer/internet version is that when I put my shows on, I have to click it back into full-screen between every episode. I love to watch cartoons like South Park and Adventure Time (Adventure Time episodes are only 15 minutes) I set my computer up to my TV via HMDI and all is great except getting up every 15 minutes to put the next episode on full-screen. If you all could figure out how to just leave a show you are watching on full-screen because you are still watching it.. that would be amazing. I would easily rate 4-5 stars.

title: Horrible Interface
review: I was excited for HBOMax to launch due to the new shows however, I’d gladly give up content for a platform that actually works. The sign on process just didn’t work. After typing in the password I had to trick it into actually submitting by hitting sign in and not done as that would grey out the sign in button. Then it told me to subscribe when I’m already a subscriber. I had to click a few declines only to be allowed to log into my own account. Then I had to select my profile multiple times. In addition the chrome cast just does not work... this is by far the largest flop for a platform ever. You had so much time to make this work and fix the bugs before the release. Hopefully an update is soon to follow!

title: It needs some work
review: I’m excited for this app and what I’m sure they will do with it.(Syndercut)  Unfortunately right now it needs a lot of work. You can’t continue watching anything you’ve started without it restarting back at the beginning. One of my other huge issues with the app is that when you download a show it still uses data which defeats the purpose of downloading the show from the start. That being said I know that this app just came out so I’m sure they’ll fix this issues soon. I’m also very excited for the different plans that I’ve read AT&T has for this app going forward.

title: Absolute trash
review:
DO NOT SUBSCRIBE TO THIS SERVICE. 
The customer service is absolutely trash. The fact my smart tv doesn’t support it was annoying enough. I got over that but then a lot of content I was hoping for was missing... or incomplete...for 15 dollars a month that’s inexcusable. The straw that broke the camels back  was how quickly they cancelled my subscription after my debit card got hacked and cancelled.  I literally had 12 hours to put a new card on the account. I could have accomplished this but they since they contacted me by email on a Saturday night I was unaware it was even an issue. They took away my promotional pricing and just said tough.  This has got to be the worst streaming service I’ve experienced yet, for the highest price. Makes no sense.

title: The content is good, but the app is a huge disappointment
review: I like the content, but the app needs a lot of work. On my iPad, content will stream for a few minutes, but then routinely dies into a cycle of ceaseless buffering (I don’t experience this on other streaming services). I’ve found that the only solution is to download the content to my device. However, the app spontaneously deletes my unwatched downloads every few days, so I have to waste bandwidth to redownload whatever I happen to want to watch—and that necessitates planning ahead, which is counter to the concept of on-demand. Really frustrating!

title: Responsive developers/support
review:
I received a developer update through email that this problem should be resolved - and they’re right! Working again! 5 stars for responsiveness as well as content. Thanks!

(Previously) While I am obviously online with a valid connection, my HBO Max app has been reporting “you’re offline” for three days now. All other apps working fine. Rebooting my ipad, updating the app, etc, have not helped. Disappointed in the fragility of this app. Netflix working great, though!

title: So Disappointed
review: HBO shows are worth more than to be on this app! The app on a TV is slow, on my iPhone 11 it gets hot, all while offering ZERO features. There is no “15 second” ff or rewind, no FAST ff or rewind option, no way to “restart” and episode FROM the actual episode, the “continue watching menu” is ONLY the episode (you can not access the shows main page or any thing other than THAT ONE episode), there is VERY LITTLE info on shows/movie, no actors or cast listed, and no intuitive recommendations or even “more like this” listed. Oh, and I haven’t mentioned the crashing, at least once a day, always when using captions. ANY streaming app is easier to navigate and use, and this one COSTS MORE THAN ANY APP! So bummed out. The old HBO app funtioned better.

title: Cost is way too much for an App that doesn’t include all content
review: I have the same  complaints others are sharing, but I would also like to add that the App shouldn’t have been released until ALL contracts are signed with companies.  Because of the rush to get this out, I can’t watch this $15 a month App on my fire stick.   MAX includes all shows and my HBONow is limited still.  I subscribed to this for Friends and other specific shows and now realize the app cannot  been added to my fire stick or the Roku device because the greedy companies can’t come to a decision on their costs they want to pay or be paid.  You shouldn’t be charging the consumer your high-price if you aren’t able to supply the full product.

title: Can’t watch downloaded shows offline!
review:
Please tell me the point of downloading shows (or movies or whatever) to my iPad if it won’t let me play the stuff when I’m not connected to the internet? I open the app, go to downloads, and I get a message that I’m offline, and should check the connection. There is no way to watch. Seriously? I KNOW I’M OFFLINE, that’s why I downloaded the media ahead of time! If you don’t want people to be able to view content offline, don’t offer a download option. BIG FAIL. 

My second big complaint is the same as a lot of reviews: I can’t select a different episode from the “continue watching” screen. Moderately big fail.

title: Frustrated
review:
I have never been so frustrated with a streaming app.  I have yet to watch anything without constant buffering, my internet is a fairly consistent 7.0 Mbps dL speed.  I have been (attempting) to stream it on my PS4 but constant buffering makes it impossible. I have deleted the app and installed it again and nothing changes.  Maybe there will be an update to fix this on the coming days or I won’t make it past the 7 day free trial.

I have a consistent 7.0 Mbps DL, the app seems to work well on my I phone however with the PS 4 app it does not work properly and I get consistent buffering.  All other streaming apps work just fine on my PS4, this problem only persists with the HBO Max app

title: Where are the movies going??
review: What’s incredibly frustrating about this app, that I’ve noticed, is the fact that you’re taking a gamble whether or not they have a certain movie or series. For example, the movie “Elf”. I know you’re app has it because I’ve added it to my list but now every time I go in to watch the movie it’s taken out of my list. And when I go to search up the movie title nothing shows up. This is frustrating for someone who just wants to watch a movie they KNOW you have. I’m fine with the app, it’s okay, but sometimes I want to watch a Christmas movie and I should be given the ability to do so when I know you have the movie.

title: Amazing content, really bad app..
review: I love all the content this app has.. I’m a fan of a lot of the movies and shows the app has available to stream.. but the app is crap.. I honestly think they spent very little time at making it a good streaming app.. I keep going to the app store constantly to see if they put out a newer version.. the main problem I have with the app is that it buffers, ALL THE TIME!!! No matter what I’m watching.. And if that weren’t enough, it shows an error message on the screen and prevents me from casting anything.. I really hope these issues can be fixed because I really enjoy the content and I’m paying to watch it.. it’s getting ridiculous..

title: Thank God I didn’t Pay for This
review: The app works fine on my iPhone XR.  When I try to stream it through Chromecast or Apple TV though, I get a message saying “there was a problem decrypting this video, please try again later.”  When I got to stream movies or episodes, the trailer part of it plays fine.  As soon as it’s time for the feature film there is an issue.  I thought the issue was being caused by needing a software update on my phone.  No.  Update the Chromecast maybe?  Still won’t work.  I’m very disappointed.  I have no issues streaming any other app through Chromecast.  I’m getting a headache trying to get this thing to work and it’s just not worth it.

title: Watered Down
review: It has a few shows I would normally pay for HBO for(which there are not enough of now- I almost just subscribed but here is why not) but I was curious to the “Hubs” they offer of other networks. The hubs are watered down versions of the actual channels and do not have all(or even half) of the programs those hubs have to offer. If the DC and Crunchyroll catalogues were complete I would sign up but I’m already paying for them and you do not offer all the shows I watch or enjoy on that network.  When you step your library I might pay $15 for this, but as it stands now, just know what you’re getting before subscribing if you are attracted to the hubs.

title: Good app, broken voice search
review: It’s a good app. I can turn on/off subtitles without pulling down a menu. I appreciate the Just Added/Last Chance/Coming Soon sections. I appreciate that it doesn’t try to skip intros and credits. There’s plenty to watch. The only problems I’ve seen are a few movies that left that weren’t in the Last Chance section, and voice dictation for search doesn’t work on the AppleTV or iPad. On the iPad (model MP2H2LL/A, iOS 13.5.1, HBO Max ver. 50.2) dictation gives results, but it causes an error message, with no option but to restart the app.

title: HBO plus a fantastic selection of grade A classics
review:
Really impressed with Max. The UI is modern and smooth. The complaints I had with Now have all been taken care of. The selection of classic films, both from Warner and Criterion is spectacular. 

The only letdown is that there is no 4K DV/HDR and Atmos support at launch which is disappointing but it’s easy to look past this given the quality of the content here. Hopefully it won’t take too long for titles such as GoT, Westworld and recent films to be upgraded considering that 4K HDR transfers already exist.

title: This app needs some serious updates!
review: I would like to give kudos to the amount of content on the app. However, the experience of browsing is terrible. First the app doesn’t actually work well with Apple TV. When you add a show on up next not only does it not stay updated but it keeps trying to force me to use HBO GO (which is not on my Apple TV at all). Secondly, it really is hard to navigate. Trying to find a search button 👀 seems nearly impossible. Content is layed out to show what THEY want you to see first, not the content that you’ve already watched and want to continue to watch. 2 stars I told all this craziness can get refigured out.

title: Necessary but could be better
review:
I need this platform to access Sesame Street for my little one and discovered other series I enjoy, such as South Park and Doctor Who.

My main complaint is the captions, whether on the app or the tv, just do not work after one episode. For someone who is hard of hearing and prefers captions over volume this is a huge disappointment. Exiting out of the episode and going back in does not work, you have to exit the app completely and then return to the episode each time for the captions to return.

title: Max streaming
review: Nice work I’m so happy that HBO has joined the App world. Please note that there are some bugs. I was downloading a show to watch later off line. However once I started watching if I had to pause it or got interrupted by a call. Once I returned to the current show to continue. It would start over from the beginning of the show and not where I left off. I do like the option to download and watch later great job. If possible the streaming warning that comes up before view is it possible the have that agreement only once not every time you open the show or shows?

title: Was good until....
review: Was good until it updated to MAX now it says  it’s unavailable for my provider, but if I start a free 7 day trail it allows me to stream. So ridiculous, after paying for a full month already, I would have to cancel and re start back up again just to get the app to work. Tried contact HBO to trouble shoot and fix it but couldn’t get through ANY of their contact us links. Very unsatisfied. I only signed up for HBO NOW so I could get MAX when it debuted, I’ll probably just cancel it all in the end since I can’t access even HBO NOW anymore since it’s updated to MAX. What a waste of money.

title: Love the Library, Needs to be organized a lot better
review:
This is movie and content heaven. But navigating the app is very difficult. It would be nice if they organized their catalogue the way Disney+ has it organized by into different sections. I know if you scroll down to the bottom you can do that, but it makes navigating so much easier if it’s at the top. 
Also, the one thing that would make the app perfect is having a voice search function in their Apple TV app. Instead of typing out each there, this would make it so much easier. And lastly, switching between pages takes too long. Please make the animation faster.

title: Issues
review: Seems pretty buggy currently, sometimes it auto signs me out. This time it signed me out and when I was trying to sign in it says the app is having issues at this time I go to hit restore purchase and it somehow miraculously signed me in (without being prompted to enter credentials).Now I’m trying to download a couple of movies for my plane ride and I’ll click the download button it will flash and showed queued then immediately show the option to download again thus repeating the process. I’ve deleted the app and re-installed to see if that helped nothing does.

title: I love the content, but offline downloading is poor
review: I’ve tried multiple times downloading episodes and it works great in one go while app is running, but as soon as you close the app while it’s still downloading it’s either dropped from your queue or all progress is erased. This needs to be fixed. For Last Chance listing, a date of expiration would be helpful, and movie selection pages would benefit from a continue button. Continue Watching would also be helpful if it brought you to the listing page or season list instead of auto play instead of having to scroll and find the show again

title: HBO Max is not ready for prime time
review:
With all the hype and lead time to develop a quality experience, they dropped the ball on this one. The biggest draw for me was the ability to download programs for viewing offline, something HBOGO lacked but other streaming services offered. 

I downloaded several programs. Some won’t play at all. Others pause for no reason. You can’t resume from where you left off. And worst of all, several times it wouldn’t load downloaded programs without an internet connection. That is the ONLY point of downloading anything! 

I know it’s new, but AT&T’s (parent company) track record with video services tells me they won’t be in any hurry to correct these issues.

title: Great but where are the other languages?
review: This is worth the money. We this during quite time because we all had the virus and couldn’t go anywhere: we’re still trying to isolate as much as possible. There are tons more shows and the Harry Potter movies?! It is unfortunate that there are no other languages available, not even subtitles. That’s one thing Netflix has over this. I know they had Game of Thrones in Spanish at some point because my dad watched it. But now he can’t rewatch it the same way. I hope they update this so we can keep it even after this is all over.

title: downloads
review: i download daily shows/movies to watch on my morning 2 hour commute. netflix is my “go to” for episodes, but HBO is preferable. But i cannot re enter a movie or tv show i download once i pause it to answer a call or check other apps! I get a notice that my connection is offline or unable to connect pops up. I don't have the pleasure of always using my at&t’s slow service for my shows. Is there a way around this that i am missing? HBO MAX is the only app that kicks me out until internet is turned back on. I see nothing in the trouble shooting.

title: It is ok
review: HBO max has a wide range of shows and movies to watch but it is a hassle to watch them. It takes two minutes to load onto the app and to click on shows . You also cannot skip intros to shows like Netflix has, you have to do it yourself. Fast forwarding is also a hassle and you have one set speed for it . It takes a minute to go 10 minutes ahead. The app lags even though I would use other streaming apps and it would work perfectly fine so I believe it is the app itself. The layout is also a bit challenging too.

title: It's great! Just some questions.
review:
I really love HBO Max, unfortunately I can't figure out how to get it on my TV. Except the thing is, my account is set on age 8; that means I can't watch some Harry Potter or Justice League movies even though I've already seen them. HBO Max is a great source in finding shows and movies, just it doesn't have very good ones.

Questions/Suggestions: Is Upside Down Magic coming to HBO Max and if it is when. Please add more Animal and Wildlife shows. Please add LEGO Ninjago Movie.

I hope this was helpful to some, also thank you if you read this review!

title: Great content terrible app
review: HBO is HBO and their content has always been great but for these people to make us get rid of the 17 apps they made us download and combine them in this one app that doesn’t have ANY of the features of the previous apps is down right stupid. You’ve been in the streaming app game for plenty of years and you don’t have auto play? No continue your series/ where you left off ( like the next episode is already loaded just press play)? No skip intro? No skip credits? No section for shows you’ve been watching ?  It annoying every time I try to use the app that I prefer to stream content using other services or watching HBO content via other sites  👀👀

title: Same as all others
review: Tv is dead and unlike how TV guides use to inform us what was up and coming or being cancelled these streaming services ones we have little to none of that. HBO puts things in there existing section like all other sites yet they do not tell you what will be in there, why or more importantly how long you have to enjoy it. With that said hbo is still really good with new content giving directors writers a platform to tell/show their stories. 1 Star for no details on the expecting of contracts and two for the contents given to those of us paying.

title: Great viewing options, bad app
review: I love the viewing options provided on this app as well as the layout and overall mapping of the app. My HUGE issue is that the app just doesn’t work well ... on any device. It constantly slows as if there are internet issues, but I have 150 mbps internet speed and only 3 devices connected. Another issue that I’ve encounter is that the show/movie will play without sound, resulting me in having to completely close the app and restart what I was watching. I found these issues on both the iPhone app and the Samsung TV app.

title: Doesn’t work all the time.
review: I loved it at first! I downloaded it to watch Game of Thrones and rarely had a problem. Setting up to my tv was a bit of a pain but I got it going. This app only works when it wants it to though. I have TERRIBLE WiFi connection but I can watch Netflix fine. The episodes buffer every 5 seconds and it is literally unwatchable. It’s frustrating. The ui (user interface) is slow and just clunky. Oh and it works only when it wants too remember! If you’re considering paying for this, wait a little until they fix what’s wrong. There’s plenty of other reviews just like this and i hope this helps make your mind up. This will be my last month.

title: Good, but could be Better
review: I pre-ordered this over a month ago and have been excited about this service for a while.  The amount of content here is staggering, with a not-very-impressive DC library (not a single Superman flick at launch? Seriously?). If WB found a way to put their heads together and integrate DC Universe’s content (which I pre-ordered and currently subscribe to) with HBO Max, I would legitimately drop all of my other streaming services.  Figure out what’s happening with DC Universe, then I’d be thrilled to come back and give this service 5 stars.

title: Won’t play downloads. What’s the point?!
review: For me it happened after iOS 14, but my boyfriend experienced this maybe a month before then. I download shows and movies so I can play them offline. I mirror my phone to the TV through hdmi cable  connected to an apple brand adapter and everything works fine up until I click play a downloaded video. The odd thing is sound will play but the screen will go black, it won’t even show hbo app after I click play. No other streaming app has done this so far. Other apps play downloaded content fine and I’m able to mirror them to the tv without a problem. This is the main use of the app I have. Please fix this.

title: Who designed this?
review: Just like the regular HBO app, it’s trash. Can’t easily navigate back and forth or fast forward. All to often you hit back or just try to click a description to read it but it plays instead. When you click back and back again to see the other search options, it acts like you have to start all over. I mean, someone designed this and then someone approved this! I hope they are in the unemployment line soon, because this is pure garbage just like the original app. If the content was so amazing, I would have ditched this crap long ago, but HBO makes the best shows and movies around.

title: Lacks Language variety
review:
I like how much content there is, but I’m very disappointed that there are no dubbed versions of movies. Although I am knowledgeable on the English language, my family only speaks spanish. If I where to watch a movie with them, they wouldn’t understand anything, and there’s no fun in that. I know there’s a “Latino” category. And you’d think “maybe there’s dubbed versions of movies in that category” but no, it’s just a small corner filled with Hispanic movies. 

I’m pretty sure y’all have the choice to make dubbed or AT LEAST subtitle versions of different languages, I’m just disappointed that you chose to stick with english only.

title: Good app, needs improvement.
review: It seems streaming is the default setting even with downloaded videos.  In order to watch downloaded videos I had to switch to offline mode otherwise I get a message telling me to find wifi or change my settings to stream over cellular. Anyway, when I put my phone in offline mode, the downloaded videos work play just fine. It’s not a “huge” inconvenience to put my phone offline to watch downloads, but it is an inconvenience.

title: Confusing Sign In Experience From Apple TV Channels
review:
It is confusing to figure out how to sign in and use your Apple TV Channels HBO account to access HBO Max. The sign in page is buried under TV providers. Once you start the sign in flow the forms do not interact well with the iPad keyboard. For example, they do not auto populate with your Apple ID and password and the keyboard is constantly dismissing on each field, which makes for a painful sign in process.

Then I’m forced to create an HBO Max account when I’ve already signed in with my Apple account. Why?

Please make the sign in process easier!

title: Hijacked
review:
They changed their app, and now I cannot access HBO, I cannot access my account, I cannot cancel HBO, AND I CANNOT GET A RESPONSE FROM MY REQUEST FOR HELP AND TO  DISCONTINUE HBO. I’m so disgusted with these arrogant people who seem to have total disregard for their customers. I use an iPad and if they didn’t know whether their ‘new’ system would work, they should never have pushed it out to the public. I know this will be hidden and no one will see it, but here it is anyway.   

UPDATE:  reloaded HBOMAX to try again. Sure enough a few shows came up but would not allow me access eve after I signed in. Told me it was not supported on my device. SO WHY HAVE YOU LOCKED MY DEVICE INTO THIS ‘NEW’ APP WHILE TELLING ME TO USE THE HBP NOW APP?  Are you really THAT STUPID?

title: Good Content. Video Issues
review: I’ve had some troubles watching the videos because of my problem with the captions. I like all the content you have in the app, but I’m practicing my English and I still can’t watch the videos without subtitles, that’s why even though I like the app so much I can’t watch the videos cause’ I don’t understand them at all. I really need your help to fix this because if I can’t fix it at the end of the next month unfortunately I’ll have to unsubscribe of the app. I really don’t want to. I hope you can help me with this.

title: Wow, such junk
review: Well thanks for taking yourself off of my streaming platform without any notice. I only find this out after 15 minutes of trying to just get to the sign in page. I can’t believe that the hbo website can’t even make a link on the page that’s supposed to help you sign in. Instead I had to read through a bunch of jumbled nonsense of directions trying to tell me what will and won’t work. Oh well, I only liked you for John Oliver anyways, I can find a stream somewhere online and save myself some money and the headache of dealing with a company that is out of touch with their customers. Ending of GOT blew anyways, your company deserves to lose customers.

title: ATT login not recognized
review: What good is Day 1 access if I get told “can’t verify login”? Went through all the steps including refreshing cache and resetting password, HBO Max still says it can’t verify my account through ATT wireless. My ATT TV login for free HBO still works but I can’t access HBO Max using the same login info. Called ATT and confirmed my unlimited data has it included. Stayed on hold for an ATT tech rep for 40 minutes. Never reached a live person so I gave up trying to get this resolved. I took a screen shot of my current plan on ATT which states clear as day “HBO Max Included” just in case they try any funny business. With all the emails and texts I received stating I would have access on Day 1, this crap is pure BS!

title: Typical Streaming Playform
review:
Typical streaming platform.  Lots of black, user friendly.  Only let’s you have 5 user accounts.  Adult accounts and child accounts.  Child accounts have ability to choose movie and tv ratings, with PIN lock to switch accounts.
I couldn’t sign in with my DirecTV account on the app until I first completed the sign up on a desktop and refreshed the app on my phone.
Seems as reliable as other streaming apps so far.  I like it and look forward to viewing more content.

title: Not user friendly
review: It’s very annoying to have to search a show to go back episodes of the show I’m currently on. It freezes/buffers a lot so working on that issue now. Also having to stream from my phone causes issues of it not always mirroring if I walk away with my phone and come back. It may have kept playing and my phone is no longer on the same page or responsive so I have to disconnect and close out everything and start again. Sometimes a few times. I like the selection they have, but buffering over 20 times in a 22 min show is pretty lousy.

title: AirPlay erratic
review: I have to use this app to watch HBO Max via AirPlay on a 2020 Vizio TV because there is no HBO Max app available for the TV. AirPlay works fine for other apps on my iPad, but it is erratic with the  HBO Max app. I successfully watched a few episodes of “Raised by Wolves” yesterday, but today it does not work for other episodes of that series. Yet I can watch the film “Dirty War”.  “An Angel on My Shoulder” worked the first time I tried it, but now will not play. “Young Sheldon” played successfully when I first attempted to watch, but won’t work a few minutes later.  I have no problems with content from the Apple TV app playing via AirPlay on the same TV.

title: No app for tv
review: Great content but app won’t stream to tv. Tried mirroring, casting, and Airplay. It worked once and then hasn’t worked since. App is updated. Tried deleting and reinstalling. Still get same issue. All other video apps work as expected except this HBO Max app which requires to Airplay/cast to watch on tv. By having it continually error, I’m stuck watching on small screens. Tried on iPhone 11Pro, iPad 6th gen, 4K Apple TV and get same results with same failure. All powercycled, same network, all updated, etc. Once it can stream again and not give errors, it will be more enjoyable. Please fix or advise of other way to resolve.

title: The Way a Modern App Should Be
review:
The new HBO Max update was much needed. Prior to the big update, trying to navigate HBO Now was an absolute nightmare on Apple TV and iOS. You were better off using the Apple TV app to find and continue shows on HBO. This update fixes the spotty user experience and I’m proud of Warner to fix it.

The content is so much more worth the asking subscription price. $14-$15 to watch Game of Thrones, Succession, all the old Batman movies, and best of all... SAMURAI JACK?? Definitely worth it. Thanks Warner!

title: Love the content hate the layout
review: I biggest issue on iPhone so far is I have to reach all the way up to hit the arrow to go back.  Also I click on something to find more details and go back it takes me back to the beginning of the list vs keep me where it was. Also would love a better system for finding shows. Hbo content would be better if it wasn’t mixed in with everything else.  Maybe I’m still new to it, but I had hbo before this and I want to see the new stuff

title: Great but needs work
review: Love that I can watch friends and quite a few shows from my childhood, but they really need to fix the fact that it won’t stay full screen between episodes. I travel for work and watch on my laptop on my bedside all night long and it’s a bit annoying having to click the full screen button every episode. It’s been about 2 months and there still hasn’t been an update, I know there are bigger fish to fry, buuuttt I think I can speak for a lot of us when I say that we’d LOVE this small change.

title: Recent update is buggy
review:
The recent update introduced bugs that make using the app a pain:

Popping out the video stops it, and continuing to play is thereafter buggy and difficult to manage. The video should switch seamlessly between pop-out and full screen.

It is no longer possible to jump back from an episode to the entire series, there’s just no link to do this. Tapping the “left” button (with the series name on it) brings the user to the home screen, instead of the entire series. In the previous version, it was possible to tap the “Sxx Eyy” link above the episode title to go back to the show page, but this is no longer working.

title: Spoiler Alert!
review:
Honestly, I’m not a major fan of being forced to leave HBO Go, an app that I was using for 8 years, and having to transverse to another brand new, bug-filled, glitchy app, with more content than I asked for. 
That is what I was afraid of with HBO Max. 
But even worse, is that I feel like the descriptions of some of the movies, illustrates far too much information than is needed. I want a summary of the movie, not a detailed description of what happened! 
The summary of the movie, “A Perfect Murder” is a perfect example. 
I like the idea of HBO MAX, but I miss HBO Go, with the short and sweet movie summaries that draw me in instead of spoiling the whole thing.

title: Good Navigation but Poor Audio
review:
AppleTV app review.
I feel HBO Max has a lot of content to offer and is a fantastic upgrade from regular HBO. The navigation didn’t change too much with the switch to Max. But, compared to Netflix, the audio is horrible. I have to turn the volume up 20% higher compare to Netflix and even then the dynamic range isn’t that great. They need to stop doing their audio so compressed. If I have two movie choices of equal interest I usually pick something not on HBO Max due to the poor audio.

title: So mad with this app
review:
I’m so mad now to watch a movie I can use my data I have to use Wi-Fi why plus I have my TV connected I got the application in my TV and I cannot find the same movies in my TV just in my phone how is that even possible I even have updated the version on my TV I just hate this this is why I’ve been unsubscribed to a lot of applications because they start with all this dumb thing with Wi-Fi that is the reason why I got this app because I don’t have Wi-Fi in my home I live in the middle of nowhere do you people should realize that not everybody live in the city just waste my money this months for this......
Never leave bad reviews but right now I’m so upset with this..

title: Don't waste your money
review:
Every time I try to use this app on my TV, it either streams without sound or doesn't load at all. This was happening a while ago with game of thrones.. I could get it to work about 25% of days, the other 75% I had to go with Netflix. Now months later, trying to watch a show on here for the first time since then and what do you know! No sound and/or will not load. I am cancelling this terrible service and getting my money back. 

PS: no, it's nothing to do with my internet or TV. I have tried EVERYTHING other times this was happening. Just had to come back the next day and hope HBO was going to give you what you pay for.

title: Good Content, UI Poor, No MyList for Apple TV Device
review:
As the title indicates, HBO Max has great content, BUT the UI is clumsy at best and the functionality has has yet to come to maturity. I feel as though the app is somewhere between a beta and ready for release. 

My complaints about the UI and functionality is not different from those that have all ready been mentioned by many others about this app and subsequent feedback exchanged with developers. So, I won’t repeat them here with one exception.

Would like to point out the Apple TV app (Apple TV device, service accessed via DirecTV) does not have MyList. At the top of the screen: Browse, Search and Settings—no MyList. The iOS app has a MyList, but not the app for the Apple TV device. Hope that this will be remedied in the near future as I would rather not have to keep a written list of what I want to watch and then have to search for each program every time I use the app. 

Hoping the app will vastly improve in future.

title: User Interface Not Intuitive
review: Which makes me wonder why, because all they would have to do is take notes from Netflix and adapt it and make it better. Why on earth would you not be able to see all episodes from where you view one episode to easily switch to watch another? You have to go back like two screens. You’re telling me none of you seriously thought about that? How many people did this app go through that gave that the green light? I seriously didn’t even want to write this review because it gets me mad thinking that I’m doing their job. Get better.

title: Avail. on Apple TV, Fire TV, Nvidia Shield, iOS etc
review:
This has been available on all major platforms for awhile. It’s a growing but handful of new releases, with a few choice quality new additions to the “HBO NOW” content in an a slick streamlined interface. 
The win here is the quality of what’s on offer. It’s not a bunch of B movies overdubbed in English. It’s all considered top quality movies and tv. With the growing content of exclusives it’ll only get better. It’s only monthly. Try it yourself.

title: Great Shows Awful App
review:
I had previously used HBO Max on my smart TV and had few issues. The interface is ugly and clunky but I had no issues. 

The app has the same ugly and clunky interface but with a slew of issues. It takes 2x the bandwidth to stream a show as Netflix does. When Steaming from 4G I often have to give up on HBO and switch to Netflix. HBO does a bad job packaging the data. 

Additionally, downloading shows for later does not work. They often remove themselves from your library once downloaded or reset to 0% once they are fully downloaded. I spend a great deal of time away from internet so I like being able to download my shows for later. It’s not possible with HBO MAX. I have only ever been able to successfully download 1 episode of 1 show in the last month. 

The selection of shows is great and that is the only reason for 2 stars. 

The app is awful execution and is by far the worst of any streaming service.

title: Good service
review: It is a really good service that includes lots of movies and shows old and new. It movies such as the goonies, spongebob the movie, godzilla and the LEGO movie 2. I also enjoy the studio ghibli films on the service. I like the Cartoon Network section of hbo max,I just want more to be added. Also the Hanna Barbara catalog is good. It also has good shows like the Big Bang theory and we bare bears.  My only complaints is add the LEGO movie, the LEGO Batman movie, and the LEGO ninjago movie and they should add a section for Hanna barbera.

title: Family Sharing?
review:
Maybe I’m missing something, but I can’t find any information on how to enable family sharing with the Apple family service. My husband is paying for this service and I’d like to be able to watch stuff on my iPad, but it doesn’t seem to work? 
Bigger issue is lack of information and support content overall, I’ve spent 20 minutes looking and haven’t found anything from Apple or HBO on how to use/setup the app, just a lot of media articles.
Agree with other users, content is great, but interface is meh.

title: Apple TV app interactive problem
review: The Apple TV app’s interaction is a mess. The menu button’s mapping is different from any other app I used. You cannot resume playing by pressing Menu button when you’re swiping through the timeline. Also, how can each episode get its own page and can be add to watch list individually? It is so confusing. The subtitles of new episodes of Last week tonight with John Oliver are delayed in playback. And the search function on Apple TV is still completely broken! Who has time to scroll through 26 letters? We need dictation and being able to type on iPhone!

title: Great Company but buggy App
review:
I’ve been an HBO user for some time and I honestly think that for premium content they compare to none- I appreciate them for this but I think they’re let down by the app at least the iPhone version. I tried changing my password and it kept freezing. I can’t imagine that for a simple task as changing a password could be so frustrating, I checked and there wasn’t any update for it and that’s even more crazy. It’s a buggy app and it needs to be updated. 
Great content but the app needs work. Thanks

title: Disappointing all around.
review: Really wanted to like this, but there’s too many problems. First off the interface is horrible. The biggest sin would be the streaming quality. You can tell there’s much more compression and noise, audio cutting in and out with just plain HD. Just figured out that older movies don’t have the 5.1 track. Why is Batman in HD but with stereo? My old batman DVDs have a 5.1 track. Can’t even get the basics right. They advertised such a deep pool of content, well you can’t get that here. Want more DC? You have to subscribe to that. Want more anime, you have to subscribe to that. Expensive, low quality, shallow content, and they drove the guy that made great content over to AppleTV+.

title: Doesn’t work!
review:
Tried to watch 3 shows in the past month and each time it played a few minutes, paused a few times, then displayed a screen saying “Can’t play title.  We’re having trouble playing this video.  Please try again later.”

I tried.  Multiple times.  On various shows.  At different times.  On different days.  Monday at 1:30 in the afternoon HBO MAX won’t stream a movie.  A documentary on a weekend evening won’t play.  ABC works fine and I’m not even paying them anything!  Pay $20 a month, and HBO tells me I should want to watch sometime later, not now.

HBO MAX demonstrates exactly why streaming is such a bad idea.  This NEVER happens with DVDs or OTA television!

title: TV show never stops playing
review:
Love the app besides the fact that that my TV show continues to play all night. I wish HBO Max would update with the similar feature as Netflix where it asks if I want to continue watching. When this message would pop up it would be great because my show would stop playing and my iPad would turn off if I was asleep. Instead of waking up to it still playing in the middle of the night or morning and seeing future episodes. Please consider adding a feature like this. 

Thanks!

title: No longer works with chromecast
review: Title says it all. I own 3 chromecasts and have the same problem with all three. This is a recent development as it worked before. I can click the cast icon and the purple HBOmax screen comes up, but then the app won’t play anything I click on. It’s like the screen on my phone just doesn’t recognize I’m hitting the play button.  I can watch content on my phone and then click the cast icon and this also fails to play via TV. Since I use chromecast to watch HBOmax on my TVs I’ll probably just cancel my subscription. Hoping this gets fixed by the next update.

title: iPhone app great, PS4 not so much.
review: While I understand this is a review on the Apple App Store, this was the only way to provide feedback to HBO Max developers regarding the PS4 app. It is very laggy and I took a long time to add all movies to my list just to find out there’s no section on the user interface to expand the full list. So I only have access to view the 20ish most recent things I added. That is a problem that needs to be addressed.  Auto play next episode as well as skip intro would be amazing and is currently lacking on that interface.

title: I love the service, but now I can only watch on my iPad
review:
HBO decided they were going to save money and not put an app on a lot of devices, to include Roku (which is how I watched HBO Now on my TV).  According the their support pages, all Samsung SmartTV after 2016 should get the app, but my model is having mixed results (with it working for some people but not others).  HBO needs to get their act together and provide the same level of support they used to (and the same level of support their competitors provide) or else there is little reason to have the service.

The iOS app works fine, but there is no syncing between HBO Max and the devices still stuck on the older HBO Now.

title: Very good launch
review: This app has what I think is one of the better catalogues when it comes to streaming apps. It’s worked well the last fee hours and actually has profiles, unlike HBO Go and Now, which is a welcome change. I have one very minor complaint however, I think the video player needs to be updated to something resembling Netflix’s or Hulu’s where you can double tap to skip and rewind. All in all, a successful launch.

title: Amazing content. Terrible streaming.
review: Best content by far in a streaming service. The streaming itself, however, is frustratingly horrible. Can’t go longer than 5-10 minutes without it needing to buffer. On average it takes a solid 5 minutes to continue playing if you let it figure itself out. I’ve taken to hitting the 15 sec rewind, then pause and play. That seems to kickstart it. But it continues to happen. Makes watching things a task since I always have to be ready to nudge it along and can’t just sit back and enjoy. Hope it gets fixed with an update or something.

title: Requires New HBOMax Account
review: To be clear, I subscribe to HBO Max and have an account which I use on computer (though it doesn’t work in all browsers). When I open the app and tap Sign in with Provider, it takes me to the Create an Account page. If you do that, none of your saved shows or progress or settings are retained. They say you can link accounts, but they assume it’s easy and will always work flawlessly, which means it doesn’t work well at all. This, plus the segmentation of HBO into different services you have to buy? TV is back to the dark days of Cable. Except this time it’s going to be even more expensive and confusing.

title: Can’t get the basic functionality right!
review:
I don’t know who developed this app but they’re either underpaid and it shows or Warner Media is flushing money down the toilet on this developer. 
Here are my issues:
1. The app doesn’t work with cellular data even when it’s enabled. Keeps giving me the prompt to enable Cellular in video options. 
2. App doesn’t recognize the downloaded episodes and you need to actually go into the Downloads section to play a downloaded episode. 
3. Playback ends after playing each downloaded episode. You have to manually play the next downloaded episode and there’s no Autoplay for offline playback.

title: Your service is broken
review: How long has HBOMax existed? Several months now? You’d think a cash machine like HBO would be able to utilize technology that isn’t completely broke or at least they’d know how to fix it. But since launch this app is broken and doesn’t even work fifty percent of the time. It’s an exercise in frustration where it’s the most expensive streaming service where you pay to not watch anything because it doesn’t work at least half the time. Pull your heads out of your greedy corporate butts and deliver what we pay for, you miserable incompetent morons

title: Parental Controls Completely broken make it unusable
review:
Parental Controls broke so most content I pay for is inaccessible with “Title Blocked” and no prompting for the HBO Max Pin, the apple tv restriction pin , nothing... just blocked blocked blocked.
I have parental controls on my AppleTV setup to 12+ and I can watch hardly anything on this App because the parental controls are completely broke. It locks you out of all content and does not even provide a pin override even on “Max User” or  an adult profile setup in the app itself.. no way to get around it but completely disabling restrictions. 

This is NOT something I have to do in Netflix, Prime,  CBS or anything else for that matter.. if restricted content is accessed. 

Ive also made multiple reports of this on the Apple Feedback app and the developer has done nothing and it has been weeks. I wonder how many people have dropped HBO or had kids watching adult content on HBO due to this major bug.. so incredibly irritating the developers and HBO fail to act.

title: Horrible Interface
review: Such a glitchy app. They literary had the better part of a year to create this app and we get left with this garbage at $15 a month. Try adding a bunch of content to your List and then watch everything constantly disappear. Even better is when you re-add stuff, it don’t disappear, but only the most recent 10 “adds” show up. Then, when you click “see more” to view the rest of your content, the app recycles and takes you back to the home screen. So good luck having to remember all of your saved content. It’s a blast after a long exhausting day. Not that I’m surprised. AT&T owns HBO and they’ve always been garbage.

title: Best of HBO and more.
review:
I have to say when I download the app last week, I was very much impressed with all the content that was available.

I can watch the entire Studio Ghibli library as well as some of my favorite Cartoon Network show such as Steven Universe and We Bear Bears just to name a few.

However my only complaint is when I switch HDMI ports from my Apple TV to my cable box, when I switch back to my Apple TV, it automatically plays my show where it left off without touching my remote.

I don’t know if this is a glitch that others are experiencing, but hopefully this will be resolved with an app update in the near future.

Over all a great service for the money. The only thing that would top this is using the HBO in space logo from the 80’s as the start up screen, that would be awesome for old and new users alike.

title: Very nice selection of content
review:
I love how much content and how diverse the content is on this app. It is very nice to have it all organized by the original source (HBO, Cartoon Network, etc.) as it makes browsing for content easier. HBO Max is great for animation lovers like myself. I’m glad that AirPlay works so seamlessly with the app. 

Please get HBO Max as an app for Vizio TVs though, because I’d rather not have to always use my phone when watching HBO Max on my television.

title: Make em stop please
review: There is no ability to have this turn off auto play. If you fall asleep on the first episode expect to have this sucking bandwidth ALL night non stop. Other services with don’t have auptoplay of at least stop after a period of inaction every couple episodes. Also please make it work with the space bar on iPad Pro 2020 magic keyboard. And advance and go back 10 secs with the direction keys. Nice selection of titles for the price but it needs to take advantage of keyboards.

title: Language options
review: Once again. I loved it,  but there is no choice at all to find Game of Trones in Spanish. I used to have Direct TV and watch it in Spanish. I got a feed back from you guys in my previous review about this issue. Still  it wasn’t helpful at all about what I’m looking for. There is no way to watch some series in English in to Spanish like I used to do it on Direct TV. Would be wonderful if you guys fix this issue. For sure you guys will get more Spanish speaking people get this HBO Max and will get more profit for you guys. Thanks

title: Audio Glitching
review: I’ve been watching a show on my iPad (I can only access HBOMax on my phone/iPad/computer, which is an entirely different annoyance/issue), and I got to episode 5 when the audio started glitching! It cut out maybe 5 or so minutes in and then started playing random audio from a previous episode. I’ve closed out of the app and re-opened it multiple times and this keeps happening. It could just be this particular episode, who knows, but hopefully whatever is going on gets fixed soon.

title: Download option is useless
review:
The app gives you the option to download content, but won’t even open without internet access; so forget about watching anything on an airplane. Tried on two flights. Even turned the phone off/on. And for some reason, it won’t let you organize your list. iPhone 11, latest iOS.
UPDATE: After latest update I was able to watch one downloaded episode on a flight, but the app wouldn’t let me play another episode I had downloaded. I closed the app to try again but got an error message every time I opened the app.

title: Great Content, Meh Features
review: I love the content, and it’s the good service, but it’s missing a good amount of stuff. The big one for me is no Roku support, I hate how it’s not on it. Other issues are lack of 4K, lack of recommendations (I know, I know, you do handpicked stuff instead but like.. could you at least put a row or two of recommendations?), and the features you said would be coming out soon, like Recommended by Humans (celeb recommendations), dual profile watching, etc. Still, I recommend!

title: Terrible.....
review: I cannot unlink my HBO Max subscription from my AT&T Wireless account that I canceled due to terrible service in my area. I contacted HBO Max to get it unlinked or to get the account deleted so I could use the service. Easy right? Nope..... HBO Max was not able to help so they sent me to AT&T to get it resolved. AT&T wasn’t able to help so they sent me to HBO Max. After about half an hour each with reps from both parties, I gave up. When they get it together, I’ll try the service again. AT&T really took on too much when they purchased all these assets. Not only is their wireless service in the garbage, everything else is going down the drain with it.   Get it together.

title: Great but needs work...
review: Occasionally deletes downloaded shows or movies on its own before I get to watch them and have to re-download if I have time to do so. Also for shows that are series it would be convenient to have the ability to choose to watch more episodes of that show from the existing screen rather than having to search or type in the show every time I want to watch that particular show. Otherwise great app with great catalog.

title: Really enjoyed it when it worked
review: HBOMax has great content. We really enjoyed the DC movies and shows, Studio Ghibli movies, TCM and our little one loved the Sesame Workshop programs. BUT the app is buggy and recently stopped working with Chromecast, so you’re stuck watching it on a smaller device, which isn’t great if you want to watch something with friends or family.  Customer service won’t help beyond telling you to reinstall the app. (Which doesn’t fix the issue). It’s frustrating. UPDATE: Just lowered this to 1 Star. It’s no good if you can’t use it and after repeated attempts to contact  customer service they have not responded in any helpful way.

title: Turn auto play off!
review:
I like to go to sleep watching tv. Every other streaming app I’ve used has had the ability to turn auto play off. This way, it doesn’t keep playing all night. This is something that really needs to be addressed!  Perhaps I’ll change my rating after that is fixed.

Update:  found another thing that needs to be fixed. My daughter downloaded some things on her iPod. She cannot even open the app if she isn’t on WiFi. Please look at some of the other apps and fix this stuff. If she downloads something, she should be able to watch it off WiFi. Otherwise, why bother downloading?!

title: Not User Friendly
review: This app requires an internet connection even when you’ve downloaded a movie or episode to view in a low or no signal area. The graphical interface is lacking, always making you go through multiple screens to get to where you need to be. When you want to view what you’ve downloaded, the app should have a button solely for downloads and when you are in that section, the app should understand you want to view what is on your device, not stream from the server that you cannot reach due to your location.

title: Cartoon Network!
review: So I downloaded this app originally to watch Steven Universe since I didn’t want to watch it illegally. I was fine with making a subscription and continued to watch Steven Universe, after watching a few episodes I found out there’s a bunch of Cartoon Network Series on this app! I got excited I watched Steven Universe, Clarence, Adventure time, Regular show, Uncle Granpa and We Bare Bears. Overall this is a complete success! Thank you so much HBO Max!

title: Fix needed
review: I have an account through DIRECTV and it finally after 3 hours logged me in but when I had to verify my email the email never comes I’ve checked spam and everything I just say on “hold” with the live chat for literally an hour and a half for no one to answer and they ended the chat before it could happen i’ve texted and get no response I absolutely love HBO and was excited for this app since the first commercial and can’t get any help from the horrible customer service. I just want to watch my shows and can’t do that because no one will help

title: Please Fix The App
review: This app is the worst streaming app I’ve ever used. It crashes constantly. Tells me “can’t play title we’re having trouble playing this at this time” EVERY TIME I try to use it on air play or even with an hdmi adapter. There isn’t an app for the the television yet which is also annoying bc I don’t want to have to use my phone every time I wish to watch something then I have to deal with the app crashing if I do want to view it on a bigger screen. It’s so frustrating I’ve been thinking about cancelling my subscription until it’s fixed. You have a wonderful service the crappy app is ruining it. FIX IT!

title: Amazing app
review:
This awesome 5 stars for sure! The only bad thing is it’s hard to sign in. The kid profiles are great because there’s a password for it for the kids can’t see or watch the adult movies when you create it it asks you witch rates you can watch like tv-y or pg that stuff. But it’s not that great if your kid knows the password. I totally recommend this app.

P.s. if you have HBOGo then this is free just press sign in with tv provider and poof your in!

title: Streaming series could be easier
review: Enjoying the content. Please make it easier to choose any other episode of multi-episode or multi-part content from any given episode. Often when watching a show, I get distracted or fall asleep and if I want to go back and review content I’ve missed, I have to go back to the home page and search for the show again to find the episode I want. Also, it would be helpful if the search bar automatically showed most recent searches.

title: Great content, app is designed poorly
review: I love the content on HBO Max, but the app is very irritating when trying to find exact episodes of a series you are already watching.  Also, there is no double tap to skip or rewind feature, instead you have to use the buttons in the bottom left of the screen when you have the full UI when watching a movie/tv show.  Whenever adjusting volume, it brings up the full UI instead of just a small volume bar at the top. Like I said the content is great, it’s just the app is poorly designed in my opinion.

title: Question
review: I don’t have a review yet, because we haven’t watched anything yet. It took a while to login to the account t using our At&T credentials. We finally got in. We have an LG tv and apparently the app is not available on that. We also have Roku and the app isn’t available on that either. So then I tried my phone. I see all the content, but it says I have to download each show or movie that I  want to watch? Is that right? Why do I have to download everything? Will it take up space on my phone? Why doesn’t it stream like Netflix or Disney? Am I doing something wrong?

title: Not worth the money!
review:
They say “Turner Classic movies” but all of 15. You would think everything played on TCM would be available... Nope! You would think every classic western, war, or black and white movie would be a  must. Its selection is 1% of Netflix unless you want musicals.

Their search feature is trash. Even when you do search, it can’t just give you what you are looking for or genres, but give random content. Search “john Wayne” you get a few movies but then Sesame Street, Veep, watchmen, Westworld etc....

This is almost as bad as Disney+.... for $15/month, haha! yeah not worth it! Netflix has a better and bigger selection of content, I don’t know how.

title: Loved hbo now not stoked on Max so far
review: I’ve had hbo now for quite a while for streaming loved it and was super stoked that even more shows and titles would be offered with the switch to hbo max , just learned it won’t be compatible with my fire stick which is definitely inconvenient but After some first day glitches with the chrome cast , streaming is working with that now. Love the content and would be super happy if it becomes compatible with fire stick as well

title: Not compatible w Roku—can’t watch TV on a TV👎
review: I love HBO content and Cinemax too, but unfortunately as someone that only has a Roku streaming device, I am unable to watch any of the content, except on my phone or computer—who wants TV content that can be watched on anything except for a TV. Not good. Poor planning. They never should’ve launched and promised a product that leaves huge swaths of its consumer base locked out. Again, love the content—if only the business end was good at its job then maybe we wouldn’t have TV content that people can’t watch on a TV. The executives really botched it on this one.

title: Free for AT&T Customers!
review: I have recently received a text from AT&T, saying that I now have Free Access to HBO? It stated that HBO is now included for Free with my AT&T Plan, which is an Unlimited Plan. It also mentioned to just go to this sit, download, & then to click on the sign up button. When prompted it said to hit the (already am a member), that just to hit click that & that I would Not Be Charged! Free Streaming!!! That’s what the Text Said... Can you please tell me if this is Legit or Not? Thank You!!!

title: Great Content, horrible app
review:
Everyone knows HBO. Besides being a household name in entertainment, they host modern shows of all genres. People love HBO for the awesome movie selection and amazing original shows.

I cannot login with this app. Or on my tv. When i got the app finally working through my PS4 (all on the same TV and the same wifi mind you) it somehow magically works fine. This is a problem. 

Again, I like the content and am interested in enjoying HBOs product. But their delivery applications make it nearly impossible to even view their shows/movies. 

HBO cant get an app writer, coder, development team that can actually do their jobs. It doesnt matter what device, what generation of device, or even the internet connection, HBO apps never work for me. HBO Max is just HBOs latest failure. They couldnt get HBO GO to work. Or its predecessor. Now they unveil this monstrosity. Please fix yourselves before HBO becomes the Comcast of the entertainment world. 

There is great content. Just be better HBO

title: Good but needs work...
review:
App overall is pretty good. I’m enjoying rewatching GOT. 🙂 

Few suggestions that I’m hoping are already in the works:
1. When you go back into the app on your phone to finish what you were currently watching, it only shows that one episode and then extras and sneak peeks. There’s no way to select a different episode without typing in the name of the show and going through the seasons to select the next episode. 
2. Please speed up the fwd/rwd feature. Trying to rewind an hour long episode back to a certain part or skip ahead to a certain part takes entirely too long. 
3. Please include a Skip Intro option and Play Next option at the end of the episode so you don’t have to back all the way out and scroll through episodes to get to the next one. 

Other than that I’m really enjoying the app so far.

title: This app should be improved for people like me who rely on voiceover
review: This app is not voiceover friendly I have not been able to access this app far as using it and another problem when it comes to signing in it doesn’t work I have HBO max included in my phone plan and not able to use this service at all a quick suggestion there should be a way where you can sign in on the app using your AT&T phone number I think this would work out much more better

title: The app is broken
review: So I am trying to sign in to my account and it gives me an error message. I realize that it’s only day one so I try to watch on my ps4 pro. Turns out that did not work either. HBO max, can you please fix these issues soon before my trial is over. Don’t get me wrong I love the service but, with issues like these and no fire tv or roku app I don’t know if I’m going to keep your subscription.

title: You could do better
review: Is this HBO or some new company that just started to have a streaming program? HBO could do better with the layouts and tiny little details that helpful for viewers. Excited for Friends and all the Ghibli Studios. But not because you got everyone hooked on those and they don’t care about the app’s performances. It is part of the watch experience after all. Do better please! Make my $15 worth it. You’re HBO after all. Or have I been giving you too much credits this whole time...?!?!

title: Needs to cast but ok
review: It’s ok has some bugs here and there but it is a new app. The continue watching section doesn’t seem to let you pick an episode so a little annoying when I fell asleep and want to go back a few episodes. Another is it needs to add being able to cast from your phone to other devices connected to hbomax or even over WiFi connection like other streamers long apps. Other wise tho it’s pretty smooth

title: A few things wrong is why I gave 2 stars.
review: First the app cuts out during movies and won’t come back to the spot if cut the movie out at. Sometimes you can’t even get the movies to play, it just keeps loading. Second when watching a show and the next episode comes on the screen blacks out. I dig HBO but when I am paying for an app on subscription, I expect to have have problems with it. If they fix what is wrong I will change my rating but as of now it makes me angry and I find it highly unprofessional for a major pay cable network.

title: Hello 👋
review:
look ima jump to conclusions.. I may don’t have the app but I watch it on my tv so all I’m asking is.. PLEASE PUT STEVEN UNIVERSE FUTURE ON THIS APPP 😩😩😩 pls? HBO max is a wonderful app and I’m surprised u guys have the walking dinosaurs on this app I used to love dinosaurs 😁 but any way pls read this and pls do this? Plsssss I’m begging u guys it’s so boring in quarantine ☹️ and it’s my dream to watch Steven universe u
Future so I’m counting on u guys to pls do this                                  Goodbye! And again pls read and do this

title: HBO was the greatest thing ever.  This isn’t.
review:
Where HBO had loads of high quality content and incredibly unique series and stories, the additional content added by HBO Max is loads of athetic and unsolved shows, where finding entertainment is like a needle in a haystack.

For now, I just go to the HBO section most of the time, but the app seems fully intent on mixing these disparate content sources together into some disgusting and repulsive media jambalaya.

If you enjoy picking at the carcass of old and expired attempts at entertainment, reruns, and the memory of HBOs greatness, than this overpriced app might be for you.  Just don’t forget to cancel, this is not a place for new content.

title: LOL
review: 6 originals. 6. And I have 0 interest in watching any of them 😂. One is Elmo hanging out with the Jonas Brothers and then you got some low budget looking reality shows and Anna Kendrick going for the paycheck. The rest is ancient TV shows you see on replay on late night basic cable. No 4K? What are you guys smoking over there??? My guess: tried to pull a Disney+ with the stay at home crowd but this sure ain’t to Disney+. HBO is a winner. Always has been. But man, this is weak. Hard pass, stick with “basic” HBO (which is all you’ll use in this app anyway). Prove me wrong, HBO. I beg you, because this looks pretty sad.

title: No Siri search
review: The app is ok. All these streaming apps are “special” in their own way but it’s functional. But I don’t understand why they use a non standard search UI. You have to use the remote to scroll through letters. The standard search UI used by many other streaming apps is much better. You can dictate a search or use the remote on your phone to type with a full keyboard.  It doesn’t make sense that they did extra work to have a worse experience. Very odd design choice.

title: This is a great place to find all of your favorite shows and movies
review: So I’ve been using Disney plus for quite some time which is awesomeness so when I saw hbo max bring some films and shows from CN hbo and others I was shocked it blew my mind so I was really excited and yeah I can literally watch anything from these channels so this was probably your best idea hbo and Warner media I hope a lot of People enjoy it as well

title: Disappointed
review:
The selection is awesome I love friends , Big Bang and fresh prince! 
HOWEVER! I haven’t been able to watch going on two days now the apps on both my smart tv and Xbox one says connection error and can’t connect . I tried downloading to my phone so maybe I can log in to see if it’s subscription mess up on my part but I can’t even log in at all!!!!!! I thought it was because of my password but I do the reset password like 3 times but nevvvver get the email!!!!! How you expect people to pay for something they can’t watch or even get access too??? Guys really need to get this fixed!

title: Connection issues
review: The content is great, but it is heavily out weighed by the poor performance of the app. I use the app with a Chrome Cast to stream content. Every time the app is used it disconnects from the casting device and takes several minutes to reconnect. This completely prevents users from pausing and rewinding content. Additionally, when you do use the back up 15 seconds feature the app either crashes or buffers forever. Finally, I use the same chrome cast with several other apps and this is the only one with these issues. Therefore, I don’t think the chrome cast is to blame.

title: Please fix Captions issue on IPhone
review: I can’t turn on the caption while watching on my IPhone. Captions work fine when I watch on Apple TV and Smart TV, but not on my iPhone . I tried delete the app and downloaded again but still doesn’t work. Even after the newest update it still doesn’t show captions on my IPhone. I’m using IPhone 11pro right now . Thanks. Love the app .

title: Horrible! Don't waste your money!
review: The app is not available for Roku. Screen mirroring is no longer supported, you only get a black screen with just sound. Tried to use a laptop to watch, it works for only 10-15 minutes then the sound goes away and I'm soon left with a message saying the video can't be played try again later. That's bs. I have wasted three hours trying to watch one 40 min episode of PLL. For $15 a month the app and the webpage should be much better than it is. I am extremely disappointed. I have never had more trouble with a streaming service than I have with HBO.

title: Consistent sign in issues
review: I’m still shocked at HBO’s inability to partner with AT&T and not address sign in issues. It is still a boondoggle to sign in via a provider account and does not work. It’s clear they want to drive anyone getting this with a mobile plan to pay them directly for a monthly subscription. In an era so saturated with content I would think they would put more emphasis in letting people in to view their content (people who have authorized access...like people with qualifying mobile plans). This was an issue with HBO GO and apparently continues to be something they don’t care about. Sad.

title: Nothing new
review: HBO Now/Max/Go I wish this company would get it’s act together and offer a streaming service worth paying for. Or they should team up with a streaming service that knows how to stream content! They need to hire me to make their decisions and focus on making content! Content=A. Streaming service(s)=F. Their recent failure of an app doesn’t work with firestick. So I can’t watch the same things on my TV as I can in my phone. So it’s completely worthless as I would rather stare at the wall than watch a movie in my phone. Unless I’m on a 13 hour flight! I have tried all of HBO’s apps and been left with a bad taste in my mouth

title: It has potential to be great
review:
I was so excited to see the titles HBO max had to offer that I subscribed to this service immediately. However, it became very clear that it is not there yet. Why am I unable to get this app on my firestick or roku? 

Even on my iPad or iPhone, my biggest complaint is downloaded content. I have things that are shown to be downloaded, but when I try to watch them it just buffers. This is my second time being a subscriber because I was so frustrated but I will most certainly be cancelling until they figure it out!

title: Disappointed
review: I was super excited to be able to watch my favorite shows again, until I decided to move from my living room to my bedroom and realized the app is not available on my tv upstairs. How can such a large company only have it available on certain TVs?! We have a Roku TV and we cannot get it on there, nor can I stream it from my phone to the tv. I would HIGHLY recommend you check to see if your device has the app available before paying for the service, otherwise you will be upset just like I am.

title: HBO Max versus HBO Now...what’s the difference?
review: So I just got HBO now a month before this app came out. I didn’t oh much mind to it because it was the same thing nor did I think it would affect my subscription to hbo now. But long and behold I can’t sue the app because I have hbo now. Can someone please explain to me...wth is the difference. It’s HBO in general, why screw over current customers that PAY for an HBO service wether it’s like me or thru their cable. It’s the same thing. Now I can only watch anything hbo on my web browser. If you have hbo now. Do not update it. It will turn into the max version and won’t let you watch anything.

title: Great content, terrible execution
review: I read the reviews when I originally downloaded HBO but i thought with the large number of reviews cover in app issues that some of them would of been addressed already. Boy was I wrong... it seems next to impossible fast forward or rewind anything more then the 15 sec skips. Only seems to be working with Apple TV which is garbage. All my other streaming apps work with my Chromecast, i even tried another stick and it still didnt work.

title: Closed captioning
review: So before this new update if you turned on subtitles, it just stayed on until you physically turned it off. Which was ideal for watching a series. But now it has to be turned back on for every new thing you watch. It’s so inconvenient when watching a series, you can’t just let it play through and there’s no way to keep them on. Really hoping this gets fixed. Especially because this is the only place I can watch friends!!
