title: Good selection but very slow
review: Great selection but holy moly is the app extremely slow. Takes forever to launch and if you’ve been signed out and have to sign back in it takes unnecessarily long and just sits on the loading screen if it even lets you sign in at all.  All of my other streaming apps work perfectly fine so I really don’t think the problem is on my end. When it takes a half hour to get signed in something is clearly wrong.

title: Where’s the HBO quality in this app?
review:
I love the content. HBO certainly rocks, but this is app is just not at the same level of quality. The user interface is bad. It freezes and is so slow. For instance, to search for an episode of a series you’re watching, you have to search for the series because there’s no way to check all episodes from home menu or on the episode continuation). Not user friendly and intuitive. 
I wish HBO could invest on creating a better app so we can watch their awesome content in a better platform.

title: Good selection but still need some work
review: I am really impressed with the selection this app has but there is currently one thing that is preventing me from subscribing. Personally, I think that there should be more options than just a monthly plan. I can’t speak for other people, but I personally don’t like paying monthly plans and would really like it if they had a yearly plan. If they had a price I could pay to get a years worth of subscription, I probably would subscribe.

title: App is trash and they know it
review: I was given the promise and promotional pricing to watch free for 30 days. I downloaded the app on my iPhone and Apple TV. I followed the directions and it still would not let me watch anything at all. So I canceled even the free subscription. This was back in July. Now I got charged for it and had to log in just to cancel it again and request a refund. Then get the reply via email that it is a one time courtesy to me to give me my money back and it will take up to 7-10 business days. Which could be another month or so. Smh don’t bother with the app. It’s obviously a scam!!!

title: No mirroring or roku!?!!!
review: Pay for direct tv with all the premium add ons and several other popular streaming services and now if I’m at my office or another property I have to pay for another hbo subscription to watch on roku? This is ridiculous and outright thievery!! It’s bad enough that you can’t mirror but charging again to play on roku goes beyond greediness. Watching on small phone screen only seems hardly worth having app so you can just track and sell my data for the few things I don’t mind mainly just listening to on my phone. Shame on you HBO!

title: What a waste
review: I have downloaded, streamed, believed and more and yet this thing just doesn’t work. Gobble up a bunch of good movies and shows they executed well but then I can’t watch them for $15 a month. Downloaded movies don’t work when you’re even connected to WiFi and the whole point is they’re supposed to be free of WiFi needs. Try to watch a movie while sitting 3 feet from the router and that doesn’t work either. Get it together champs because you have 23 days till my subscription runs out and I’ll never download it again.

title: Some episode glitch problem
review: While I am enjoying the HBO Max app, somehow I’m experiencing a episode glitch with the show I was watching called The Amazing World of Gumball (a show that I used to love watching all the time on Cartoon Network) and as I got to the episode “The Procrastinators” right as the intro was about to finish, it all of a sudden brings me to the first episode of the show. I don’t know if the glitch is a problem with other shows available on the app but I hope it gets fixed on a future update.

title: Tentative 2.5 stars
review:
Glossy graphics are not a helpful addition if it's at the expense of every other UI feature (or lack thereof). 

I don't want to see newly available on your platform. I want to see 'New in My Stuff'. 

I will re-watch a stand up comedy special, bur do not want to see one I just watched suggested, or their old stuff interspersed with other old stuff I've explored, out of chronological order.

I want 'continue watching' separate from 'my stuff' (which should be recommendation fodder), with sorting options. This must include a "watched" and rating function. Gonna make it difficult to find anything I like? I'd rather read. 

Ideally a formerly coveted premium service would provide stuff I want AND a pleasant experience. I would settle for telling you what I want (and you deliver) OR you streamline browsing options.

title: Great Streaming Service But...
review: HBO Max is a fantastic value prop but my disappointment is really that it wasn’t its own app. I use to have HBO Now and when I no longer needed it, I hid the app so it stopped interfering in my Apple TV app. I was shocked that when HBO Max released it was just an upgrade to the Now app so I could not enable the Family Sharing to allow my kid to download the app. Outside of this issue which is a bit of an iOS and developer issue I’m loving Max. Please add more DC content.

title: UNDER THE REGULAR STREAMING SERVICE 😔💔
review: I’ve been a huge fan of HBO since 20 years ago because of the quality of the content, I was exited to give it a shot once it’s streaming service become available. Unfortunately, it has not 4K and/or HDR support, the absenteeism of subtitles and language audio tracks make it a weak service against competitors; taking on count Disney Plus offers Dolby Atmos and Dolby Vision, on top of the options for subtitles and audio languages tracks since the launch date. So disappointed about the lack of important features for a worldwide brand in 2020 ☹️💔

title: Same Old Quality-No 4K HDR
review:
The app works and the content is there. The streaming quality is the same old HBO GO or Now quality. Meaning not great especially compared to other services. We have the same blocky H264 codec being used, with the same crushed blacks and smudged brights. A large swath of the new DC content is available elsewhere in 4K HDR, while some of HBO’s own content is available elsewhere in 4K as well.

HBO Max is the most expensive service to not offer 4K HDR content, and putting something on a roadmap isn’t a selling point. Implement it now since you want our money now...

title: Glitchy/ Needs work
review: I love this app and the content, although I do have a few issues with the way it works. Mainly the fact that when casting content on the app from my iPhone to my TV, if I turn off my phone or jump to another app and then back to the HBO Max app, somehow the app stops showing that I’m casting content -even though the content is still playing on my tv. I then have to disconnect the cast and reconnect so that I can continue to have functions like pause and volume controls display on the app. So annoying. So simple.

title: Works but has bugs with Chromecast
review: The app is designed better than HBO Now and has good content. My major issue with the app is its functionality with Chromecast. HBO MAX no longer ‘speaks’ with GoogleHome, which is not the biggest problem. BUT what is a major problem is that fact that EVERY-TIME anything is streamed to Chromecast it eventually no longer connects. And HBO MAX will not re-connect to Chromecast, until i shutdown my iphone and restart my iPhone. Nothing else has been found to correct the issue.

title: Constantly glitching
review: The content available and coming is worth five stars itself. The problem is the app continuously glitches. Casting to a smart tv, the content pauses to “reload” every couple of minutes. It also throws the feed off, not allowing the content to air on the tv in full display. Tried downloading content first before casting to see if that was a solution but it comes up with the same result. Extremely frustrating when trying to watch new content and you can’t even see half the screen.

title: Can’t access what I paid for
review:
I’d rate this if you had not removed access to those of us that subscribe to HBO now!  Why would you create a replacement app that doesn’t allow people who are paying you a subscription to access said subscription?  Why delete the app that worked for us and then say “this isn’t available through your current provider”. My current provider is DIRECTLY THROUGH HBO.

Edit to add in response to your comment: there is nothing “more” to tell you via email, you know the problem, there are many other posts about it. This is horrible customer service.

title: Different language tracks missing
review: I thought HBO Max would finally add different language tracks for their shows, that are missing HBO Go and HBO Now but are available if you have cable. I was wrong. Not even HBO Max original content is available in different languages. Which makes it so half my family cant fully enjoy the shows. Netflix original has different language tracks, Disney Plus has different language tracks Apple TV Plus has different language tracks, why cant HBO Max have any? Unless they add that option ill skip

title: EVERY APP/SHOW DOES THAT! Sorry but change is needed.
review: This is a very great app but overall...... it mostly just steals your money cause you have to pay for almost EVERYTHING in the app. But it’s a great app so I recommend it if your fine with losing your money. And I love the colors it’s so spacey and cool! However did that is smart! But anyways I love your apps have a great day! Oh, and please make it a bit cheaper and I also was trying to say whoever but it corrected me.

title: HBO Max is Awesome!!!!
review: I love HBO Max much better than old HBO Go and HBO Now! It have old TV Classics series, Max Original, I love Looney Tunes cartoons, DC Universe, so much more! There is no problem for me to use (CC) closed-captioned and apple devices & PS4! I hope someday will add Nintendo Switch, & Roku. Hey I suggest to feedback to add HBO Max profile name with icon or avatar, like Movies Anywhere do that. I’d still give 5 of 5 because HBO Max is so awesome and keep it up to better and much better in future!

title: Too much buffering
review: Got so excited for this app! Love the selection, including the classic movies from tcm is HUGE! Always wanted a streaming service to make an emphasis of classical movies and you guys did that thank you! HOWEVER you must fix the constant freezing up and buffering in episodes and movies. A twenty minute episode of fresh prince takes thirty minutes because it freezes up like six times in one episode! Please fix that! I promise I’ll give you five stars when it’s fixed!

title: Content is the only good thing
review: I was so excited about the titles I’d have access to with HBO Max, but the experience is horrible because of this app. There are a lot of international titles and the language controls don’t work. Casting is inconsistent and disconnects often. The download feature doesn’t work, so you can’t watch anything offline. The interface isn’t intuitive at all. To top it all off, every time I’ve reached out to customer service I’ve had a bad experience with them as well. Really wish that they had done a better job with the service. I really wanted to like it!

title: Great subcription service!
review: What a great service! HBO Max gives Netflix a run for its money, it’s amazing the shows and movies available to watch, i started the 7 day trial and was amazed by all the content available, also by how good the app runs on all my devices, (ios, xbox, playstation, mac safari web browser) i just had to stay!.. keep up the good work guys i totally recommend it!

title: Laggy App
review:
I have a new smart TV, and 100mbps internet. I try watching this from my TV, from my computer airplayed, and now from my iPhone 11. The app takes forever to load, buffers often, and exits altogether frequently.

I’ve looked at many HBO forums, and there are many others with these issues. HBO support consistently attributes it to slow internet. And consistently, others point out that their other popular streaming services don’t experience the same issues.

The content is great. The delivery is buggy and needs attention.

title: Great content bad pricing
review: The content in the app is great but I feel as though there should be a free trial of a month or two and you can cancel anytime I love the content in your platform it has the classics lots for peoples childhood the only problems is the amount of movies is seriously lacking not having much to offer but besides that you are amazing the price is a bit high especially since others offer the same for 6$ a month which is better

title: Meh...
review: The TV Shows and Movies are great! I love how you can download shows and movies, but i have a few concerns. First, on the iPad app, you can scroll left and right and it hides some episodes on TV Shows. Auto play doesn’t work great, it is usually 30 seconds late, and there is no skip intro function. Also, if you have a keyboard, there are no functions that you can use (e.g. Space Bar = Pause/Play, Arrows = +or- 10 seconds). Also, on my iPad, whenever my iPad is on mute, the sound from HBO Max Doesn’t come out. I have to unmute my iPad, and then it starts playing.

title: Disappointed
review:
No 4k hdr support.

For advertising Snyder Cut and making such a big deal about it you don’t even have Man of Steel, which starts the story, or the extended edition of Batman v Superman, which you’re essentially spending money on making one for Justice League... it’s just odd.

You have Harry Potter. Cool. But we’ve all seen them and own them. Imagine if it was the extended editions! Not just 1 and 2 but also 3-8! It’s been done before on broadcast freeform, abc, added deleted scenes back into 3-8. Something you cannot buy! Imagine selling HBO Max including Harry Potter the extended collection. You’ll make a lot of money I’ll give money for that. I’ve wanted all 8 extended versions on Blu-ray for years and I’m not even that big a Harry Potter fan. So imagine!

Love the looney tunes cartoons old and new. Very fun to go back to the first ones ever.

You removed Gone with the Wind. That was a big mistake. Sets dangerous precedents.

title: User profile issue with continue watching
review:
Why would there be an option for different profiles if the continue watching  gets mixed together amongst the different profiles on the account? 

I keep having this issue and it’s frustrating because it defeats the purpose of having individual profiles all together. 

Otherwise I love the content and interface.

title: Doesn’t recognize chrome cast half the time
review: I love the app and the content! The only problem is I can’t cast it to my chrome cast cause the app seems to ignore the one in my home. When I click on the cast option it says it’s listening for a pin? I got it to work once by uninstalling and reinstalling but since then I haven’t been able to get to cast on my tv again. I really just want them to resolve this issue and then it would be a perfect streaming app.

title: Closed caption doesn’t work
review: I really love all content that HBO max has, but I have a few complaints. It only works correctly on the webpage, which bothers me because I don't always have a laptop with me. The closed caption doesn't work on the iPad/iPhone, and I don't know why you haven't tried to solve this, because it is essential. Also, you don't have an app for ROKU, so if I want to watch a movie from my tv, I need to connect a computer, and it's annoying. You should get your service better for it to worth paying 15$ per month.

title: Actually really good and a growing collection of Anime
review: I get this app through ATT and there is a nice selection of shows to choose from. I really like all of the Ghibli films and am liking the growing collection from Crunchyroll. I am actually surprised by the good selection of Anime the app has ( although still not large enough to replace other services). I see big things for this app in the future.

title: Several issues with language inconsistencies
review: Currently, I am working my way through Doctor Who season five using a lightening cable with my iPhone to cast it onto my tv. Now all episodes on the season worked fine this way except 10 and 11 which were playing in Spanish I believe. But as soon as I pulled out the lightening cable, the episode played in English just fine. It’s a strange bug that, if fixed, I would love to write a better review. Also one of the episodes was cut a few minutes short of the end.

title: Disappointed
review: I was super excited when I pre paid for the subscription. I was going to have access to my favorite shows and was planning my binge session. I have a Roku tv and can’t watch HBO max. This is ridiculous why release a streaming service and not be available to people who have roku or amazing devices. I’m not about to sit on my phone to watch these shows when I paid good money for a tv that I’d rather watch it on. I even tried to screen share and it wouldn’t work. Really contemplating canceling my subscription until they get it together and get hbo max on ALL streaming devices.

title: Great but not the best
review:
There is a wonderful selection of content , but I guess the My List feature bothers me the most . What’s the point of it being an option if you can’t see what you save . 

The app also constantly crashes on Apple Tv
. This streaming platform has great potential, but it needs to improve on its design , layout , and functionality. Also it would be great to have a more tailored experience. I’d like to Get the most of out what I’d truly like to see .

title: Love this app
review: I highly recommend this app! I got a 30 day free trial not thinking we would really use it but turned out the whole family loved it. Our son and daughter kept asking if we were going to keep it over and over again b cause they loved it so much. App is very easy to use and has wonderful content for everyone’s likes.

title: Won’t cast anymore
review: I really enjoy having access to shows I want to see on my phone when that’s the best option for viewing, but the ability to cast to our television just stopped without explanation. We aren’t having issues casting with our other apps, and online, lots of people are having the same problem we’re experiencing with the HBO Max app. It’s much harder to move around and watch the show on my small phone screen, so I’d really appreciate being able to cast shows to my television.

title: Ads and not on Roku
review: I was really looking forward to being able to stream Friends and The Big Bang Theory (along with the TCM content!). I wasn’t expecting COMMERCIALS before each episode (almost every single episode), especially because they advertised their program as “Commercial Free”.  I was also hoping to watch these shows on my Roku. Apparently that’s not possible. What a waste to have a TV in each room to have to sit and hold my iPad or phone, where only one person can see it. When the ads disappear and I can watch the content on my Roku, I’ll be happy to leave 5 stars.

title: I LOVE THIS!❤️
review: So i was looking for friends but i could not find it but one day i Found HBO MAX! And when i looked inside i found all sorts of things AND I EVEN FOUND FRIENDS! This app is so so cool i love it. I think we all Need this app because sometimes in netflix or anywhere else you watch your things might not have what you are looking for but this app Has what you are looking for download now!!!! 🥳❤️

title: So good so far.
review: So far it’s a good app, I’m happy they added some of the Cartoon Network shows on there and Adult swim shows for everyone. Hopefully they’ll add more shows on there, along with other animated movies on there as well. I actually like to have Ed, Edd & Eddy on the Cartoon Network collection and other CN shows on there. Thank you very much HBO Max, hope to see more shows and movies you will add soon. 🙂

title: This app is horrible
review:
I love the HBO content, but this app is the bane of my existence! There so much I want to watch, but I get so frustrated with this app that I have to walk away before I throw my iPad across the room.
The 2 most frustrating things are not being able to skip the previously/intros and the fact that when I watching something (I cast it), if I go back into the app the program progress is gone. Just poof, disappeared. So I can’t pause, stop, go back, nothing without stop casting then go back in. When I have to do this, all progress of the program is lost. So annoying.

title: Great content, atrocious download experience
review:
HBO Max has great content that can be downloaded; however, accessing the data is regularly a nightmare. HBO Max handles downloads worse than all of it’s primary and secondary competitors in the streaming services market.

With no internet access, the files are frequently inaccessible even if downloaded minutes before trying to access the file offline.

Unlike other streaming services, HBO Max is get the entire file in one attempt or lose the entire download. Finally, the app tends to show something is fully downloaded when it actually has a few more steps to take before it is fully downloaded (and if you close the service... download lost). 

All of the above should be easily mediated to improve the app.

title: Constant interruption
review: I generally liked the HBO go app. I also really appreciate HBO Max his new content platform. But what I really don’t like is the fact that when I’m trying to stream some thing on my phone and interrupted every few minutes to warn me about cellular data usage. Maybe having a single notification at the beginning with an option to change my settings would be helpful but when I’m trying to just watch a show or movie being interrupted constantly is unhelpful and annoying.

title: Good content, bad streaming
review: HBO streaming is very poor in basic things compared to any other service. Every time I decide to watch something I know is going to be painful. You need a lot of Internet, most shows have only audio and captions in English, the “continue watching” is useless and annoying (it still says I’m on episode three of a show I finished), it has errors when downloading. They should adapt to the audience that pays instead of making people struggle to watch shows on their phones or computers.

title: The App is Slow
review: The app is quite slow, slower than the CW app! The animations are choppy and the loading times are long. There is a lot of content but the app makes it troublesome to search. I think there should have been better preparation for the release. Before it came out, there should have been a UX and UI reset. It feels like it was built from a template instead of from scratch. Hope there could be an update in the future! Unfortunately, I will not be paying $15/month unless I see speed improvements.

title: Love it
review:
I love it.  Just add a skip intro and skip end credits to your series. Thx

Thanks for adding the skip intro for the series. 

The other issue I have is the volume.  For the movies and shows, it seems very low however the 30 sec ads play loud. The ads seem to be the right volume because when I go to other apps it’s just fine.  Thanks!!!

title: Good Streaming Service
userName: Darth Vader Lord Of The Sith
review:
You’re probably thinking finally a Warner Bro’s.  Streaming service! I  use to like this app until they got rid of the Harry Potter movies!!!!!! What the heck dude!? Why would you make a streaming service only designed for WB especially Harry Potter! That’s the other thing, we finally get HARRY POTTER on a streaming service and they decide to get rid of it all !!! What’s next, FRIENDS ? The Brothers of Warner don’t get the bigger picture like Disney +. Lucky for me, I’m almost finished watching the show FRIENDS.
After watching The Wizard, I’m getting rid of it.

title: The sound quality is unacceptable.
review:
Kudos to HBO for finally showing films in their correct aspect ratio after so many years. The sound is horrendous (TV 4K). For some reason during the previews that air as you start playing content, the sound is amazing. 

But the moment the actual show/movie starts it's awful. You have to turn it all the way up to hear dialogue but then the sound effects are way too loud. If you browse the HBOMAX subreddit, there are dozens of complaints about this and it seems to be a carry over from the HBO GO / HBO NOW versions.

Please provide this your immediate attention.

title: Not enough content
review: How can HBO charge so much for such  little of their content. They claim to have sub categories ready such as DC, looney Tunes,  Cartoon Network, [Adult Siwm] etc. but they don’t even have the majority of those prime television and movie content form those those studios. DC alone is missing a crap load of content. Not even to mention the looney tunes and Cartoon Network. All I’m saying how can HBO CHARGE SO MUCH for such little content. You literally have It’s competition charge half the amount for more than double the content. All I’m saying HBO you need more stuff or you will lose people’s interest fast.

title: Best video streaming app I’ve used
review: Deepest library of big name movies over the entire history of hollywood. Imo. And no issues streaming unlike many other apps who are dropping connections all the time. Love the attention to classic titles as well as new films. I suggest the new viewers to try out the Clint Eastwood films. Can’t find such a deep collection of his films anywhere else. Thank you !

title: No Spanish,French, portugués etc language options
review: A wide range of movies and franchises that are well known. My major complaint is that you are not able to select the language you want to see it in. Only English, not very supportive and not to mention the bigger consumer viewer you could take in if you have a multi language option . Only way to see different language movies if they were originally made in that language. If that’s the case why not just leave the studio ghibli films in Japanese and not in English. 🤷🏽‍♂️

title: Confusing Interface
review:
First of all – HBO Max’s “Hubs” (which have the in-depth catalogs), should be prominently displayed at the top of the home page. Those shows and content aren’t even found until you scroll almost to the bottom of the page. Or accidentally come across it from the sidebar. 

I admire the way they’ve made their extensive catalog something of a strength. But it needs to be displayed first. 

As an HBO subscriber who accessed its library via HBO GO previously, this interface pales in comparison to that. The interface is lacking useful information similar to a website. Most of the data/ or links should be located above-the-fold. Such as shows that are “Featured”, “My List” & “Continue Watching”.  

Then as you scroll vertically down the page, things like “Coming Soon”, or “Just-Added” Movies/ Shows should follow the home page links.

title: Umm.... Really?! They make it where you can’t
review: I glad I am using my free trail but it’s a waste since I can only watch on my phone or IPad. I have two Roku TV and can’t watch HBO Max on either. To watch on my Apple TV I have to AirPlay it.  It’s the most expensive streaming service out there and it only works on limit platform.  I can long into HBO now on Roku with the HBO Max long in info though but I really think most people signed up for HBO Max for friends. If your thinking about trying it out. I say wait until it’s more available on other providers.

title: No keyboard and trackpad gestures support in 2020 :(
review:
There are a lot of things to like about the app. Prominent download buttons. Continue watching. Manage list.
Easy to discover content. 
I replaced prime video HBO access with direct HBO max. The biggest downgrade is keyboard support. Volume control with arrow up and down. Jump back/forward with arrows left and right. Space for pause. Swipe back on trackpad to go back. Etc. 
Please please please add support for keyboard and trackpad.

title: Binge Worthy Feature Request
review:
I’ve been an HBO subscriber for a while and I’m glad to see the inventory expanded. However now that more shows are available (that people tend to binge) I would love to see a “Skip Intro” feature and or speedier cut after credits. I’ve been spoiled by using this style of feature on other platforms and would love to see it here. 
User Interface is important, with millions at home streaming/ binging give us a little treat with a Skip Intro button.

title: Bad
review: I like the shows. However, the app keeps signing me out of my account. It’s a terrible pain to sign back in it’s challenging, won’t take my password and when I try to change it HBO says they’ll email me a new password and never do. I just want to watch my show and end up spending over an hour trying to fix my account. I like and enjoy watching the the shows I think there’s a good selection but there’s no sense in paying for the subscription if I can’t sign in to watch the shows. Please just send me an email with how to get a new password already.

title: Buffering & Screen mirroring problem
review: HBO Max has great shows/movies but it seems when I’m not streaming it from my iphone and try to play it on the big screen on my PS4, it buffers sooo much and won’t even play, it may be an internet problem but everything else loads super fast on my ps4 with my internet including Netflix,Hulu, etc... so instead I tried to screen mirror it from my iPhone and it literally won’t let me on the HBO Max app? It’s really disappointing. 🙁

title: Junk!!!!
review: I signed up for HBO 2-4 weeks ago and was using HBO Go to stream shows from my phone to my old Apple TV. Didn’t have any issues. Several days ago I was force on to this new app and I can barely watch for 5 minutes before it stop playing. I downloaded a show since I got a repeated “internet connection” error message (which I didn’t believe) and I still have issues streaming from my phone to the Apple TV. Thanks a lot for forcing a crappy new app on me and preventing me from watching what I’m paying for. How do I get refunded for all this wasted time and frustration?!?!?!?!

title: Are you kidding me!!!
review: I never ever leave reviews. I also never ever get mad or upset. I usually just let things go. But, thisssssss....I am beyond upset with how this all turned out. You spent so much money advertising something that was supposed to be SO amazing and it is absolutely horrible. YOU HAD ENOUGH TIME TO FIGURE THIS OUT!!! I am unable to download the app on my IPad. Can only watch my one show on my phone and there isn’t a stopping point on it...so If I fall asleep, it just keeps going and going. Find a way for us to be able to have this app on ALL PLATFORMS. Quit cheating people out of their money. Man UP!!!

title: Really??
review: So now I can’t freaking watch any of the shows I USED to watch on the HBO Now app because I didn’t know updating the app would cut my access?? I shouldn’t have to go to the website to watch shows! Why didn’t you just create a new app? What’s the point of this HBO Max B.S. if people can’t access the shows they used to?? You all are money hungry donkeys (you know the word I really want to say). Shame on you for cutting people’s access and not giving them a heads up that updating the app would result in no longer being able to access the things they could on the HBO now app!

title: Content is good, but AirPlay works about half the time
review:
Good luck trying to airplay anything to your tv with this app. I’ve attempted countless times to air play shows and movies to my tv and it simply doesn’t work. Or when it does work it cuts out after 5 minutes of use and you have to mess around with it for 10 minutes to get it to stream on your tv. 

Also what a terrible design for an app to default to only working over WiFi on your phone or tablet, even when you have unlimited data and they advertise you can stream anywhere with it.

title: Needs improvement
review: Hbo should have the language option as a drop down menu of some sort instead it is a weird one button which goes between the languages whenever you click on it. If you start the movie in one language and want to watch it in a different language it stays in true original language you chose rather than the one you want- very annoying. Please fix that.

title: The worst streaming app!
review:
Simply horrible. Can't watch a movie on iPhone X without a million problems. Gets stuck, disconnects, suddenly shows black screen but movie goes on. And restarting the app rarely fixes the problem. Have to delete and re-upload the app almost every time we watch a show! 

Shocking that HBO spends 100ds of millions on creating great programs but they try to save on the most important thing there is: the tool that brings these movies to the customer. Whatever pleasure the series bring into our lives is destroyed by this stupid dysfunctional app. FIX IT ASAP!

title: No Good Movies and Expensive. Also stole my money.
review: I’m editing this review and saying that the service stole my money. I paid $16 for a month of this service and only got 2 weeks and now wants me to repay. I don’t even think it’s worth it because most of the movies I’m seeing are really boring or I’ve already seen. I only bought this expensive service because of Close Enough. However that’s the only thing I watched because I can’t find any other good movie or show. Does this service even have like newer titles.

title: It’s off to a good start.
review: Many people complain about HBO Max for it’s lack of support on other devices. It’s still quite new so you can’t blame the developers for it’s lack of support plus the app itself is pretty clean and easy to use I personally haven’t had any problems experience-wise. It’s a great app that just needs minor improvements.

title: Eh...
review:
Eh. It’s very hard to navigate. Before the app change, I had HBO Now and it was super easy to find the shows that I wanted to watch. Now, it seems I have to spend 30 minutes looking for my show, which is annoying and makes me close the app and go somewhere else. 

It needs to be better organized. I get having the other networks...but I feel all the movies and shows are grouped into one section. I personally would like to see it organized by individual networks. 

It can be better.

title: Doesn’t work with Apple TV HBO subscription
review:
I am subscribed to HBO through Apple TV. Apple claims that HBO MAX is included with Apple TV HBO channel if you sign in with Apple ID but that’s a false claim. HBO Max charged me $15/m extra (7 days trial is free). I have no problem in spending some extra bucks but business model based on lies and deceit will not work

Looks like the response is just a poorly programmed generalized statement from a bot. I clearly said , I subscribed through Apple TV HBO channel which includes HBO MAX. I know how to sign in. Your HBO Max is messed up or you are just plain unethical who should be sued for making false claims and fraudulent charges.

title: Love it
review:
Only problem I’ve had so far is when I try to scroll down on the titles info I can’t so I can’t read all of what the show are movie is about hopefully u fix this issue 
Other than that live the app works way better than Disney plus when I got that. 
Was just going to do the free trial but will definitely keep.

title: Amazing!
review: I love everything about this app it’s easy to navigate and it has all the shows that you can’t stream anywhere else. If you have a direct tv you get it free which is another huge plus. It has shows ranging from pretty little liars all the way to all 8 Harry Potter movies I would recommend you try it it’s definitely a game changer!

title: Poorly designed user interface
review:
Like many others, I’ve found the Apple TV app to be very poorly designed:

1. There’s only one way to search for titles: using the onscreen keyboard which is SO very painful. Every other streaming app has a search field that lets you use voice input or your iPhone keyboard if desired.

2. Movies don’t always disappear from the Continue Watching section when finished. You have to go to the HBO Max website to get rid of them.

3. You can’t see other episodes of a series from the Continue Watching section. If you want to see the episode list, you have to SEARCH for the series (did I mention how painful that is?)

Because of all of these problems, I try to avoid the HBO Max app and instead use Apple’s TV app for things like searching (which fortunately includes results from HBO).

title: Can’t connect consistently
review: I enjoy the app when it works.  However, whenever I change WiFi networks I receive an error message when I try to login.  The most recent has been true for several days.  I can login with my phone but not my tablet (and I could before).  I have restarted my tablet, logged out/in of my TV provider, and removed and replaced the app with no results.  It seems that you have a good product with a poor application when looking at other comments.

title: WORST OF THE WORST.  Rarely does this even work
review:
I do not write reviews.  Usually ever.   BUT after having evening after evening ruined by trying to use this app, (so I could movie marathon with my daughter or trying to have a romantic evening). 
It doesn’t work on the phone, it doesn’t won’t to work on the smart tv and it will not even cast.   I can not believe they got my money for this, and the amount they charge to use this mockery.   I should have read more reviews before downloading so I wouldn’t get caught in this utter display of incompetence.  HBO should do everyone a service and refund their money and then pay them to use this poor excuse of a service.   

But hey!!!! At least they will let all of the previews of what they want to show you play just fine and then of course once the movie starts..... crap.   

Goodbye HBO.  Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice..... well that won’t happen.

title: Disappointed
review: I’ve been trying all day to login to HBOMax from my iPhone with no prevail. Every time I try logging in it gives me an error message saying that too many attempts have been made trying to login. That could be the furthest from the truth. I’ve tried troubleshooting all suggestions from Google, but still no luck. I’m not interested in changing my password.  I not only have Internet and cable (HBO included with my ATT package), but also unlimited wireless service. Guess I’ll have to miss out on a program that I was truly excited to watch. Thanks a lot HBOMax app or ATT.

title: I will eat crow
review: I complained earlier that I had downloaded content but it streamed is anyway. It gobbled up data. I put my phone on airplane mode and found a different way into downloaded content from there. I was mad at first. The developer pointed out that I was probably in the wrong section. They were correct. For that I am reevaluating them at 5*.

title: So many problems and glitches
review: I know this app is new but it needs lots of work! Great options of shows/movies to watch but the app is constantly giving me problems on the tv and on my phone. The app just suddenly shuts down, it forgets what episode I left a series on, it’ll tell me there’s an error and just freeze, I’ll press one thing and a whole other movie will come up. But hopefully with upcoming updates everything will get better. I’m so happy to be able to watch friends again

title: Horrible for trying to cast to TV
review: So, there’s no fire stick app so I have to cast through Apple TV or chromecast. Ugh to both. No other tv app is so glitchy. Apple TV—will play and then at random intervals just pause the show. Chromecast—after you connect and press play the controls to chromecast disappear so if you want to pause you have to close out of the app, then to keep playing you have reconnect and then press play again. Newest IOS and most up to date HBO max app. And I deleted it, restarted my phone, reinstalled it and restarted my phone again. Same issues.

title: Close to great
review:
The app is good, but really, really wish it didn’t require bouncing out of the Apple TV app to watch content—it would be fantastic if content just streamed within the Apple TV app (like it does with Channels, including CBS All Access for example and even the previous HBO offering through Apple TV Channels). 

I understand that’s beyond the scope of just this app, but this is a component of it, and the overall user experience suffers because of it.

Please, please consider this.

title: Not Voiceover friendly!
review: It’s not Voiceover friendly using my iPhone 11 Pro.  I did not try it on any other device.  Almost everything I do is on my iPhone 11 Pro using Voiceover.  Voiceover is very clunky on HBO Max app.  I can’t advance to the next item by using Voiceover jesters by swiping.  If I want to search around the screen I have to move my finger around the screen.  I am probably missing a lot of content by doing things this way.  It would be helpful if I and other Voiceover users could simply swipe around the entire HBO Max app smoothly to fully engage in the experience.

title: Problematic
review: This app has possibilities. I like the addition of TCM and Ghibli content. However I noticed that when I’m online and try to play a download it streams the title instead of playing the download which costs me a lot of data. The solution, so far, is to go offline and then the app directs me to the download page. I guess it’s a glitch in the app’s program which should be fixed. Secondly, when a download expires and I attempt to “renew” it doesn’t renew the download. I will update my review when problems are corrected.

title: Good Content. Buggy App.
review: I’m enjoying the selection of entertainment here but theApp needs work. When I stream a movie from either my phone app or my iPad app, I get an error message that it can’t play the movie or show. If I respond to that message it crashes. If I ignore the message it plays the movie to the end. Unlike other Apps that stream media you can move to another app without it shutting off the movie and you can dim the iPad or iPhone. I am running the latest version of IOS on an iPhone 11 and an iPad Pro.

title: Does not prioritize downloads and forgets place
review:
I download episodes because my internet is intermittent. The only way to use the downloaded episodes is to turn wifi off, but often I need to leave it connected (for example, downloading software update). Even though I have the episodes downloaded, it shows that the episode is buffering because my current connection is not good enough.
Also, it does not save the place I left off at for downloaded episodes. When I start an episode I have partially watched, it starts at the beginning.

title: Great content, terrible interface
review: I’m so fed up with this clunky app I’m actually thinking of canceling my subscription! No ability to turn off auto play, getting back to episodes in series and wanting to restart episode (it can be done but only after wasting time hunting through the app for the main listing of all the episodes in a series)...I get tired just trying to explain it. HBO, there’s just no excuse for so bad an app. Fix it!

title: HBO Max was worth the wait
review:
I’m glad I waited for HBO Max. Heard about it late last year, and waited so long for this. Holy crap, this update is GOOD. 

The app is so sleek, hasn’t crashed on me and is just all around easy to use (take note Netflix, your UI has gotten progressively worse over the years). 

It also comes with all 8 Harry Potter movies. You really can’t ask for more!

title: Criminals
review: Total disaster so far and can’t get a person on the phone who knows how to help me. Oh and here’s a nice little slap in the face: just - week ago the “hbo now” app disappeared from my Apple TV. So I try watching hbo now on my i pad and I figure I’ll mirror it to my tv. Nope. They somehow rigged it so I cant mirror it. So I spend hours on the phone with Verizon who tells me I don’t pay for hbo any longer. But I produce an Apple bill which says I do. The other thing that is hasn’t been accessible to me in over a week is hbo go which I’ve been watching on Apple TV, phone and iPad for about 3 years. Morons

title: Shows are great, app is garbage.
review:
There’s no reason this app shouldn’t support 4K. HBO has taken shows that I’ve watched before on the same set-up and made them complete garbage.

The Apple TV app should get negative stars. I’m forced into this half-baked, garbage app so AT&T can steal more of my data and habits than they can get through other players that work well? Please. The piece of garbage TV app doesn’t even support scrubbing, so god forbid you need to go to the middle of a movie, which you often do since the app will often crash and not remember where you were in the film.

title: If 0 starts we’re an option
review: That’s what I’d give. One day, out of NOWHERE, the app stops working. I have an account t that I pay for and can use on my TV with a fire stick, but it WILL NOT WORK on any laptop, tablet, or other mobile devices.  It tells me that my service is not supported. It used to work fine, now it’s a waste.  We will be canceling our account because this is has been an issue for MONTHS and has yet to be resolved.  I’ve tried to contact HBO about this issue multiple times, and NOTHING is done to fix it.  This is how you lose business.

title: Got HBO through AT&T?  Think again.
review:
Ever since the HBO Max campaign rolled out, anyone who had access through the AT&T unlimited data plan has been cut off.  I've called in repeatedly and they can't/won't help me.  Last time I called in they bounced me back and forth between customer support & tech support and each claimed that the issue is with the other department.  This went on for 4 HOURS.  Each transfer the sound quality got gradually worse and worse.  Last guy I talked to was really nice and confirmed that this has been pretty prevalent.  Then he promised to move this up the chain and confirm via e-mail.  

That was over a month ago.  

Never got an e-mail.

I tried the chat function but as I was waiting for anyone to answer, it kicked me off because it claimed that I wasn't responding so I got booted.  

Don't even bother with this app and don't expect any help.

title: I am still paying — why can I not access through an App now?
review: I understand the contractual issues with Roku, through whom I subscribed years ago.  But why am I cut off from all HBO Now access through an app until that gets resolved?  I cannot log into Max, even into the limited library I still have a right to watch.  I am stuck with a cludgy browser interface, unless I am missing some obvious solution.  And there doesn’t seem to be an option to go back to the old now interface.  Very frustrating to a long time customer.

title: Casting feature worked fine then didn’t
review: I have a Vizio smart cast tv. I have no stream/cast issues with my other apps. Hbo Max was working fine until two weeks ago. It will not cast from my iPhone or iPad to the tv any longer. I have searched the Internet high and low for a fix but it seems there are none. I am not purchasing a chrome cast to attach to my tv since it’s already built in. What is the issue HBO max?

title: “My list” needs improvement
review: There should be a specific section where I can assess My list and not have to scrolled to the side to see everything I have added and on top of that I can’t see everything I have added to it, there is some limit. My boyfriend spent hours adding stuff to our Smart Tv app to later realize only part of it is in that list. Please fix that. Other than that, no complaints.

title: HBO max was a complete mess and is a scam
review: when I tried to cancel my subscription they didn’t give me the option on my phone they just said to renew subscription clearly they are to still have me have that subscription they can go to hell I got 15 dollars off my credit card and before I also tried to cancel my subscription but it gave me no option on my phone I refuse to download this ever again money I could of used to buy food but no and let me remind I have no computer so I had no option but to continue it , very bad !!!

title: Great content but app needs fixing badly!!
review: The user interface is lousy and the downloading feature is broken. The downloads section is buried in the user profile and more than half the time that I try to download something the download percentage just gets stuck at 0% and once it does get downloaded after I watch it and try to delete the download it takes forevvvvver until it even registers that I tapped on the buttons to edit and delete it. I love the content but the app itself is crap! Very frustrating to use!

title: APP REPEATEDLY CRASHES TO SIGN-IN SCREEN
review: I wish I can give this app no stars, but unfortunately I am forced to put a star to complete my review. This app is really buggy to say the least: after logging in and getting to my “who’s watching screen” I hit my name and I’m automatically taken back to my log-in provider screen. This is very frustrating and annoying. The developers need to do a better job in fixing the bugs if they ever want this app to be successful. This is only my second time using this app and it’s very disappointing. Please fix the constant crashing!!!

title: Worst interface
review:
Pretty much the worst interface out of any other streaming service. 

Suggestions: center play/pause button, add next button for tv shows to play the next episode, show season number in the title that’s being played, make episodes easily accessible, add skip title sequence option, and fix the issue of closing out of minimized screen when episode ends and play next episode instead.

It’s really weird that the app is so terrible....
Come on, it’s 2020, streaming services are part of everyday life, I’m sure there is plenty of research about user experience of such apps, app development is pretty advanced. Being a multi billion dollars company, how did you end up rolling out such crappy app....you really dropped the ball. It’s been over a month now and no significant updates to fix this crap.

title: HBO NOW subscribers have been SCREWED by HBO MAX
review:
I recently tried to use the HBO Now app on my iPhone, only to find it had been replaced by HBO Max. The app said I could use my NOW account info to log into MAX, but when I tried logging in it told me that because I subscribed through Roku, my account would no longer work. So now I’m paying for an NOW account that won’t work on either my iPhone OR Roku. How is that for screwing your customers??

My advice? Don’t spend money on an HBO account. There are so many PPV choices now, so why spend money on one that you cannot rely on to work with your devices?

title: Major connection issues
review: I have had major connection issues on my PS4 since the update, it loads the previews just fine but it will not play any shows. Customer service says it’s my internet, but all my other streaming apps work just fine, as well as using my phone to stream the app with my internet. The issue has to do with the app and the PS4 specifically, I’m wondering if others are having the same issues. If I can’t watch on my tv anything I will have to unsubscribe.

title: What am I paying HBO GO for??
review: I haven’t use the HBONOW app on mobile in a while; we usually stream via Roku. I just saw that my app auto updated to HBOMAX instead of HBONOW and the Max app won’t let me log in with my EXISTING subscription that I pay for. Some kind of message about my subscription not being compatible, and telling me to watch through HBONOW online instead. When I go to the HBO Now website, there’s literally no place to sign in, just to download the HBO Now app, which no longer exists. Seriously ridiculous - why am I paying for a subscription I can’t access on all devices?

title: Love the App but
review: I would have stay with my subscription but then I realized that you can’t play in any of my tv. I have Roku in all my tv. I even try to see if I go to my Apple TV app it would work, but no. Could only use the app in my phone or my Mac on browser. So when HBO max is on other platform I won’t be using it. I can’t be watching on my phone all the time, I would have love to see it on my tv.

title: I love it, but there could be some improvements
review: I mainly was excited to get this because of access to ghibli content. I want to be able to watch it in Japanese without English subtitles, or even better, with Japanese ones. I can’t remove the subtitles while watching it in Japanese, but I think it would be a quick fix to have an option to remove the captions

title: Review for the App, not the content.
review:
I switched to HBO Now years ago because I liked the idea of getting my content directly from the network that sources instead of paying Comcast. 

The only reason I did this was because HBO Now streamed their shows the second they aired locally on TV. I was able to watch every episode of Game of Thrones the moment they aired, no delay. If I got home a few minutes late I could start right at the beginning, making it veritably better than HBO Go or HBO w/ Comcast. 

For some reason, this FORCED upgrade to HBO Max has me sitting around waiting for my show to finish airing before I can play it for myself. Completely unacceptable and the only reason I ever made the switch to HBO Now. 

Game of Thrones is over, and while HBO still has the best content, I won’t stick with a service that sheds its biggest selling point for me. The competition is fierce.

title: Headphone Quality Issues
review: My big complaint is that the sound can only be heard in my left headphone on random shows/movies. That just started this week. I didn’t have any problems with that while watching Curb Your Enthusiasm a month ago but it’s present now. I don’t have that issue with any other streaming sites. It’s even disproportionate without headphones.

title: More subtitle/audio options !
review: If HBO max wants to compete with Netflix it must offer a wide variety of Subtitles and Audio, at least start off with spanish for now. My parents pay the bills including subscriptions and for now they will only stick to Netflix because it's the only platform that will offer these variety selections. If you want more viewers streaming your service you must offer this! You are loosing viewers by not doing so!

title: Skip intro function
review: I find this app okay. Would have gave it 5 stars if they would have just added a SKIP INTRO while starting a new episode. Like for example I’m watching The Sopranos on my Samsung TV and the start of every episode there’s no SKIP INTRO which I find it annoying cause I have to manually fast forward every single start of an episode. Other than that it’s a great app.

title: Interface is terrible
review: Whether it’s on the iPad or Windows, HBOMax is terrible to navigate. But the biggest issue for me is downloaded programming. First, if you are connected to a data source it will stream instead of playing the downloaded material. Secondly, if you have no data (think flying) the competed downloads are so poor it attempts to “buffer” missing sections of the download. Making offline viewing very painful. So much for my Perry Mason binge while flying over the Pacific. Every episode had 15 seconds missing about every 3 minutes.

title: Persistent audio issues
review: I love the app, I love the content. All of it has been pretty good for me except the low audio levels on some content. The most egregious example was Deep Blue Sea where it was unwatchable due to dialogue not being decipherable. Today it was trying to watch The Invisible Man on the app (on a 4K Apple TV). It was in range but too low so I switched to watching the film off the cable box instead of the app. Please fix this. Thanks in advance

title: Eh. I expected better.
review:
The two stars are for the content. Warner Bro’s obviously has some great programming available. 

If it wasn’t for the content it would be a one star review for the app itself. Lack luster features when compared to other streaming apps. Definitely have some improving to do for the plan price.  

There isn’t the ability to auto skip the intros to TV shows. You have to fast forward through it. 

The navigation of the episode list is frustrating and counter intuitive in my opinion. 

For the price I’m paying for this subscription I am not happy with the fact that there are ads at the begging of some programs - you can fast forward through them - but still. 

Biggest problem right now - I can’t get it on my ROKU!  Come to a freaking agreement already!!!!!

title: Meh
review: The app itself is okay I suppose. It seems to work fine most of the time. My only issue is HBO removed their Apple TV channel so now I have to download another app when it was already built into my TV app with my other subscriptions. I would much rather watch it through the TV app because it is far superior in design and function. On the content side, I am fairly happy. Original HBO shows with some really Max originals.

title: Garbage Downloading System
review: App is fine (minus occasional freezes and lag) but the system of downloading is such utter garbage. After tropical storm Isaias, I went into downtown to download shows. With 5 bars of LTE it took two hours to get to 51% on four TV episodes, I closed the app and when I came back everything, both partially downloaded and in the queue was gone. 2 hours wasted. Its now 8:30 PM and I am left without anything saved. It’s 2020, the issue of TV downloading shouldn’t be this awful. every other streaming service does this fine.

title: Hit or miss after downloaded episodes
review: This app has been hit or miss after downloading several episodes and then trying to watch them in airplane mode during travel.  All of the episodes say they are downloaded and have not expired but will not play... even after landing and on WiFi.  Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn’t...so much for watching them on the airplane....

title: Been waiting for something like this!
review:
So happy that I can finally stream all of the Fresh Prince  episodes and a few of my other faves like Pretty Little Liars and Friends. It was simple to sign in with my tv subscription. 

I hope that add more shows like Wayans Bros, My Wife and Kids, Family Matters, A Different World, and 2 and a half Men.... and more 90s and 00s sitcoms.

title: Fantastic
review: Watched an Entire Season of a Cool show, no problems at all. Added several shows & movies to my list and no problems with that either. Watched a downloaded Show offline and works fantastic. Highly recommend my family and friends to try this App out!! Love it!!

title: Unfortunate.
review: I couldn’t cancel my subscription through an online platform. In able to cancel my subscription I had to download the app and do it through there because going online and trying to sign in would redirect me straight to the App Store. Definitely an unnecessary and annoying step. Then I log onto there only to be redirected back to the webpage I was originally trying to access to cancel my subscription. Which doesn’t really make any sense to me and honestly was very inconvenient and annoying.

title: Not VoiceOver compatible
review: I was really excited to get this app, though I am totally blind, I am an avid TV watcher; and really wanted to re-watch pretty little liars. Signing up for the free trial was easy because I did it from the website, but when I go to put in my credentials in the app, that button that says already sub subscribed  no matter what I do that button is not detected by my screen reader and normal of double tapping makes the button work. It’s really sad since  HBO is backed by such a huge company.

title: What We NEED!!!
review: Its 2020 they’re should be a remove from list button! for all the half watched and unfinished  movies you’re not going to continue! I’d love to be able to jump back into my show without having to scroll through 10 different ones I didn’t like.

title: The worst HBO app
review: I have never had an app freeze as much as HBO Max. It is the only app that freezes, so I know it’s not our internet service. It freezes when I try to go to the next episode in a series, it freezes during viewing and the A/V gets held up and “skips”. It is incredibly frustrating but it is the service that came with AT&T unlimited. If I was paying for the service independently, I would cancel immediately. I only gave it two stars because I like HBO itself.

title: No internet connection
review: I’m using an iPhone X with 13.6.1.   I successfully used the app on several occasions.  Recently when I click on the app, it opens to the message that I have no internet connection.  I checked a few other streaming apps on my phone and without hesitation they open and stream content without issues.  I vetoed I have internet connection and deleted and reinstalled the app twice.  That’s a lot just to get HBO MAX to work.  In the end know many default solutions as a techie junkie... the app just doesn’t work.

title: Great app
review: This app is great good variety of movies! The thing i don't like is that i can only watch enjoy this on my iPhone? We have a Roku and been trying to find this app and it's not available? Why can’t it be available for us to enjoy this great movies on TV? And will it be available  soon for us to download it? 🙁

title: This is horrible
review: I can’t even log on. I’ve tried using my old hbo now password and log in, Nope. AT&T log in, nope. Resetting my password, nothing has been sent to my email yet so I guess that doesn’t work either. It even asked to verify my account by going to aT&T, when I click the link it provides it just refreshes back to the same page. The transition should never be this difficult and frustrating. I’m giving up tonight, maybe there’ll be an email to reset my password when I wake up in the morning.

title: Missed timing of a show
review:
I really like the streaming service and all but
For some reason I try watching a show I’ve been waiting to come out for 2 whole years (close enough) and it was an awesome experience.  Tho I have a problem with a sound error where the voices don’t match the frame of the video.  But that’s okay.  I’ll try another time

title: Bad initial user experience
review: It doesn’t matter how good your content is if it is a huge hassle to just start watching a show. Take my money! If you’re worried about Apple taking a cut, just charge me more! The sign-up process involves disclosing my name, email address, and agreeing to terms of service, when ideally it could be a single subscribe button. In a world where everyone has 1 million accounts and passwords, it would be nice if all of my content subscriptions could be managed through a single source that actually respects privacy.

title: Good content But no Roku
review:
The content provided is good, and the way things are categorized helps. But the lack of availability on Roku is probably going to really impact subscription numbers. I find myself using other services that I can watch on my TV, rather than using my phone or tablet to use HBO Max. I’m going to give them a little while to figure it out, but they really need to make it more readily available if they’re going to want it to work. 

Also, doesn’t work off WiFi.

title: HBO is bugging out
review: Every time I would try to watch something on HBO it would say “ video can’t be played right now , please try again later “ so I would either come back later , restart my phone , or close the application but every time it says the same thing .. I’ve been waiting for HBO max to air then I had to wait to get the app and now it’s bugging out .. please fix this problem ( I have an iPhone XR by the way )

title: Unable to watch on Roku
review: I was excited when the app on my iPad changed to Max. But then I couldn’t access it on my Roku devices...and now can’t access with my 3rd gen Apple TV device! I’m done...I’ve waited for you to come to an agreement with Roku, but Apple TV is the final straw. I can only watch on my iPad. Unless I am traveling, it is worthless to me. I have now unsubscribed for HBO. Someday, maybe, I will check again to see if you are on Roku. There are a lot of options besides HBO! Guess they will get my money now.

title: Glitches
review:
-Sometimes when I open it, it freezes. 
-Everytime I try to play a show with airplay, I have to skip to the middle of the show just to get it to sync properly with the tv. It otherwise won’t do airplay. 
-if I want to fast forward, rewind or use close captioning, I have to do it by phone but the controls disappear unless I pause it on the tv. 
-sometimes if I rewind it, it glitches and skips and moves to a place I didn’t put it at or restarts.
-we have a smart TV and can stream all other apps through our tv except this one. We have to use our phones for this. So it really is drag when it doesn’t work well.

I hope the UX and programming is improved. So far we’ve been frustrated.

title: Cant get signed in with mobile provider
review: I have AT&T as my mobile phone provider.  AT&T customers are suppose to get HBO MAX free with their unlimited plan. I have checked with my mobile provider, and yes, my phone plan does include HBO MAX. But, every time I try to sign in with my mobile provider, the screen keeps cycling back to the sign in page where it asks you to link your account. I have tried to sign in on my phone, my daughter’s phones, my son’s, my husband’s and even on a TV with no luck. I have even called tech support. Still, no luck!!!!!!!🤬😡

title: Just doesn’t work
review: I was very excited to finally watch hbo again; however, it’s very hard to watch anything on the app. I rewinded on a movie and for the rest of the movie, the frame rate dropped completely. The dialouge was so far in front of what was actually on the screen. I tried fixing my internet, I tried restarting the app and nothing worked. I’m very disappointed with this app and I hope there will be modifications to improve its’ quality of streaming.

title: For a new release, color me impressed
review: The lead up to this launch was a long one. Licensing deals, HBO executives leaving, and the question of how such a varied amount of content would be organized in app. But I have to say, it’s well laid out and the separation between different sections is nicely obvious. All in all, an excellent launch with great content for the same price as HBO Now. Looking forward to the Snyder cut!

title: Using Xbox? Read
review: If you are using this for your Xbox which is why I got the app forget it. Sometimes it will work long enough to watch a whole tv episode other times 5 minutes. After reading many other reviews I see it is a very common problem. I haven’t used it on my phone much yet but I will update if they fix the issue or if phone has similar results

title: Don’t Download This App!
review: THE WORST streaming service I’ve ever used. HBO, you guys need to really get it together. I have HBO, but wasn’t necessarily interested in downloading HBO Max. But now there isn’t even an option to just have an HBO app on my phone. Not only was I forced to download the HBO Max app, but had to subscribe to it in order to watch some of my favorite shows on my phone or iPad. On top of that! You can’t even watch any shows from this app unless you are on the WIFI! I repeat, this is a horrible app and HBO has lost another customer. Do not download this app.

title: HBOMAX in my TV not working
review: What is going on? I installed the app in my smart tv and I watched maybe three movies but each time it would take long to get connection to search for movies, since yesterday I have not been able to get movies the app is searching and searching, the three dots are blinking like it searching but it has not been able to load any movies anymore. It’s very frustrating. It’s supposed to be included in my package with my wireless but the app is not working in my TV like it supposed to . Not happy right now.

title: Frustrating
review: When I pause and try use another app (reply to a message) and come back I have to start the show over again from the home screen and scroll back to where I left off. Sometimes I’ll come back and it starts where I left off. If I’m downloading to watch when I don’t have service if my phones screen goes dark I have to start downloading again from 0 and start over again from the homescreen. I would think I could download in the background while using other apps.

title: Very Poor Decision
review: I have had HBO Now for years and have been very happy. Today I tried to watch it on my phone and found out that HBO Now is no longer available and if I want to watch something I have to subscribe to HBO MAX. And if I subscribe to HBO MAX I can not watch HBO on my ROKU. So basically I have been forced to make a decision keep HBO Now and only watch it on my TV or subscribe to HBO MAX and only watch on my phone. My choice will probably be to drop HBO all together, as I'm sure a lot of other people will do. Thanks for making my choice to save money each month easier.

title: So far so good
review:
The app is good so far, but need some tweaking, needs a search by genre, and please give anime an independent genre, anime is not for kids.
A little big detail it doesn’t support Roku nor Firestick.

No other languages options, no suggestions, little content. I have had HBO for over 10 years so I was excited with this new app version, but I see no improvements in general to HBO now or HBO go.

A week later since the launch, the repertory is so little compared to the other streaming companies, still the language and subtitles option is basic, the biggest is the Roku and Firestick platforms not available yet! HBOMAX was announced one year ago, yet they couldn’t copy and paste, tweaked from the the other streaming apps... very disappointed now.. there was no need to create HBOMAX

title: Awesome!
review: It has such a wide range of content with so many great films and shows, it’s almost overwhelming as I don’t know where to start first! It has a great system which makes it super easy to find what you’re looking for and I 100% recommend this to be added to your list of top streaming services.

title: Won’t even open up
review: It has all the potential of being my next favorite streaming service but for some reason, when I leave the app and go back in later there’s some sort of connection error. At first I thought it was just my connection but all my apps work perfectly fine, I’ve tried re-downloading only for it to work for a bit before acting up again after I close out the app and go back in later on.

title: Are you KIDDING me
review: I have paid for hbo now as long as I’ve been a cord cutter and was so excited to to see that my account rolled into hbo Max with all of the new content. Come to find out that the hbo Max app  is NOT ROKU COMPATIBLE!? So because I have a Roku tv I now have to go out and buy a new Apple TV or device (or whole new TV!?) to get the new hbo content I’m literally already paying for? Meanwhile my hbo now app still works, it just has none of the new stuff. Imagine a whole channel just being like “nope sorry f your brand of TV specifically”.  What a freaking joke.

title: Issues!!
review: It was a great app at first I really loved all the content. But then out of no where it logged me off ok no problem I tried logging back it and it said my information is wrong when I haven’t changed the password or anything it won’t let me connect using my xfinity information then it says I have to pay for the app but it’s suppose to come with my plan with Comcast. If this is just a way to get people to pay more for something they don’t have to pay for then I’m done HBO and Comcast

title: Great selection, bad App
review: The movies and shows speak for themselves they’re top notch. But the app is really really bad. When I select a movie and hit play to chrome cast it will usually cause an error on my TV causing it to crash. When it does load it will play for no more than 20 seconds before it does the same, it will crash and cause my chrome cast to kick back to the menu. It’s a massive bug that means I can only watch these shows on my cell phone.

title: Zero stars!
review: They get zero stars but forced to give one in order to submit review. Why offer free subscriptions if you’re not going to honor them or pay for something you cannot sign in to?!?! It will not allow me to do either. Absolutely ridiculous! I sure hope you read your reviews and value your customers enough to compensate for all the inconvenience but most importantly, fix the issue and prevent this from happening to anyone else. I was never able to watch anything on the app & never reimbursed. Not happy.

title: Hate the updated version!
review: When I first received the notification that I would automatically be given this new updated version of this HBO Max, I figured it was cool. However, I did not think it would reset ALL of my saved content. Now I have to search for my shows; some of which I cannot remember, and save them again to my list. I am very unhappy with this. Also, some of the content HBO Now had advertised as coming soon that I was interested in watching is now completely gone so that makes me sad.

title: Managing profiles not working
review: I have just installed this on my phone and I created profiles for my kids with parental control and now it doesn’t let me see movies because it’s applying the parental restrictions to my profile as well. I have deleted and reinstalled the app, I have removed my kids profile and still the same. The section of Manage Profiles on the app doesn’t do anything but changing the circle around the name. You need to fix this ASAP.

title: Paid subscriber yet still playing ads
review: I’m a new paid subscriber to watch Friends. I like that HBO offers good selection of movies and tv shows. However, between the shows, I just hate watching ads for other HBO shows they are promoting. I understand HBO wants to promote some of the shows and movies, however, it should only be played during the free trial periods not when you are already a paid subscriber.

title: Great until it lost all my profiles
review: The app was working great, excellent content, no real gripes with the app itself. Then today I try to login and when it connects through my tv provider like normal all the user profiles for my family are gone, so is viewing history, etc... Deleting and adding app back didn’t fix the issue. This is a core function of this sort of app so 2 stars on what would easily be 4 or 5 if it functioned as expected.

title: No audio
review: Every time I try to play any movie or documentaries in my Tv there’s no sound at all. What am I supposed to do! And funny thing is It has audio on Phone or iPad. I did everything but nope no sound on my tv. It’s just for HBOMAX rest of the other apps  like Netflix and prime are just fine. You guys really need to fix this. And the app should be loading faster too it almost took me like whole 2 minutes every-time I try to login. These glitches might lose your subscribers as fast as they come in the first place.

title: HBO Max is Solid 👍🏻
review: I just started using HBO Max after I got it for free (thanks to HBO Now), and so far so good! I’m hoping more big titles like (The Matrix) arrive on here, because so far the content here is great!! The interface is pretty simple and easy to use, but I do expect some changes between now and then. For now, HBO Max is perfect for those who love HBO and Warner Bros.

title: Great selection - major connectivity issues
review: HBO has my favorite shoes and the movie selection here is nothing short of amazing. If I could ever connect. Or when I do, stay connected. And it’s not my WiFi. Other streaming services work perfectly. I tried using my data on my phone, same problem.  This would be the best streaming service available, if it worked. I spend more time watching those three dots than I do my favorite shows.

title: Glitchy
review: Sometimes HBO Max works, but most times, there is no sound for ANY of the movies or series. It’s not my TV, because if that was the case the sound would never work. Also, if you try to use the back button after watching an episode or a movie to return to the home screen, it never loads! You’ll have to exit the app completely and go back in. I cancelled my membership because there’s no point in paying for a streaming service that doesn’t work most of the time.

title: Crashes and logging out every single second
review: So I decided to get a free trial of hbo max so I decided to watch some shows you know like close Enough and all that stuff 2 weeks later I ago onto hbo max and suddenly it says that I’m locked out! But I don’t even remember signing out. So I sign back in and I continue watching hbo max shows, BUT THEN while I’m in the middle of the show a second later it suddenly says “SIGNING OUT” when I was in the middle of a show! Please hbo max fix this stupid bug you have the worst streaming app ever

title: Great app but needs auto play
review: I love being able to watch all the shows and movies. It would be very beneficial to have an auto play feature and a skip intro option or skips intro automatically if auto play was used from last episode.

title: Pretty good app
review: I don’t know if it’s just me but, the sound seems kinda low compared to the other apps. I have to put the volume up pretty high just to hear the conversations people have either in the movie or tv shows.  I haven’t used to much of the app because I’ve been busy, but the sound was my only complaint so far.

title: Content is good, app stinks.
review: The layout of the app stinks. My son wants to watch DC Comics stuff, and the adult profiles have a special tab to make it easy to find. My son is special needs and has difficulty typing out names and whatnot. It seems mighty stupid to give adult profiles more tabs to make things easier to find so why in the hell doesn’t a child’s profile have more ease of access buttons. Then again, coming from AT&T I should know better than to expect anything to be well thought out or easy to use.

title: Start From Best Streaming Practices
review: We should not have to be your product managers. Start the user journey from the high point of what is already accepted as “best practice” in streaming. Also, you’ve had years of learning from GBO Go and Now that should’ve been baked into this app and it’s like you threw all that learning out. By the looks of this app, some of your WFH product people are doing more relaxing at home than working. Fire a few to wake the rest the fk up.

title: Poor airplay support
review: This app is terrible UX wise and playback wise. All the content is restricted to 1080p. On vizio the chromecast only plays audio in stereo. Airplay does play audio in dolby format but for some reason HBO restricts the video to 720p. Pathetic! The airplay pauses in between because HBO plays different videos! First the trailer plays and the airplay pauses, then you hit play manually again and there’s a video about “this is a hbo presentation” followed by the actual movie. What a terrible experience! The wishlist is hidden under the user icon for some reason.

title: I am a subscriber but cannot login
review: I can’t use any of my subscribed benefits online because I can’t login.
