AT&T can’t seem to fix it - they are totally at a loss since I came in before bundled services and before they bought DirectTv (when Directv was separate things were a lot simpler) and therefore HBO can’t fix it; therefore, the app is completely useless for me. 0 stars if I could. A separate login would solve this issue - I provide my account # and set my email and password. Fixed! But no, that’s too easy.

title: Closed captions need to be fixed
review: I really like the app I really don’t have any problems when I use it movies and shows load with out a problem. However the closed captions need to be fixed I press the cc option on the bottom corner to turn them on but nothing appears on screen.

title: Good in concept, bad in execution
review:
I like the app because it gives the option to download for offline viewing. It also has Close Enough (which I’ve waited years to watch)

That’s pretty much where all of the good ends. For some reason I can’t pull up my downloads unless I have service. Even then, if I’m watching something I have downloaded and I lose service again, the message saying I’ve lost connections comes up on the screen. 

I believe that some bug fixes, and this app will be golden

title: Can’t Log in
review: I downloaded HBO Max a couple of days ago and it let me sign in through my tv provider without any issue. The next day I went on the app and saw it logged me out so I proceeded to try to log in with my tv provider. Every time I press the log in button it gives me a “connection failed” message. Other people at my house can log in through the provider with no problem. I’ve deleted and re-downloaded the app a handful of times and it still does not work. I don’t know what to do.

title: WHERE IS THE ROKU APP
review: I won’t make this longer than it needs to be: the content is GREAT. Fantastic even. Loading is inexplicably slow, and like others have pointed out, it is not very user friendly in that it’s hard to find where you left off when binging a show. Again, bizarre at this point for a streaming app. But worst of all, I hate that I cannot watch this on my tv with my roku. HBO, please get contracts in order to make it happen. It’s been a month now!

title: There is no skip intro!
review: I would live this app even more if there was a skip intro button while the intro plays. This is because I find it very annoying that you have to skip past the intro manually. I would love if you added this feature. Otherwise, keep up the good work, and keep adding amazing features.

title: DISAPPOINTED
review:
So, I see that HBONOW has been “replaced/upgraded” by this supposed new app...all WITHOUT clear instructions to user on how and WHERE it would be available prior to the “upgrade”.  I just attempted to log in only to learn that it’s “not available” on my devices and I can’t get to the old app via Prime Video - WHO PLANNED THIS MESS???????

Tell me how to watch the remaining HBO shows that I’ve paid for until I can get the new mess!!! And, oh btw, I have an HBO account that I can’t even use to upgrade to Max...for some reason it isn’t recognizing it.  Go figure..

title: It’s worth it.
review: It’s worth the price because you get movies and shows from: Cinemax, HBO, DC, CNN, TNT, TBS, truTV, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Rooster Teeth, Looney Tunes, and Warner Bros all in one place. They have hundreds of movies and shows plus they’re adding more every week! It’s better than Netflix because Netflix doesn’t have that much newest movies like HBO MAX does...

title: Disappointing start
review:
There are a lot of movies here, but it’s the little things that are off Putting.  Things like cropping friends to fit wide screen instead of keeping the original aspect ratio.  

If you are going to offer anime or other foreign films, please make sure to include the original audio as an option.
Not including Japanese language and subtitles to the studio Ghibli films is a huge miss as most watchers of Ghibli studios are older than young kids.

I opted to try for this reason alone and was greatly disappointed (like season 8 of GoT level of sad)

 You can also let the user decide on language, and whether to allow for full screen vs cropped.  

I’m hoping this gets fixed in future updates.

title: No picture when connect Apple device to a TV
review: I download content (high quality) while at the office to watch when at home where there is no reliable broadband internet connection. I connect my iPhone or iPad to the TV using the Apple cable.  Lately when I try to watch content, there is no picture on the TV. The device says “streaming to tv”, but I get sound only. 🥴

title: Loving the design, features, and content!!
review: So much new content to explore in addition to the always incredible HBO original programming and licensed films! The interface is really nice and I can only imagine how great this app will be once they roll out even more of the features and content they’ve announced! Great stuff!

title: Complete disaster
review: I don’t know who the genius was who decided that there should be THREE different apps (HBO Now, HBO Go, HBO Max, etc.) but it is a nightmare trying to figure out which one is active at the moment and what content it has. I subscribed to HBO Now (or was it HBO Go? I can’t even remember at this point) and now they’ve come out with HBO Max, which, surprise, doesn’t work with ROKU. So I got a chromecast so I could watch the content that I am already paying for, and the app won’t even let me sign in. Complete and utter failure of an app and a company.

title: I had left a not so positive review.
review: When I first got on hbo Max I didn’t like how it didn’t keep the movie if I left to answer a text. Hbo has for sure listen to my comment cause it is no longer an issue. I am sure I am not the only one they heard but it feels good to know they listen.

title: Love the service...when it works
review: I really like their service. The app needs work. I dislike that I download episodes to watch while offline and I can watch 2 then it asks me to sign in again. But I can’t because I’m not online. The whole point was to be able to watch when not online. Now I’m back with service and I just get a blank screen every time I log in. I deleted and re-downloaded but it’s the same thing. I go through this just about every day. Frustrating.

title: Needs work!
review:
There should be a feature where I can see all episodes, like being able to click on the title instead of having to search. 
Also, after there’s a glitch with what I’m watching, it doesn’t come back to whatever I was watching but it skips to the next episode and the previous episode disappears. 
Please be added to Roku.

title: Sometimes it works, sometimes not
review:
The app is very hit or miss on whether it decides to work. 

HBO shows are amazing, but the effort it takes to watch them on their app is terrible. The app fails to play any content either locally on the phone or via chromecast. Using WiFi or cellular data doesn’t seem to make a difference either. The app loads, you can browse shows, but nothing will play. This behavior happens to sporadically that it feels random.

title: Download disappears
review: What is the problem here?  I have to download movies when the traffic on our hotspot is slower, since ATT does not provide rural customers any option but a cellular hotspot. The problem is that when I download a movie to watch later, later the movie starts download all over again. This is insane why does it always do this. It is impossible to watch it as it streams since the cell service is so bad. Please fix this.

title: Bring back “Legendary Nights”
review: The movies & vast variety of tv series are great. But I really enjoyed “Legendary Nights the tale of Gatti-Ward”. As a kid I was fascinated by the old “Legendary Nights” & other boxing documentary series, I really really hope you guys bring back the docs on the sport of Boxing would definitely bring back that fan base from the days of HBO & boxing.

title: Buffering is ridiculous
review: I’ve had hbo now and switched to max. I still have the same issue with it buffering all the time. Can’t watch anything without it buffering. It’s not my internet connection because all other streaming services for fine. It’s just this app even when I use the computer it never fails. There are so many complaints I don’t really understand why we’re still having the SAME issue.

title: I understand now why this app is so low rated
review:
Just downloaded the app, can’t sign in. Just get a message that says “can’t connect. We’re having issues connecting to HBO Max right now. Please try again.”

This appears to be on the developers end. My internet is fine, all other streaming apps that I have are working fine. Tried multiple times and getting the same message over and over.

Amazing that the app can’t even perform the first function of logging in. It looks like HBO doesn’t want me money. I’m sure all the other reviews that are criticize other major problems of this app are legit.

I’ll spend my money else where and probably never go with HBO again. Learned a long time ago that apps that launch like this rarely ever get fixed. Years later they have the exact same issues.

title: Disastrous rollout, fallout
review:
We had planned for months to sign up only to find at the last moment that our streaming services *and* smart television “don’t qualify” for service. This, after watching quality programming on HBO literally for decades, seemed a genuine disappointment—until closer examination reveals much repetition and relatively little exclusive programming. Perhaps this particular conglomerate will make things right. I’m not holding my breath, and will stick with other services and different workarounds until ATT and/or WarnerMedia comes to its senses. 
Zero stars.

title: Awesome!!
review:
People really need to read and follow instructions before they leave a negative review. I have the AT&T 1000 plan and this app is flawless. Easy. Fast. Even a caveman could do it. Forrest Gump’s mom was right... Stupid is as stupid does. If you have AT&T, don’t listen to what the stupid people write. 

Read. Listen. Apply. 

It works.

title: Great App!
review:
Logged in with AT&T login without any issues. The app was easy to setup and looks sleek. Playback works instantaneously. Great job so far on having a nice app. 

For those giving low stars for app not being available on Roku, go find a forum or go to HBO’s site to complain. The iOS App Store is not the place for that.

title: Don’t work half the time
review: So I login to my HBO MAX account and then it tells me I don’t have a subscription. So I called my provider (Cox) and told them if they could help me. I was on the phone for 2 hours trying to get it working. Finally it starts working, just to find out about a week or two it’s saying to same thing over to me that I have to pay for HBO MAX when I’m already paying for it. This has happened to me a least 4-5 times. It’s like why am I paying for something I can’t use????

title: Great initially.
review: The HBO Max app was a 5 star app until the last week.  I don’t have the ability to airplay over WiFi. Up until a week ago I could download a movie or show and cast to my tv using the hdmi to lightning adapter flawlessly.  Now whenever I try to I get audio on the TV with no picture and a black screen.  Other streaming services still work using the above mirroring technique.  It’s hard to justify keeping under these circumstances.

title: Inconsistent and annoying
review: The first time I used it everything worked. While it was a little slow, I was still able to download and watch a movie and several episodes of a series. Now with nothing in my queue I began another download and it reached around 30% and would just disappear from my list of downloads. I’ve tried several times with the same results. Extremely frustrating.

title: The content is great but this app feels racist...
review: I was really happy to get HBO Max cause me and my wife enjoy a lot of shows that they have...but when we got the app there were no subtitles in spanish or any other language at all... so now we feel excluded from enjoying your content since we are not so fluent in english...this is really sad it feels really bad that a company like this doesn’t care about the hispanics that really want to see their shows... it feels racist

title: Good start, but buggy.
review:
Overall, I like this app and the content. There's not a ton of content and I was hoping for a bit more DC but that's okay. 

My biggest problem at the moment is downloads. They do not continuously download if I'm not in the app and a bigger problem, when it says they're downloaded, I return to the app to find half my downloads have disappeared. I've downloaded the same shows/movies about 5 times now to no avail.

title: Improvements Needed
review: When watching a show the next episode should play prior to the credits ending; automatically. There should be a skip intro option. Also why are you playing commercials for your other shows? We already pay for the hbo max you don’t need to promote to your subscribers. Netflix has all this figured out maybe they can help.

title: Glitchy
review: The app has some amazing titles, but when I am watching on my Apple TV, whatever I am watching gets interrupted multiple times with the same “Oops! Something went wrong” and I have to go back to the home page and start the show again. I’ve deleted and re-added the app, hard closed it and restarted it, still the same message. Very annoying.

title: Still no subtitles after complaints from HBO Go
review: I immediately canceled my free subscription because I watch a lot of shows with my mom on Netflix in Spanish subtitles or audio. This app has nothing in Spanish ! Only actual Latino shows are in Spanish . You would think after all this time Hbo would finally add subtitles or audio after not doing it on HBO Go. This is why Netflix is the best streaming service and will remain the best because they cater to all people! Looks like I’m going back to Netflix, good try though !

title: Can’t view downloads offline
review:
It’s incredibly frustrating that I download a title. Then when I’m on the go I see the option to view that download once. Only once.
Then all the app displays is “Cant Connect: We’re having issues connection to HBO Max right now. Please try again.”

I know you can’t connect. That’s why I downloaded the title to watch offline. What’s the purpose of this feature if not to view while without internet.

title: It’s okay
review:
Why isn’t there an option to select episodes from the continue watching section? I feel like this is important. I’m having to search and then select the episode I want to watch. 

Also I noticed there is not feature like the Netflix “are you still watching”.

Overall it’s alright. It has a clean design and just really basic.

title: It’s okay... love the content, apps okay.
review: I just hate that if you don’t have internet and you’ve downloaded episodes, it takes forever for it to load still like it’s searching for internet. It shouldn’t take that long. And also I could have extremely good service and it still buffers constantly and sometimes the app will shut me out completely when I try to go to just watch my downloads.

title: Not functional
review: There are good shows and movies but none of the platforms-computer, tv or phone- are very user friendly. You can’t pick which episodes to watch you can only go in order and you can’t go backwards. I don’t like how on the computer if you’re in full screen when it goes to the next episode, it takes you out of full screen. Also you can’t download the app on a fire stick to watch. Overall there’s a lot of work that needs to be done

title: Closed Captioning
review: I think it’s nice that you have the option to customize closed captioning through your devices, but honestly it irks me that the subtitles aren’t centered and I don’t like the settings I have to choose from on my iPhone or Xbox one. I have never had this problem with any other streaming service, including HBOGo, so I’m not sure why this is the way it’s been done for HBOMax.

title: I upgraded their rating!
review: My initial rating got upgraded from one star to five when they made it accessible to those of us paying for traditional HBO through a cable subscription. Thank you HBO. They have a nice selection of stuff to watch, some of which really surprised me.

title: ANTI-CHRISTIAN
review: This services does not offer a single Christian, spiritual or religious movie. When I put in a well known title such as the passion of the Christ and countless other blockbuster titles, it gives me NOTHING except suggestions for non religious movies.  There is one movie that comes up but it is “silent” and I’m not sure how many people are interested in silent movies as I’m not. There are many many categories offered so everyone except Christians have something to choose from. I’m so tired of these companies attempting to  steer everyone away from God.

title: PIN doesn’t protect adult profiles
review: I feel like this is backwards. The PIN needs to unlock the adult profile. As it is right now, children can log into adult profiles if they aren’t already in their own. The PIN is only there to keep a child in the profile it’s already in. There are other services out there that have it set up to unlock adult profiles with the PIN. Please fix this!

title: Trilogies leaving like crazy!!!
review: i can’t finish a single trilogy i like. i get HBO Max and start watching Harry Potter. i get half way through the movies (POOF) they're gone, so then i decided to watch the Hobbit. i watch the first movie THEN POOF GONE. i don’t even wanna try Lord of the Rings because it’ll be gone before i can finish it too!!! i get that they can’t always stay but a warning that they’ll be GONE the next day, it would be nice so i can actually binge them before they’re gone instead of watching them at normal past.

title: Issues with Chromecast
review: Overall the service and programming is great you get all the HBO movies and shows plus older and new Turner television shows. The only big issue is that when I try to use the app with google chromecast I do not have audio. I tried checking everything and cannot seem to fix it. So I can only watch it from my phone and iPad which is a pain.

title: Terrible launch
review: The fact that HBO launched this new service without having contracts in place with all of their television providers to allow access to for us to use this app is very disappointing. Also the fact that there are now so many different HBO apps that do the same/various different things is terribly confusing. If this is the one app to rule them all, then you should probably work on giving all the people that pay for HBO television access to this app immediately.

title: Can’t play title
review:
50/50 chance when trying to play a show I would get a “can’t play this title” message. No connectivity issue; other shows would play. I have had this problem trying to play several shows and not one in particular. 

The interface is great and a wonderful improvement from the previous app.

title: Incredibly buggy app
review: When the app is not buffering interminably, there are connection errors — either to a particular show/film, or to the entire service. Other times the app claims I’m offline, and won’t load at all. This happens on average 50% of the time I try to play material from my iPad or Apple TV 4K. It is tremendously irritating. The company makes too much money and the subscription prices are too high (for a new and clearly under-tested service) to produce such horrendously unreliable apps.

title: 2 Stars
review: I was so excited when my cable provider had a free 30 day trial of HBO Max! I’m only giving 2 stars while the content is good, it’s disappointing that I’m unable to watch on my Roku, since an app is unavailable. I’ve resorted to hooking my laptop to my tv to watch my shows. The chrome cast ability is non existent, and has not worked once for us (brand new tv). I definitely won’t keep this app after my trial ends, it’s not worth the hype.

title: Offline download issues
review: Easy enough to download when online. The problem is when you don’t have a connection and you try to watch what has been downloaded. If you start watching, switch to another app, then switch back, you can’t get back into HBO Max to continue watching. It gives a Could Not Connect Error every time and doesn’t let you navigate to downloads page.

title: Total BS!!!!!
review: I’ve had HBO since it first arrived in Miami. As of July 31st I will never have it again! The fact that they want me to pay twice for the same service is ridiculous. I have HBO on my direct tv account, which I stream on my HBOGO on my other TVs. So HBO decides to no longer be carried by Roku. What genius came up with that idea! Did they not see the success of Disney+? This only shows me they don’t give a crap about the customers, only about making more money. So long HBO, say hi to CBS all access on your way down!

title: AirPlay and Interface has major issues
review: App continues to display error messages while trying to play using my iPhone 11 Pro. I had to fully close app multiples time every time I tried playing next episode. Interface has lot of empty places. Thumbnails can be tighten up to show more content on one page. Also, once you into an episode from homepage you don’t have the option to view other episode from the same page, you have to go search for it.

title: Is there a way to Skip intro and end credits?
review: HBO needs to include “skip intro” and “watch next episode” features on its interface. I have to fast forward every time I watch an episode. I’m currently watching “the wire” which, true to its time, has a super long intro and end credits. Netflix is on point with this, and HBO needs to step up its game to continue to be competitive in the streaming space.

title: Difficult to work with
review:
Edit due to developer’s response:

 I did every single thing to troubleshoot through the link provided and still not resolved. I can’t go anywhere after watching a movie/show because every where I try to go it spins and spins and spins and spins.....so I have to close the app and reopen. Horrible app navigation. 

I have the HBO max app on my Samsung TV. IT’s easy to browse and watch movies, no buffering or streaming issues during a movie playing. But every time I try to return home after watching a movie, it spins and spins. Literally for 5-10 minutes to the point I have to close the app and reopen it because it doesn’t seem to know what to do or how to get back to the home screen. It’s horrible! 

I’ll come back and give it more stars if this gets resolved.

title: Add more content
review: Seriously, I love HBO and this HBO Max is a good idea. The app is good too, don’t get me wrong here, it’s a very good idea but I wish you could add more content that most of us haven’t seen. Everyone most likely seen all the movies in the app, so it would be great too add content that we haven’t seen yet. If you’re reading this, thank you for listening.

title: Please fix this
review: First of all I love love love the selection. I mainly subscribed for Friends and Studio Ghibli movies but there is just one little issue that I am not content with. I have a Rokutv and currently I am unable to stream on my tv even though I am paying for HBO Max. To make it worse I couldn’t use my hdmi cord to split screens. I am so sad to subscribe to this service and not be able to use it on my big screen :(

title: Life was so much simpler with just HBO Now
review: Good luck scrolling through movie or show selections on the Apple TV app. Any time I scroll through the movies, it crashes and I’m taken back to the home screen on my Apple TV. I thought, perhaps I should baby the Apple TV and scroll slowly. Nope. Still crashes. Then I have to scroll down to the HBO Max app, sign in again, scroll to the movies, and see how far I can get down the list before the app crashes again.

title: Having Audio Issues
review: There seems to be an issue with the sound mixing. I’m watching Spirited Away and the music is really loud while the dialogue from the characters is really low. It’s like this for both English and Japanese languages. I thought it was just me so I put on my Blu-ray copy and that sounds perfectly fine so I don’t know what’s going on here. Is anyone else having this same issue?

title: Poor user interface
review: Great shows, horrible user interface for the iPhone. My controls (pause/play, fast-forward/rewind, etc.) constantly disappear every time I try to access them. I have to find the episode I was on and push play again to get the controls to come back up. Quite annoying for the high price!!

title: Works Perfectly and Seamlessly
review: I have a DIRECTV account with an HBO subscription and it could not have been easier to sign in using my current password. If it doesn’t work for you, then you are the problem that needs to be fixed.

title: Can’t verify your subscription
review: It would be nice to use a service you pay for. I will change the review once I actually can see something to review but until I can actually watch something with this service, it deserves a 1 star review

title: No WiFi makes using app difficult
review: I don’t have WiFi. When I first got this app I was able to stream movies and TV shows but, now I am required to download movies and TV shows. It takes an awful long time to download a  two and a half hour movie. I have to download it while I sleep and watch the next evening. I won’t be getting a lot of use out of this app.

title: Problems logging in
review:
I received HBOMAX when I signed up AT&T almost a month ago. I have it for one year. I can watch it on my TV but I cannot watch it on my iPhone or iPad. I could for 2 weeks and it kicked me off and no matter what trouble shooting steps I go through it will NOT let me log in. I have called for help 2 times. No one could help.....I am still Not able to watch on my my phone or iPad. 
What is your Suggestion ??? 
I switched from Verizon and the transition has NOT been smooth. 
HELP ‼️

title: Fix the feature that continuously plays once I fall asleep
review: As much as I hate Netflix “are you still watching “ feature; It’s very much needed and appreciated now that hbo max doesn’t have this function. I fall asleep watching Friends and wake up in the morning and I’ve smiled through 2 seasons as a time. Even when I have my tv sleep timer on. I use chromcast to cast to my tv and after the tv turns off it continues to stream. 😠

title: So many bugs
review: I want to like the app, I do. But one day I can stream while doing other things on my phone and the next day, the app has to be open and then phone cannot go to sleep without interrupting the stream. Lots of “sorry, having trouble playing this content right now” messages being displayed. Content is great, but an actual Apple TV app or Visio smart tv app would be great. So many kinks still need to be worked out.

title: But a great launch
review: All the fanfare for this service and then it’s released without full ability to send to a larger TV screen unless you have some specific services.  Given how pervasive HBO is and the number of cable and satellite users that purchase their product, one would think that more consideration would’ve been given to that group bs only those that stream or watch TV from a PlayStation console.  It’s disappointing.

title: Auto-updated to an app I can no longer use?
review:
I have a subscription to HBO Now, but for some reason I can’t access it on any of my devices anymore because they all updated to HBO Max?

Here’s a brilliant idea, if you haven’t figured out the licensing through some providers, don’t remove support for the app that actually works until you’ve figured out an alternative.

Non-sensical that overnight this app changed names and now will not allow me to sign back in. Way to bungle a roll-out.

title: Poor performance
review:
Where to start? The image quality is noticeably worse than the major competitors. 
For some reason the menu runs at what seems like 4 frames per second or so on my PS4 pro although runs fine on Apple TV so something is definitely up with the optimization. 
The previous app was fine there was really nothing wrong with it from a user perspective. 
Not sure why they would go backwards. Smells like money or favors.
Someone at HBO screwed up on this one.

title: Can’t sign in if you have an account.
review: For some ridiculous reason, only primary account holders can make an hbo max account. I have an account I used it for years on hbo go, so did my 4 other family members. Now the accounts are useless. Can’t watch anything on any of my hbo apps. Would rather stop watching all together than shell out another 15 to use your app. Allow all hbo account holders to access hbo max please. Miss hbo go, get rid of this garbage and bring back an app that works.

title: Dropped the ball
review: HBO forces our hands into downloading and transitioning to hbo max and the amount of bugs is unreal. Where to begin...offline media downloads rarely play. On today’s flight, the app didn’t even give me the option to access my offline downloads. Switch out of the app to check a text or an email and it will redirect you to the home screen and not the video you were watching. Very disappointing- would not recommend. I’m canceling my subscription.

title: Keeps crashing on AppleTV
review:
Continual crashes.  Sometimes when you open, sometimes when you pause a show, trying to browse to movies, or wherever, every time a crash and restart with “Ooops something went wrong....”. 
Usually takes 3-4 tries to get a show to start playing.   Don’t touch anything, don’t pause, don’t rewind or skip ahead.   Horrible.  So frustrating.  Tried rebooting AppleTV, Tried deleting and reinstalling the App.  Nothing works.  HBO Go was great, HBO Max is an absolute dumpster fire.

title: Impossible to access easily...
review: Honestly I would have nothing but good things to say if it weren’t for the fact that they make it near impossible to watch easily on many different devices. For those that don’t have the most current and up to date TVs, iPads, tablets or whatever their service doesn’t support older devices. So unless I wanna go out and buy a newer TV or iPad then I’m screwed to watch all that they have to offer. Please for the love of god HBO please fix this issue!

title: Cellular warning pop up
review: Just started using the app and it’s annoying how many times the warning that I’m streaming using data pops up. I hit dismiss but it comes up again in 10 seconds. Sometimes like 8 times in a row before it finally stops popping up. Then with a new episode pop up warning starts over again. Please fix.

title: Good content, horrible connection
review: They have a lot of good content on this app. However, that’s completely ruined by the constant buffering. I can’t get through more than 20 minutes of a movie or series without it buffering for a total of five minutes. It’s not my internet connection. Every other streaming service works perfectly fine. Fix your app. It’s not worth subscribing for this.

title: Auto play keeps playing shows after quitting app
review: We need to be able to turn off auto play. We will leave off on sat, episode 2 of a season and then come back and will see on the  continue watching section that it’s at episode 9.  This happens on Xbox whether we quit the app or not. This is wasting my bandwidth. Please pass this on to whom ever can fix this. And get the dang app on fire stick already!

title: Here for the max content
review: There's very little original content from HBO that would entice me to subscribe but with this max service, a huge library of classic TV & movie content from past decades is made available. That's definitely worth the price of admission.

title: Not my fav
review: .  However I do love the fact that I have access to every season of South Park but where is every season of vice news Definitely needs more improvements and tweaking seems like all my shows that I wanna watch like vice news show the main reason i signed up for HBO are not there to watch. all they have are the special reports ones.  where are seasons one through whatever six or something

title: Could be better
review: The subtitle are huge and the fast forwarding or going back is a struggle and can easily go to far forward or back. No option to automatically go to the next is also frustrating and not consumer friendly. Just a few changes that would make the experience much more enjoyable.

title: Buggy - not worth the switch from HBO Now
review:
App is terrible. First it's not compatible with my Apple TV. Sure, it's an older version but I'm still not pleased. Now it won't download on my iPad pro... and even on my iPhone, scrolling is hit or miss. I can't scroll to read more on any "about" screens. 

All in all a net negative compared to HBO Now. I don't care how much more content there is if I can't access it, in fact now I'm paying to NOT access it.

title: Auto play feature
review: Great collection can’t wait to see more - but really Wish there was an auto play feature - like an auto play on series episodes - and or auto play on the lists of movies we saved.

title: Doesn’t Work
review: Great content but I can’t see any of it. The app freezes and won’t open. I’ve deleted the app and reinstalled it but it hasn’t helped. I was able to get a film started and on my Apple TV using air play (I have a vs 1 Apple TV which doesn’t carry HBO Max) but it freaked out and stopped working. It told me to check my internet connection, but my wifi is completely working. Sadly I can’t use my Roku either because HBO and Roku are having a fight over who knows what.

title: Glitchy
review: I love the content and the app. The only major problem I have with it is when I’m on my iPhone and I’m watching a show, if I have to go to my home screen the app closes in the background. I have to restart the app all over again to continue watching. It’s very annoying.

title: Hmmm
review: The new shows are great. However the app crashes on me a lot. It says there’s no internet when there clearly is. The prompt for no internet will pop up during my shows often. Yet the show keeps playing so clearly- the internet works. Also wish firestick and roku would update so I didn’t have to watch shows on my phone.

title: Really?
review:
HBOMax can, and should, do better.   The autoplay is horrible.  I fall asleep and have to go back and figure out where I left off.  Having to click around to get to the full library of a particular show is lame.  
Like expanded content. But it wouldn’t be hard to improve the user experience by making basic changes to the app

title: Scam
review:
Update: after reading the developer’s response, I would rather pay for Friends separately than give another dollar to this crap company. 

The service isn’t supported by Roku or Fire Stick. They fail to mention this before charging you, and they also refuse to issue a refund as it is “against policy.” I guess scamming their customers is not against policy. I wonder how much money they made off of charging people who can’t use the service and then refusing to refund them.

title: Love the APP
review:
App worked great I download movies and shows to my iPad and watch in my rv on my tv thru HDMI connection recently in last few days I now only get audio no video have you changed something in the app since last update very disappointed since I use this while traveling

Thanks Greg

title: Minor problems
review: I came close to giving this a 5 stars but what bothers me is the fact I keep getting logged out from my account randomly and it’s getting annoying having to sign in many times. Other than that I’m very excited for your upcoming originals for 2021.

title: Rushed to blocked sharing I’m guessing
review:
The app is too glitchy to release.  Chromecasting during adverts throw exceptions and you have to restart.  Interface is inconsistent and nonintuitive. 

There is no thought to error handling or messaging... shouldn’t have to research forums to sign in with my own account - unlike the dozen other streaming apps where it works.

I guess they don’t care cause they have the content? Meh hbo is getting over rated anyway...

title: Can’t stream on Roku TV
review: Okay HBO, I get that streaming services are fighting with platforms, trying to establish who has more power in this next era of how we consume media. But it’s common sense that I’m more likely to stream from a different service than to replace my Roku tv so I can watch HBO Max. You’re not going to win, so get crap settled so I can watch TBBT on my tv instead of my phone or I’m just going to cancel my subscription and this app is going to tank.

title: Can only see on one device
review: I bought HBO MAX  because I was having surgery and wanted to watch movies while recovering. Now I’m home for 2 months in a neck brace and can only see HBO MAX on my iPad even though I have an Apple Device set up for the big screen TV. The only HBO on my Apple is HBO Now and it won’t let me sign in.   So I have to stack pillows high enough on my lap to see the iPad which still strains my neck. I have tried everything. A waste of time and money. Too bad. There were some good movies

title: Movie ideas to put out in HBO
review: Why not put the movie the boy 1 and the boy 2 it would really help people when they are stuck in lockdown. The app is amazing I get to watch old horror movies with my family when we are stuck in the house

title: App will not open
review: The app will not open on my iPad. I have tried all of the suggestions on the troubleshooting page (reinstalling, restarting the iPad, making sure my software is up-to-date, etc.) and nothing works. I now want to cancel my subscription, since I can’t use the app. However, when I try to sign in on chrome, the webpage asks me to download the app. Apparently the only way to cancel the subscription is through the app, WHICH IS NOT WORKING! What a waste of money!

title: Auto play feature
review: Please change the “ cellular data usage” message after every episode when not on wifi. Or at least give an option where I can click don’t show this message again. I would rate higher if you had a smooth auto play feature while using cellular data.

title: Needs work,  I think
review: Been using this app now for a few weeks.  I download content to watch offline during breaks.  When I open my iPad (WiFi only), it tells me it can’t connect to app and I am forced to use a hotspot to watch downloaded content.  Once I connect, I have to re-sign in.   Shows are starting back at beginning.  There shouldn’t be a reason I am unablemmwatch downloads while offline.  Right?  Help!

title: Downgrade from HBO Now
review: This new app is not very good. The video playback when starting or continuing a series does not always work right. The video will stop playing even after pressing play. Also where is the Siri search. Why am I still having to type in letters instead of using the voice remote. HBO Now just worked and I never experienced an issue. HBO Max is inconsistent and does not always work correctly.

title: Offline watching
review: Great app! Love all of the choices and the general flow of the app is very easy to navigate BUT I downloaded some titles to watch when I was going to be off WiFi and there was no way to access them! When there is no access to WiFi the app does not even load so I am unable to make my way to the downloads....please fix this!!!

title: Add more lists?
review: Love this app so far. Can’t wait to binge watch Dr Who. But can you guys please make it so we can have more than one list? Like I’m going trough Looney Tunes and picking out my favorites, but would like to put them in a separate list. All the Roadrunners in another list and so on.

title: Account =/= Subscription
review:
Used my free trial for an exclusive third season of a popular show (thanks for excluding half the fanbase on that one)! I cancelled my free trial/subscription and there’s no feasible way to actually DELETE MY ACCOUNT. Not subscription, ACCOUNT. Literally ANY OTHER SUBSCRIPTION SERVICE / PAYWALL HAS A DELETE MY ACCOUNT BUTTON ON THEIR APP. HOW HARD IT IS IT TO PROGRAM A BUTTON. 

Good choices I guess, though I can find most of them on better services. Horrible UI and Help/Customer Service. I SHOULDN’T have to go to call another company to DELETE MY HBO MAX ACCOUNT.

title: Wish HBO GO was still operational
review: I know things change but not sure why HBO decided to get rid of a proven app like HBO GO. I used it for years and quite frankly was highly disappointed in the forced switch. Not to mention there most certainly would be bugs and kinks in the new app. Seems like they could have let the MAX app be piloted a bit longer before forcing everyone to leave the other apps.

title: Chrome cast
review: This is so annoying. When I download the app it says “hey check out the chrome cast option” and then when I sign in and try to use it it disappears. One reason why I keep using other services because this one I cast cast to my TV. And plus they released the app before it was on roku so I can’t watch it in there. Overall a super rushed release and seems like they will pay for it because of that.

title: A lot to learn.. apparently.
review:
This app is a mess, strange because the previous HBO apps have had issues but were at least functional and things easily found. So many scroll errors and poor layout choices boggle the mind. 

And if trying to be a big hitter in streaming, have basic things on a show page like recaps and trailers. This whole experience needs to be overhauled if the intent really is to drop the other HBO apps. I’m embarrassed on behalf of the designers and managers.

title: HBO Max
review: Wether it’s the hbo side or the apple side something somewhere isn’t right. I enjoy the selection well worth 15 bucks a month. However I’ve had the app less than an hour and problems are there. Title pictures not loading, videos not loading after ad breaks, app freezing. That’s what’s happened so far. Hopefully bugs resolved soon.

title: Awful can’t even describe this experience
review: So my AT&T wireless plan includes HBO Max.  I tried online for an hour to connect the 2.   After changing the user ID and then trying to combine an account I called AT&T. Was put on hold 25 minutes, the agent that answered worked on it 5 minutes then said he had to connect to the tech department.  He did not stay on the phone and then I was entered into the beginning of the AT&T que. I tried to get to tech support and then was hung up on.

title: Offline Downloads Don’t Work
review: Good content and pretty app. Way more cons though. HBO has gotten a huge head charging 15/month. Also, I often don’t have WiFi, so I download episodes to watch offline. Half the time, during these episodes, I have to skip ahead 15 seconds and miss things. Gets on my nerves severely. Hire someone who works for Netflix’s app design to fix this buggy mess. Also, no Roku app? Sigh. All around not good.

title: Love HBO Max, but...
review: I love the platform and every content, but my parents don’t know English that much and there’s no option for me to change language. I hope there’ll be an option in the future for me to change the audio so my family can understand what they’re watching.

title: Bummed about accessibility
review: I was so excited to finally be able to launch HBO Max but was immediately aggravated that I couldn’t download the app on any of my devices (Roku, Firestick, LG smart tv). I can only watch from my iPhone then airplay it to my smart tv but it’s not as seamless as other apps. I really wish they would make this app more accessible because then it would be perfect.

title: 10x better than Netflix
review: Has everything I could have ever wanted. Whenever I watch Netflix, I search for an hour trying to find something good to watch. With max it seems like every show and movie is high quality.

title: The Fyre Festival of Streaming Apps
review:
App is broken. Says my provider doesn’t support it, but my providers are AT&T and HBO. If AT&T doesn’t support it, why did you develop it? AT&T is 40% of all mobile users! The single largest mobile user base in the country! Who doesn’t support it? HBO? 

Releasing an unsupported product that doesn’t function in place of a functioning one your customer has paid for is called fraud. Publishing a mobile app not supported by the largest mobile carrier (or by yourselves) is just dumb imho.

title: Basic app, lacks customizations
review: Would love to be able to select a different episode from the continue watching selection or view the show title page. Where is the feature to turn off auto play? Auto play is nice, but more of an inconvenience. Clearly the app was not well thought out and rushed to market.

title: No 4K?
review: It’s absurd to me that HBO would release their streaming service without 4K. Every other major streaming service offers this. HBO, one of the biggest entertainment companies in the world, can definitely afford to make this happen and for some reason they didn’t find it important enough. 4K is a standard in homes now and by the time HBO makes this happen 8k will be starting to become just as popular.

title: HBO FAIL
review: What a terrible way to treat your customers who used HBO NOW to stream. To replace the app entirely cutting off their access from streaming on their devices is really unconscionable. I’ll be unsubscribing from HBO from here on out since I can’t get it on my devices and that was one of the primary ways I was accessing it. You didn’t have to be awful to these customers, you could’ve created another app without discontinuing the HBO NOW app. But you chose to be terrible to these customers.

title: I can’t download things
review: I love the app! But I try to download something! When I turn my WiFi off for the road, It says “having trouble connecting to HBO MAX” I can’t even reach the downloads! Can you please fix this? UPDATE never mind! I figured it out!

title: Airplay needs attention.
review: Overall the app content is good but the airplay inconsistency is frustrating!  I can usually get one episode to play normally through airplay then when it switched to the next episode it loses connection we can’t get it reconnected. Doesn’t make a difference if I’m trying to live stream it or download it same issue.

title: It’s ok I just wish I could hear
review: I downloaded the app and I like the selection of what I can watch but my issue is I can’t hear anything at all. I test my headphones to maybe see if it was that but my music, podcasts are all playing normally so I don’t understand why I can’t hear in the app. I saw on reddit that a lot of people are having this issue as well.

title: Loading
review: Great content but I have to often delete the app and redownload it due to poor streaming. It will tell me it cannot play any title over and over again, blaming my internet as if it’s my fault. Total bs. The only way to resolve it is redownloading which is incredibly annoying and anger inducing. But other than that, the content is incredible.

title: Small user interface problem
review: I am enjoying the content however, when I request information on a series it doesn’t allow me to scroll, so the bottom text is cut off. I think this could be an easy fix for the developers.

title: Content Heaven!
review:
I already was subscribed to HBO GO before and updated my account for HBOMAX. Just finished going through movies and tv shows from A-Z and my watchlist is now packed! Looney Tunes (old and new!) current DC films, and so much more! I was really surprised how diverse and broad the content is and it’s only day 1. 
Worth it!

title: In Case You Missed It
review:
Apple TV is on Roku. So if you have a Roku device then get the HBO Max through the Apple TV Roku channel app.

Since I haven’t tried out this app yet and have to rate before a review I’ll give a rating of 4 because I am familiar with HBO and other Warner associated material and have always enjoyed the experience I get from them.

title: Why?
review: Why on earth would you put out a streaming service that’s isn’t available on a large portion of people’s televisions? I can only stream it on my phone which is just completely annoying. I love the service itself but come on. That wasn’t a smart move.

title: Best content out there
review: I was really impressed with HBO Max content. Not only it has the original HBO content but also seems to have every latest movie. I don’t think I would need to keep my Netflix or Disney+ subscription with HBO Max around

title: Invoices are confusing
review: Of course, that’s the plan.  I get three (at least) notifications of what I owe each month for directv and each is completely different.   Same holds  true for cell service.  I don’t know how people keep track of these balances!!!!!!   Simplify your invoices.  Send one, not three completely different bills.  So frustrating!!!!!!!  Verizon: 1 invoice each month.  Comcast:  1 invoice each month.  So simple and no confusion whatsoever.  Fix the mess please!!!!!

title: Rick and morty season four malfunction
review: I honestly want to give five stars so bad, but  Rick and morty season four was suppose to be out October 1 and it is October 3 . I am watching the series and it won’t let me, I’ve tried to see if there’s a update but there is none .

title: Half-Finished App
review: Downloading movies and episodes for offline viewing is consistently terrible. These issues are device and connection independent. The UI needs improvement too. For example when scrolling lists the list displays on the far left side of the screen while there's no touch response when interacting with the corresponding row on the right side of the screen.

title: Sound is too low
review: I love the Max and it’s selections. The only issue that I have is that the sound on all of the shows or movies is way too low. I have to turn my tv up almost all of the way in order to hear some of the dialogue. None of my other streaming apps on my Apple TV have this problem. Other than that it’s great.

title: Everything is great but bugs
review: I love this app all its shows and movies but every time you want to watch something it just random stop that you have to repeatedly refresh everything to get to the end of the movie or show and it’s very annoying

title: Good when it works!
review: After we watch a program/ movie, it won’t reload to main screen. Dots just go across the bottom of the screen. After a couple days (if we’re lucky!) we can access again and watch something. I thought it was fixed for a bit, but I was wrong. Subscribed early for discounted rate. I haven’t cancelled yet, hoping it would get better... it’s not. Too much $$ to only get to watch one thing, once a week.

title: Needs Updating
review:
Sometimes the app won’t even open up. Not sure why, but it sits on the opening screen kinda looks like it’s loading but never actually does. 
If you download shows/episodes don’t count on watching them if you don’t have internet. 
If you don’t have internet don’t count on getting into the app at all, whether it’s just to see your downloads or anything.

title: Cannot Log In
review: I have had a HBO Now subscription for over a year and had no problems logging in. When the app updated, I have not been able to log in and it says it’s not supported. I’m paying for a service that I cannot access because HBO has not updated the supported devices. They shouldn’t push an update if they cannot support devices that people use to access it. HBO should at least give back our money if we cannot use it.

title: Again , like others, good content, terrible interface
review:
Good content, especially the HBO specific, Last Week Tonight, GOT, The Wire, Curb your Enthusiasm, etc.
Why can’t the app pull up my content better, why is there no Picture in Picture??! I work on my IPad and often would like to watch HBO while checking my mail or other tedious task.
Also, the Roku thing is ridiculous, please get that fixed.

title: Can’t get connected through cable provider
review: I am using an iPad and have never had issues logging in to the app until this week.  Now I cannot get past the dial of death as the app sits and thinks... very frustrating.  The connectivity of this app with cable providers leaves something to desire.  I have lost two hours waiting that I will never get back.  I do not recommend this app if you are using a cable account to access.

title: good buut
review: I love hbo max and they have a great variety of shows and movies. Not much wrong but if your kids account for something you have to put in your “pin” for it. I don’t recall making one. Please fix this because I have to delete and download this app again and again.

title: Terrible
review: This app isn’t supported on Firetv. Are you kidding me? What is the most readily available, most purchased tv on the market? Firetvs. I guess I watching hbo on my phone now? Absolutely not. Fix this problem! What a terrible roll out. If you haven’t struck a deal with fire tv don’t take the service of HBO go away from your subscribers. Really infuriating. And from looking at the app on my phone content looks basically the same so why the new, less functional app?

title: Content is great but there needs to be Dolby Atmos/Vision support and an app for LG televisions
review: The content is great, especially the original content, however, it is disappointing for their to not be a smart tv app for new LG televisions. Also, there needs to be Dolby Atmos and Dolby Vision for the content as that is offered with other streaming services. Without it, the content on HBO Max seems less premium.

title: Superb
review: Superb Video and Amazing Audio on iPhone speakers. Such a cinematic experience on my XS Max. Love it. Will stay subscribed due to awesome loud surround audio and video which covers full screen for iPhone. Glad I subscribed. Wish there recommendations were better and annoying profile chooser window goes away for a single profile user.

title: I like it but ...
review: I recently purchased my fiancé a Roku in the huge hopes that he would be able to Stream HBO max that he would be able to watch it in his apartment without me so I can get some sleep. I realize your app is fairly new but I are you  Planning on having a stream across all platforms?

title: Good so far...
review: I like the options that are offered but my only complaint is when watching a tv series, and it goes to the next episode, the viewing screen on my computer gets small again...why?? Other than that, app seems good thus far.

title: One star
review:
I don’t think Im gonna keep the subscription because I can only watch the app on my IPhone but when I connect it to my smart tv it just plays the HBO preview then when it gets time for the movie to play it just buffers for ever, & I know my WIFI is A1 because everything else plays just fine on other apps. 

Ps: it’s crazy because as I’m making this review the move starts to play but has no volume yo it now. Smh I can’t win for losing 🤦🏾‍♂️

title: Love the content but HATE having to cast
review: Can HBO just come to a deal with Roku already? Or prime? Or have an app in Xfinity menu? Soooo many options now yet the only way I can watch it on my tv is to cast it? Chromecast has so many issues in itself that it makes me not even want to use the app. Seriously might cancel until these things are resolved

title: HBO Max Review
review: This is my favorite streaming app because I don’t end up spending more time searching then watching and they have some good Shows/Movies on here. My only problem is that they don’t have an app on the fire stick just regular HBO which doesn’t have everything That HBO Max has

title: Most Frustrating Apps
review: HBO has always had the most frustrating apps. From HBO Go to HBO now they’ve always been horrible and HBO Max is no different. Now and Go frequently had issues with buffering but at least I could watch the shows. It’s been months and HBO still hasn’t reached an agreement with Roku so I am unable to watch on my phone or laptop. I will once again be canceling my subscription once I finish binge watching the latest series.

title: HBO MAX-Maximum Frustration
review: I have enjoyed a subscription for years.  I am cancelling because the updated app not only does NOT work on my FireTV  for some reason some compatibility issues.  Additionally, the app on my portable devices does not download content for viewing off-line.  I have an incredible signal in my house on my wi-fi.  Other content has no problem downloading—-just this app is problematic.  None of this was ever the case before the updated HBO -MAX came out.  EPIC FAIL!!

title: What a nightmare this app is.
review: Just trying to relax and watch some tv and all of a sudden I find myself spending over an hour juggling devices, applying updates, signing into accounts, and reading FAQ after FAQ to get this thing connected to my tv. All for it to continuously freeze up every time I try to cast it from my phone. You’d think HBO would have this process hammered out before forcing everyone over - I guess not. Certainly not impressed here.

title: No SPANISH language option
review: Kinda disappointed that HBO MAX isn’t launching with the option to view its shows in Spanish,,not even subtitles. I know they offer it when you watch HBO on TV, so they definitely have the capability. I know for many people in the Latino community this might be a deal breaker. Hopefully they update and include it in the future.

title: Can’t see my entire list
review:
Using this app on our Apple TV. I just added a ton of things to My List, but can’t seem to access it. I see the my list section on the home page, but you can only scroll to the right and it shows about 20 things I added then stops. 

There’s much more that I added and can’t access. Super frustrating. When you click on browse, there isn’t a My List option. How can I see all that I added?

title: Worst parental controls ever!
review:
If you open the app on appletv anyone can play the adult profile. So kids can just log into the adult side when they open the app. IF they are on the kids side then they need a pin to SWITCH to the other profile. There should be an option for you to always have to put in the pin to get into the Adult profile. It’s basically useless. 

Also the layout isn’t great.

title: A Great App
review: Netflix watch you’re back. Lol So far I have been in joying this app the since its release. You’ll definitely become a couch Potato within minutes. The app is not hard to maneuver if you’ll familiar with HBO Now. Long story short...  So Many Movies, SO MAnY ShoWS!!!

title: A huge problem that needs to be fixed
review: When using smart cast, the volume is preset at max. If you go to adjust it it turns your tv all the way up and you have to turn it down.... why is set at full blast? It should be set to my phones volume. Wake up the whole family and blow out your speakers.....

title: Inaccessible application
review: I would like to echo some of these other users comments. In addition, it is not accessible to screen reader users. There are those of us that use voiceover on the iPhone and iPad. Blind users enjoy listening to shows as well. I cannot navigate this application because it is not marked up properly for screen reader use. HBO, you have a lot of financial resources, please remedy this.

title: Not casting
review: Randomly stopped casting from my phone to tv this week. Did everything it says from deleting the app to contacting chromecast. Netflix and prime video work fine being casted but HBO Max just gives me a black screen that’s just loading and gives up. Even the rep at HBO that I’ve been talking to fix this problem doesn’t even know and keeps saying is that all for today. What the hell am I paying for when it’s not working.

title: Can’t even log in
review:
Won’t even let me sign on via my service provider which is ATT U VERSE. Tried reinstalling, deleting tv provider on iPad settings, nothing works. I like the content but like others have said, app is garbage.

EDIT: downloaded the update today and thought it would fix the problems on my iPad Pro. Nope, still won’t even let me sign in, just hangs there after I enter my details. As useless as ever, wasting my space on iPad.

title: Please get hbomax on lg content store
review: I love hbomax but I can’t use it anymore. It’s not available in my App Store for my LG tv and that’s how I watch everything. I had it on my PS4 but can’t use that anymore. Please put HBOMAX on all platforms. It’s not fair to the customer that we have to buy an additional product to use this service when we already have places that we watch streaming services. Your attention to this glaring hole in service would be appreciated

title: Does not work for At&T accounts
review:
Tried logging in to my hbo max account with my HBO plan.  I have the account that comes with HVO max. On the apps loving page under At&t accounts my credentials don’t work. I called ATT customer service and they also said it should work with my plan and could not figure it out. 

Can someone please fix this bug or stop advertising that your service works with Att accounts. please. I’m now definitely never paying for HBO max.

title: Closed Captioning
review: Closed captioning is fine on mobile devices but when I watch HBO Max on my smart tv the CC are so big they sometimes block the view of the content. They are all over the place, make them smaller and maybe don’t move them as much because they are so larger than I’m used to! It’s kind of annoying!

title: Sleep Timer
review: Love the app and all of the content, but if I put on a show to fall asleep to, I don’t think it should just keep playing forever until I stop it. I’ve come back a day later to see my show jump another 7 seasons. Add a way for me to stop playing after a certain number of episodes and I’ll rate a 5.

title: I love it just not for my Hispanic family
review: My family is a huge fan of HBO. When we tried to watch a couple of films, the only available language is English. My family was disappointed as we have seen various films on HBO that are in Spanish. We are very please with Netflix and Disney plus as it offers other languages

title: Need option to turn off autoplay
review: It’s a video app that does all you want it to do, except when you want it to stop. The fact that you can’t turn off autoplay - where one episode automatically continues to the next in a series - makes no sense.

title: Make sure it’s compatible
review: I was very excited for HBO Max, mainly so I can watch Friends anywhere and anytime. However, I can only watch on my tablet in phone. (Didn’t know this until after I started the subscription) I have ROKU TVs throughout my entire home and news stories say the “company hasn’t reached an agreement” to allow ROKU users to add it to their TVs. Will likely not renew until this problem is solved.

title: No app on my firestick makes it useless.
review: I already pay for HBO through Comcast, so it’s annoying that I have to pay additional for the Max service, but I was interested in the content so I was still willing to pay it. To find out that I can’t access it through Firestick or my backup Roku is a deal breaker. It’s a poor business choice not to have this worked out before release and made me immediately cancel my subscription.

title: Major flop by HBO
review:
Programmers need to come up work a better interface. Nice selection of programs, although several original HBO shows and movies are not available such as Hysterical Blindness. Why? Just open the entire library. 

Tons of bugs. App crashes for no reason. This is 100% the app and not my smart phone or TV. Show freezes and tries to reload and then I need to exit reboot the app. 

With all the revenue that HBO has - why not make it great?!

title: Pay for now but can’t use max
review: I have been paying for HBO now but find out the new HBO shows are only on HBO max that can not be streamed on my Roku. I instantly canceled my HBO now subscription and will not pay for MAX until they add it to Roku. Research your target market it’s not people on laptops and cell phones. It’s people streaming on TVs. Why would I pay the same amount of money for half the shows. Fix your app put HBO On Roku and other streaming services it’s not hard.

title: Better version of HBO Go
review: The app is great and works well with my Chromecast. The only problem, which has become quite an annoyance, is that the app doesn’t stop playing a show or movie when the TV is turned off. So when the TV is turned on later the show/movie is still playing I’ve lost my spot.

title: Account
review: I was expecting the app to be like the CW were it didn’t matter if you had a account. But I was surprised to see the you have to have one to watch shows and that kinda of ticked me off. I know you have to make money some how but couldn’t you just have like 30 seconds of adds every so often?

title: Used to love it...
review:
HBO needs to step up their game, and make this available in all viewing platforms. It was great before the change to HBO Max... had no problems  with it before. Loved it actually, but since they rebranded and changed things up it became unavailable for me to stream. I am still paying for a subscription and now I can’t even watch it on my device.... Booo HBO!

You should have secured your streaming availability before rolling the rebrand out.

title: Disappointed ☹️
review: I loved the whole idea of HBOMAX, but I MISS HBO GO.  HBO GO didn’t hassle me or prevent me from watching due to cellular streaming.  HBO MAX freezes fREQUENTLY and prevents me from enjoying movies, series, documentaries, etc.  it’s now July 15 and HBO MAX made its debut May 27 with ample time to resolve bug and kinks in the app....hurry, I’m losing faith.  I deleted the app and downloaded the app again like many of us would yet the same result.  WarnerMedia and it’s developers created an app that isn’t so friendly to users...

title: Good Content, Bad App
review: You can download content to watch later, but if you don’t have internet access, the app won’t open. This means if you’re flying on a plane, in the mountains camping, etc. you can’t watch the content you downloaded. The app will not open without service. Please fix. This is on both iPhone and iPad.

title: This is a mess
review: I pay for hbo go and it won’t let me use it on my iPhone or any apple devices and my PS4. So I’m basically throwing money out the window. I can’t access any content and I keep getting a message that hbomax is unavailable and to use hbo now. So I try that and it just redirects me to hbo max. Fix this problem. I would like to be reimbursed for all this tome it’s been unavailable. I’ve been waiting on this issue to be corrected for a while now.

title: Can’t view anything w/o interruptions
review: It’s been ten days of attempting to watch original content and movies without getting errors that the video could not be played. Not one time, have I been able to watch any length show from beginning to end and not be kicked out with an error message. It’s terrible. It doesn’t matter which device I use from my iPhone to iPad and there’s no app on the Apple TV. I’ll be cancelling my subscription ASAP.

title: Bad service
review: 1 star because you had 3 different apps that all did the same thing. Confusing as hell to remember which one to use. Then 1 star because you went and combine them all, but now streaming services don’t work for AT&T customers (yet). So this app is completely useless until you get all your ducks in a row and I’m paying for streaming that I can’t access. Great job

title: Portrait vs. landscape
review: Can we get an update so the app lets you do both portrait and landscape.?  Currently you can only operate in landscape when you rotate an iPad on the launch or search screens  and potrait only on an iPhone for the initial launch.  Can we get both options on all devices....?????

title: Classics, new classics, anime and hbo originals
review:
Excellent.
The app works well and doesn’t look like all the others.  Surprised how much content available that I hadn’t seen in a while from the vault.
If they can produce new content as excellent as band of brothers, Silicon Valley , game of thrones, sector five I’ll be happy.

title: Having sign in issues
review: Where do I sign in with cell phone provider. It states that you can select TV provider or mobile service provider but when the button is clicked it only takes you to the TV providers I cannot login with my credentials. This came free with AT&T cell phone service the only reason I’m trying to use or even sign in and I can’t even use it. Not troubleshooting or wasting my time. Deleting app

title: Awful, terrible
review: The app won’t load onto my iPad even though I’m running OS 13.2 when 12.2 or later is required. Also it won’t work on my roku TV. What’s the point of having a streaming service that only works on my phone? No wonder they are running a cut rate special for the year with such a cut rate product. This app was launched over 2 months ago. Will it start working before my subscription is up in another 12?

title: To much buffering
review: Just got HBO max today and I am streaming the app from my ps4 console and the movie just kept buffering never had a problem with any of my other streaming platforms; just needed to get that out there, if it’s just the fact that it’s on my console or because the way it streams in console is different from cellular or Pc.

title: Well Designed and Streams as Expected
review: App is well designed and runs smoothly, haven’t had any issues and at least for me doesn’t appear to be missing any features.

title: I just wanted a trial...
review: But then I watched infinity train season three and Lovecraft country and both shows are still being released... you’ve got me hbo max, I will pay for your content!!! Evil posting these wonderful shows!!!

title: Weird subscription
review: We had hbo max through at&t and I was watching friends one day and then I took a break and came back after a bit and it said I needed my parent or guardian to unlock all access. So I talked to them and they said the subscription apparently ran out. But it hadn’t been a month yet and they said that at&t said they have the subscription but hbo says they don’t so idk

title: Play/pause problem
review: Anytime you switch out if the app or close it the play/pause feature disappears. It’s a very annoying problem and each time you need to navigate to the show and hit okay then pause. This didn’t used to be a problem but it is now.

title: No downloads, no auto play, no skip recap
review: Won’t let me play any of my downloads while I’m offline. Kind of defeats the purpose of having it. Will also crash every time I try to stream from my phone to tv. There’s also no auto play for episodes so you have to get up and change it manually if you’re connected via hdmi cable with an adapter. No skip recaps. The app was great until you want to watch it anywhere else.

title: Terrible.
review: I received a subscription through my AT&T service. And it worked perfectly for about three days. I was really excited about being able to watch some of my favorite show. But now, all it tells me to do is re-link my subscription and every time I do it just reverts me back to the sign in page like a endless loop. SO DISAPPOINTED right now. I’ve tried to delete and redownload. I called at&t to see if they can help. I get nothing.

title: Now it works
review: Originally gave 1 star since couldn’t connect w att/directv issues - those were resolved and able to get access today - thanks for quick updates

title: So far, so good…
review: Today, on day one, the apps seem pretty stable. There’s, as advertised, too much counter to browse in one sitting. The hubs are like Disney’s and keep you focused. Can’t wait for additional features when they’ve acclimated to volumes.

title: Chromecast with HBO Max
review: User interface could be easier to work with but I’ve been using HBO Max and chromecast since the new app started but since I’ve updated to iOS 14 the chromecast symbol is gone. I went to the other apps to check and it still work fine. But HBO no longer offers the option to cast to my chromecast.

title: Keep having to restart app
review: Love everything on here...when I can get the app to even load up. I’m on the most recent version of iOS and the app on this device and sometimes restarting the iPad will help but there are days I can’t even get through a single episode of a show. It’s not my internet because I don’t experience this with other services.

title: Everything was perfect until...
review: Everything looks perfect. The content is  impressive, but I was really disappointed when I realized that there are no other language options other than English.  There is not even the option of subtitles in different languages.

title: Eh.
review: There are plenty of options on what to watch, bunt on anime like hunter x hunter, you can’t even change the language to the original Japanese! Otherwise, it’s great. Please add an option to the anime series to be able to change the language to the original Japanese.

title: Bring back hbo go
review: Possibly one of the worst apps ever. I have a very fast internet connection althoug ALTHOUGH each and Every time I try to watch using this app it stops many times and then won’t load at all. Why am I paying if it doesn’t work. Love the showtime app, it NEVER craps out like this one. Too bad because I really like the shows. Oh well, better I save my money. Also even after downloading content it still won’t play.

title: Chrome cast??
review: The app has good content and I can watch it on my phone and newest Samsung tv, but It doesn’t give me an option to cast to anything from my phone. The button appeared when I first downloaded the app but it has disappeared since then. Without the button, hbo Max is useless for all the rest of my devices.

title: I guess it’s fine
review: I like skipping a lot so it is annoying that the skip button is not available. Also, they don’t have a lot of movies. But I don’t really care cause I don’t use it that much

title: It’s doing much better now.
review: I like the app. It use to have glitches that would slow or make the video repeat apart it was very annoying. However it started doing that less and then stopped. I watch movies and cast to my tv all the time. 🔥

title: Update no longer shows free streams
review: Started watching Veep on the hbo now app and today I open the app and a notification tells me to update because this version is no longer available. I update and open the app then I find Veep I click on Veep and it tells me to subscribe. I’m already subscribed to other streaming services so I’ll have to pass on hbo for now but maybe subscribe later.

title: Playback controls disappear
review: Loving the content but I’m having issues with the app. When I use Chromecast to cast to the TV, the playback controls disappear, even after clicking the Chromecast widget. Since I can’t pause or rewind once a show starts, I end up watching from my phone, which is a terrible experience, especially for the price of the service.

title: My account with the computer and the phone don’t sync
review: Got me really frustrated — just checking out my first TV show on HBO max. Wanna switch it up to watch it on my phone, then I realized I couldn’t find the watch history on my phone cuz they don’t sync from the computer! WHY

title: It’s good but...
review: It’s a good app and I like how you can just switch with just updating the app. But whenever I try to watch it on my phone it says my wifi needs to be connected and it already is and it still doesn’t let me watch it. All in all the app is okay for its shows and movies but it isn’t all that.

title: Good Stuff to watch but how? App is terrible
review: We’ve been struggling to figure out how to watch this on our brand new top of the line LG OLED TV with the latest Web OS. All other streaming services are available but HBO? Nada. Well, you say, how about Airplay from our Apple devices...nope. Doesn’t work. Used to but after their latest update now that’s broken too. Hard to figure why we would continue 15 bucks a mont for something we can’t watch.

title: Horrible
review: This app isn’t bad, it’s downright awful. Doesn’t keep my TV provider login information stored, and despite the fact that I can download shows, when I’m on an airplane watching them, the app says it’s not connected to the internet and then gives me a consistent error when I try to restart after it crashes. Absolutely horrible execution on this. Thanks for going away from HBO Go and giving us this hot grabage.

title: Streams well
review: So. Far since deciding to buy this app I have been pleasantly happy. We got the app before the Max roll out. My only complaint is that while using the app via Roku tv it does not allow me to watch the Max originals which was the purpose of getting the app.

title: Can’t even use the program
review:
Still on Comcast until I fully quit shortly, so for now I would need to log in via Xfinity. But nope. I can’t log in directly on TV (Samsung) and I can’t get the app to get to log in screen on phone. It hangs up on choosing provider then after 4-5 minutes if the list populates and never goes past my choice of provider. 

So, I want to login and watch but there’s no way to do it. That’s pretty awful.

title: No longer usable through Xfinity
review: After a great summer of streaming all sorts of movies and shows, the app is no longer usable. I keep receiving the error that I’m trying to log in using a “secondary Xfinity ID.” This was never a problem before and from what I’ve read online, it is a problem for many now. From my research, it looks like even if you log in with the primary ID, it still gives you this error.

title: Can’t watch a show with out it stopping
review: I have HBO max and there is not a day that it doesn’t happen I’m sick and tired of it I’m trying to get back on after it log me out and tried to send a reset password even though I have a touch screen  password and no email has been sent and now I have to call the bank to cancel the auto pay !

title: HBO = Great Content; This App = Terrible Coding
review:
Huh? 

So I download content for offline listening. I go camping. I’m, well, offline. I pop open HBO Max iOS and am ready to watch my previously downloaded content, and whoa, wait, HBO Max fails to open because it can’t connect the the internet. WTH. Nope. Can’t use at all. Just keeps trying to connect and won’t load past slash screen. 

No offline watching for me. Bad bad bad.

title: You never fixed my 2 new phone purchase problem
review:
-1- Your insurance shipped the phone to the wrong address and blamed it on Fed-X 
I canceled the insurance on all 3 phones 

-2- you sent me the small version of the 
I-10. 

Stiffed me with I-10 XS Instead of I-10 XS MAX 
No matter how many times I tried to explain  the problem , even though I called you the day I received the new phone 
You sent me the wrong size and now I am stock with it 

You guys used to be much more customer oriented, your agents are very nice but they couldn’t help me 

This is the first time I ever had a problem with AT&T , I was never verbally told about the 14 days buyer’s rule 

I am going to be stock with $1,100 tiny phone for a long time to come 

So sad to bad for me
