I was really upset when I realized I couldn’t watch what I wanted till next Christmas. I’m not to excited about this any more. It’s not a good set up. I feel i was conned out of my money. I bought the year subscription and I wish I hadn’t.

title: Great service bad app
review: As a streaming service Disney plus is very good but as an app it is bad. This is not a review of the service but a review of the app. One of my points for Disney plus being a bad app is that it crashes randomly and will not open for a bit after it crashes. Recently my power went out and since I had a lot of stuff downloaded on Disney plus I thought I would watch that until my power got back on. But when I opened the app it went to a dark blue screen and then crashed I tried again but the same happened. Then I tried to restart my iPad and try again. When I opened up Disney plus after I restarted my iPad the same thing happened. So instead of using Disney plus I had to use Netflix. When my power got back on I had to delete Disney plus and redownload almost 100GB of shows and movies. The reason I’m writing this is because just now a few days after I I redownloaded Disney plus and all my shows and movies the same thing is happening I thought it would be solved with the new update but no. I have not found any way to stop this and I am very mad. Disney plus needs to put more work into there app and it’s quality control. If anyone from Disney plus is reading this please help me and thank you to every one who has read this.

title: Update Suggestions
review:
So our family of Disney-lovers find Disney+ to be everything we wanted it to be! Can’t wait for more of the original content to be released, also! 

I just have a minor suggestion for a future update that would make things a lot easier for us (and I’m sure others). Our son LOVES to watch the Mickey & Friends shorts. So much so, that we re-watch them constantly. However, after an episode is over and it’s continued to auto-play, if we go back to a previously played episode, it stars playing at the credits. There is no “play from the beginning button”. That leaves me scrambling to manually hold down the rewind button. Now it’s not so bad to have to rewind something, but the real problem is once that episode that I rewound is over, it will auto play the next episode and (because it was previously viewed) starts playing that from the credits again! It’s extremely frustrating considering the episodes are only 3-4 minutes long. On the Disney Now app, if the episodes were played to completion, any rewatches go back to the beginning. PLEASE MAKE THIS A FUTURE UPDATE! I fear my sanity and productivity are in jeopardy until this is fixed.

title: Great Service, Missing One Key Feature
review:
My wife and kids and I love the service so far! There’s tons of stuff for everyone to watch and we’re enjoying showing them the classic movies we watched as kids. The app works quite much better now that they’ve squashed some bugs and added the all important continue watching feature. 

The app is still not perfect however. After using the app more, I’ve noticed some peculiarities that don’t make much sense. The first is that when someone watches something on their profile, it will often show up on the continue watching list on my profile even though I’ve never watched that show on my profile. This happens quite often with my son’s episodes of Mickey Mouse Clubhouse. The other weird thing I’ve run into is that Moana can not be found on a child’s profile. This means my 5 year old who loves Moana must have an adult account that is more difficult for her to navigate in order to watch her favorite movie on the service. 

Overall, we’re very happy both with the service and the app. Once a few minor tweaks are made, I think Disney+ will be able to play ball with the big dogs.

title: Charged twice
review: I have been charged twice for the same account since December of 2019. One payment is being withdrawn from Apple and the other from Google Play which never has my information on the first place(with different billing dates), I repeat, FOR THE SAME DISNEY+ ACCOUNT. I called Disney+ to get an answer and they kept telling me that it wasn’t their problem and that SOMEHOW Google got my information (email and credit card number) and that even though they were accepting two different payments methods FOR THE SAME EXACT ACCOUNT, they couldn’t do anything. That I had to call Google Play and tell them that I was being charged from Apple too and ask them for my money back. I called Google and they told me that my report for a refund didn’t meet their policy and that for them, this one was the only payment method for the Disney+ and that I needed to call Disney+ (which I already did but they kept tossing the ball to Google or Apple). Then I called Apple and guess what... THEY SAID THE SAME THING, that they are not connected to Google Play and they cannot give me a refund. I don’t know what else to do, I realized that this happened to so many people and they still don’t have an answer. Disney+ is authorizing payments from two different sites for the same service/account and not doing anything to solve the problem.

title: Fixed the Bug so YAY
review:
OLD REVIEW:
So, I gave this four stars because I do love the app and would love to give it five stars if only this one problem would be fixed. I was initially annoyed about the no “continue watching” feature but with the update that fixed my problem. Or so I thought... when I first got the continue watching update it worked on all of my devices. Unfortunately, now- no matter what device I am on- it restarts the episode that I was on. The continue watching will show me my show and say 7 mins remaining, or something like that, but when I click on it it will load to the beginning of that episode. 
This is not the worst because I will fast forward to where I was, but I do feel it is an inconvenience and would love for it get fixed. Again I would like to emphasize my love for this app and getting to rewatch all of my favorite Disney shows and movies. Please fix this little bug so I can change my review to five stars.
NEW REVIEW:
I love the app and have changed my review to five stars because the bug mentioned above was fixed. Thank you Disney+ this app is amazing.

title: Love it but 1 issue
review:
I love this app and have had it for a little while now. All my favorite Disney channel original movies in one place, talk about a childhood dream come true! 
The only issue I have had that doesn’t seem to have been addressed in the update, is that my watchlist isn’t working right. Currently, it’s missing some shows and movies that I can look up and see that I’ve added to my watchlist already, though it’s not showing up when I open the watchlist. 
The watchlist is also duplicating the items that do show up on the list. I’m not sure if this is connected to the other problem I noted above or if it is a completely different issue. 
Obviously, I still love the app and have even recommended it to a few people. I just wanted to mention this issue that I am having as the other reviews I have read didn’t seem to mention this.  I hope this is an easy fix, as I do think this app is great.
Disney as a company is amazing! I am so grateful that I can watch all the movies and shows I love that are more recent, while also having the option to revisit some old favorites that I grew up watching (and loving).

title: Surprised
review:
Update: So somehow as you watch content it is saved into documents and data. I have no content downloaded within the app but somehow over 6GB of documents and data?? Also it shows multiple episodes downloaded in the storage setting view of the iPhone that aren’t downloaded within the Disney plus app itself. After deleting those episodes that aren’t downloaded but somehow are, there was still over 590MB of documents and data. I deleted and reinstalled the app and it had mere kb of data. As I start watching content again, the documents and data keeps increasing, what gives? I have tons of other streaming apps that don’t do this, it’s a major hassle, please fix!

Original review:Lots of things already available. The menus and selection content loads quickly and the playback quality is very good. Also tried it on the Roku and it also looks way better than every other streaming app I have. Things load and begin to play quickly. They have a search function but they also have multiple ways of categorizing so you can get to what you want pretty quickly as well. So far it’s working and looking great, have to see how it does when millions of people are using it at the same time.

title: Nice service, app needs work
review:
We (obviously) enjoy a bunch of the Disney content, and even some of the “original” content (like The Mandalorian) is very well done. However, the app itself leaves a lot to be desired. My two main complaints are:

1. The app always begins playing a show immediately with no buffering, but then, at exactly 20 seconds in, buffers for 5-10 seconds. This is extremely annoying, especially when you’re watching a Pixar short that is only two minutes long. Also, since the update, the app has begun buffering randomly in the middle of programs, sometimes 2-3 times in a row. For reference, we also have Netflix and Britbox, and neither one EVER stops the show at any point to buffer.

2. The lack of a working “continue watching” bar. I know that this bar showed up in the update, but it doesn’t work on either of our devices. The bar is there; it shows the programs we’ve been watching, and how far we’ve progressed into them. But when I tap on one of the programs in the bar, it nearly always restarts the program from the beginning. About once in ten times, it will restart from where we stopped watching, but those aren’t good odds.

title: One little thing
review: Alright, so this is going to be short and sweet. Disney plus is amazing, I use it all the time to watch my favorite movies, and recently I’ve been binge watching the marvel movies. It works out pretty well for me. New episodes come out within a few days (which is pretty awesome), you get to watch anything owned by Disney, and it’s just awesome. (Especially The Mandalorian) But there is one thing that could make it better, and I’ve seen other people make this suggestion too. Disney plus should definitely have a “currently watching” section. It’s the one thing left that I need. Otherwise I have to look up the movie that I’m watching, find the right one, and hope it starts off where I ended. And it does, but I think it’d take a little less time and effort if you put a currently watching section right on the top bar of your home screen. That way I can click the app, scroll down a tiny, tiny little bit, and click the movie or show that I’m watching. So yeah, my suggestion (which you should totally add) would be a currently watching section. Otherwise, Disney plus is basically perfect for me.

title: Almost complete
review:
The service is off the a great start and I have no doubt that Disney will continue to add more movies, shows, and shorts as it continues. However, while there is a lot of stuff in the service at launch, much of it feels like filler material and some of the things not included can felt. Such as not a single Indiana Jones movie, or the fact that Disney now owns all of Fox’s catalog but only include the Simpsons and avatar. No alien or fox X-men movie? 

I know these will probably be added later on but I feel like a streaming service that wants to truly compete with other platforms like Netflix should have many of these films already included to form an unbeatable backbone and then continue to support the platform with original content and other  new releases after their run in movie theaters. Otherwise you get what we have now, which is a service that has a couple of main classics here and there, and a few originals, but is mostly made up of Disney channel original content and lots of live action D-list filler movies that only someone who grew up with would enjoy watching for nostalgic reasons.

title: TV shows out of order
review: For what I use the app for it works fantastic.  I have noticed updates being rolled out and see the changes happen which is fantastic. The biggest con I have is the older tv shows are out of order. Watched the new Ducktales and Talespin and the first 2-3 episodes for each are hidden randomly throughout the run.  I know it’s a cartoon but it is nostalgic and watching it as an adult and wanting to know why certain things happened would be nice to know at the beginning.  Other complaints would be stretching the old Simpsons 4:3 into 16:9. The old Disney cartoons are 4:3 so why not the old Simpsons?  The app works well with chromecast. Every now and then the programming will stop playing whether it’s 2 episodes in or 8. It’ll randomly stop.  They need to add skip intros to all tv shows like The Mandalorian has.  I look forward to the future of this streaming service and can’t wait for the whole MCU to be available. Also, please add more classic Mickey Mouse programming as big blocks. Not individual 6 minutes episodes. I have to search for and stream one at a time. Fix these issues I have pointed out and this will be in my eyes a five star app.

title: BLUE SPIRAL OF SLOW and bugs...please fix
review: Have a 150+ Mbps internet connection and think Disney + should work fine when you pay for it?  Yeah, me too.  However, the app is buffering nearly all the time and sometimes stops in the middle of shows to show the “BLUE SPIRAL OF SLOW” as the app attempts to catch up.  I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling, closing and restarting the app and device more times than we care to keep track of, checking for updates and...oh yes, I would think a minimum 150 Mbps download should be adequate for an app that requires 5 and 25 Mbps for HD and 4K playback, respectively, but who knows?  Also, as an added insult, try using the forward or backward playback arrow just once in the app to skip ahead or back a few seconds and you will incur the wrath of the blue spiral for the rest of the episode that you happen to be watching.  I might expect such problems from lesser apps, but naively thought Disney would have fixed them early on...and yet here we are.   I have asked before (to no avail) and shall ask again...please fix the problems!  You get 2 stars because the content is and would be nice to watch, but the bugs in your app for both iPhone and iPad make it difficult to enjoy.

title: Content is mostly what you expect, UI is dreadful
review:
It’s pretty clear they are hoping to coast on the popularity of the brand, and it will probably work. My kid likes Disney enough that I’m willing to jump through the hoops. 

Still, there is a ton of stuff that is not available because of prior licensing agreements, which is extremely frustrating when the only thing the service has going for it is the promise of a comprehensive repository. They definitely should have waited until they had reclaimed all their content, or offered an extra service where they handle explaining the intersection of greed and intellectual property to my crying toddler who just wants to watch Tinkerbell.

As an app, it does a fine job of providing the underwhelming experience it’s tasked with, so I didn’t knock off all the stars. The service itself has been very slow to catch up to the basic experience other streaming options offer. Overall the whole service and app feel like they were rushed out in beta and are only now beginning to resemble a finished product, which is disappointing from a company that has all the resources it needs to do things right.

title: To good to be true!!❤️❤️
review: I’m obsessed!! I love Disney+ because it has everything! Like i remember on Netflix i would be watching girl meets world and then before i even finished watching the series they took it off the app and i was just like REALLY YOU'VE GOTTA BE KIDDING ME 😡 so then i downloaded DisneyNOW and i would watch an episode of something but then have to wait like 2 weeks to see the next one and it wouldn’t even go in order! I was like JUST PUT SOME STUFF ON THERE PEOPLE COME ON!! So i just deleted both and then Disney+ come out and i was like HALLELUJAH!! One thing i will say is there is a lot of glitching like when I’m watching the show will stop and pause randomly and then you have to push the button twice. Also when i turn my tablet around it will turn the screen but instead of like turning sideways it goes into the corner, i don’t think that made any since like AT ALL lol 😆. (Im tryin here lol 😝). Other than that this is just amazing i love it so so soooooooo much!Thank you guys so much for this you are such a blessing!! Thanks a million! God bless!!🙂🥰

title: Horribly optimized app
review: Getting two stars because of this app missing the simplest streaming features out there across all devices. Not being able to easily resume a movie/show gets beyond irritating. Especially when they release a resume feature couple weeks after launch only to find out it’s broken, you have to manually search through the app each time to find what you were watching; find it, hit resume and it simply restarts. Thought it was my device messing up, but same happens on mobile, pc, fire stick and playstation. Don’t understand how such a big company that claims to be the new kings of streaming can’t even manage to have the simplest features work. Playbacks constantly skip where the video freezes and the audio continues. This can last 5-10 seconds, goes in a loading loop and then rewinds back to the spot before it hit the video freeze. This has also been happening since launch and happens quite often. Overall it’s a pretty crappy app that was rushed and never optimized for common use. Great selection but unless you want to deal with a headache trying to watch what you want, i’d wait till Disney decides to fix this app as it feels like a Beta testing.

title: Disney+ is Okay.
review: Disney plus is an app you have to buy, for an app you have to buy it has some low points. To start with is the thing that I hate the most. You can’t use the Disney+ app when it needs an update. Disney+ takes up sooooo much storage already and when it needs an update you have to wait until you have enough storage on your device! I also had to keep the Disney Now app just so I could watch new episodes of currently airing shows which is REALLY annoying and takes up more of my storage. I also hate the fact that a few shows, like Andi Mack, don’t have the entire season! It’s like starting a movie and skipping an entire hour of it! It is also quite annoying that there are the 1st and/or 2nd movie in a three movie series on Disney+. I watched the first mighty ducks but the second and third one are not on Disney+. I do however like the fact that they have all the original Disney movies that you have to buy on your regular TV. This is a good app for someone who is into only the older Disney movies and shows. However, it can be quite annoying for someone like me who likes old and new Disney shows and movies.

title: It’s a very nice app, but still need some work
review: I have an account and like I didn’t want to be selfish so I let my friends come on it since you can add up to 7 people. The thing is, what if one day I decided I don’t want them on it anymore but they refuse to leave. I can’t do anything abt it except cancel the subscription but then everyone else would be effected by just one person . The owner should be able to have more control. Like the owner can do stuff with other profiles and manage stuff more and ppl who aren’t the owner of it shouldn’t be able to like change or go on other ppls profile unless allowed or something. Like you can go on the owners profile even if your not the owner. The last thing is, I trust my friends so I gave them the password to it so they can login but what if for some reason(I doubt the ppl that are on my account would do this bc they are my closest friends) but one day they could just decided to change the password because even if your not the owner of the account, you can still change the password which isn’t right. But that’s all I have to say

title: BEST THING EVER! *take my word for it*
review: Okay to start off I’ve never wanted to make a review of anything but this is something I wanna talk about! When they brought this up I was like it’s not like they’ll have Snow White or Crash and Bernstein! But when got the app this morning...🤯! SOMUCH CONTENT! Basically my whole childhood, my siblings childhood, my parents childhood, my Grandparents childhood, and Even my great grandparents childhood! I mean Starting off with Disney! So many TV Shows I can’t find anywhere! So many movies! So many series! And way to many things to even count! Marvel has the OG X-Men y’all! I mean I’m not even kidding! We have some Star Wars! With CLONE WARS!!!!!! And they got some FOX OG’S! Including AVATAR,HOME ALONE, NIGHT AT THE MUSEUM, THE SIMPSONS, THE SOUND OF MUSIC AND MORE!!!! Take my advice and get it plz y’all! If you don’t like these and like documentaries😒... they got those too with... National Geographic? I’m being honest I don’t really like Nat Geo but HEY THEY STILL GOT IT! But being honest there is some technical difficulties Disney is having so if it says “No Connection” just exit and re-enter it’s no big deal! So take my advise and get this!

title: Love but frustrating
review: I love Disney plus, has great movies but I’ve been using it more recently and getting more frustrated with playback issues. I watch on my PS4 but also on my iPhone as well. There are several things that are continuing to happen that make it harder and harder to enjoy movies... 1. When I try to rewind it, the picture freezes, but the sound keeps going until it catches up with the visual, which is frustrating cause I continuously have to rewind. 2. Sometimes while viewing, the picture will freeze and sound goes ahead but then the video rushes through the scenes to catch back up with the sound. 3. Other times while viewing, the picture freezes, the sound goes on, and then the sound rewinds further back until it matches the picture. Very frustrating when I’m trying to enjoy a movie. 4. I also very often get logged out out of my account which makes me log back in every other day if not every day. 5. When finishing my movie and trying to go back to home it freezes and everything is just a grey screen. So I constantly have to shut down the app and open it back up.

title: App needs work
review: Your content is there. The app needs work. Profiles need personalization or more than just having a watchlist. For example, there’s no “continue watching” section so hope you know where to find whatever it is you were watching. Also, you can something to your watchlist. Finish it, but without knowing how to manipulate the bugs, remove it from your watchlist. Strolling through all the features, you can click on a show, and even if it’s in your watchlist, it won’t show that it’s in your watchlist, leaving you to believe programs you add to your watchlist aren’t actually there. In regards to manipulating the system to take something off of your watchlist, you have to click add to watchlist to ADD it again, then click it again to remove it. That seems to be the only way to remove a show from your watchlist. And this is a problem on ALL my devices not just mobile devices. This includes the Apple TV, and the firestick app. Disney, y’all are great but with so much content on this service, a person needs a better way to keep track of what’s in their watchlist and what they’ve been watching. Please correct this.

title: Great content, series pages need work
review: The amount and quality of the content here is great. However the way older TV series are being handled is inconsistent and pretty rough. Some pre-HD shows are presented in their original 4:3 aspect ratio and look fine, but others for some reason are zoomed in, stretching the image and cropping the top and bottom of the screen which looks terrible, and there is no option to switch. Additionally, nearly all the shows I browsed had every episode listed under one season, which means you can’t look for episodes by season and have to scroll right through dozens of episodes to find what you want. Some episodes are mistitled or misnumbered, meaning they auto play out of the intended viewing order. And if you plan on watching a whole series, it doesn’t appear to save your spot so you have to again scroll through the 50-80 episodes of “season 1” to find where you left off. Hopefully these issues will be addressed soon because the rest of the platform seems great and I am very excited for how much content is available to stream for the first time ever thanks to this platform.

title: Great selection, but lots of tech issues
review: I only gave 4 stars because the selection is awesome — there’s something for everyone and every mood. However, I stream Disney plus on my iphone hooked up to my TV and that has presented problems. For one, ANY notification (including phone calls) will cause the picture to pause but the audio still continues. Seldom times the show will catch up and continue, but a majority of the time, I have to restart the app. From there, the issues continue. The show seldom saves where I left off; it restarts and I have to fast forward to where I left off (or the best of my memory). Sometimes it’ll say “oops, can’t play this selection right now,” which is even more annoying because I have to unplug my phone from the adapter then reconnect it.  Also, if watching a series, I don’t like it doesn’t automatically start the next episode. Otherwise, as previously mentioned, I love reliving my childhood shows and sharing them with my children. This is priceless. If the tech issues could be resolved, I’d give 5 stars.

title: I love it but there’s two things...
review:
I love this app.  Is such a great way to go down memory lane and easier to find Disney films but I have two little problems. 
     I use this app in all of my devices, my laptop, my consoles, my phone,  including my smart tv. In all of those providers I can change the subtitles except for the smart tv. I found a way but it wold be a lot easier if I can do it directly in the tv. My way is going to my phone putting the options I want and turn the tv off and put the show in the tv. But sometimes it gets annoying.  So please fix that. 
      Another issue is there’s some shows that don’t have their full episodes, and I know is a new a provider but I would love to have all the episodes of violetta. A few days ago I finished the first season and when I was about to start the next one I find that the rest of the seasons aren’t there so please it would be great if it can happen. 
    But beside that Disney plus has been a great app. Keep on the good work.

title: A fantastic app and service, could use an additional feature or two
review:
I hate to sound like I’m parroting other reviews, but... I honestly can’t think of another word to describe Disney+ aside from fantastic. From some of the earliest classics that put the name “Walt Disney” on the map, to the legendary pictures that make up the face of the studio and the stream of new films, shows, and other projects, there’s something on here for almost everyone.

I understand that at the time of this review, the service is just over a week old, but if there is at least one thing I would like to add to Disney+, it would be the addition of a section dedicated to some of the content that Disney has rights to (and might add to the service) that are geared towards more mature audiences, such as “The X-Files,” “Deadpool,” and other such properties or materials that might not be suitable for younger audiences (in case such a proposition isn’t already in effect).

Aside from that suggestion, this is definitely a streaming platform for fans of Disney and beyond.

title: Worth it! My cats and I cant wait for updates!
review: Let me start like so many reviews by saying that the amount of content is out of this world. I will just say I look forward to updates on this app. 1.) I would like a way to mark what episodes I’ve watched already in a series. My memory isn’t good enough to do this for long seeing as my mind is filled with the needs of my cats. 2.) I would like a “last watched” section to easily remind me what I was watching before my cats got into a major fight and I went running from my comfy chair to save my poor fat cat from her distress inflicted by my sleek sporty male cat. 3.) When my lap is being occupied by a sleeping cat, I don’t often have hands to touch my phone between episodes and since the auto play option isn’t working between episodes, poor fat cat is having to move once again. While the app is working well for my cat’s diet and fitness plan, I think these slight modifications would make it more cat lady friendly. And yes, if you did read this all the way through, the first thing we watched was Aristocats.

title: BEAUTIFUL but just a few things
review:
I absolutely love having all the movies in one place. The movies from the vault are such a blessing and it’s like I’m reliving my childhood again but the app itself could use a bit of improvement. I love how they offer a variety of section to search in and maybe find a diamond in the rough to watch but then when you do and suddenly get distracted, you lose your movie and oops! You forgot what it was called!! So I definitely definitely think it needs a “continue watching” section.
Also I heard about some of the older classics being ban being of the culture it depicts... I think this is not smart at all and hope it does NOT happen. Yes those movies depict a culture of a time that is no longer relevant, but it’s still history. What’s the good in censoring history when it’s a fact that it happened? Those movies are just what they are, classic. Definitely, most definitely, should not be put back away.
Over all love the app but maybe they could make some improvements!

title: Great so far
review:
This app has all the old and new Disney including all the other major companies like Marvel and Star Wars. It didn’t have new releases but I will hope that they will be available here before release on Red box and other sites after they leave the box office. The reason I am giving three stars is there needs to be improvements made and this is a new app. There is no place to stop and save in the middle of shows and movies. It also does not tell you what you have already watched, so it is hard to pick up unless you remember yourself. I also wish they had a “currently watching” tab included with the “my watchlist” just to make the app easier to navigate. That being said I have always loved Disney and this app is a great new way to rewatch all of my older favorites that I didn’t have easier access to before this platform. Continue improving on this app Disney and there will have more people subscribed than it already does now. 
I recommend this product highly as it is reasonably priced as well for the amount of content you are given, and also has multiple profile options.

title: Please Fix Sound Issues
review: I have to start by saying I am a huge Disney fan & love everything Disney. My house is all Disney & I even have a Disney Room. I’m obsessed with all Disney movies & all Disney music. And Needless to say I was sooo excited when you launched Disney+! That being said it pains me to write something negative about Disney. I absolutely love it EXCEPT there is definitely a sound issue which is very very frustrating to say the least. I checked all my equipment & compared it to other channels so I know it is just on Disney+. Sometimes you can only hear the lead singers but nothing else in the background including music! You can only hear their voices. Sometimes you can hear the music but no voices. And it changes-sometimes a movie will sound fine, other days not at all. So I know it’s not just that movie. Some of the movies have been-Descendants (all 3). Zombies & all of the High School Musicals. This is aggravating to no end. I might expect this from someone else, but DISNEY?!?-Very disappointing. Please fix this issue as I have seen other reviews saying the same thing. Come on guys, BE DISNEY!! Please & Thank you

title: Worst. Streaming. App. Ever.
review: I was so excited for this app to come out. I have used many streaming services over the years, but have never even come close to experiencing one that is done so incredibly poorly. Even after the updates, I have never watched a solid 10 mins of video without getting an “oops something went wrong” and during those ten minutes the video glitches horribly. I have the fastest internet available, no other apps have problems. I love Disney, I love the ease and comfort of the features on the app, and it is visually attractive. But for a company as large as Disney, it is appalling how horribly the service actually streams video, end it takes me about 7 tries to watch a 1 hour long episode of The Mandalorian, regardless of what device I’m using the app on. Incredibly disappointing that Disney our the bar the lowest it’s ever been. Either they’re trying incredibly hard to not spend the money required to fix it, or there are some people that REALLY need to get fired because I wouldn’t trust them to change the batteries in a remote. Everyone I know has stopped or slowed down using the app for the same reasons, it’s hard to watch such a marvelous idea waste away because it’s being designed by idiots.

title: Great But Not On iPad
userName: Cool Person that u can trust
review: I am in 6th/7th grade and my mom had always been overprotective and made sure what i watch is kid appropriate. I am a big Disney fan and so I decided download this app on my iPhone, xbox, and tv. It works great and I love the app. There are no problems, they have plenty of kid friendly shows and movies, and plenty of adult movies. There is even a setting to change your account to the kids account. There’s just one problem, I downloaded this app on my iPad and it never works. It will just say, “Oh no, something went wrong playing...” and that’s it. No options to fix the problem, and explains no real reasons it went wrong. I went to the information section of this app on the apple App Store expecting it to say something like doesn’t work on iPads. But it says, Compatibility: Works on this iPad. I don’t really know what to do except just watch Disney plus on other devices. I wouldn’t recommend this unless you have a different device to watch it on. If you do, I think you should really purchase an account.

title: THIS APP IS AWESOME 😎
review: So I fell in love with Disney+ a minute I got it all the shows are appropriate for all ages. All the shows are super attractive they have shows from like the 2000s From 1960s even two today it’s great because there are no ads and they are really no problems the only problem I have is sometimes it logs me out or pauses or when the Device I’m using is off and Disney+ just starts playing by itself but anyways some of the shows I recommend our shake it up Or K.C.undercover or good luck Charlie or JONAS they also have a great movies they have nature Pixar Disney this app has pretty much every show ever OK that’s a little exaggerating but they have movies and shows for adults they have kids cartoons literally two-year-olds can use it. It has like shows for little babies everything on this app is totally appropriate for kids and adults there are no ads and you’re paying is so worth it! I hope you like Disney+ to because it for me and my family is amazing!!!!😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊😊

title: AWESOME except.. READ THIS!
review:
Ok. So personally, I love Marvel, and it is the main reason we got Disney+. But I have one major problem with it (certainly not the content 🤣).
Whenever I am watching something, like Black Panther for example, if I decide to close the app, I can still hear the audio playing in the background. Several seconds later it’ll stop, but when I open the app back up it crashes. I also have it downloaded on my IPhone. So, when you have the IPhone version you can download videos from the app so you can watch them anywhere! I was happy when I found out about this, but I soon figured out that the app must stay open and the phone on for it to download. If you close the app, it will completely get rid of the download and waste your time.. as a warning if you download on your phone pay attention to make sure Disney+ doesn’t close or your phone doesn’t automatically lock -_-. Other than that, great app with amazing graphics and tons of content and variety! PS- SPIDERMAN HOMECOMING AND FAR FROM HOME NEED TO BE THERE PPL COME ON! Also, glad Frozen 2 came and am now waiting for Rise of Skywalker...

title: One problem & recommendations
review:
From launch till today, Disney + has been a great addition to the streaming business. Almost all of the problems that I had have been fixed. Only one thing remains, anytime you go into the download section of the app, depending how many movies you have, the list will take a long time to load and when exiting a movie it glitches and you have to wait at least three seconds for it to go back to normal. For most people that wouldn’t be a problem, but for me, who has at-least eight movies from all Disney franchises, it’s noticeable. 

This next part is more for recommendations.
One recommendation I have is that when you download the movie, you should be able to get all three options of quality and calculate much storage each of the qualities take. Even though most people don’t care about deleted scenes, a minority,  which I am part of, like the commentary, deleted scenes, etc. I hope Disney will add a feature to install deleted scenes and commentary. Now this is more of a personal problem, but because I am bilingual I don’t have problems with the language barriers of the app, but to my parents it’s hard because not much content is in Spanish or has Spanish subtitles.

Apart from that, all the app is overall a great streaming service. Despite me having this one issue and some recommendations, I will rate it five stars because of the content and the quick to update responsibility. Thank you for reading this.

title: Thank You Disney!
review: Let me start off by saying this is truly is a beautiful app, and well worth the wait for the sheer amount of titles that Disney has graced us with. That being said, the initial glitches and hiccups were definitely to be expected with the overwhelming number of first-time users. However, the app is still very well designed and all encompassing, while still leaving plenty of room for future growth. I would like to see a “Continue Watching” section (emulating similar streaming apps) as I find it time-consuming to be continuously searching for what I was watching rather than having it conveniently placed on top of the list at launch. The saving grace to this minor flaw is that the app does allow for auto play, so you don’t have to go back and fast-forward to where you were previously watching. In summary, Disney + is highly anticipated app that lives up to most expectations, and can be easily improved with consumer feedback within the coming months.

title: Amazing content, app could be improved
review: Overall the content is great! There are some concerns about the app though that I hope gets fixed. Here are a few: 1) there needs to be a continue watching section so you don’t have to re-search the movie or show you were watching and have to remember which episode you were on, 2) if you’ve added something to your watchlist it should show that if you click on it again and should have a way to remove it from the list after watching, and 3) the “recommended for you” category doesn’t seem to change and is showing the same stuff even after watching multiple things so I do not believe it takes into consideration what you seem interested in. All of these also make it seem useless to have separate profiles if a single person’s specific shows are not going to show up as continue watching or recommended. Again love that I have all of this Disney content now, but would also love to see improvement in the app itself!

title: Forever a Disney Girl
review:
I am not giving 5 stars for a couple of reasons... 
First, there isn’t a “recently watched” or “continue watching” area in the home screen. Every time I want to continue watching where I left off, I have to go to my profile and then to my watch list and select from there, which brings me to my second issue. If you are watching a tv series, you select the series you’re watching from your watch list, then you have to scroll down past each episode and hopefully remember which episode you’ve left off on, because if you just click the play button at the top without going to the actual episode, it starts at the very first episode and very first season. Also, unlike Netflix, if you’ve watched an episode, it doesn’t show you in some way (a progress bar or check mark) that you’ve already seen that episode. 
Other than those 2 things, so far I am enjoying Disney+! I love Disney, and I am curious and excited to check out the “through the years” of Mickey Mouse!

title: Fabulous Launch Disney!
review:
Download, login, and browsing happened with perfection... the first surprise. Then the content, WOW. I knew they had to offer a lot since the claims being made by Disney prior to launch were quite bold... and they weren’t kidding, the library is comprehensive, extensively built starting with the very 1st Mickey Mouse film, and including practically everything you could possibly want from Disney (a few movies or offerings have an upcoming release date if they’re not currently available, and I certainly expected a few titles to be withheld for many possible reasons, so not disappointed about that). 
I’m personally very excited to check out all the National Geographic shows & movies that I browsed through, and watch a whole lot of movies I loved as a child & haven’t encountered for 30 years! 
But AS FOR MY YOUNG CHILD, this will now bring a lot of happiness to his life as we get to share all the incredible Disney movies with him now!! YAY!!!!! Thank you Disney!

title: Great content, but app needs work
review:
It’s great having all the major Disney content in one place, from original Silly Symphonies to latest Pixar releases. There’s still a lot missing, but D+ is new, so there’s room to add. 
My first major complaint is the video. There’s absolutely no adjustment for slower internet. I don’t always need full HD and the lines get crowded late in the day, streaming slows down. Instead of dropping resolution (like virtually every other streaming service) I’m sitting here waiting for my movie to buffer.
Next is the organization. Obviously, my “keep watching” needs to be at the top, so I don’t have to search through three pages to find the show. “Next episode” link doesn’t always appear at the end credits like it should.
A few more minorities tweaks, and it should be fine. Like I said, it’s great having them all here and a lot of these shows take me back. I don’t normally dabble in streaming service originals, or which are usually crap, but Mandalorian alone is worth signing up for this.

title: Needs work
review:
Disappointing. There are so many little things that other platforms have improved on over the years, how did Disney not check out the competition and get a jump start. 

The app is overly simple with very little ability to navigate. You constantly have to navigate back the the home screen and then step by step to your destination. The ‘continue watching’ list (in my opinion the most important space in a streaming app) tends to not show up; and when it does you have no ability to open the show’s page (thus allowing for episode selection). There is no skip to next episode button. No episode selection while in video. No tracker to show what you’ve previously watched (to know what episode your on). And difficult navigation to your own watchlist. The app is great for browsing and that’s about it, but since most people have a good understanding of what Disney has to offer this isn’t all that important. 

I love having access to all this content but that’s not what Disney+ is, it’s an experience and it’s lacking.

title: Clean. Snappy. Add a back button on the left.
review: Just downloaded the app. I loved how clean and simple the design is. Disney’s enormous library is immediately apparent. From Marvel to Snow White, it’s all hear. As a parent of two, I really like the streamlined nature of the kids section. I was prepared to add every Toy Story movie on my own, but instead there is an entire curated collection made by Disney for easy discovery. Having all your favorite Disney movies in one place will turn digging through binders of DVDs to find your copy of Hocus Pocus at Halloween an absolute breeze. With Mandalorian already out and Marvel with a lineup of original series to come, Disney there for the parents too. All I ask is that a back button of some sort be added to the top left of page for the movies you tap on. The little X in the top right is ok, but it being on the left on smartphones is way more natural, even a drag and remove would be good. Fantastic showing from Disney otherwise. 5 stars

title: Good... BUT, not great... yet!
review:
Disney+ has been amazing, so far! My family and I are thrilled to be watching all the old shows and movies again, as well as, all the new content! I love the Mandalorion.. so freaking good! However, I do feel there are some major key things missing that could help improve Disney+ overall experience!

1) to start, having to fast forward through the movie or show to where you left off gets real annoying real quick! Or, even having to remember which episode you are on next.

2) there should be a newly added section or some sort of indication to know that there’s a new episode or a new movie uploaded to Disney+.

3) My family and I watch it on our Samsung Smart TV which works great, but the only issue I see is when you click into a couple of shows and then click a suggested show or movie, in order for me to get back to the home screen I have to constantly click the back button. There should be a menu pop up or a way to instantly click to get to the home page or go back straight to your watchlist.

4) Speaking of the watchlist something is wrong with the add button. You can add a show or movie to your watchlist, however you can’t deselect it from your watchlist.

I’m sure there could be plenty more improvements I can help resolve, but overall, great job! I know it just came out, and we all knew there were going to be bugs and things to improve on from the start. Keep up the great work!

title: I literally love Disney+
review: My friend told me about this and I thought I could give it a try. I asked my mom and she checked it out. And it was $6.99 a month! A really good deal for Disney movies, considering that Disney has a long history for classics and favorites. We bought it and I rapidly went to search for Gravity Falls. All of the episodes were there. I loved that there are some movies that aren't on Netflix and are in Disney+. The movies have a remarkable sound quality and great visuals, even though some of these movies were published in the 1930s. All of them have a variety of blockbuster films to choose from and they release earlier than Netflix does. It would take a few days or months to get a movie on to their page but with Disney+, you could admission your favorite films that were released only a few days back. Not only Disney movies, but the Star Wars series and the new and original trilogy, documentaries, Marvel movies, and finally the Simpsons.

title: Don’t reinvent the wheel!!!
review: First let me make it plain that I love Disney+. However, there are things that are needed, and I can’t figure out why they were ignored. First, WHY is there not a “continue watching” or “recently viewed” section??? It’s very annoying that we have to search for what we were watching. Secondly, when I’m setting in my chair trying to find something to watch, it can be very hard to see the title from across the room. When I hover over the movie, there should be some sort of pop up that helps me see the selection title more clearly, the rating and a short snapshot of what the selection is about. Thirdly, when I pick up watching the movie from where I left off, it says “play” instead of “continue watching”. I realize you’re trying to be different than your competitors but there are some things they’ve been doing right for a really long time. Do what they’re doing and STOP TRYING TO REINVENT THE WHEEL!  I’ve paid for a year’s subscription but will probably cancel if these simple things aren’t fixed. By the way, I took one star off for each of the three complaints listed.

title: Great, but one slight issue
review: I have been using this app for the last few weeks and I can say that I absolutely love it. However, I have experienced one slight problem. When you turn forward or backward the show or movie you are watching by 10 seconds, it gets stuck loading on the iPhone 8. This prevents you from pausing it or turning it forward farther. You then have to exit the show or movie you are watching and re-enter it. This is more of a minor inconvenience than a complaint but I still feel that it should be addressed. Also Both my kids and I used to love watching dog with a blog together on Disney channel amongst other things, as well as some distinct short films like John Henry, Feast, The Little Match Girl, and Tick Tock Tale, however I have been unable to find them on Disney+. While I acknowledge that this comment will most likely be unacknowledged by most everyone, I would love it if these changes were addressed to.

title: Good app
review: So the app is great and has so much but is too much shorts that are not really interesting but no Indiana Jones I mean Indiana Jones is even at Disney world. But maybe babies will watch the shorts but I think they are a waste of time and are really stupid and stop supporting gay people it is wrong read your bibles and stop making movies about nerds and wimps and maybe make them about people who actually have talents and stop making your Disney Chanel stuff so stupid they’re so stupid and are not even entertaining like nobody wants to watch people bash each other with a stick in the head those are my complaints and one more thing stop making live action remakes it makes nobody remember the old ones you walk up to a kid and you say have you seen Aladdin and they say yes but they are really just talking about the remake and if you keep making them then don’t try to shove communism and demacratism and atheism down are throats and don’t make stuff so stupid

title: Amazing! Just a couple problems.
review:
Disney+ is a magical place streaming literally the best movies, with a wide verity of Action, comedy, and fantasy. Awesome Disney+ originals, and Star Wars and Marvel TV shows and movies. How ever it’s pretty hard to enjoy a series when there is several movies in the series missing. 
It all started when I was watching the Pirates Of The Caribbean, which is a truly amazing series, and a fan favorite, but the 4th one was missing. Like seriously, really? And a bit later, I watched the first X-men movie and was like ‘OMG this is good where’s the next ones?’ There were only two others which were way further in the series. So when I looked up if they were on Disney+ there was a website saying watch X2 on Disney+, and when I clicked on it, it brought me to the app, and said ‘this media is not findable’ or something along those lines. 
I understand, copyrights, and distributing trades, but this is a very annoying thing to deal with. Thanks for your consideration, and have a nice day.

title: Great content, but some issues
review:
The content is great. The UI is relatively friendly on both IOS and AppleTV. However, why is there not an option to resume play or to start over when you pick a movie? Having a young child we watch the same movies. Over. And over. Being able to restart from the beginning for the 90th viewing of Little Mermaid would be nice to be done at the touch of a button instead of having to pause and rewind. Also, why no chapter skip/chapter select feature to skip automatically to that one scene that the kids just have to watch repeatedly? It feels like I’m reliving my childhood not only in movies that are being viewed but also in how I’m viewing them since it’s akin to watching on VHS. If they can get these small issues resolved, which should arguably have been there at launch, it will be a 5* review. PS, Mandalorian is great!

Update: the above issues for restart and resume have already been addressed. Chapter select still lacking though.

title: Needs to add option to “continue watching”
review:
While I am pleased with the service overall, there are a few things about it that I find to be disappointing. It is mildly inconvenient that my watch list isn’t shown on the main page, but what’s even more inconvenient is the fact that the service doesn’t seem to keep track of where I left off while watching a tv series. Every other streaming platform has a “continue watching” function, but Disney + lacks this ability. 

On a minor note, the available content is great. However, when I first heard there would be a Disney+ streaming service, the first two shows I got excited about finally being able to stream from beginning to end were The Famous Jett Jackson and The Proud Family. Imagine my disappointment when I discovered neither show was available on the service. I hope one day these get added to the service, but for now. I guess I’ll just settle for That’s So Raven and Lizzie McGuire.

title: It’s a Bugs Life
review:
Buggy. Incomplete. Almost like a Beta? 

While this is a new platform and is bound to have room for improvement on its initial launch, I am surprised (and honestly quite disappointed) that a company of Disney’s caliber neglected to polish their flagship streaming service this much. It fails to incorporate important elements of what I would consider basic streaming user experience while boasting a user interface that feels clunky and often quite glitchy. However their programs are organized decently well which could be a testament to their forethought or the fact that there just isn’t that much variety in content yet.

Missing elements: 
- ANY way to track series or films that you are in the middle of watching. You have to go re-search it again.
- Even when you find the new program it does not track which episodes have been completed.
- No way to customize your home page to your favorite programs.

Glitches:
- Switching from user to user will glitch
- Loading series will sometimes glitch to where only certain episodes will show- sometimes no episodes will show! 
- During streaming difficulty in scrubbing to a specific spot

Positives:
- Disney content. Let’s be honest it’s why we’re all here. Their years of labor and/or buying up other companies’ labor has paid off.
- Easy to find a specific show or movie. (Just wish I didn’t always have to!)

Long way to go in my opinion to be a polished well established streaming service, but they’re in the right track.

title: Some of us aren’t five.
review: The app is fine. It works as it should other than it buffers often. The content, on the other hand, is not what I expected when I paid. I did not pay for adult Disney movies to be edited or cut to remain “family friendly”. Movies such as “Splash” are not what they once were. As a thirty-two-year-old, I was excited to hear that “Lizzie McGuire” was being brought back and that Hillary Duff’s role as the lead, that I once loved, was being brought back as a fellow thirty-something and not the typical, stupid shows that bring them back as a parent. Not all of us are at this age. Once again, Lizzie was going to be relatable. Hearing that it is on hold to be revamped into another elementary-age-friendly show was extremely disappointing, in addition to the other edited movies. As an adult, save your money. Pay for your Marvel and vintage content, if this is what you were after. I’m cancelling my subscription and will possibly pick up the subscription to Hulu—where I hope Disney makes the right choice and places an adult Lizzie and other content they don’t feel is suitable for children.

title: Can’t wait to see what the future holds
review:
I am 29 years old and will never forget growing up watching Disney movies. When I heard about the streaming service I couldn’t wait to download. Upon downloading I was not upset at all. Neat design, easy to use, and immediately you see newer marvel movies, as well as some of the old classics. The choices are endless.

The only reason I gave it 4 stars was I first downloaded it on my PlayStation and the app said it couldn’t connect to Disney+. Checked my internet first and everything was good there. Instead just downloaded on my phone for now. I also got to the same message a few times on my phone but it was within the app instead of at first when booting it. Also just to see the amount of videos I tried to go to “A to Z” and see everything and i wasn’t able to get past “Aliens of the Deep”. I do understand that all new apps have kinks to work out so I look forward to seeing the updates, as well as watch it on my PlayStation.

title: Suggestions
review:
I’m glad y’all put a “keep watching” panel on, and I love how many shows there are to watch. I like Disney+ more than Netflix right now, if not for anything other than the sheer amount of shows and movies that were previously archived. 
I do have some suggestions, though. First is that the “keep watching” panel is currently a few panels down, so I have to scroll to continue watching. This isn’t a big deal, but it would be nice to see it without scrolling down. 
Another thing is that Netflix’s titles seemed... bigger? The thumbnails for everything on Disney+ are a little bit smaller than on Netflix so if y’all could fix that it would also be great. 
Other than those two things, I am in LOVE. I get to watch all the childhood shows I couldn’t before, and I get to see new things on it that wouldn’t be on Netflix for several months. You could say I get “the best of both worlds” (yes I am totally rewatching all of those). Thank you so much for making this app!

title: Great Service, But a Lot of Bugs
review: Hello! I really enjoy this app. It has a lot of my favorite TV shows, series, and movies. Disney+ has a very neat and professional layout, and the advertisement is pretty decent. It is just kind of glitchy. The Disney+ app on my 6th generation IPad has been having some issues. Most of the time, I cannot pause the video and there is just a loading sign. Also, sometimes when I go back to my "continue watching" screen and click on a video I'm watching it will start from the beginning, instead of the place I left off at. I've also been having some problems with Disney+ on my PlayStation 4. Multiple times during movies, the picture will be paused, but the audio will still be playing. I could not pause them. It took about a minute for them to get back to normal again. Once or twice I've had to shut the entire system down. Anyway, despite these bugs and glitches, it works great! Thank you for your service!

title: love the app... but there’s one issue making disney+ my last streaming choice..
review:
it goes without saying that the app is incredible with such amazing movies to chose from. however, every time we try to stream something to our tv using our Google chromecast, movies or shows will just randomly stop and buffer. this can last anywhere from a few seconds to even several minutes. this totally ruins the movie watching experience. 

I always update the app (i have the latest version now), but that doesn’t ever help the issue. we’ve also closed out of disney+ and restarted it, ive re downloaded the app, we’ve even restarted our chromecast. nothing works. we have this same problem every. single. time. it’s such a disappointment. it’s made disney+ our last streaming option in my household, even though we would love to watch more of it. 

i haven’t seen anyone else mention this, and i never review apps, but i just needed to mention it. will this be something fixed in the next update? how can i fix this?

title: Disney plus is great but some shows and movies could be added to make it the best
review: So I LOVEEEEE disney plus I watched so many Disney shows and movies through my childhood years and it’s great to rewatch them and watch some new ones too the price is so reasonable, and Disney plus barley removes any shows and movies only when their contract with the creators of the movies or shows expires. Here are some shows and movies I think should be added upside down magic, Spider-Man homecoming, Spider-Man far from home, Cory in the house, and you guys should add all the episodes for every season in andi Mack I haven’t watched andi Mack in a long time so I really want to binge watch it in Disney plus even though the grandfather in andi Mack did something bad doesn’t mean you have to remove all the episodes he was in andi Mack is a really good show so pleaseeee Disney plus add all the episodes of andi Mack if you add all these movies and shows I recommended should be added I would appreciate it and love Disney plus more

title: Would love it if it actually worked!
review: Every time I click on a video to watch it says oops something went wrong, the sound doesn’t line up with the characters talking, or when it finally does start to work it will buffer forever while my internet is great, and start playing in English AD, then it will almost immediately say oops something went wrong. I don’t even select the English AD it just automatically starts playing and when I try to switch it back to regular English it locks up and takes forever. I can’t even close my phone. Tried to contact support and tried the online chat. Told me my wait time was less than 30 mins. At the 30 min mark it kicked me off. So I called and was on hold for 2 hours just for the person to tell me that he was having trouble with his app too and it was a technical difficulty and to try back in a few hours! I pay for this and don’t want to have to wait to watch it. It’s not even been out that long so why is it already messing up so bad! It would be wonderful to watch all the shows that I loved during my childhood.

title: Love it but
review:
Love Disney love that most movies are available. But here's the caveat that's not listed. For some movies a not available in your area error message comes up. I'm in the United States. Not sure but maybe if a cable network is showing movie in my area, I have to wait to watch? I'm also a smidgen peeved that recent movie releases currently on cable pay per view, are not available on the Disney stream yet, despite Disney marketing saying that they would be. Two examples are the live action Aladdin and the live action Lion King. No reason why these two aren't streaming as neither is in theaters now. 

The only other issue I see so far is the lists. For example, pull up Marvel. Not all Marvel movies are listed under this tab. But if you do a search on an actual movie title it comes up. 

So all in all this is still a great value and I will probably continue to subscribe. There are so many great movies on here. Hopefully these things I mentioned can be attributed to a new streaming service getting off the ground and will be fixed shortly.

title: Needs some tweaking.
review: Big disney fan. I was so excited for this app.  I really do love the content. All my favorite movies from my childhood, and all my favorite original series and movies. I love the movies. I get to sit down and enjoy a movie with my daughter for an excellent price thank you disney for thinking about the lower class. I really did think it was going to be expensive and almost didn’t try it out. Here are my buts. When i see a movie and have to leave mid way. I would be nice to login and be able to see and just start it. Instead i have to search for and then press play. And sometimes it restarts. Same for the shows. I love the simpsons but when i go back to watch i have go to the season i was on. Then scroll until i find the last episode. Sometimes its hard because i cant remember and there is no way to tell if i have already seen it. So of you could please work on that, to me, the app would be perfect. Thank you. Have a wonderful day.

title: It was good at FIRST
review: Ok we know that Disney is amazing enough to come up with this streaming service. But the first time I streamed something onto our old viso tv it was fine it was the mandolin and when I finished it my iPad was fine. Then one month later. I streamed the whole avatar movie onto the tv the same one and my dad was watching the playoffs so we had to do it in my moms bedroom. Then after the 3 hour movie I noticed my iPad colors started to act weird and when I called my friend my iPad started to act weird and as we called the colors started to change on every thing on my cousins hair started to change to silver and when his hair is brown and everything started to change to white black and blue. I still like Disney plus but not when they break my iPad and my mom said I’m not gettting another one unless I buy one and I am in no position to buy or demand one please fix this or tell me this an Apple issue

title: Love the content but app leaves a lot to be desired
review: No need rehashing all the good things about the content and nostalgia and all that good stuff - I’m going to go straight to the point. Two big issues for me: 1. Lack of auto play and 2. Being unable to skip end credits. Auto play should be a setting we can toggle off or on (or apply automatically) especially on the Apple TV app. My daughter loves to watch the Mickey and Minnie Mouse cartoons which are about about 3 min 30 second in length but due to the lack of auto play I have to be on hand (every 3 mins!!!+) to fast forward through the end credits and the click on the next episode to play on the Apple TV. On Netflix it works differently as auto play kicks in and loads the next episode. If this can be fixed, that would be great. On the app it’s the same but slightly different as there is still no auto play but a box pops up on the bottom left which my daughter has now learned takes her to the next episode but an auto play option would eliminate that.

title: Minor “settings” not included with Disney+
review: There is not a “continue watching” or “recently watched” section so you have to search for what you were previously watching. Then let’s say it’s a TV show, you can’t just press play at the top bc it’ll play episode 1 each time starting you from the beginning. So you can’t press play so you have to search for the episode where you left off. And Disney+ doesn’t make it easier to search for the last episode you watched because all the episodes don’t have that colored bar many streaming services have that show how much of an episode you watched or if you had watched it at all. It looks like an app created for children in it simplicity. These are just some of the “settings” I've taken for granted that other streaming services offer aside from this app. Other than these minor problems that I’m sure will come with it’s future updates, it’s content is amazing and worth the price.

title: All the favorites, one small problem
review: Just like everyone else here, I was very excited to use Disney+ and watch all the old favorites along with the new original shows. I’m very happy with the service thus far but I’ve been having an issue with the auto play feature since the release of the app. I use my iPhone X to cast Disney+ movies/shows to my Google ChromeCast. When watching a show, the app will stop streaming after the second episode. It’ll go back to the placeholder screen that says “Ready to cast” but it won’t let me select the next episode. I have to disconnect my phone from the ChromeCast, close the app, then re-open it and reconnect to the ChromeCast. After that I can play the next episode but the same thing happens again after the second episode. Not sure what the issue is, this doesn’t happen when I use other streaming apps like Netflix or HBO GO. A fix to this would be appreciated. Other than that, Disney+ has been great.

title: Needs some bugs to be fixed still... but understandable
review: So, the interface design is elegant and clean, I haven’t experienced any weird lagging or anything of the sort and the image quality is really great (I can’t say for sure as far as audio because I don’t have a setup that could allow me to fully appreciate this at the moment). However, my biggest issue with the service right now, and this is not just for the iOS app, but for every format including Roku and the website itself, is the fact that there isn’t a “keep watching” section, thus making me have to do a manual search if whatever I’m watching isn’t immediately recommended to me or manually saved to my watchlist. To this I’d also like to point out that when I do the search, I’ll often have to remember where I left off in a series because if I just search what I was watching and press play, it’ll just play from Season 1 episode 1 of whatever series I choose, regardless of the device I’m watching from. Other than that good job guys!

title: Hard for Younger Kids to Navigate
review: This is a really good app, and I can see it only getting better. Baby Yoda needs to be a profile picture option. I have a sister who has poor vision and can’t read, and the app is hard to navigate for her. She goes off of pictures to find her favorite movies and shows. I think Disney+ needs to take some pointers from Netflix’s kid section. It’s very easy for children to navigate, even if they can’t read. I feel like the categories need to be better organized. I don’t know what a lot of the category titles mean. The content is amazing, but I hope they add more or keep rotating content. I binge watch TV, and I see me running out of things to watch in a couple of months. It seems like the app has content more geared towards kids, but is hard for them to navigate. I love the watchlist though, because I went through all the movies and TV and was able to add her favorites, so she only has to look through those.

title: Great Nostalgia, Needs Tweaking
review:
I am just as excited about having all the movies I grew up with available to me just as the next person. Any movie made from Disney is on here and so I can only prepare myself for what is surely going to be weeks worth of binge viewing. 
One thing that I, and many other viewers I have talked to that have the app, would recommend is the inclusion of a “recently viewed” or “continue watching” function. I would love to pick up where I left off watching wether it be a movie or a specific episode in a season. 
It becomes frustrating when you’re halfway into a season and there’s no progression to show which episodes have been viewed and which have not so it essentially becomes a guessing game. 
Overall, if the app designers include these kinds of functions, there’s no reason not to purchase a membership if you’re looking to reminisce at all the pieces that Disney has released ranging from their newest films to their old classics.

title: It’s a great app! But I wish it had a larger variety of shows!:)
review: Disney+ is really amazing for streaming different shows and movies on different devices made by Disney, they have a large variety and full episodes and full seasons, and great selection of movies too, I really enjoy the app, thank you! But, it would be a whole lot better if it had a larger variety of Disney channel/Disney XD shows for example ANT FARM, LIV AND MADDIE, AUSTIN AND ALLY, MIGHTY MED, KC UNDERCOVER. I was very disappointed in that department of the app because I had begged my mother to bye this app for me and for one of these specific reasons and I would feel really bad that my mom would pay the extra money for some shows that aren’t even on there:(, I EXTREMELY encourage if you guys could list a few more Disney channel/Disney XD shows on there then it would be a lot more enjoyable, if you could update the app that in this type of department of the app that would be really helpful😁. Other than that, the app looks great!:)

title: Still needs work guys
review:
Disney just deserves at least 4 stars but the app needs work. When switching devices or watching it in the same device the next day, it doesn’t save which episode you were on. There’s no continue watching category. No watch list category 
It definitely needs more categories, I can tell there are more movies on here than I can see because when we search other things come up. It’s not displaying anything and there’s no where to view them. 
I love having Disney shows, Pixar and right now I’m watching National Geographic. I love having them all at my finger tips and I thank you greatly for making Disney+. I’m looking forward to updates...
I love how you can skip Intro. View similar videos than the video your watching. That movies like turner and hooch are on here also! Definitely could use more movies like that. That you can make as many profiles as u want! Super awesome feature, has to be your best feature.

title: Great content, poor execution
review: I really do love Disney+ and its high quality streams and content! However, when compared to a more experienced streaming service like Netflix, the manner in which the wonderful films and TV shows are being streamed to our devices falls a bit short. The mobile app (for both iPhone and iPad) glitches quite often and is slow at times. There is a recurring issue with the Chromecast feature in which is crashes if the user attempts to skip forward/backward using the 10 secs buttons. This makes it difficult to enjoy. Another Chromecast issue is the lack of customizable audio while streaming. Without the ability to choose another audio setting besides Dolby 5.1 (which my TV does not support), my audio constantly lags and it is very frustrating to watch content most of the time. I’ve always been a Disney fan and would love to see these issues resolved as soon as possible. Thanks!

title: I love it
review: I love the fact that Disney came out with a streaming app that includes all or most of their Disney channel original movies as well as their old shows that they used to show on TV. They also include marvel movies as well as starWars, National Geographic, and Pixar. The streaming app really gives me the chance to reminisce on all the old shows they used to watch when I was younger. But the only problem that I have with this app is that when I am watching a show it doesn’t have a continue watching so I would have to always go back and and search what show I was watching before find the episode that I was watching before and it really is a lot. Because half of the time when I am watching a show i always forget what episode I’m on or etc. so if Disney improved with this I wouldn’t have a problem and that is the only one that I have this app other than that it’s pretty cool.

title: Fav TV app
review:
Good things and some fixes they need to change. 
 First of you can’t even watch Moana in the kids channel! My favorite show “Jessie” is ONLY on the adult channel! So is another one, “Diary of a future president”  and a classic “Diary of a wimpy kid” all is on adult channel! And you can’t even watch any new shows or movies. In months. Like it took mad long for them to add the freakin “Proud Family”
But on to the good stuff. You can watch ALMOST anything that you want! Get your own channel and check back later! I love this app! While my sister’s watching “Bluey” I’m watching ZOMBIES 🧟‍♂️! All of the girls at my school and I have been talking about it and sing the songs! I really can’t stop singing 🎶we were made for this there’s nothing we can’t do!🎵 And….. 🎶All the tm’s they told me walk away I sid fo’get it.🎵  I love this app! So someone needs to thank Walter Disney for creating DISNEY ‘cause I’m sure he would have never thought that DISNEY would go this far in history!

title: Slow poor app
review: This site is VERY SLOW. and every time I wanna pause the movie or show, it shows the loading sign so I can’t pause it. I can’t believe with all money Disney makes, they can’t upgrade their crap and make it easier on customers. Also, there’s glitches with this app. I was watching a show... I got out of it, then later decide to resume and watch it. As soon as I open the app back up to watch it, the sound of the show starts playing but there is no video with the sound. It literally was playing out of nowhere without me even clicking on the show. And when I kept trying to press the show to resume, it played new sound over the sound that was already playing. Why was the show’s sound playing without the show even being on? Even when I logged out the sound was still playing! Only time it would stop is if I got out of the Disney plus app. I had to uninstall. This is bogus and such a waste of time. Fix your site/app Disney. You guys aren't broke. How annoying and creepy at the same time that this happened

title: It keeps crashing
review: I was pretty excited at first to try it out. I logged in with no problem and was happy to see that they had the classics and throwbacks on there. This morning I tried to play something for my little sister, but the app kept saying “unable to connect” I checked my connection and everything but the app was still not working. I went to the support and read that it might help to uninstall then re-install the app. I tried it, but this time it would not even let me login to my account. All it said was, “We’re having trouble connecting to your account” I decided to try a live chat and was put on hold. My wait time said less than 30 minutes. I was waiting for about 20 mins trying to connect to an agent when out of nowhere the screen went blank and said “session timed out due to inactivity” I could not get ahold of an agent at all. I understand it just launched but I felt a little helpless with seeing that the support advice did not help and when I tried connecting to an agent the support page kept crashing itself.

title: It’s an ok app
review: I love all the movies and have been binge watching so many old movies but I think there’s a couple problems that need to be fixed/changed. I think that there should be separate accounts you can long in to so you’re not having to scroll through all the movies/shows that the rest of your family has watched just to find what you were watching to resume it. Another thing I think should be fixed/changed is how they post movies/shows that you can’t watch yet. It’s nice they’ll eventually be available but it’s on the app like you can watch it till you click on it and it says it’s not available for a year or so. I understand that someone else has the contract still but it’s like a tease saying here it is but you can’t watch it yet unless you have whatever other app it’s still on. Other than that, the app is nice and has a lot of good stuff to watch. Makes me feel like a kid again 😁

title: Weird design and annoying customer service
review: Hello, for the most part, I love the app and that I can watch so many classic Disney shows and films. However. I spent 45 minutes today trying to simply find where to change the language. The guy I was chatting with online was no help until the very end. It should have been an easy answer: go to where you choose a profile and select “edit profiles” and then select yours and you will see “language”.
