No, instead the man right away told me to just click “App language”. Where? Instead of answering me he told me to then go grab my phone, translated app language for me to Spanish (because my phone is in Spanish) and told me to just select that. 1. I can speak Spanish, especially basic Spanish so thanks for the insult. 2. If it was that obvious I would have done that. Then finally I got him to tell me where to find that. I was so frustrated. Language should just be in the settings for the application—where most people will look for it.

title: Nice try, but...
review: I’m not going to talk about what the service offers, but rather the actual app. Why would ANY streaming service launch without a “continue watching” button/list?? And if you minimize the app, when you reopen - Home screen. Not where you left off. And since there’s no continue watching option, you have to scroll/search to find it. And if it’s a series, you open S01E01 no matter where you were watching last. Also there’s no indication of having watched an episode, so you’re left picking through until you found where you left off. Literally, no one wants to do this!! This is why EVERY OTHER SERVICE offers some sort of continue watching..or better yet, when I reopen the app just show me what I was watching. Why are these simple options not on this app? And now with the new articles about the app being hacked and accounts are up for sale on the Dark Web within hours of launch? I’m not sold. It may be cheap, but that doesn’t make it worth it....

title: Great app great service but needs improvement
review:
1. Disney add a continue section on the home menu so I can continue watching from where I left off at it’s hard when I watch several episodes of a series then later I go back to find out oh wait what episode was I on

2. Disney I’ve noticed that some of your series are not in the right order like ducktales 2017 I really wanted to watch episodes but this series is story driven making it hard to watch this way fix soon check all series there’s a few I’ve personally noticed

3. Watch list I’d love to see an update with having this on iPhone app I’ve been using it on my PS4 it’s great I mostly use it to add in one spot all my favorite movies and tv shows in one place plus please make it so that shows appear ABC not as you add them and I love how there’s no limits to how many you can add thanks you guys did a great job on this so far

title: Needed link to find
review:
First impressions:

I’m saddened by the fact when picking a profile icon Captain America wasn’t one of choices. I thought maybe it was because his contract was up but then I saw Iron Man! I’m crushed. I had to go with my second choice Yoda and I guess he’ll do. 

Joking aside there is a lot of content and I’m excited to give it a go. The UI is simple and easy to use so far 5 star experience ok actually a 4.75 you can have the last .25 when Cap is an option for profile icon 😜

6 months or so in and I like it still but I guess if I’m honest I’m disappointed by how little content there is for adults. I get the draw is family entertainment but you do realize that children sleep right? Thanks to Covid-19 there doesn’t look like there will be any new marvel content for the foreseeable future. I think the biggest mistake all the streaming services made when they launched they depending on their Library’s of already released content to bring people in. While yes people will watch them, for the most part they’re the added bonus not the draw. Especially if it’s still airing repeats on tv. Unless they bring on some content for adults and I don’t mean sex or graphic violence I would settle for sitcoms that aired like on abc or even fox to fill the time till the Marvel series premier. Something an adult can enjoy I’m

title: Missing Something....
review:
First off, thank you Disney for making this awesome vault of wonderful movies and shows available in one big app. So far, haven’t had any real issues with the app itself (I’ve only used it with my AppleTV). Wish going back to the main screen was a little easier with that after looking through a ton of movies that I added to my library. 

I’m also thrilled that you included Avengers, NatGeo and Star Wars into the mix of classics. But there’s something missing from the Star Wars collection... The two (if there’s more than that, I’m sorry, but I’m going off of what I used to have recorded onto VHS’ from back in the day) EWOK MOVIES!! If you’re going to include the side stories and collections from the Star Wars franchise, one canNOT leave out those love able, yet feisty bear like creatures, and their movies that give more background into who they are! So please, for all of the Pete’s (Peter Parker included) sake, give us our Ewoks back!

title: ALMOST perfect!
review:
I love the new Disney streaming platform! There are so many choices!! It is so nice to have my favorite movies all in one place. 
There is only one issue I see as of yet that I’m hoping will get fixed soon: a “continue watching” section. It is quite annoying to have to go back to the search engine and type in the name of a movie you started watching. Netflix is generally set up the same as the Disney platform, so maybe do exactly the way they have it, one more of the sliding rows with the currently watching shows and movies. Only remove a movie from there when it is finished. 
Other than that, the platform is a thrill, some movies are still missing but i understand it has to do with the streaming contracts those movies share with other streaming platforms. Still, it would be nice to have them join into the platform asap. 

Over all, nice job! I wish more big studios followed in your footsteps.

title: Suggestions
review:
I LOVE Disney plus but the thing is that they don’t have like all of the Disney shows. Don’t get me wrong I absolutely love the shows and the movies but that don’t have all of the movies for Pixar or Disney. Now with the shows it is great but it doesn’t have mighty med which is a show I know and love. Mighty med also have a collab with lab rats but they have one part of it and that is the lab rats one also not to mention that the viewers are left on a hanger then on lab rats it is like it never happened like it all just happened in an alternate reality. Another thing that is not on Disney plus is some of the Pixar and Disney movies. Pixar and Disney are a really great companies and I am GLAD that it is on Disney plus but some of the movies aren’t there like Toy story 4 or Aladdin the live action movie or Frozen 2.

So basically on Disney plus there are some movies and shows that are not there. I would really look forward to seeing some more of Disney XD shows.

title: I want to love this app...
review: I truly do because of all the great content for anyone to enjoy. But for me I am having a lot of technical issues that don’t seem to get worked out with updates. Things I add to my list disappear being the biggest challenge. I will add a movie or show. Click on something else. Go back to said movie or show I added and it’s not been added to my list. Or something shows it is in my list and I go to my watch list but doesn’t show it in there. My list only shows about 10-15 things I’ve added and shows duplicates. I have added way more than 10-15 movies/shows. It’s on all the devices not just one. Everyone on my account has this issue. Finishing a movie does not take it off your “continue watching” section. Having an option to auto-play the next episode in a tv series would be nice. If the price went up for this I would not keep it because of these issues I have that do not seem to get resolved with updates.

title: Great App and Content
review:
I love the Disney+ app and the ability to watch all my favorite content. Things like old animated films, the Star Wars movies, and Marcel now have a permanent home for viewers to easily watch consecutively. The original content like the Mandalorian is also amazing, and I look forward to upcoming originals in the works. 

My only complaint with the app is it’s slow buffering time, especially when connected to Chromecast which is how I play content on my TV. I normally need to shut down the app and go back in which wastes a lot of time. Even when it finally goes to a certain place in the video, the user control for finding a place in the video is tough to use and again, buffers slowly. This is not as big an issue on the computer for me, but I think Disney can improve the software to make the user experience more seamless.

Thanks Disney for a great app. I think any fan should get it.

title: I love this
review: This is so cool. 5 stars!!! One day I  was playing on my moms phone and saw this app called “Disney+” I was thinking it was just a game so I didn’t get on it. I didn’t have a phone yet. So my mom asked me to go why my computer. She got it and I asked her what was she doing. She said, “I’m getting this app for y’all to watch it has Disney movies and shows on it” by y’all she meant me and my brothers and sister. I love watching it too! I was so happy when my mom said she’s paying for us. Now I can watch anything on my laptop and phone! When we had Direct TV we could only watch some episodes of Disney channel shows. And it sucked. Now I can watch shows episode by episode. I’m so glad that this exists! I can watch any show/movie I want at home when I’m bored! This is the best app ever! I’m so amazed. I never thought my mom would let me and my siblings get an app like this! 5 stars!! 😌

title: Unorganized
review:
First off, this is my very first app review. I’m usually not so frustrated but I feel Disney needs to hear a few things if they’re going to be in the game with Netflix. 
Ok, great start. Really, I love seeing all my favorite movies and shows in one spot. Plus, there’s a little bit for everyone. Nat Geo, comics, Star Wars, Pixar... etc! 
However, not all the shows show up. For instance, I randomly came across Doug, The Simpson’s, Goof Troop, Talespin, 10 Things I Hate About You and so much more! The best way I’ve found to find my old shows is going under the “suggested” link. These shows should show up under the “shows” tab. 
Also, on my Tv I’m able to scroll over and see “my list”. In the iPad app, this doesn’t exist. So all those shows I hunted for and stumbled upon are just MIA unless I type them in. 
Overall, I’m excited to see my childhood favorites but we’re a month away from the year 2020! This needs to be streamlined and simple. No more hunting just display everything up front!

title: Needs playback memory and sound glitches
review: I really like how it has everything Disney on it. I have two major issues with it though. One is on the app as a whole and the other is specifically on my Samsung tv app. They DESPERATELY NEED a playback memory or “currently watching” tab with memory of where you are at in the program if you pause and come back to it later. Gets old really quick when I have to fast forward through a two hour movie to get to the spot I left at. The other issue is on my Samsung tv. Every program I start, no matter what it is, has a sound/video glitch in the first 5 seconds of starting the movie/tv show. The sound is then 5 seconds behind the video for the rest of the program unless I close everything and restart my program. Other than these two things, it’s ok. Like all the shows and movies, old and new. But unfortunately, based on technical difficulties and poor user interface, it only gets three stars for me.

title: Special Day for me and Disney
review: Down loaded the app on IPad, logged in, but got an error on the first day. Closed the app down, brought up, still the error but hit to retry and bingo. I was able to screen mirror from my IPad to my Samsung TV and watch a show around 10 am. Later that day Samsung had the App available for download to my TV. We watched a Movie that evening. As far as shows in a series being released once a week, that is normal since like when TV was invented. News has reported about how expensive it will be for people to be paying for all these individual Apps. Internet is about the price as cable and how much do we complain about nothing to watch. Not no more, just don’t get that many apps that it becomes expensive. Disney+ gets my approval. A new venture for them with a little rocky start so give the tech people a break to get the bugs fix.

title: Great Nostalgia/Needs Improvements
review: When we first got Disney+ we were very excited and loved all of the cool nostalgic shows that they offered. Most of the initial bugs were worked out fairly quickly after the initial launch of the app. However, the more movies that I’ve watched that I am more familiar with, I’ve noticed that they cut some of the movies differently than the original Disney Chanel showing. For example some movies such as Lemonade Mouth and Camp Rock have key scenes cut that are important contributions to the plot of the movie. I’m sure there are other like this too. Movies on Disney+ should be cut the same way they are originally shown on Disney Channel. I’m not sure why Disney decided to cut scenes but it doesn’t really make any sense. Not sure that I will keep it after the free trial for this reason, but also because I feel that eventually I will grow tired of the familiar movies and TV shows. I would need to see more original content before I would consider keeping it.

title: Smart pausing
review: Hey! I wanted to say this app is great and as said in previous comments, I love the diversity of older content that can be hard to find and it makes watching the newer stuff easier too. Lovely. But I have a few problems with the way things work within the app. Maybe it’s because I’m too used to Netflix (😱 oh no competitor name), but is it wrong for me to think that your movie or show should pause when you answer a phone call? I had to answer a phone call that ended up being longer than expected and when I came back, I was suddenly halfway through the movie I started right before the phone call. There are other issues similar to this that I can’t pinpoint at the moment but I’m not trying to be overly negative either. I enjoy this app a lot more than I expected I would and am glad for it. But issues like this being fixed would go a long way towards making it even better. Thank you for your time and have a great day 😁

title: This App should much better
review:
With all the money and all the resources available to Disney, this App is a sorry excuse for the brand. Extremely low quality operating system with a number of issues earns this 3 star rating. While the library and original content is all what you should expect, the user friendliness and overall navigation is far behind the curve of today's standards of streaming services. 

I used the download feature for the new Star Wars series and found it “buffering” multiple times during viewing and pausing and skipping. Any attempt to rewind or fast forward caused serious malfunction and unresponsiveness from the App itself. I never have such problems with titles downloaded from other services and should not experience playback interruptions once title is downloaded to devices “hard drive.”

I challenge Disney to improve the navigation within movies themselves i.e. Fast Forward, Rewind, Pause, etc; as well as the download feature.

title: Needs a little work...
review: I just want to say that I overall love Disney+ but there are some things that need to be worked on to get my rating of five stars. First of all Why is there no continue watching bar!?!?!? That is very important, it is irritating that I have to search up my show or movie again and again just to keep watching it. Second Every like 20-45 seconds Disney plus will start buffering in the middle of my show and it’s goes on for about a minute. I’ve checked my internet and WiFi and they are both fine so it is not me. And last but not least I think it would be a good idea to add new movies that are coming out from Disney in the time span of at least 1-2 Months. I think that would get you a lot more people to buy this app just because how early you guys put movies and shows on. OH and also I think another good idea is to put like little short videos on here of like either behind the scenes or just a little short clip extra of a movie so yea overall tho’s are my main concerns and ideas.

title: Frustrating
review:
It is so frustrating using this app. My kids are younger, so they like to watch Disney Jr episodes over and over. Some days you can’t watch the episode because it always starts where you stopped. So half the shoes are stuck in the credits because the app will auto advance to the next episode right before the credits end! Also it’s really hard to rewind and fast forward. The show will stop and say “oops something went wrong!” Some movies and shows have scary parts for my kids so we fast forward. It’s not like we are letting them watch Marvel, it’s things like Jafar or the evil queen in the classic movies that make them afraid. I want the option to fast forward to be easier. 

Also, if I’m paying a monthly fee then I’d expect if a movie is available to buy in the store then I should be able to watch it on Disney plus, but no the newer movies aren’t on here. 

I’m glad to have so much on the app for the kids, but it needs a lot of work.

title: The Little Things that Ruin the Magic
review:
Quick version: good content, bad app in experience. Binge worth content on anti-binge platform.
It’s great to now have (most of your) Disney content in one place. As they evolve I’m sure that they will be rolling out more content.
There are some major over sites that Disney has failed to consider. With all the content available how do you not have a “continue watching playlists”. This is a standard feature on most, if not all SVOD platforms. One is forced to remember and re-search there content and episodes when re-opening the app or exiting their current view. Also my auto play is currently not working. I’ve heard this is an issue for other users as well. You’d like to sit and binge your favorite new or classic Disney content but app is set up to deter one of achieving that goal. I hope the app developers know that they still have a long way to go to create a user experience that is on par with rivals such as Netflix. Nostalgia can only carry you so far for so long. Disney, you can do better.

title: First Day Review
review:
I haven’t watched any content yet, but have browsed the titles and attempted to set up profiles. I am a little disappointed at how disorganized the categories are (and I’d like to discover or rediscover more movies, so I was hoping for them to include all content that fits a category rather than a handful). Can’t complete my profiles or browse Marvel or Star Wars yet. I’m checking that up to a large amount of people trying to utilize the servers on opening day and don’t expect that to be an issue long-term. It does appear that they have a kids account. I have server issues when trying to set one up, but am hoping that I can select/control what content I’d allow for my child. 

I’m happy that they added documentaries and older content, so I won’t just be watching shows from my childhood or today’s pickings. So far, it seems to be worth the money. I’m not sure yet if it’s capable of working with chromecast.

title: How is this app such a train wreck??
review:
Who is in charge of app development for the Apple TV?!  Most companies would probably fire employees for not doing their job correctly.  Not sure if it’s different for other gens but the Apple TV4k app is very buggy.  It’s as if they created the app and then never actually tried it out before release.  One of my biggest complaints is having to start the movie from the beginning after you’ve watched it through to the credits.  Most other streaming apps will consider the movie completely watched once you hit the credits at the end.  Disney+ does not.  If the movie does not play all the way until the end of the credits, it will resume to where you left off in the credits when you try to watch it again.  Most other streaming apps at least give you the option to Resume or Start at Beginning.  Why not here?!  

Sometimes when you leave the app, and then open it back later, it just resumes whatever you were watching earlier.

Other times you will get a black screen with the audio playing in the background.

Every now and then it just crashes and exits the app.

Some of the shows don’t have the option to pick an episode until you start the very first episode.  Then you can back out, scroll down, and sort through the episodes.

The only reason I gave this app 2 stars is because we love the content, and they have the different genres/franchises laid out nicely.

PLEASE TEST YOUR APP AND FIX IT!!!

title: Old Simpsons in 16:9 aspect ratio only? Shame.
review: Overall satisfied with the app, but the old seasons of the Simpsons have been reformatted in a 16:9 aspect ratio to fit modern TVs. That means the original 4:3 frame is chopped and this isn’t how the show was meant to look. Some visual gags are even ruined because part of the frame is missing due to this reformatting. It’s a well known defect. FX solved this problem with their FXNOW app, which let users choose between 4:3 and 16:9 when viewing The Simpsons. The Disney+ app should have had a similar feature at launch and amazingly still doesn’t have it. Various publications have called this out. The Simpsons is one of the marquee Disney+ titles, and Disney has spared no expense and has done everything possible to make sure you know they have this show, but in 16:9 it isn’t quite the same Simpsons you know and love. It needs to be available in 4:3. Other than that, they did a nice job.

title: Great app but...
review:
I just downloaded the app a few days ago and I’ve downloaded a movie to watch and a show on to my iPad. On the movie:I was only able to watch 30 minutes of it before I had to stop it. When I went to finish watching it later in the day, the app won’t let me. I kept getting a message so I just deleted it and will go back and watch it later.  On the show I downloaded, I was 10 minutes into it and the show froze up. I couldn’t finish watching it. Every time I tried to start it again the show just spun and then it kicked me out of the app.  So I just deleted it off my iPad and watched it when I got home.
Watching movies and shows on my iPad while connected to the internet seems to work fine. But I’m disappointed that I can’t download a movie to watch while on my lunch break or away from WiFi.  Thanks

title: So far, great performance, and design!!
review: Disney+ is here and it seems that it lives up to the expectations. I heard of some people having issues with streaming opening day but I have yet to have issues but also my internet connection is quite good. None the less, first impressions of the design and look of the apps interface is sleek and user friendly. Very similiar to Netflixs mobile app. Really like how they broke out their content into their own designated Disney “Universe”. Im a 29 year old male and have no kids but grew up watching all the Disney films and am a big Marvel and Star Wars fan so there is a lot here already to take in and its AWESOME. I got my 1st year free cause Im a Verizon Unlimited member but as of now if the price on the subscription doesnt increase by next year, I would consider paying the $6.99 monthly fee along with my Netflix and Prime sunscriptions. Happy streaming :)

title: It’s great
review: I really like Disney plus, I do have a few issues though. My biggest issue it Andi-Mack. Numerous people would agree that Andi-Mack is one of the best shows Disney has produced. I used to watch the show a lot and I never finished it. I went back to watch it but almost all the episodes are missing. I did some digging and figured out the reasoning behind it but most fans are more upset than happy about it. I won’t talk about the detail in any way but consider putting all the episodes on there. The situation is done and in the past, theirs nothing you can do about it and no fans blame the company in any way, shape, or form. The episodes you cut out show nothing explicit, so please do consider bringing them back. All the fans would really appreciate it. The show is something a lot of kids now days should be able to see, it’s very inspiring and brings light to a lot of bad situations.

title: Overall great streaming service
review:
The content On Disney plus is amazing! The only reason it’s short of 5 stars to is due some features missing.

On roku for some reason i cannot turn on subtitles which is a big deal to me but i can when i use the app or log in online. Also on the roku it is difficult to rewind or fast forward because you can only move by 15 second frames, can’t hold it down and it doesn’t show frames like on Netflix so you can visually see where you are at which is very convenient.

Also i wish that Disney plus would allow you to sign out of all devices because i log into a bunch of devices and sometimes that results in people having 24/7 access to my account that I don’t want. I reached out to a Disney plus member about this online and the only way to do that is to completely change your account email which i do not want to do.

title: In Love but still a little heartbroken
review:
I loveeeeeeeeeeeddddd Disney when i was younger so this app is awesome for me and my little girl. Not only do i have some classics really almost all of them but it has Marvel and Pixar. The only thing i was hopeful of was seeing Proud Family from episode 1. Add that and a couple other shows and movies and it’s 10 stars for me . Also , it’s a little tedious that when switching from mobile app to smart tv devices I have to go search for what i was previously watching. And even once i get back to the shows page it doesn’t play from where i left off. It seems there’s a few ease of access updates that could be set in place. Right now it feels like you’re just trying to show us the endless availability of great shows and movies but i can’t wait to see the transition into making this app flawless through and through. 

But. Please. Add. Proud. Family. Lol 💙✨

title: Pretty great but needs a update IMMEDIATELY
review: Disney+ is the best for watching all the old tv shows from the 2000s and Disney channel movies. I love that I have everything Disney at my fingertips but it needs to be improved on. First of all there has to be a counting watching tab. I want to be able to watch something and come back to it without having to search it up or add to watch list. Also I forgot what I have watched sometimes so a continue watching tab would be perfect. Second episodes and movies should have a way to indicate where you are in the episode or movie. I never know what episodes I have watched because it doesn’t show you anything. And lastly the watchlist needs some improvement. I should be able to remove things from my watchlist. Also movies and tv shows should show if they are in your watchlist and not all just show a + sign even if they are in your watchlist.

title: LOVE all the movies and shows, but the app needs to be fixed!
review: i absolutely love disney+! i'm so glad i can watch all of my generations shows and movies and introduce them to my son. but i've heard that disney+ will be taking movies off and cutting scenes due to certain "inappropriate" content. its sad that people now are so sensitive to things, if they are offended, they don't need to watch it or have their children watch it! it was normal for a grown man in the 50's and 60's to be smoking a tobacco pipe, theres no need to cut movies due to that! and along with everyone else, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE add continue watching!! its so frustrating to try and find the exact episode and scene i left off on a show. again, please don't take everyone's favorite movies and shows off due to people who EASILY get offended, it's ridiculous. people need to ease up, there are many of us who can agree that it is not "inappropriate" in any way.

title: Great Selection, Poor App Performance
review:
I’ve been a subscriber since day one and my wife and I absolutely love all the movies and shows that are available to watch. 

However, it’s completely inexcusable that my watch list is still broken even after all these months since launch. On the first day, I excitedly added tons of stuff to my watch list. I noticed over time that my watch list was glitched and it hasn’t been fixed at all. Not even half of what I’ve added is actually saved to my watch list, only random titles. Not to mention when I go to add something to my watch list it doesn’t get added anymore and when you click off the movie/show and then click on it again it acts like I’ve never tried adding it before.

Disney is a massive company so I know they have the money and resources to fix the issues with the Disney+ app but it says everything about them that they haven’t even made an attempt to fix my issues and many others I’ve seen in other reviews.

title: Virginia’s Disney plus app
review: I want to say thank you so much for making this app because It has high school musical the musical the series because I watched the episodes and the extras and Olivia Rodrigo’s Music video singing All I Want on the piano and the same song All I Want genius explained Interview video because I seriously want to thank her for singing I think I kinda you know and the start of something new and out of the old and I think I kinda you know dute with Joshua bassett because they sang the same songs as a mashup dute together because I really liked that so much this year and thank you for putting that on the Disney plus app and I really really appreciated and listening and encouraging and enjoying it because I have the same soundtrack album thank you for releaseing It ok from Virginia Rea and my email address it’s Virginiarea1@Icloud,com ok❤️

title: Should I be ashamed?
review:
Let me start by saying the app downloaded and opened without issue. Great format, content is unsurpassed (duh) and I have experienced no glitching or anything as of yet. Great app.  
As a 35 year old mother of 6, I wonder if I should be ashamed of how excited I AM for this app. For myself, I mean! Lol I have been counting down the days and now it is here and I am so excited I don’t know what to watch first. Probably, Robin Hood, but having these Disney classics right at my fingertips is amazing. My birthday is next week and I have seriously been saying that all I wanted was Disney+ to hurry up. And health, I want my health back as I suffer with chronic, often debilitating, conditions. Disney+ is now here so maybe my health will follow. Lol 

Okay, to summarize, Disney+: GET IT NOW! The app is great and the content is everything you want and so much more! Happy streaming my Disney people!

title: Outstanding, but could have more shows
review: I love Disney! It is an amazing place to go to, and if you ask me, they’re the best ones to create shows and all kinds of movies. But, the only thing that should be fixed is the lack of movies that people love. And this is just my opinion, but, I would just want someone to look at this just in case they are questioning getting this app. But other than that this app is so amazing in a lot of ways. It only costs 6 dollars a month! Hey Disney, if you look at this, I am just going to say, I love everything that you have ever done. Disney + is amazing everybody, so don’t just take my word for how Disney + is. But if anything, this is definitely a 10/10 review. Just try it out, and you know you will like it. I sure did! I watch Disney everyday. So, I hope this helped. Bye, and thanks for reading!

title: I LOVE Disney BUT
review: I’m a huge Disney fan since I was young. Trips to Disneyland being a So. Californian is a regular thing and movies are a treasure to me. But the glitches on this app is Killing Meeee when trying to watch things. It works half the time. Will load slowly or play the audio and pause on the video trying to load it then ends up playing from when it first glitched. Or when it isn’t working and I go to watch from where I left off it starts from a couple episodes ago. I knew it would the first couple weeks being that everyone in the world (who can) was pretty much jumping on board. But it’s been a a while and I’m sure they’ve had enough feedback and they def have the money to hire the best to fix these bugs, I’m sure they will, I just expected them to do it sooner than this because they are about quality. I’ll give them a better rating when they work better than Netflix. Common Disney! We need glitch free Disney Magic!

title: This is great! ... just not quite there yet
review:
I love the fact that there are so many options from Disney, Pixar, Marvel, Nat Geo, and Star Wars. As well as all the original Disney channel movies therefore fulfilling my childhood dreams and allowing me to be a kid again. 
With all the joy this new streaming service has given me there are just a couple of things that needs to be fixed and or added. 
1. There needs to be a continue watching section. I don’t like the fact that when I go to watch an episode of a show I have to scroll through and try to remember which episode it is the I am on. Same with movies. Sometimes I can’t finish a movie and I want to come back to it but I can’t because I don’t remember how far I was in the movie. 
2. There needs to be a way to Mark already watched episodes 
3. Keep the old shows the way they are don’t sensor them for more sensitive audiences. Keep them the way they were and instead write a disclosure about how this was a different time and the current Disney franchise doesn’t reflect the same ideals, but respects the original artistry of the shows and therefore will keep them as the were. 
4. The auto play needs to be fixed. Sometimes it works and some times it doesn’t. 
Over all I am so happy with my Disney plus but I hope that in the future updates these issues become resolved

title: Needs More Original Content, But Excited for It Long Term
review:
Title says it all.  I realize part of it is the fact they're using the weekly release schedule for original content (to start at least), but it still feels a little underwhelming at launch.  Long term, I know that the Disney+/Hulu/ESPN+ bundle will be among the best values in streaming, especially for families.

By the way, props (or not) to Apple for being so underhanded and hiding Disney+ in search results for the app (I imagine because of Apple TV+ and feeling threatened, even though they haven't even proven themselves capable of being a competitor to either Disney or Netflix yet).  I had to pull up the page for another app and go look at all apps developed by Disney just to find it.  Granted it has only been up for a couple hours, but still, it's not like the thinking at Apple was "not a lot of people will want to download this right as it goes live."

title: Amazing  but one problem 😁
review:
I love Disney movies and if you do I recommend you downloading this app it’s amazing. You get to watch every Disney movie.  But there is one thing that was very confusing. One day my family and I wanted to watch Captain America on our tv. So we  put the HDMI lighting adapter.  in our tv like we usually do when we watch Netflix. But it didn’t show the movie on our tv. I would really appreciate someone would fix that thank you. 😊

    I really enjoy that you get to download movies that you can  watch anywhere at anytime. How come   Disney has  to have gay people in Disney shows.  It’s  disgusting little children don’t need to see that. God made Adam and Eve. Not Adam and Adam or Eve and Eve.  Walt Disney would not approve of this would he. Half of the people are not Gay in the world so why do we have to watch people who are so please don’t put Gay people in Disney movies. Thank you for reading.

title: 99% perfect
review: The app is great and the content is even better. Through playing around, searching and watching, I’ve noticed a few things to improve to make it even more perfect. For starters, a resume watched section right on the homepage to show what you’ve been watching. Also it’s kind of weird when you play a movie then pause it, then go back to watch it the button doesn’t show that you’ve watched it or how much time is remaining. Also, it would be nice to move the watchlist to the homepage as well instead of in the settings. The homepage would be better if right below the Disney/Pixar/Marvel ect. buttons that you put a continue watching section, then the watchlist section, then continue with your originals, recommended for you ect. Also I love the collections feature on the app. Hopefully you expand that over time with different subjects and themes.

title: App is great when usable
review:
I have been locked out of my account since the day I purchased the subscription and could only watch two episodes of content until that happened. Currently I can’t login at all without being told to call customer support and to add to that I’m put into the longest wait line ever because as I understand I’m not the only one. And this is all because they have had too many people sign up for the service as they said on their Twitter help, though I don’t understand what they were expecting being that they’re Disney. How could they, the largest entertainment company handle this so poorly?

Edit: I have now worked out the issue no help from Disney, I understand that they were limited but they shouldn’t have done it like this. Reminds me of Rockstar with Red Dead on PC these companies can’t just wait, maybe we should all just wait.

title: Misleading Advertising
review: I love the app; it’s worked just fine for me, except for a few sign-on issues at the beginning.  My only issue is that Disney advertises that it’s all of Disney, all in one place, but this is a total sham.  It seems like half the movies I search for won’t be available until such and such a date.  Many of these aren’t even brand new releases (some I tried to find were released in 2014!)  They advertise that “The vault is wide open,” but still keep much of their content under lock and key to keep us paying for their app until we can watch what we thought would be available from the get-go, based on their publicity.  False advertising!  It would be more accurate to say, “The vault is partially open, but you’ll have to subscribe for ages to get the content you really want.”  This being said, I have enjoyed viewing what content I DO have access to.  It was just highly disappointing to see the dreaded yellow print: “Coming in XXX, 2020” on so many films.

title: No Currently Watching Area
review: I love Disney plus so far! However, one thing that is severely annoying is the fact that there is no area to view what you’re currently watching or have ever watched. You just have to remember what you were watching and search that up. There’s not even a progress bar when you click on that movie to show how far you were into it. Sure, it saves your progress and you can see that once you play the movie. But it’s extremely annoying to have to remember what you were watching and go find it again if you don’t watch it all in one sitting. That’s my only complaint. Otherwise, all the other features are great. There’s CC, skip forward and backward 10 second buttons while playing something, you can set up profiles for people, etc. Please Disney, make a currently watching or recently watched tab for us!!

title: Room for improvements
review:
The content is great. Movies, older TV shows, shorts. The quality is pretty good considering how old some movies/shows are. Separating Star Waes from Marvel from Disney helps with looking for stuff. A couple of improvements:

A “continue watching” section is missing. Unless you’re watching something featured on the main page or categories, you have to use the search option to find whatever it is you’re watching.

When I have gone back to watch something I was watching before, it starts from the very beginning so I have to scroll through the timeline to find where I left off from the time before. So not only having continuing a movie/show where you left off but also accessing that specific title from the first/main page.... a la Netflix i guess. 

Scrolling through the titles is not the fastest. At least with a PS4, being able to use the L1/L2 or R1/R2 buttons time scroll over 4 or 5 titles at a time would be great. Holding down the left or right directional button only movies one title over, it doesn’t keep scrolling. 

Another PS4 issue, the subtitles do not sync up with the audio. The subtitles appear on the screen about a sentence ahead of time. 

Personalization of the profiles is pretty cool. Changing profiles names and being able to choose different characters is awesome. 

Looking forward to more improvements.

title: BEST THING SINCE SLICED BREAD 🍞 ❤️🥺😍
review: I honestly could not have asked for anything better . Early Christmas present as long as I’m concerned. My childhood has come to life . I mean it’s more than I imagined . There’s movies I didn’t even know Disney was apart of . It’s been 2 days and I’ve watched Toy Story , Toy Story 2 , Mary Poppins , Brave , Star Wars (New Hope), Wall-E , Wizards of Waverley Place episodes , and just put on Annie . Basically I haven’t done much in the last 48 hours , but I don’t see how I can help myself . All my favorite movies (besides Harry Potter of course) are on this streaming service . I don’t see myself canceling ever ever ever . My new go to. I l or the way the site and app is designed as well . I’m especially a fan of “out of the vault” for Disney fans we all know how special that is . I’ve been counting down the days for this and it did not disappoint. ❤️🐭✨

title: Great APP
review: This is one off the best apps I have ever downloaded it has everything I need all the old shows that don’t play anymore you met get a little disappointed when they don’t have one of the shows that you used to like but they so many other great shows that don’t play anymore you will just forget about it. Also on this they have some shows that don’t even play on tv. Also any amount of people can use one account unlike Netflix were you have to pay extra if you want multiple people to use that account. And that is why I like it is also pretty cheap to get. Saying how many shows they have on the app it just a great app and a good way to catch up on some old classic shows that rarely play on tv any more. And some don’t play at all any more this is just a great app to get.

title: Great app, but when it comes to downloads.....
review: I love this app. It’s awesome! 😁 I also happen to be a Marvel fan, sooo, let’s just say Disney+ is great for me. Lol 😂 anyway, about the downloads thing. I downloaded some movies for a trip where I’d be offline. So when I got on the plane ✈️ , I clicked my Disney+ app ready to watch my favorites. It said my downloads were complete, it even had the check mark. But when I went to play it, it said it was unavailable for playback. All my downloads said it. I was upset 😢, cause now I was movieless on a very LONG flight. But I later connected to a friends hotspot, and downloaded another movie.  And it worked. So I recommend double checking, just to make sure your downloads are actually downloaded. 🙂 Overall I do love Disney+ , but I think it’d be nice if they improved their download feature. Well thanks Disney!! And thanks for all u do. 👍👍🙂☺️

title: Disappointed
review: So I’ve been really hyped up to finally see what Disney+ is all about, my family in the states downloaded it and got an account. And I’ve heard absolutely wonderful things. This isn’t why I’m disappointed though. I’m disappointed because I am unable to access Disney+ in Okinawa, Japan—while being stationed here as a military member. I’ve heard that Disney+ has all my favorite childhood cartoon and movies, and it would be so wonderful if other people like myself overseas would be able to get a taste of home, y’know? Maybe one day Disney can possibly make it to where streaming in another country is possible, like Netflix. But for now, I gotta say, Netflix will probably be our go-to movie streaming app because we’re able to access it. I understand it’s probably hard to make these things happen, but imagine the possibility of being able to stream a movie or cartoon over FaceTime like we do with Netflix?? The long-distance movie date nights would be spectacular!!

title: I love it! Just have one suggestion though!
review: Don't get me wrong, I love Disney! And Disney+ makes it so easy to watch throwbacks or the newest shows and movies! I just wish there was something small. I wish there was a "watched" feature like on Netflix and other apps. It would make it a lot easier to check if you've watched an episode of a show you're binge watching. For example, right now I'm watching Hannah Montana and I took a break from it for a few weeks due to school work and being really busy. Because of this I forgot what episode I left off on and I had to skip through a few episodes to catch up and remember what was going on. With a "watched" feature I would know where I left off the last time I watched something. Besides this, Disney+ is amazing!! I highly recommend it!

title: Finally!!!! 😃
review: This is the best movie or show watching channel, ever. PERIOD so much movies I’ve always wanted to watch are on Disney+ I love how it has, Star Wars. Pixar. National Geographic. And so much more! (DONT FORGET MARVEL!!!) I wanted to watch avengers endgame for the 2nd time so bad!!! 😭 As soon as I started watching, the first thing I watched, was Avengers Endgame at least 3 times. Then I got to see all the classic Star Wars!!! 🤩🤪🥳 it has all my favorite movies on it, except.... Spider-Man. I think Tom Holland is my favorite actor. And I loved him as Spider-Man in the movies. But I wish they put those movies on Disney+. I saw Spider-Man far from home the night it came out, and I loved it!!!! 😀😃😄😁😆 but I was extremely disappointed to not see it in Disney+. 😕. But other than that, it’s my favorite app for tv. Thx 🙏 Disney for a great app! My rating, a big fat A. Great job Disney! 🤩🥳👍👏🤟😁😁🤪🥳😃

title: Great movies
review: Maybe you guys should add more Disney shows. I love Disney channel and Disney+ but it needs more greater and better shows that can make peopl happy and we need happy shows that make you smile. Cause I love Disney+ but it needs lore shows all shows make you happy but we need some more like a lot of shows but if you guys have time to read this that would be fine cause I really need someone to read this. If you guys don’t wanna add more that’s sad. I’m just saying this is my opinion i’m trying to make this opinion for everyone that loves shows maybe they wanna watch a new show on Disney+ that’s what people need new shows I love big city greens and I love Disney+. If you don’t read this you won’t know the idea. This is just an idea for people that wanna watch different shows that they’ve never seen before.

title: Disney Plus- Almost there
review:
After a little over a week, I’ve canceled one of my several other streaming services, because there’s a lot of content here. Time will tell if it’s kept fresh and updated- or if they did the “IPO” with a bunch of blockbusters to get me hooked, only to taper off in a few months. But I’m optimistic. 
The only couple things that needs refining in my experience so far are: if I leave a movie and come back later, when I hit ‘resume’, it just starts at the beginning again. No big deal, except when I scroll ahead to the point I was at, when I take my finer off, it’s jumps several minutes (like 10-15) the other direction. Not anything more than an annoying inconvenience. 
For developers: I’m casting to Chromecast  from an iPhone X. Everything is UTD software wise. 
Get that fixed, and keep up the selection, I’ll keep on subscribing.

title: Issues=preventable bugs not “high” volume demand
review:
Need to fix video format capabilities across platforms. Watch videos just fine on IOS IPhone X, XBox One, but can’t watch on Apple TV Gen4 without going to video format 720p SDR 60Hz specifically. Hope that helps others out there. Kind of crappy since TV and platform are fully HD capable. The app and content are supposed to be as well. Not so much an issue with volume straining bandwidth of servers vs bugs that should have been caught before this rolled out. 
Would have given much lower but with the amount and quality of content, I’m pretty happy as long as I was able to figure it out since there was not a single Disney provided solution for this out there. Otherwise from such a name brand that has the money and ability to have bug proofed this other than maxing out bandwidth before rolling it out, I’d given them a fat zero.

title: loveeee it but needs a few small things
review:
How can anyone not love this?! All of the great movies and shows, and some i even forgot about and loved! Butttttt i really wish there was a ‘continue watching’ tab or something like that becuz it’s kind of a hassle to go and search for something that might not be on the first page and if my watchlist is pretty full i still have to scroll and find what episode of that’s so raven i was watching. Being able to rate what you watched so if you’re watching something new you can remember if you liked it or not and help out with the recommendation suggestions because just because something is on my watchlist doesn’t mean I’ll love it. Still veryyyyy excited for everything on the service, it was a great idea. Great content and greattttttt quality. Absolutely love it.

also.... PLEASEEEEE ADD “My Date with the Presidents Daughter” 😫 thank youuuuu

title: Alllmooosttt theereee!!
review:
In the words of my girl Tiana the app is “almost there”. I LOVE Disney +. So far this app has been a dream, there so many things that I haven’t been able to watch or even find on the internet that I now have access to and I’m so excited for even more.
My main plight is the lack of a “continue watching” feature, I know everyone else has said it as week but I’m a Leo so I gotta make sure people see my opinion too lol.
I also wish there was a little bit more in terms of searching for things. The main page doesn’t show me everything on the app so it can make it hard to discover new things and I feel like I could get bored after a while being recommended the same things.
There’s still time though! I’ve still got to finish watching my childhood of Hannah Montana and That’s so Raven, I’ll come back to update my review after the first update or once the season are all gone, whichever come first.

Very disappointing, I just cancelled my trial before the end of the 7 days. I never heard about Disney + until it started showing up on my social media news feed so for a free trial I thought hey why not check it out. My daughter asked me to delete it off her iPad within 5 minutes and I have yet to find a movie available I want to watch. On the first day the app launched I found several movies I was interested in watching only to click on them and discover they were not available till 2020, one of them (I believe Maleficent) not available till late October 2020. This seems to have since been remedied with unavailable movies no longer showing up on the app but those that are available, out of all the Disney & Pixar movies made are seriously disappointing. Happy to stick with Netflix & Prime Video, their user interfaces are far superior & the watch options are so much greater. Nice try but a huge disappointment. Even for a small child a Noggin subscription is a better value since it has games + shows. 🤷‍♀️👎🏻🙅‍♀️

title: Excited but some fixes needed
review: I have been soooo excited about this platform. The selection is great and I cannot wait until there are more originals to watch. I don’t know how I feel about releasing an episode a week, but I am sure there is good reason. It just seems like a step backwards into the world of TV versus new technology a streaming. I noticed two things that I hope will be fixed immediately.1) many times when I start a show, the sound and the visual is off a few beats. I have to restart the program and it usually fixes it. 2) I have not figured out how to pick up where I left off in a show. It seems I have to track where I stop so when I come back to it, I can fast forward to where I left it? That seems odd. There should be an option to start from the beginning or to resume. Has anyone else been having these issues?

title: But we never get to watch Mulan!!!!!
review: Hi! I absolutely love watching things on Disney+ and every movie is free!.... well not every movie. Mulan is not free. It made me so sad that I gotta PAY for a movie! I understand if it was a lot of work and payed a lot of money on it but not so many people gonna watch it if u need to PAY for a movie! My mom is also disappointed in this that you gotta pay. Like she gotta pay on groceries, she gotta pay on traveling, she gotta pay for Christmas presents ( she makes presents every Christmas ) like it’s not like we have to pay for these things. And as you saw on the title it says we NEVER watch Mulan. We really want to but we gotta pay! My brother disappointed too cause he loves when his favorite movies turn into movies where real peeps act the movie. He got very mad too. ( he gets mad if something not going right ) so plz plz PLZ let Mulan be free!!!!!

title: Great for kids. Gets old quick for adults. Not much content
review: If you have young kids it’s great.  Don’t think twice -get it.  My review is for people with older kids and fans of Marvel and Star Wars.    My teen girls do not watch it at all. As a Marvel fan and Star Wars fan that has seen all the movies it’s ok to watch here and there but completely lacks new stuff.  One series that had little action the Mandolorian. Not better than any of the movies. Content just lacks. I guess Netflix spoils us. Disney has almost no weekly new releases for all ages like Netflix. and when they add new movies they want you to upgrade to a more expensive plan when you’re already bored of the current plan. Because there’s no new content?  I can not justify continuing after Verizon’s free year.  I rarely use the service.  Rare to see anything new for adults that doesn’t require a costly upgrade. Did I mention I’m bored of the same content?

title: Great App + A Suggestion!
review:
Hi Disney+ Team! I love the accessibility of this app and pretty much everything about it! I have watched so many movies while in quarantine, so out of the vault, others being brand new. You’re new movies are amazingly done, such as the talented CGI of the live-action of The Lion King, the impressive storyline and animation of Onward, and the heart-warning, emotional story of Stargirl. 

Suggestion: I think the app would be even better if on the home page there was a “Coming Soon” section to get people excited for upcoming tv shows + documentaries + movies, such as the long-awaited upcoming adaptation to the Percy Jackson and the Olympians series! 
Lastly, thank you so much for making the recording of “Hamilton” come out so much sooner! Me and so many other people are very grateful and happy. 
That’s all! Sincerely, a huge Disney fan.

title: Nothing compared to Netflix
review: I’d like to start off by saying that I really like the app, and I like the content but the app is so much harder to use than Netflix. Here are my list of problems. 1)After finishing an episode, it doesn’t automatically play the next, so I have to manually scroll to the next. It wasn’t a problem until now I’m on episode 50, and it’s really annoying at this point. 2) It’s so hard to find new things that I like. I know there are a lot of good movies on here, but I can never find anything unless manually search for it. I don’t know if an algorithm is used to display movies/tv shows but what I’m seeing is definitely not what I want to watch. 3) Finally, I don’t know if it’s just my phone, but after I close the app, the content continues to play. It’s kind of annoying to have to make sure it’s paused before moving on. Other than that, I really enjoy using this app so far!

title: Won’t waste my money!
review: The kids have been dying to get Disney+ even though we’ve seen 75% of the movies on here I thought why not try it out and see if it’s something we’d enjoy $6.99 a month really isn’t that much I mean come on you waste more than that on junk you don’t use so since the kids are out of school I decided why not try it free for a week to see how much we’d actually watch it I am so glad there is a free trial! I would be very upset if I had actually paid for this it is so annoying every time you start a movie it cuts off and has to reload it does put the movie in the continue to watch section so you just go down to that and start it back up but if you had searched for something then all the results gone so you can’t watch the movie then hit back and pick a different movie you have to search again start the movie it cuts off reloads and you scroll down again to find the movie in the continue to watch section I’ve cancelled my subscription it’s too aggravating to pay for

title: Watchlist Messed Up
review: I added a bunch of stuff to my watchlist the first day I got the app and everything was fine and then a few days later when I scrolled through my watchlist it stopped about halfway through as if there was nothing else to load. Then it would load more items but they would be the same things that I just scrolled through, so it’s like half of the movies and shows I added get repeated twice but a bunch of other stuff is missing. It’s been this way for about a week now. Definitely makes it annoying and difficult to find things I want to watch because I can’t browse everything I’ve already taken the time to add to my watchlist. Glad a continue watching section has been added to pick up from shows and movies I’ve left off on, but it would also be nice if the individual episodes had some sort of status bar of how much I’ve watched them, if at all.

title: Content is great! Ease of use, not so much....
review: I was so excited for the app to launch because I kept hearing great things about the content. Content is great and it’s so nostalgic to see movies and shows from my childhood! However, the ease of use is awful. The watchlist is not easy to access. Why do we need a widget on the bottom bar for downloads? It would also be great to be able to leave a movie or an episode and have the app save where you left off! I have also noticed that the app does not show if you have watched something either. Now I need to remember which episodes of what series I have watched and if I leave something in the middle I have to remember where I left off. I hope this is improved in a later update! It would be great if the watchlist and download placement was switched, and if the watchlist also included things you were currently watching. Looking forward to seeing updates!

title: Constantly doesn’t work
review: I downloaded this app when it first launched and the whole family loves all of the content. Disney+ has a huge variety of things to watch. There were frequent down times at first. Which was to be expected with the app being so new. Things soon leveled out and worked perfectly. Still occasionally it would have a “ bad day” but after going through the fix all with all things electronic things would work fine. I am currently having issues with the app. It has been over 2 weeks since it worked. I have deleted and downloaded again, disconnected from the internet, I have even reset my network, and still no Disney+. Every other app works so I truly believe this is a Disney+ error and needs to be rectified immediately. I realize things happen and it takes time to fix but I feel like 2 weeks is plenty of time. This Is a service we are paying for and to not be able to use it is not okay.

title: Couldn’t even get started
review:
I am a huge Disney fan and was finally going to hop aboard the bandwagon and get a Disney Plus account, do the free trial, and see if it was something I would pay monthly for. However, I created an account, put in my email and password and then was met with a notice to contact customer service. I tried multiple times to log in on the app and on my laptop, to no avail, saying my account is blocked.

My one star is for the company, not the app specifically. After a search on Reddit, it seems that this problem has met a lot of others besides myself that planned on being payed customers that are discouraged due to these unknown errors that caused them to be on the phone with customer service for hours. The results are workers admitting that they have no idea what the problem is and the customers having to create a new account and cancel the old one. I will have none of it. I will not call customer service for 3 hours to have them tell me that there’s no real problem. Please fix this.

title: Great app but content loading Too slow !
review: I downloaded this app days after release. I love the app and so does my daughter. It has all the best Disney, Pixar, cartoon and even marvel movies! My daughter is non stop at rewatching her favorite Disney princesses movies. But i do have a problem with lagging. I have Verizon wifi so i never have problem with loading movies or anything on other sites. But i do with this Disney plus. Every Time i put something on for my 3 year old the movies always freeze and the audio continues or take very long to load. I barely use the app as much now because my daughter complaints every time it freezes so i have no choice but to put Netflix for her. I use the play station console to use the Disney+ so i dont know if thats the problem but i never have loading problems with any other. Please fix this. I love the app.

title: Not impressive
review:
Here are my issues with Disney+

The main screen: The main screen is a series’s of rows of thumbnails, just like Netflix’s setup... but there is barely anything there. What I mean is, you scroll through about ten or so titles in each category which is in reality a tiny fraction of what’s actually available. So, in order to find something to watch you have to think about a title you’re looking for and search for it in the search bar. What I found even dumber was that the same thing is true in the more specific “categories” sections. For example... you can visit the Star Wars category and scroll through all day long and NEVER find “The Last Jedi” but it’s totally available, you have to search for it though. Dumb. So dumb. 

Subtitles: My partner is hearing impaired and we watch tv with subtitles on 100% of the time. The subtitles on Disney+ across all of the platform always show up about 6 seconds too early, causing confusion about who is speaking on screen. 

Loading: There is always loading problems. Skipping, loading, restarting when the scene finally loads up... really annoying. I actually turned off the app and decided to watch Avengers:Endgame on a different platform. One that doesn’t have loading issues. 

All in all I’m not impressed. But I paid for the year so I guess I’ll tune in again when the new Marvel TV shows come out in the spring, binge those, and cancel.

title: Not up to the Disney standard quite yet
review:
I wish I wouldn’t have been so anxious and waited before purchasing a year of this service. It’s still very buggy and slow, which is to be expected but it’s making the user experience a bit frustrating. I LOVE the content and the simplicity of the app. But trying to remember which ocean doc we’ve already watched so that I don’t keep clicking the same one, is insane!! I literally keep a list of which Nat Geo and shorts we’ve already watched. Please fix. 

Also I forgot to log out of a device while traveling and now everyone who visits that Airbnb probably is using my account free of charge. I wish I could log out of it! Please fix. 

The content is there and you’re adding new things all the time but it’s hard to get pass those two issues for me. I hope we continue to see more issues resolved since I’m stuck for a year with this service.

title: love the app but a few suggestions
review:
I love the disney plus app and all of the classics that are there that i watched as a kid, however it could definitely use some improvement. I understand that it’s fairly new and upgrades will come with time, but these are just some suggestions for the future. 
First, i wish you could make a favorites list or something so you don’t have to re-search what you were currently watching.
I also wish i could go back without having to refresh/restart the entire website (on pc).
Next, I think there should be a way for you to skip end credits and go straight to the next episode/movie, similar to netflix.
Lastly, for some reason, the skip intro button doesn’t skip the entire intro, not a big deal,  but something that can get a bit annoying when you’re binge watching a show.

title: Almost fantastic.
review: I was so excited to finally get Disney+ because I would finally be able to show my kids the stuff I grew up watching and also see some new stuff myself. My first disappointment is the lack of a “continue watching” section, especially given the fact that there was forethought into being able to set up multiple profiles. The other disappointment is with a number of movies being listed but not actually being available until 2020 or even 2021! I mean what the heck Disney? Are you telling me that D+ isn’t going to be fully up and going with all content for 2 more years? That seems a little lame considering we’ve all been waiting 2 years to get this service after it was announced. I guess for now I’ll enjoy the content that is available and try to wait patiently for what’s still missing.

title: Overall Great App
review: This app has been great!!! I have it on my Roku and on my IPhone! The only downside is it doesn’t stop like Netflix or other apps do! It will play all night without stopping and you wake up at 8 and it’s still playing!! There also aren’t shows on there that should be! Like who wants to watch “Diary of a Future President” (which by the way that show is crap) when other shows like A.N.T Farm aren’t even on there. Plus you can’t advertise that you have all of the movies and shows when clearly you don’t!!!! I am still waiting on movies like Enchanted to show my 5 year old sister!! Read people’s reviews on what shows and movies they want before adding crap!! We are in QUARANTINE nobody wants to watch movies about the Earth. Or Diary of a Future whatever. All of these new shows (besides HSMTMTS) are crap. Walt Disney would not have wanted this!!

title: No “Continue Watching” feature
review:
Mostly a good experience. No problems with the workability of the app. I like that I can watch the old Disney movies I grew up watching.

I don’t like that there’s no “continue watching” feature. You have to search for the tv show you were watching then sift through all the episodes trying to remember where you left off. It’s hard to remember, especially when your binge watching, where you left off. With a show like The Simpsons, with literally hundreds of episodes, it can take awhile to find where you left off. 

The only other thing I don’t like is that they’re kinda misrepresenting themselves by placing icons and titles of movies in rotation that aren’t available. They will be available, but not for a few months or even a year on some titles, which does nothing for you now. It’s annoying to see a title while browsing through the content and get exited that this title is among the available titles. But, no. “Due to licensing issues this title won’t be available till October of 2020”. Wait, what? Why do you have it in rotation with the watchable content? It should be in its own category(“coming attractions” or something) instead of in the “Action and Adventure” category with other titles which are available.

But the app itself hasn’t given me any issues and is mostly user friendly.

title: Please do more anime 🥺❤️🍥
review:
Ok I have no way to watch anime aside from DVDs and CrunchyRoll is 17+ so I can’t even get that but I’m a BIG anime enthusiast. Latterly the first movies I watched were ponyo Totoro and the cat returns and like every Other Ghibli movie my favorite show has been Avatar the last air binder, do you know how hard it is for me to be left hanging with naruto I can’t watch Naruto what ever that last word says until I’m 17! Sasuke is still with the bad guys!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!😭😭😭😭😭. Granted you do have one anime it was great by the way but as a webe I NEED more so in conclusion, I would appreciate more anime from Disney in the future.                                                                                                  
 P.S.      the inter time I was watching future Avengers, i was pumping my fists saying “This makes all my wildest dreams come true!!!”

title: Some minor improvements that need to be made
review: Overall Disney+ is hands down one of the best streaming services and I love it so so much. There are still somethings that could be improved like the continue watching. After you don’t watch a show for a while the show goes away from your continue watching list. This is really annoying especially considering that a lot of people may not be able to watch anything for a few days considering work, school, etc. Another thing that could be  improved is that not all great Disney shows are on there. For example, the new season of Raven’s home. Season three is on Disney channel but yet not on Disney+. One main reason this deserves four stars is because some shows are not on it. For example, Mighty Med was a great show with lots of viewers yet they do not have it on Disney+.

title: Has some kinks
review:
I’m disappointed that there isn’t a “continue watching” feature and each time I go into the app I have to search for the correct next episode in a series. It’s not that big of an annoyance when you’re a few episodes into season one but will get annoying very quickly as you move beyond the first few episodes of a series. It doesn’t even mark them as watched so if you take an extended break you’ll have to have a good memory to remember where you left off. 

The auto-play of next episode feature is also not working, at least not on my iPhone. I have to manually hit play for the next episode to begin. 

There are several Disney junior shows (kate and mim mim, Goldie and bear, Sofia the first to name a few) that no longer air that we were hoping to see on here, especially since one was recently removed from Netflix, but I’m hopeful they’ll eventually be included.

title: Can’t Register/ Start Free Trial (FIX IT DISNEY!!!)
review:
I’ve seen and heard of Disney+ plus for a while, and finally decided to “try it” (after seeing so many cute scenes of baby yoda in the madalorian). So here I am installing/downloading the Disney+ app, and suddenly when I tried to click the “ START FREE TRIAL” button, it gives me this error “Sorry, something went wrong. Please try again later” with two options button that I can press “Retry” or “OK”. Press “retry” many times, nothing happens still on the same screen, tried the same thing pressing “ok” choice again same thing only without the “sorry, something etc, etc...”

Come on Disney fix these. These is the only ever and first time (I hope) that I actually commented to an app w/ a complaint even before “trying” to use it. MOST of all this is not a Good First Time Impression to your customers (that could be lifetime). I know you might not (deeply) care (being that you guys a what a multi billion even trillion dollars company) but at least hear this comment out from an average joe.

title: BURY MY 1 STAR OPINION
review: Uhhhh, sadly it’s easily something to NOT love, we already own basically all the things that are on here. From movies to t.v. shows we have it. There isn’t really anything new with the exception of the mandalorian series (which only has TWO episodes that I see). Disney paid a lot of $ to hype this thing up and you can tell, vast amounts of ppl signed up. I can easily say I will be sticking with my other streaming subscriptions which have content that is fresh. It’s funny how the “from the vault” section or whatever is supposed to be something to be excited about...lol, guess what we already have them so how about I open my vault for free and enjoy them.... I’m not trying to dig you Disney I’m just saying that I was excited yes, but after a day or two we planned to cancel. You can charge me the $6 if you really need money for the 6 or 7 days we had it. BUT SOMETHING TELLS ME YOU DON’T NEED THE MONEY NOW DO YA....lol... I’ll be watching the web to see if you actually make fresh new content but as for now it seems boring and just ......MEH.

title: Best thing since television
review: Honestly I’m not that old to know if TV being brought out was that amazing however, I am old enough to know some of these classic movies. Those old VHS tapes and scratched sup DVDs that would skip over key scenes midway through movies is now a thing way in the past. I remember sitting with my family and enjoyed watching Star Wars and Beauty and the Beast as a kid, wondering man I wish we could have all the Disney movies. Well now that I have kids of my own, Disney Plus has really allowed me to have that on my phone!!!along with firestick.. etc... also, Disney has allowed my family the opportunity to relive those moments in time while creating new moments with the Marvel lineup and countless other Disney Junior lineups. One of the best apps ever created for family interaction and just utter JOY!

title: UX on AppleTV: 1⭐️ / Content: 5⭐️
review:
Please fix navigating extras on Apple TV. Scrolling left to right in extras, while exploring, or just trying to find something specific is frankly unpleasant. The text describing details are cutoff, and even the program length (time/duration) is pushed out of view by long clip titles. How do I differentiate between a 2 minute deleted scene and a 2 hour behind the scenes documentary. A lot of video must be going unseen because of this.

The iPad & iPhone apps already scroll vertically when browsing extras so I can see everything “as intended” there. But on the Apple TV, where I actually want to watch this content, usually it’s not worth trying, because you can’t even see what your choosing sometimes. It’s so bad I had to write a review. The Content is obviously great. But Disney+ Apps (each and every single one of them) should be equally great. Period. The resources are available to the developers! so the expectations are high. As they should be.

title: Cannot get it right
review: Went through the Verizon plan to try for a year. After a few say I was kicked out of the app because apparently there was an issue with the birthdate link to my email. They supposedly fixed it by having us transferred to my wife’s email. A month later the app tells us our subscription ran out. When I call the supposed fix was never actually fixed. They put us on for another month assuring us that this time the issue would be fixed permanently. Even going as far as sending us an email so that we can correspond should the same issue arise again. Well another month has gone by and the app again says the subscription has run out. I try reaching out via the email and never got a response. There are far too many streaming apps to have to call in and ask Disney + every month to fix their issue. It’s obvious Disney was not prepared to enter the world of streaming. And it’s obvious that their product is far to expensive at the price of “free for a year”.

title: One key feature to add (added!)
review:
One key feature; continue watching. 

It’s nice to have all this content to watch, but it’s a hassle to stop mid season on a show and come back a day or two later and have to recall where you were. Granted, it does recall where you left off in the specific episode. It would just be more convenient to have a dedicated row to things you are currently watching. Where you are one click away to continue where you left off, instead of going to the magnifying glass, looking for the show, going to the season, maybe it was this episode, dang I should of wrote it down, okay it’s this one; it would just simplify things, in my opinion at least. Thank you for your time.

(Updated!): Disney + now has the feature “Continue Watching”, thank you guys so much! This makes carrying on where we left off so much simpler and faster. I can’t think of anything else to make this amazing service even better than it already is; other than wishing it was Friday again to watch the next episode of the Mandalorian, am I right?

Thanks again to all the members of the team that made Disney + possible, your names remain unknown but your exceptional work is visible for all to see.

title: No Way to Delete Viewing History (Customer Service was no help!!)
review: I think this app is wonderful, don’t get me wrong, but there should be a way to delete the TV/movie history you (or somebody who also uses the same account) watch. One of my younger relatives sometimes uses my account and usually plays TV shows (that I don’t watch) so it kind of bugs me when my history is clogged with shows I don’t watch. I contacted customer service to see if there was a way to get rid of viewing history but they said they don’t even HAVE that made yet. They suggested to skip the entire episode but since it’s a TV show, it plays the next episode, even if I cancel out. Hopefully Disney will add that in their next update(!!!!!). It took Netflix awhile to add that feature (on their website, not on the app btw) so hopefully the people behind Disney+ will add it soon and not years later (like Netflix).

title: Platform can be better
review: The content is ok. Love the classics and being able to see the all the Disney animated movies and shows. But Disney needs to stop playing it safe. There is not much content for adults, and what is for adults is still family friendly Witch knowing Disneys history makes sense but if this platform wants to be more they need to step it up and take some risks. The overall platform could use some work. The overall design feels lacking. It looks like it was made in the early 2000s. For a new platform I expected to look more clean and well designed. I experience crashes every now and then but it’s not terrible. I wish there was a way to tell if you finished an episode. And since Disney owns Fox I hope they will eventually have a new tab for Fox content. I’m probably just going to watch what I want for a month or two and drop it then maybe pick it up again in the future if or when things improve.

title: OMG LOVING IT
review: 😃😃😃 I loved that you can watch it on the TVs and it has all the Disney categories even for like toddlers and babies it’s a GRATE thing to have to watch and we all new it but then it got even more amazing you can do it on a tablet or a phone or a computer like yesss Queen and it’s so amazing like when you have a baby bro/sis and they keep on crying because they don’t have anything there’s a little category for the juniors and I love this because it’s a life Saver for me and they can watch it while they’re on a car drive or when your parents are at the store basically anywhere I love this app so much and I know it keeps getting better and better PS. I know it’s tough around these times and I know Disney keeps helping through this  over and over again so thanks from me

title: Great content? Terrible product…
