review: I’ve seen some of the content available on this app/service and I’m really interested. Unfortunately, it just flat does not work. I signed up for the free trial and a year subscription six days ago. I set up my family’s different profiles, set preferences and added some movies to my watchlist. Since then all I have been able to watch is the famous, but completely unhelpful error message with Ralph and Penelope (on mobile devices) or a spinning blue ring (on the computer.) The “login” button on the website appears to be a dead link, and when you work around to the actual log-in page you get the spinning ring. The app just plain doesn’t work. I hesitate to call something trash that could be great, but I wouldn’t pay a nickel for what I’ve experienced during my free trial. I understand these issue can happen, but it’s been over a week since they went live. Is there any chance that Microsoft is the parent company for Disney? I won’t be subscribing at this rate. Zero stars.

title: Great but has many issues...
review: i love disney plus and use it all the time but the app in particular has many issues that should be fixed. first one is missing episodes!!! many shows are missing episodes and the majority of seasons. another problem is many episodes on older shows are out of order. another problem is inaccurate search results. whenever you search for a title, a completely different and unrelated title might show up as well. it just looks weird and out of place. another issue is the app is very buggy. it does not load as fast and the pages for movies load one movie at a time as you scroll down. another problem is inaccurate dates for movies and shows. this isn’t really an issue but it just looks like no one took time to put correct dates in.

title: Good content, badly presented
review:
I love having access to all the shows and movies I grew up with, as well as all the recent movies I love. My biggest gripe is how poorly the service has been set up. A lot of the older TV series’ episodes are out of order, or just plainly missing episodes. This doesn’t seem like an issue that should still be going on after the service has been live for a couple months now. Especially when some of the shows were fixed within the first week, and the rest seem to just be getting ignored. I don’t want to have to shuffle around the clunky interface to find the right episode. 

While the amount of content is great and nostalgic, the lack of response to problems has led me to discontinue the service. That and the fact there isn’t much original content currently, but it’s still a new service so I’m sure that will improve over time.

title: Great App, but Questionable Privacy
review:
My two sons(16 & 13) recently got Disney+ little over a month ago. They’ve enjoyed it and watched their favorites. They love it and think it’s good. But the strange thing is that their accounts won’t stay on their phones. My older son opens up his account to only see it’s logged onto his brother’s and neither of them have done edited their profiles. It is automatically there every time he opens the app up. 
   My sons also question the security of the app as they keep getting each other’s watch list. For privacy reasons, I think there has to be an update to secure individuals’ privacy as this malfunction makes my boys curious and a little worried about this minor error. Could Disney try to fix this and does anyone else having this problem? Other than that, Disney+ is great and my boys enjoy it a lot.

title: Expected more from app
review:
Autoplay is the main annoyance.  (We use chromecast to TV)
It rolls to the next episode when there are still 2 minutes remaining of the episode, so you miss the end. 
The app also limits some series like Boy Meets World to only 2 episodes, then kick you out to the home screen. You have to search for the series again and select the next episode you want to watch. Then after 2, you get kicked out again. 
Why is there no ‘watched’ indicator on episodes? If you haven’t watched a series for awhile you can’t tell where you left off. 
The ‘continue watching’ list drops programs you were watching after a couple of days.  Apparently, someone at Disney has decided you can only have 4 programs in ‘watching mode’ after 2 days. Why? 
Another unexpected issue is when you stop watching something and return later. (This occurs only when we cast to TV)  We have to start watching where we left off on our iPad and then cast to TV.  If we start the app on the TV and then restart a movie, it puts us back at the beginning. 
Most disappointing, is that Disney knows about these issues. After U.S. launch they quickly added ‘continue watching’ feature based on customer complaints,  but appear to have stopped putting any more effort into making additional improvements.

title: Languages available
review: Hello Disney Plus, the app is great and have some content from childhood I didn’t think I’d have the pleasure to see again. I was even more pleased when I saw that I could watch a show in Portuguese (Timon and Pumbaa series) to be specific. However, for my disappointment it was Portuguese from Portugal (which has a very different accent) and even different words for the famous songs. I’d think you’d have added the Brazilian translation version of it since the likeliness of someone wanting to watch in Portuguese being a Brazilian vs a Portuguese it’s probably 95% chance to be Brazilian. Please swap to the Brazilian Portuguese translation or add it (as you did in Spanish) with European and the Latino Spanish options, that would be great for most of us who wish we can watch in Portuguese. Thank you, and again the app and context are great!!

title: Love it but it’s missing some thing!
review: I love having all of my old favorites in one spot! I’m letting my kid explore all of the movies that I used to watch and she’s in love with Finding Nemo at the moment. The design is pretty and it’s been working for me with no problems unlike what some people have been saying. I just need it to have a “continue watching list” sometimes I go off and do things with my kid and my Xbox will shut off. I don’t like having to search for what I was watching every time. I need that list. Sometimes I’ll forget that I’m even watching a series and I’d love to have that feature. The second thing is that we don’t have the option to binge watch the series. It might seem minuscule but I have a two year old and if I want to have some mommy time I don’t want to have to come back and push next episode every 5 minutes because she’s watching a series instead of a movie!

title: Amazingly well made app
review: I got the service right when it came out and was extremely excited for the mandalorian. The main reason why I got the service was for the marvel shows, I was a little disappointed with how long it is going to take for the new marvel shows to come out. The first night it came out I did notice that the servers might have been overloaded because it wasn’t allowing me to get into somethings. If someone asked me if they should get Netflix or Disney+ I would say Disney+, the reason why is because it’s cheaper, Netflix will no longer have any sort of Disney movies, and the content is high quality and very entertaining to watch. Overall I would highly recommend this service to any one who needs to find some new shows/movies to watch.

title: Needs Improvement
review: I was very excited to get the app for the content. My son loves everything Disney so this was a must for our family. The app itself is easy to navigate and it’s aesthetic is nice. My only issues are: when setting up a profile for my family, It would not save or show the profiles, so I had to create it again. When I came back to it after a while, I found all the profiles I created and thought weren’t saved there at once, when I tried to delete them, they would still be there. Secondly, the app crashes a lot and it fails to los several times. I checked my internet just to make sure it wasn’t a connection issue, but it was fine. Not sure if this is is a product of everyone using at once since launch, but I hope they do fix it. Its well worth it, but the lagging issues and crashing, make it really hard to experience Disney+.

title: Needs a few improvements
review: I’m writing this with hopes that Disney will see it and make the necessary improvements. The app is nicely designed and runs fairly well with the exception of 2 things, both on mobile device (iPhone 7). First, when playing an episode, there is never a pause button when the screen is tapped... just a spinning loading wheel. The only way to pause is to turn off my phone. The other problem is the difficulty leaving an episode or movie. The back arrow at the top left corner of the screen usually takes me 4-5 attempts before the device responds correctly. Most of the time when I tap it, it acts like it would if I were to just touch the middle of the screen, with the spinning loading wheel popping up. Please fix these things. Other than that, great app.

title: Love it all!
review: I know, theres no “continue watching” list, but just think! Every show and movie is there again! I’m a big fan of “Jessie” and “The suite life on deck” and “Teen beach”, so to re-see it again is awesome! I love “Disney+” the way it is. Yes, it can be frustrating that you have to research the show or movie your watching, but still, like I said: Every show and movie made by “Disney” is there again. And yes, its MY opinion, some people dont like it, and I will respect that. But hey! I’m just saying its a REALLY great idea in my book! But yeah, I wish everybody would appreciate it because theres SO many shows and movies by “Disney” and people don’t appreciate it or how long it took to take ALL the shows and movies (and theres ALOT) and put it to all one app. So I applaud 👏 to “Disney” and their hard work 😌.

title: Need more fixing on some of these problems I’m having
review: Ok first thing first I love Disney Plus and you know what made me sad the profile picture  options , I like to watch Disney Channel and there is about  particular show I love and it is called “Disney Star vs the Forces of Evil “ , can you add some more of the profile pictures from that show it is from Disney Channel . I just recently updated Disney Plus and I don’t see my history when I finish an episode of  a show, can you guys go back to the  version 1.8.0 please and thank you. Now when I don’t finish a movie or a show it goes away from my continuing watching list as I start something new it moves all the way to the end and goes away please fix these problems please in the next update.

title: Amazing selection just one flaw with the UI
review: So I love the selection of movies and shows, although the UI can sometimes be a little glitchy. Sometimes the pause button is replaced with a with loading symbol like the video is buffering, although the video is just fine. Another problem is that sometimes when I look at different seasons of of show I want to watch it takes a long time to load, and even then some episodes aren’t even there. I do not believe this is my internet because I did not have these issues with other streaming services. All though these are still minor annoyances, the service is still completely worth it, I just want the developers to work these issues out (yes I know this service just launched but Disney has the money to fix it instantly).

title: Lots of issues
review: I’ve been watching Disney+ on my FireTV and the content is incredible but it’s missing a continue watching feature, a lot of movies shown to be on the service won’t actually be available for a few months-a year and when I tried logging on on my laptop (it’s compatible I checked) the log in button wasn’t responsive so I tried going straight to the log in URL and it wouldn’t load. Additionally, when I downloaded the app on my phone (also compatible) it wouldn’t accept the email I provided, even though it’s the correct email and didn’t have any mistakes. I understand that they had a lot more people purchase a subscription than they thought would, however, they already had multiple streaming services to model it after yo flaws in the actual service itself shouldn’t be present. On top of that, if people can’t log in they’re going to get frustrated after a while and unsubscribe 🤷🏼‍♀️ hopefully these issues get resolved soon.

title: I love it!
review:
When I first heard about it I was so excited. I was happy to watch all my favorite childhood shows and movies. I finally got the app and I’m so happy! A few things though, number one, I would watch a show and then get out of it when I’m done, but when I go back to watch more it just plays from the first episode again. Number two, I would like an area to where it shows all my movies and shows that I’m watching. I’m a forgetful person and sometimes I’ll forget what I’m watching and where I left off. I know it just launched so I knew there will be some bugs that will need to be fixed. Lastly, I’m so happy that I get to watch all these amazing shows and movies. I’m excited for future updates and more shows and movies to be put on. 

Thank you :)

title: Finally
review: I have been waiting forever for this app.  It’s even better than I thought. The only issue was when I first tried to sign up it kept giving me an error message and when I typed my email to try signing in it said it wasn’t available in all regions.  I expect some issues though because it was only hours after it launched.  I wanted a few hours abd it let me sign up.  I had expected it to be more of a pain than it was. I have been using it since and have hit no more issues.  It’s a great app and so worth leaving Netflix for.  It is also a lot cheaper.  There are more options and no restrictions.  The only thing that could make it better would be to know what we’ve watched already and what was started and not finished.

title: Love Disney, not the app.
review: I purchased the app a few days after the release date, as it would not let me start a free trial and when I tried to just purchase the subscription directly but it would not allow me to purchase. Once I was finally able to purchase the app it would not connect to the the internet and I could not watch anything on my iPhone. I also downloaded the app onto my 2019 Sony smart TV, the same problem occurred. I figured this was happening because so many people were purchasing the subscription. The reason I’m writing this review is that it’s still having these issues this late after the release date. I am still unable to connect to the internet although all my devices and other apps are connected to the internet and are working perfectly. Please resolve this matter so I can enjoy all the memories of my childhood.

title: So much potential
review: This app has so much potential but it’s expectedly still glitchy . All the shows and movies are amazing and it was so nostalgic going through it all. However... why can’t I select a single genre/type and go view solely that category ? It lets you scroll trough a few selections in a single category (scroll to the left) maybe ten selections or so and then it just stop . You can’t press on the category name and the only way I seem to be able see more options is when I press on one selection and see additional content on the bottom under “recommendations “. It also did t save my spot in two of the shows I was watching so when I went back to them today it started at episode 1 and didn’t even have the episodes already watched checked off. anyways I’m sure it will get better and I’m looking forward to updating my review.

title: Disney+ is the absolute best!!!
review: I got the subscription last year, and trust me when I say this, I did not regret it for 1 second. I did have a problem with Disney+ a couple of months ago because it would freeze the second I opened it. Of course, a new update can out and fixed that problem. Also they’re are trying to make more money by adding this premier access thing. But I don’t blame them. #1 Nobody goes to the movie theatre, and normally it casts $50 just to let 2 people watch it, and now you can watch it with as many people as you want. #2 once you pay $30 once, all the upcoming premier access movies will be free. #3 I bet all of you guys would make 50 different types of premier access just to make money. So I loves Disney+

title: Good but bad
review: So to start with I think this app is really good and has good movies and really good organizations to find a movie you wanna watch for example like comedy. So now we can get to the bad part of it. I know this might be new to the developer but I really think it need more improvements. I do know that your are working on things but as a right now I just don’t feel it. You can put the small un- good movies but can’t put the good ol movies that people wanna watch? Not a lot of people wanna watch those newest movies such as like live action. But I really was looking forward to the live action Cinderella and beauty and the beast but now I have to wait until 2021 for the Cinderella live action and October 1st for beauty and the beast. It bothers me because not all the goods are on there.

title: Love it!!!
review: I have been enjoying Disney+ since it launched a month ago. It has tons of movies and shows all on one app. I have enjoyed reliving my childhood by watching the old classic Disney cartoons along with the classic animation movies. Only reason I did not give it a five star is there are a few glitches and bugs Disney needs to work out. I have been watching it on my PS4. While watching a show or movie, the picture would freeze but audio keeps going. Other times you would be watching and it would fast forward a couple of scenes and you would have to rewind and sometimes that would freeze the app. You would have to close the app and reopen when this happens. All in all, I have enjoyed Disney+. I just hope that the next few updates will fix some of these bugs and glitches.

title: Not available in a majority of countries around the world
review:
From what Ive heard the app is good. It does have a few bugs and issues but it’s good. I have to say that I personally wish the app was available in all countries around the world preferably in the same year as it is released in United States. 
I wish that the Mandalorian, Clone Wars seventh season along with other Disney + TV shows were available to download for a reasonable price (usually between 30-40 US dollars per season) on ITunes Store and I wish they were available soon. 
Personally I would love to buy The Clone Wars Season 7 instead of paying hundreds of US dollars it s just not consumer friendly to say the least. It is very sad to see that the majority of the world can’t see Disney + TV shows and films majority of which fans have been waiting for a really long time.

title: Worth it...but bugs
review: Disney+ is everything I thought it would be! It has everything from my childhood plus a lot of the new projects they’ve put out with more coming in the near future. However, there are bugs I have noticed...one being it seems to only allow you to add a certain amount in your watchlist and once you’ve reached that limit, the list repeats from the top and then ends. The page on the certain movie or show will say it’s in your watchlist, but when you go to the watchlist page, it’s not there. I’ve also noticed that it doesn’t add everything, you can click add but it bugs and ends up not adding it. I still love the app with access to all those Disney projects, just waiting for the bugs to be worked out. Completely worth it in the long run!!

title: Great content but still has issues
review: We got Disney plus and we are on day two of the streaming service. Day one was plagued with issues of not being available but by the end of the day it all seemed resolved. Today is showing buffering issues every 10-15 seconds both on the TV and on mobile. On first look the service seems generic. The search does not work very well until you get the exact search strung gets put in. Also there service does not pick up where you left off. I had to leave in the middle of a show and came back and the show started over. Not a huge deal as the fast forward seems to work well. As previously mentioned, day twos major issue seems to be a buffering issue. I have tried both on ISP and over mobile and have the same experience. Hopefully by day three we will have the major kinks worked out.

title: VERY IMPORTANT READ!!
review: Do not share your password with anyone!! Unless you 100% sure they won’t share it with anyone. I shared my account with couple people thinking nothing of it until someone shared it and it kept getting shared and someone started deleting the accounts and messing with my account.. I changed the password thinking it would make everyone have to log back in but that’s not the case everyone will still be logged in and there’s no feature to boot people off your account so i talked to someone from customer support and one agent told me one thing and the second time I talked to someone else they told me completely different thing so my point is don’t share your password because I can’t even enjoy Disney right now

title: Downloads but won’t share
review:
I got this app specifically for the ability to download content to my phone then later share it to my [samsung] television later. 

I would stream direct to my tv except that like everyone else I like to watch shows during normal (peak) evening hours AND I have satellite internet. So, my direct streaming experience has been mostly watching at 5am or watching a load screen every 12 seconds. Frustrating!!

So, I did some reading and found that I could (supposedly) download to my phone then airplay to my tv. However, that’s not really how it works...after having airplay freezing/studdering issues, waiting 1-1/2 hrs to chat with Disney about it (they didn’t), go half-nuts thinking it was an issue with my phone, tv or WiFi setup, I finally disconnected my internet modem and VOILA! It didn’t work at all!!! 

What seems to be going on is; Yes, you can download content to your phone or tablet at lower than 4K/ultraHD definition and you can watch on your phone or tablet just fine. BUT when you attempt to cast content to a smart tv, the tv doesn’t play the cast download but instead streams direct from Disney in HD. Apparently Disney has decided that they’d rather you didn’t see their content on a tv than allow you to view it in low def. 

In other words, Disney doesn’t want customers who don’t have the best internet speed.

title: Great content, poor usability
review:
Let’s brush past the obvious: the content is great. Classic and new Disney movies and tv shows, literally everyone in the family from my 2-year old kid to my 75-year old grandma has something they want to watch. 

The other positive (as of writing) is the app lets you download a LOT of content for offline viewing; which was a lifesaver recently for a long family trip. Each family member got a decent selection they could enjoy on the road.

The major drawback is the video viewing experience: it is just not up to the standards of a Netflix or Prime Video app. Auto-playing a series, quick rewinding or fast forwarding, etc. are glitchy. In offline mode, some of these features just don’t work. Hopefully they fix these bugs soon; that will make this app a real winner.

title: Disney please read this.
review:
I just really want to thank all involved in this accomplishment. I feel amazed to be part of this mark in history, screaming on the morning of November 12th just because it was the day. Going so excited to open Disney+ and actually having trouble, spending a good amount of time trying to figure it out and them when all was fixed, spending hours watching Disney Channel shows that I grew up watching and that I couldn’t find anywhere else years before. 
The reason why I am writing this here is simply because I was looking at the movies catalog and it gives me so, so much joy that everything you could possibly want to see again (or for the first time) is there. 
I am truly happy with Disney+ 
It is just so, Disney!

title: PLEASE fix this app! We are PAYING customers!
review: Everything on my watchlist is on their twice, and when I add things others start to disappear. It’s super annoying scrolling through my watch list and seeing things repeat, while others are nowhere to be found. I had to remove a bunch of stuff I just added so I didn’t have to go searching for things that were at the bottom of my list aka ones I added first. And that’s another problem, when I add things I never know if they’ll be at the very top or very bottom of my list. And why isn’t there a section where we can see what we’ve already watched, I’d like to be able to continue where I left off as soon as I open the app, instead of having to go to my watchlist and look for the show or movie I want to continue.

title: I love it but have one complaint.
review: I absolutely love Disney plus. All the good movies and shows that I love watching. They also have stuff from my parents generation that they can enjoy. There is also no adds during any shows which is a great thing as far as streaming services go. So far I haven’t had any glitches which is a positive. The only complaint I have is that there are several movies that I was looking forward to watching on the service are unavailable until 2020 or 2021. I looked up one film and it said that “due to agreements this film will be available till april of 2021”. I looked up another and said “unavailable till december of 2020.” Why are they making us wait so long just to put several of their own products on their brand new service?? They need to do something about that.

title: Great when it works
review: I’ve got mixed feelings for the app. Mostly good though- I haven’t experienced any tech issues with the app from my phone, so great when we’re out and about for my little one. At home, streaming the app on the tv is a headache and takes forever. When it decides to upload , none or some of the pictures are there for movie or show selection. And then when you click on the choice, it may or may not give you a okay option. Sometimes you click on it and nothing appears. Or it just spins and spins. It’s not a WiFi issue as this is the only app I have issues with. As far as the content that’s on the app, I can only say great things!! I’m thrilled my son can watch all the classics from my childhood (and even my mom’s) plus all the newest material. I’m looking forward to an update for tech reasons but aside from that, I think it’s a cool app.

title: True Imagineering
review: On the day of launch I found some glitches. (which is bound to happen being it’s the 1st day it was open to the public) Here is some I found: The play button would not display nor did the episodes, loading times were pretty big. Honestly I’m not even mad about it because this is pretty much every Disney movie on 1 app for a really cheap price, you couldn’t really ask for more. Regarding the glitches, within a couple hours Disney updated the app and the glitches were fixed faster than you can say Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious. In the end, Disney+ is true hard work of imagineering. Congrats to Disney on such a wonderful accomplishment, I cannot wait to see what Disney+ has in store for the future. 👍🏻😁

title: Needs notifications
review: I love it. It is a well-made app Best I’ve seen so far only one problem you don’t seem to have any notification settings and you don’t send any notifications that is a thing that I rely on when you’re sending out new movies or removing movies from Disney+. And I’m sure some people also have the same issue with there being no notifications I would like to see this added. And several people know that you remove things from Disney+ I don’t know why but you do one of those things that you removed is pirates of the Caribbean stranger tides but that isn’t exactly a problem I just wanted you to send a notification when it was removed so if you could kindly work on that I’m sure a lot of people would be thankful. thank you for reading this review.

title: aMazInG
review: This app is absolutely amazing  I love it especially since there is the new Mulan on it, it’s an amazing app because the controls on my iPad allow me to keep watching in the corner of my screen other than that I just love almost everything about it...but there Is one minor issue, if you are reading this I definitely still recommend this app but just know, I have downloaded many things before, and after a hour they just disappear. Disney, if your reading this comment I hope you fix that, because my family travels a lot and plane WiFi doesn’t always make the cut, we all know what I mean by that, but I still love this app I would donate money to improve that download issue...that is, if I had the money.

title: Disney as usual
review: The app is as I expected from Disney. Disney does one thing and they do it better than anyone else, Entertainment. With that being said, there are some short falls. As many have said, a keep watching tab with the ability to resume a show would be awesome. I got cut off the other night and then had to scroll to find my place again in the movie. Also, since we’re possibly downloading these to a mobile device, how about the size of the movie or episode you’re wanting to download. If that is there somewhere, I didn’t see it. It’d be nice to know how big the file was. Lastly and sadly, not ALL content is available. One of my favorite Disney movies, Johnny Tremain, is absent. Song of the South, Tex, just a few that I’ve noticed. Whether it be political incorrectness or oversight, I miss those.

title: Great content, but terrible app!
review: The content is great, but they removed some stuff which is disappointing. The app however is a totally different story. I’m having issues with my kids watching something on their profiles then it showing up on my profile as a continue watching which is very frustrating and inconvenient. It effects the suggestions. The app could be made much easier to navigate. When trying to watch it on my TV if we don’t have exceptions internet connection it won’t even work, but Netflix and every other streaming platform has no issue. I’m currently under a free year from Verizon, but if thing don’t change drastically I WILL NOT pay for it once that free year is up. I love the concept of all of Disney’s content being streamable, but it really feels like they’re much more focused on the dollar than the consumer. It’s quite disappointing from one of our most beloved companies!

title: Love Disney+!!
review: I am absolutely loving Disney+! I love being able to watch all the old Disney Channel shows I grew up with as a kid. I love being able to watch all my Star Wars & Marvel movies in one place, well most anyway. However, I will recommend a couple improvements for the next update such as a recently watched section right at the top like Netflix does so that I can pick up where I last left off rather than having to search for it. Also with watching movies on Disney+, I sometimes don’t finish a movie in one sitting and so it is quite annoying when coming back to the movie and it is not where I last watched it. I have to then go and fast forward to where I was again. It would be great in the next update that I don’t have to do that. Other than those two, I love the new Disney+!

title: some tweaks but other wise i love it
review: Disney plus is a great app definitely worth all $7.00 ever month. But, I just wish there was a continue watching section because at some point your going to exit out of the app and forget what movie or show you where watching. I would love that just so it’s easier to find. Otherwise I don’t think I have a problem with this app. And I would recommend disney plus more than netflix because I enjoy disney anything. But, if your more into netflix just because you might not like disney for any reason I recommend netflix. also this is for disney: I’ve been so excited to download this app and it exceeded my expectations again the only thing i would add if i had a choice was continue watching section. Thank You for reading my report have a good day.

title: Just a few Suggestions!
review: Overall, Disney+ has been AMAZING! I’m loving getting to rewatch all the shows I used to watch as a kid. I only have a few suggestions on how to make it better, which I’m sure have already been said. First, a Continue Watching list would be suuuuch a huge improvement. Additionally, if I go to a series, there needs to be a way of seeing which episodes I’ve already watched, so I know where I left off. Finally, I know most of the TV shows are older, but the quality of some of them feel less than ideal to watch. They’re definitely not the best quality videos I’ve watched recently, and I don’t know if this is because they’re older, if my iPad is just messing up, or if the video quality is purposely somewhat low. These are my thoughts and suggestions. Thanks!

title: Can't pause!
review:
I've been using Disney Plus on my IPhone/IPad, and although it's fine on the Roku, there is one or two problems on my IOS devices that I've noticed.
1) If I try to rewind/fast forward, I can do it, but after I do, there is a loading sign on the pause button, so I can't pause without backing out the show/movie or tapping the progress bar. This is only when I tap to go back or forward on the pause screen, not the progress bar.
2) Sometimes when I rewind, it glitches and brings me back to the main screen, so I have to click on the show again. It's really annoying if I'm watching a movie or binging a show because it cuts into the movie/show.

Other than that, I love this app. Watching all my favorite old shows and rewatching original favorites is really rewarding.

title: No complaints
review: I have had it since it came out! And I love it! I hv u guys for the heartfelt memories I’ve grown up too! I keep Netflix for the scary stuff I grew up with and also love the news stuff. But I am now in the middle of watching 2of a many fav tv shows o. Disney channel. Wizards of waverly place. And Lizzie miguire. And hv watched so many of my favorite movies! I was a 90’s kid! So all of these movies I grew up watching. Can’t play my vhs tapes anymore and don’t have them all on vhs. I haveALOT but not all of them! So happy to have Disney plus! Just brings me back to watching them as a kid and getting excited to see the movies I loved back then now. A great way to escape reality and go back to the best years of my life watching the movies I loved whenever I want! Thank you for this Disney!!

title: Worth it
review: I love this app. I love Disney so much, but I have run into a few problems while using the app. On any device... the movies and tv shows skip a whole lot.. it’s almost like I’m watching a movie on a very scratched up cd.. is very annoying and eventually I get really tired of it so I have to just leave it all together. I’ve had issues with it slipping and it backing out of what I’m watching several times. Other than these issues which I really hope will be resolved I love Disney plus a lot... I would really hate to quit using it because of this problem, and I know it’s not a connection error because my WiFi is amazing and have never had a problem with it. New shoes and movies would be great but I’m sure that will come later on down the road 😊 other than that I love it so much ♥️

title: Please Fix Watchlist
review:
With Disney+ you’ll be able to watch every movie or show (with some exceptions) that Disney made or owns. It’s a long nostalgic trip and brings joy to movie streaming. There are some issues with the app, however. The watchlist has a major glitch where if you add to many movies, it seems, it will take off a couple and duplicate the ones already on it. I wish there was a way to edit the watchlist as well. 

In certain instances, Disney+ is ahead of big streaming companies, but in other instances there seem to be certain luxuries missing. For example, a “continue watching” list or “recently watched”. 

The app NEEDS to be polished. Get the app, obviously, cause it’s cool to watch all the movies and shows you did as a kid, just expect glitches, as it is still a young streaming service.

title: Subtitles off
review: We love Disney + it’s great to have the classics available as well as all the new fun movies. We watch many of our movies with the subtitles on because of hearing problems and have found that the subtitles are a few seconds ahead of what is happening and being said. This can ruin a movie with a surprise coming. The words appear a full 5-7 seconds before someone says the line. Please adjust this. Also, rewinding with the PS4 has some glitches as well. Usually works ok, but sometimes loses its place. And another thing, there are times when the video stops but the sound continues. I first thought it may be due to internet connection speeds, but I don’t have these issues with any other streaming app. Thank you.

title: Amazing selection/major casting issues
review: First off, I love everything that is offered though Disney +. It has even more than I ever thought it would. Every disney channel original I can think of is offered, which is definitely my favorite feature. The biggest problem is the downloading and buffering issues. When I’m casting a movie or show, the app will stop to buffer almost every five minutes minimum, sometimes being stopped for long periods of time. I just finished a movie that was 1 hr 39 min and counted the number of times it stopped to buffer... 34 times..... in less than 2 hours. It’s awful. I’ve tried casting other apps such as Netflix to rule out any slow signal/bad connection on my end, but Disney + is the only one that seems to struggle. I’m not sure if this is something that can be improved on their end, but it makes it less tempting to subscribe further until something fixes it.

title: Perfect but not perfect
review: I got Disney Plus a few days ago and it has so much to like but so much to dislike as well. First the TV shows are great! The Star Wars one is amazing and they have every episode of the Simpsons. The movies are amazing with almost every Star Wars movie, loads of marvel movies including Endgame, and lots more. But some of the problems include not showing what you have watched which is annoying if you watch multiple things at once. Also if you have already watched most of the movies and finished the shows there is really nothing to do but wait for new movies or more episodes. Overall Netflix is better, shows you what your watching, a wider range of movies/shows, and is easier to locate things. If Disney improved these things in the future this could easily top Netflix.

title: Disappointed but okay
review: I’m a little disappointed with the app because you can add things to your watchlist but never find your actual watch list, you don’t have a currently watching area to allow easy access to whatever show or movie we last watched making it harder to get to, there’s no way of telling what episode you have or haven’t watched and there’s no progress bar at the bottom of the shows or movies when you find them meaning you have to try and remember which episode you left off on. While these are all things that I really dislike about the app, I do enjoy being able to go back into my childhood and rewatch old shows that haven’t been anywhere for a really long time. I know that the app just launched so a lot of things still need to be worked out, but I’m hoping that these will get fixed soon.

title: Great material but needs some changes
review:
I am truly impressed with how much is offered on the app. It’s great to be reminded of a lot of my childhood favorites. 

One major flaw that is not on here, would be a “continue watching” feature. I’ve been getting pretty frustrated with trying pick back up where I left off on a show or movie and after a few hours, it starting me completely back over to ‘episode 1, season 1’. Also, having to search for what I was just watching or scrolling all the way through. I noticed that if an episode was done and I hit the back button, it sent me back to the home page and would have to start my search process over instead of just taking me to the episodes of what I was just watching. 

Hopefully something that will change soon.

title: Great... but missing some stuff
review:
The amenities that are missing are a “currently watching” section, an option to edit the way closed captions appear (big one). Also when you start a series and stop, the headline doesn’t tell you what episode you left on - in case you’d like to know. Another is being able to skip to the next episode as you’re watching rather than leaving the whole screen. You also can’t ‘subscribe’ to any of the shows you watch that come out weekly. 

I’m excited for all the content I haven’t been able to watch since I was a kid. Seeing all these shows and movies in one place was quite overwhelming.  

I expected to be annoyed at the executive choice of having some of the Disney+ shows come out on a weekly basis but I ended up being unbothered.

title: Great service, great content, but...
review:
I love everything that is available with the service.
It is full nostalgia with classic cartoons from the 90’s that we loved dearly. Along with live action Disney Channel original series/movies.
BUT... the only issue is there is no way to mark things that were already watched. When logging in you are given the same opening window, and have to search for what you want to watch , and then sift through the episodes and hope you remember which ones you’ve already watched. This, I’m sure, is an issue for a lot of people, and tbh easily fixable. I do not doubt that this fix will come with one of the next few updates. 
This would be a 5* app, however the issue mentioned above is what pulls it down to a 4* (technically would give it a 4.5).

title: Great app
review:
I have Disney plus on my tv and on my iPhone and it works great both places. I love Disney and a lot of people like it, and it is taking over the world with how many people watch it. I love how all the movies that Disney ever posted is in there and all the channels they own like National Geographic, marvel, Disney jr, Disney channel. And some more. The reason people where saying there was glitching was because it was one of the first days Disney plus was out and some many people where logging in and on it that it glitched. I love watching movies and having a worm blanket and popcorn it this app is the perfect app to watch your movies and you don’t even have to go to movies anymore. This person who designed this is the best person in the world. LOVE THIS APP 
Get this app it is so good. “

title: Some really frustrating UI design
review:
First want to say that this is a review on the app interface itself and not the service. Love the content I can find on here. 

This app is really frustrating to navigate on Apple TV. When jumping out of an episode, say because you realize it’s not the episode you left off of or want to watch a prior episode....the app will show a screen that doesn’t let me navigate between all the episodes available. I only get an option to “Play” or “play from beginning” and “add to watchlist”. There’s no way to immediately see the episode list and jump between episodes. Really hope this gets worked out. Constantly find myself having to jump out of the app, and jump between episodes in the Apple TV app which lists the episodes and then directly links to the episode I want to view in the app.

title: Great Start, but Netflix
review:
This is an awesome app with incredible potential and awesome content. However, little details like NOT being able to see the time on my phone when I tap the screen while I watch something and knowing that some shows that Disney made are still missing like the Tarzan show makes me have doubts if I want to pursue Disney+ instead of Netflix. Thank you for the tiny Mandalorian show with baby Yoda, and thank you for bringing back Tron Uprising, but you need to expand the Disney Universe if you want to beat Netflix and AT&T’s platform in market share because you made Netflix king. God Bless Disney and hope for the continuation of old shows that ended without a proper conclusion. 

Netflix is about to have Avatar the Last Airbender while Disney gets a Mulan without Mushu or even getting down to business, so prepare yourselves, Nickelodeon and Cartoonetwork might take the fight to Disney and they were great competitors.

title: Almost ready
review:
This app and streaming service has the potential to be great. 
What’s missing:
1. Status indicators: Did you start and episode or movie and finish it? Best remember because Disney isn’t giving you any visual clue as to what episodes you’ve watched. My toddler loves Mickey’s clubhouse, every time I launch it I have to remember which episode she left off on and where in that episode she may have been. I almost always launch an episode that was at the end. Give me some visual clues!
A progress bar on the episode preview is a good start. 

2. Changing the “play episode” button to a “resume episode” button after a show/movie has been launched. Again, visual indication that something has happened here before. 

3. “Recently watched” category: every time I go back to something I’m currently watching I have to either search for it or hope I remembered to put it in my watch list. Simple solution would be to put it in the main screen. 

These are very basic expected behaviors for a streaming service and make for a good user experience. They should’ve been there at launch. Hopefully they’ll arrive soon. You don’t have to reinvent the wheel, especially when your content is guaranteed to be good. Give the users standard functions and they’ll stay happy.

title: Amazing app, a few issues
review: I absolutely love disney, and this app is truly amazing and great but there seem to be a few problems. i have is downloaded on my ipad and i’ve put a bunch of movies and shows into my watch later list... but whenever i go into it it will only show me not even 1/3 of the shows or movies i have saved so i end up having to look them up. Even when i go to my TV i have the same issue. Another issue i’m having is when i try to add certain movies or shows to the watch later list it won’t let me. I’ll get the little check saying it’s saved but then it isn’t showing up in the list...so when i go back to the movie or show, it has the + sign again to add it as if i hadn’t yet. it’s very frustrating but not intolerable. Just wish it would be fixed soon, i love the app and hate the frustration.

title: WONDERFUL WORLD!!  Except...
review:
THE WATCHLIST NEEDS TO BE ON THR HOME SCREEN, WITH A CONTINUE WATCHING FOR...(user name).  I’m an adult with no children, but I’m really excited about traveling back in time to watch my Disney favorites...BUT PLEASE MAKE THIS EASY TO DO!!!  After making this slight improvement, this will easily be 5 stars!!  I just don’t want to hunt down what I was previously watching. 

ALSO, THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT!!  When I go into the episodes of a series I’m watching, just like other sites do, mark off which episodes I’ve watched, and which one I’m currently on.  If I have 4 or 5 series I’m watching, I don’t want to have to try and remember what episode I’m on for each one.  This is an absolute must.  I just watched The Simpsons Season 1 Episode 1 last night, but there’s no recognition that I have watched that episode and that I’m now ready for Season 1 Episode 2.  As they say on Star Trek, “Make it so!”  Please.  0>)

title: Amazing!
review: My family and I are BIG fans of Disney! Disney + allows us all to watch Disney whenever we want, wherever you want! It has so many amazing movies, TV shows, and shorts. It includes Disney, Marvel, Pixar, National Geographic, and Star Wars. It has so many amazing movies and TV shows to chose from, some where you can only watch on Disney +. It even includes Disney Channel original movies and TV shows, however I would like to see more episodes and seasons of them, because some Disney Chanel episodes and seasons are not on the app. Also, I would like to see more TV shows in general, I really enjoyed High School Musical the Series, and Diary of a Future President, so more shows like those would make this app even better! However I still love the app, and it’s an overall great Disney experience!

title: Highly counterintuitive
review: This is easily the worst streaming service I’ve used. Every time I try to watch something that isn’t Disney + original programming it will freeze until I close and reopen the app roughly every 10-20 minutes (not just on my phone, on my TV and laptop too). This has happened every time I’ve used the service without fail since I got it in December. Sometimes my devices will randomly log me out and I have to log back in but other times I’ll have trouble logging out. The user interface is fine, but once you’ve found something to watch, it will inevitably crash after 10 minutes. There isn’t enough good original content to keep me interested and while the backlog stuff is pretty good, I can’t watch it without having some kind of technical glitch. This is definitely just Disney trying to ride the streaming train and they clearly don’t put much effort into it outside of the original content.

title: Worth the money, but a few suggestions...
review: Okay, let me get this straight, I love Disney+. It’s great to be able to download movies & TV shows for on-the-go viewing, a feature I have used plenty. However, it was kind of disappointing to find out that I can’t screenshot the movies. As a photo editor I was really looking forward to conveniently being able to find the right poses, facial expressions, and backgrounds from several of my favorite Star Wars characters, especially those from the Clone Wars. I get that this may be mandatory for a Disney+ exclusive such as the Mandalorian, but for other shows like the Clone Wars, that have been around for a while, it seems more like an inconvenience than anything. This is mostly why I bought the app. Nevertheless, it’s still a good app. Would recommend.

title: Disney+
review: Hello and I love the content and I think it is good. I just think that you should make Disney+ Originals more and I think you should have some more adult-like content and add some stuff that is more for mature kids. It’s a great platform, it’s just focused for kids and I think that you should do other things and add things like comedians and other. It would be cool to make some other thing like cartoons. You need to get things like onward and other things. Everyone is under lockdown and onward was only out for a little amount of time. I have loading issues on my Samsung tv but it might just be the tv cause it’s really buggy and slow. I love everything right know but some stuff should be put on it and more often. DONE.

title: Disney+ is worthless
review: This Disney+ app, just like ESPN, is worthless. I pay for a subscription to Disney+ and was able to watch one episode of a show on my home personal use TV via lightning to HDMI adapter. The next episode I’m presented with an error. Come to find out the Disney family feels it isn’t making enough money so it has become their policy to block the Lightning to HDMI connection. Considering I was purchasing this for the sole purpose to use for my personal family use and the fact that my choice of display size is being refused by the app I’m extremely disappointed and will cancel my subscription and recommend to everyone I know not waste their time or money on this very limited use worthless app. I find it very interesting that other apps I have a paid subscription to allow use of any size monitor I choose for my use via the Lightning to HDMI adapter and this app has prohibited my use of this option. Unbelievable and completely dissatisfied.

title: Good content; buggy, basic app
review: The content makes Disney+ well worth it, but the app leaves a lot to be desired. While it’s possible to make different profiles, and for those profiles to have there own watch lists, it was not intuitive how to set up either, and finding the watch list is hard. There’s also not a watch queue, so if you’re watching different series it’s hard to know where you are in them. I’ve also noticed that the “Continue watching” button rarely works, and just starts the episode/movie over from the beginning. Finally, the currently watching screen only shows series information, not episode, so it’s not possible to know what episode you’re on if you’ve forgotten. All that being said, generally having a good experience.

title: Some suggestions
review:
Was overly excited when I saw the shows and movies you could watch on here although I do have some issues. 
I have the google chrome connected to my TV and I’m able to cast Disney Plus from my phone. My problem is is that it seems to stop playing and buffer every couple of minutes. But on our other TV that I was able to download the app onto, I don’t have that problem, so I know it isn’t a WiFi issue. 
The other thing is when it comes to me casting it from my phone, it only allows two episodes to play before it goes back to the Disney “casting” screen. Which again, isn’t a problem on the other TV which has the app downloaded. I’m not sure if I’m the only one having these issues but overall love the app and the content!

title: The app is not there yet.
review:
Disney+ as a service is awesome. Disney+ app.. 

All the beloved content, nostalgic feels, music sing alongs, beloved characters, hidden gems, it’s all here in one app. New content is on its way, but the content that’s there is so expansive it will hold you over for future project. 

Now the app, super basic, which is cool, makes things simple. However lots of functionality you expect from a stream app is not there. Had to step away, and want to hop back into your movie or show... you can’t. You have to add it to your watch list before hand. Good luck if you’re watching a show. You have to be lucky enough to remember what episode you were on, most times it starts your over from episode 1. Searching through the content, not search when you know what you looking for, but ease of finding things to watch is pretty difficult. There should be more categories, make it easier to find things, not just the “top picks” or “Pixar”. Navigation seems to be a little clunky, fast forwarding feels off.. where I rather just have it play out. 

Disney+ is a must have streaming service, especially if you’re a Disney fan. If you’re a fan of streaming, it’s just not fully there yet.

title: Great content, but lacking functionality
review: I wish I could give a 4.5 because I absolutely love the content and even the way it’s categorized. The throwback section is my favorite! Being able to watch all my favorite childhood shows is everything I thought it would be and more! I love Gargoyles even more as an adult and the new content like Lady and the Tramp, however we could really use a “continue watching” section. I’m not one to pay attention to episode names and if I binge I lose track of the number, so the fact that every time I log in, I have to search for the show again, then scroll through seasons, and again through episodes is annoying. I love the app overall and adding that would be the cherry on top of an already satisfying treat.

title: Disney+ is 👍🏻👍🏻
review:
Disney+ is soooo great def a five star! I do have a suggestion, could y’all add Liv and Maddie, because that’s not on there and Bunk’d isn’t either? I def love disney+! It has a lot of good content. It has something for everybody! Oh, I have one more suggestion, add the second season of Sydney to the Max . If y’all could do that developers would be great!  

UPDATE:
Still loving disney+❤️❤️ and o my word y are people making a big deal out of nothing? Ppl! Seriously, One little bug on the app and you leave a bad review. I mean it if it glitches one time, or sometimes, it’s OK. Just fix what u were doing and move on! And if it keeps happening tell the developers. Email them. Do something about it. Anyway..... I def recommend disney+ to ANYBODY and EVERYBODY.

title: A few problems
review: So great app but sometimes it takes like 5 minutes to load the rest of the episode even if connection is good. Also when it says Something Went Wrong it resets my progress on the episode and then when I fast forward  to where I was it buffers like crazy. You should be able to download shows instead of individually downloading each and every episode . When I search something like Anime or something it shows stuff that have Anime in the title and not actual Anime shows and movies. Whenever the shows are done buffering sometimes the audio quality get worse. Occasionally when the intro for the show comes the skip intro button doesn’t pop up, so then I have to fast forward and like I already said that makes it buffer. Also when I just click nowhere near the back button it exits me out of the show occasionally erasing my progress on the episode. Fix these and I will give 5 stars.

title: App Issues/Casting
review:
Casting on this app is the worst thing ever. Love the service and I left a review before but changed it cause the app has so many issues.
When I use the app. It never ever picks up my show or movie where I last left off. I always have to find my place and it takes forever to load when I move it Back to its last place.
The casting from my phone to my tv is glitchy and it leaves these invisible like squares and rectangles. Then it goes glitchy and green and fuzzy. Then it pauses and it takes forever to load.
I tested this out with my HBO and Netflix app. I wanted to make sure it wasn’t my tv, or internet connection. My tv is less than a year old and my internet connection is fine; and my other streaming apps don’t give me the hassle like this does. The other apps casted clear and perfectly for me.
Very frustrating. I’m starting to wonder if it’s even worth it anymore. Please fix issue and I’d be happy to change my review, thanks.

title: Yall need to fix this
review: Error 83 stuff keeps happening no matter what i do. It was just working fine on my phone, you know im watching my suite life of zack and cody and then my phone dies. No biggie, i plug it in, turn it on going back to my account to play my show. Now all of a sudden it cannot connect to my account. I try my boyfriend’s account. Still the same thing. Its been happening for literally no reason each time i try to log in now it says error 83. Yall need to fix this because at this rate, i wont be paying another month for disney+ if its going to log me out of my account and not be efficient. Literally so annoying. Try to contact disney+ support and the wait time is longer than an hour. Doesnt say how long but they expect you to wait over an hour for something that was literally just working. So annoying!!!!! Fix it!!!!

title: Great movie/show selection! Needs improvement tho.
review:
As a hardcore Disney fan, Disney + has to be one of the greatest things to happen to me! $7 a month??? It’s a steal. However... the app really really really needs to improve on a couple things. 

The biggest one is a “Continue Watching” list. For this reason alone, I think Netflix is better. It’s such a small thing but makes a big difference, like why do I have to search for my favorite show every single time I open the app and then scroll to the season I was in the middle of? 

Secondly, I wish that the online browser of Disney + would stay full screen when transitioning to the next episode of a show. Again, another thing I admire from Netflix. It’s like it’s just tedious to keep double clicking every 20 minutes... Not the most important thing, but makes a difference.

title: Changes to watchlist
review:
I believe a few updates to the watchlist will greatly improve overall functionality.
Please organize watchlist A-Z and/or separate category to Movies, Shorts, and Shows. Please please have an auto play to your next video conveniently without having to go back to your library. Please please have a continue watching section to conveniently pick up where you left off. 
Most platforms are doing this already.
The watchlist as it stands is just a dumping ground, a bottomless pit, that needs options to organize as it can swell into the hundreds. A-Z is preferred at minimum. Again, this will greatly improve overall convenience.
So far it’s been great and has exceeded my expectations. Thanks 🙌🤞🤜🤘🏻👌🏻

title: B loves Disney+ but......
review: Disney + let’s me relive my childhood and teenage years I love it but I do wish it had my airbud movies to. I would like to give the company a little advice although the app does let me watch shows and movies that I still to this day love it wouldn’t hurt to see more content that the age group of 22 and over would find more appropriate for their age like let’s say for instance, the Lizzie McGuire reboot I was so looking forward to seeing on Disney+. I was looking forward to seeing Lizzie as an adult and what was she up to nowadays. I know the company has a reputation but if the company truly wants to survive the streaming industry you have to understand and loosen up a little bit so here’s what I say let the Lizzie McGuire reboot happen.

title: Great app
review: This app is amazing I can watch a ton of shows and movies with my family without having to pay money just to rent the movie but the one thing that kind of bugs me is that some movies are not available until a certain date like my daughter wanted to watch the live action beauty and the beast but we will not be able to watch it until October 1 and that can be frustrating at times. And also the download when I download a movie to watch in the plane or in the car it takes a very long time to load and if I try and download more then 2 movies at once one of the movies would not download. But overall this is a great app and I would recommend it to others

title: It’s great but...
review: I love Disney Plus, and was so excited to hear that it came out. Although there is one pretty big problem, and it mostly only happens when I use my T.V. It always freezes up and skips; when it freezes. (and it happens constantly through out the movies and or t.v. show) Then, My whole Disney Plus will be Frozen. Now I’m not the most patient person, but I have waited way too long sometimes for a movie. I love Disney and would usually will never have a problem with it, but at the end of the day it just doesn’t work and it’s a pain in the buttocks. Other than that I love Disney and don’t have any other problem with the app, for it has tons of great movies and T.V. shows from my childhood that the Disney Channel no longer has, and along with that I can not wait for Frozen 2 to come out onto this platform.

title: Playback bugs and server incapacity
review:
There is LOTS of room for improvement. I downloaded some episodes to avoid server issues. Still encountered playback problems, meaning there are several bugs there. There can be shortcuts added such as navigating to episode list from the downloaded section, instead of researching for the show in a separate menu. Everything is separated when it can and should be interconnected to work intuitively as one has come to expect.
Even with all the issues, the app does perform better than the website, which rarely works when I access. I would prefer a larger computer screen over my mobile device, so that needs a major rehaul. 
I am surprised there hasn't been an incremental patch at this point, as updates are expected at least weekly, especially with a major roll out.
2 stars instead of 1 because of content.

title: Absolutely love it but...
review: I absolutely love this app in just a few days thats been out I've watch over 10 movies and introduced some of my favorite princess movies to my daughter. But i hope that in future updates you guys include the “continue watching” section since i do stop it on and off during the day with both my daughters so i have to go to the search engine to find what the girls or me where watching  to be able to continue. Also it would be helpful if while watching a series the episodes you’ve watched would get marked I’m having to write down what episode/season i stop at so i can search for it to be able to continue. When you guys are able to fix those things im sure to give this a five star rating since i love love love this app.

title: Have you never used a streaming app before?
review:
I’m only giving 1 star because it’s not that difficult to mimic what other people are doing. You aren’t creating anything new an innovating, you’re copying a competitor with your own content. It’s a given that Disney content would be available on a Disney streaming app, so you get no points there. 

The basics of streaming are totally missing. There is no “continue watching”. You can’t pick up where you left off, in a movie or series. No auto play. No seasonal break downs.  It doesn’t show you what you’ve watched and what you haven’t. There isn’t an option to start from the beginning, or resume...just play.  These are very basic things and they’re missing. Also it doesn’t give you the option to choose which profile you’re viewing on, and defaults to the main profile. You have to figure out how to create a profile and then find it. 👎🏼 

You’re Disney....you can do better.

title: Good but Still Waiting For A Lot
review:
Obviously everyone loves Disney... there’s a lot of good content on here but it’s still missing a good amount of old classic shows. They’re pushing Avengers and Star Wars so hard but what about all the shows we used to watch when we came home from school?

Anyways, the app itself needs adjustments. 
• For some reason, captions keep coming on per episode even when I turn off the captions at the beginning of the show. There’s no option for preference in the settings for on or off throughout the whole app. 
• Like other people are saying, there’s nothing that continues what episode we left off on when we restart the app. It goes back to episode 1 of season 1. I feel like this is a general expectation for a streaming app to have. 
• On that note, there should be like a “continue” tab or something on the top of the welcome screen so we can easily access the last episode of whatever show or movie we left off on. 
• There’s definitely a better way to allow access the “watchlist” ... perhaps next to the downloads on the bottom bar would be a good place to put it. 

There’s been a lot of hype for this app and their service. You would think they’d test out all options for the best user experience.

title: Can’t connect
review: I did a pre-sign up for the service on 11-10. I got the prompts to put in my email, create a password and enter my preferred credit card info for future billing. It went all the way through and showed a countdown clock for when the service would be available. 20 minutes ago I went to log in and it said it didn’t recognize my email address. I created the account all over again. 🤨 I entered the same card I entered 2 days before. It said there was an error with my name. Seriously? It was exactly what us on my card. Tried it twice and it wouldn’t accept it. I tried a different card with no issue. Then I downloaded the app for my iPhone. I logged in and now it tells me there is a connection issue and I’ll have to try at a later time. They knew there were going to be millions of new users. I would think they would have been more than ready for this. Now I’m not so sure this is worth the effort. 😡

title: Seriously??!!
review:
I pre-subscribed and everything so I would be ready for the launch day. 
I download the app - all good. I go on the app and first thing it says is “unable to connect - retry”. So I hit retry. I don’t know how many times I pushed that button, but nothing changed. I check my wifi - it’s good. So I’m like okay maybe I just have a weak signal. Then I go to my profile to edit it a little (change my name, profile pic, etc.”)......and it comes up with the same message “unable to connect - retry”! Really??!! I can’t even do that?!
Then by some lucky miracle I actually did get on the main menu (for like 5 min), and every time I went to add something to my watchlist, it wouldn’t add it OR it would say “unable to add”. Seriously??!!
I expected it wouldn’t be perfect in the beginning with everyone trying to use it and all that, but I didn’t think it would be this bad!! It’s ridiculous!! Fix it Disney!

title: Not worth it so far
review: Buggy and crashes constantly... constantly says it can’t connect to the internet, meanwhile Netflix and prime are plugging along fine.  I get apps and new services will have teething issues, but a lot of it is ridiculous.  They had two services to literally study before releasing this.  Sound quality is AWFUL and random.  You’ll watch one episode of something and if you don’t turn the sound all the way up you can’t hear anything.  The next it’ll blow your speakers out.  Video quality seems awful on most things where I’d expect it to be amazing.  I even switched TVs thinking it was just the tv I was watching on, but no... On top of which, honestly there isn’t much content.  Granted it’s a pretty cheap service... so far.  I wonder when the first price hike will be.  It’s a streaming service that really streams pretty poorly, so to me it’s pretty much just a flop.

title: Disney+ is excellent- a few key features need work
review:
I LOVE Disney+. I finally feel like there’s a (relatively) complete streaming catalogue of Disney classics. I’m enjoying the Mandalorian and the Imagineering Story is incredible. I would like to have more original content sooner, but there is plenty to keep me occupied. With a low price and generous access (profiles, downloads, multiple streams, etc.), I think subscribing is a no-brainer. 

There are a few issues with the app that need to be dealt with. The watchlist is hidden in both the iPad and iPhone apps. There seems to be a glitch, where you can’t remove something from the watchlist. Also, it’s not clear when or if you will be resuming or restarting a title. Please fix these technical oversights so I can more fully enjoy my service!

title: Amazing and Worth It
review:
I have been using Disney+ for two months now. Since I’ve started, I have watched many movies and tv shows like That’s So Raven or Jessie or Inside Out and more! These are movies I’ve wished to watch for so long and I finally can ! I am only nine(9) and it has been a dream come true to watch so many movies at home in one day! Thank you so much for this amazing app! The only improvement is that the pause button turns into a loading button all the time for me. It’s a little annoying but I’m ok. I always have to leave the full screen to the side screen to pause the movie/show . Please improve this so people will enjoy this app even more. 

                                            Thank You

title: APP SECURITY EXTREMELY BAD!
review: My account has been breached multiple times within the past few days no matter how many times I’ve changed both the email and password on the account! If you can answer their customer service reps basic questions they will let anyone access your account! They have no extra security features at all! The only method and solution they offer to secure your account is to change your account email and password that’s it! And when you contact them their response to an account breach is to change the accounts email and password and that they will forward the situation to their tech/it department and they thank you for any suggestions you make to them that’s it! Disgraceful they should be ashamed of themselves for rushing to release their app to the public! The only way to stop this and protect your account is to delete your account and open a new account! Ridiculous!

title: People are so critical !!! Disney is amazing!!
review: To everyone with some common sense, listen...!!! Disney just released a HUGE library of content and it seems to have like 95% of their stuff at your fingertips immediately! Now think for a second....what do you think will happen when 10 million or more people sign up for this AMAZING content and try to binge everything imaginable in just 3 short weeks?!!! Of course there will be some bugs and some crashes and some buffering!!! They will work it out!! Just be thankful we have all of this great content available at an amazing price !! I’m a happy customer for sure and love every part of it !!!  Now sign up already and watch some Star Wars and Avengers now !

title: Needs minor fixes but I’m happy with the app!
review: I’m glad this app is out and has so much great, new AND old content! My main issue with it is, and I kind of would’ve thought this would’ve been a thing before launching the app. It’s probably being worked on currently but there needs to be a “continue watching” shelf on the main screen. And when I leave an episode and come back later it don’t remember which episode I’m on and there’s no markers or indication on the episode to show that was the one I had been watching. So it’s kind of a guessing game. I’m glad it still saves where I last was when I do click on the right episode. If it didn’t do that, I’d be more annoyed. I’m sure those are things that will be fixed soon though! Overall GREAT APP!

title: Great Content but A couple MAJOR flaws
review: I was very excited when Disney announced this service and the content provided has lived up to the hype. However the app and interface needs work. With the multitude of streaming apps before Disney plus, there is no reason why Disney Plus released this app without a currently watching list or category. There is no easy way to go back to what you’ve been watching. You have to go back and search it all over again. And then to add insult to injury. You can’t even hit play on the show you’ve been watching and it play from your last watched episode. You have to go to whatever episode and it will still play from the very beginning. It’s very annoying and kind of shocking because it looks like Disney didn’t do their homework. Fix it, sooner rather than later.

title: Has major flaws
review:
It’s great to have all my favorites ready to watch but it has some major flaws. 
1. There is no “Continue Watching” or anything of the sort so you have to search what you were watching and press play. It also doesn’t say “resume”.
2. The episodes on shows don’t restart from the beginning. Very frustrating to drag the dot on an iPad. It takes me like 5 tries to restart an episode because it skips to the next immediately.
3. There is no way to tell which episode you are on when watching a show. It’s a problem if you fall asleep and don’t know where you left off.
4. Not all available titles are listed. Some movies I wanted to watch had to be searched so you can be missing out on some of your favorites. On Netflix you can scroll through every title available to view.

title: Customer Service is Horrendous
review:
The services and content itself is great, sure. But, I needed to do something as simple as change an account email across my Disney bundle, something that should’ve been handled in a 5 minute call, and couldn’t be. I called 3 separate times and was on hold for longer that 30 minutes before I hung up, tried online chat twice with no avail. Finally canceled my bundle out of frustration, and now Disney+ is saying it’s going to cut off my viewing at the end of October when I paid for a whole year a few months ago. 

It’s just highly disappointing coming from Disney. And even if they reached out to help remedy my problem as seen on my cancelation page, they will be reaching out to a void email (the problem I was trying to fix in the first place.) get your stuff together Disney, it’s not all about churning people through for profit, there has to be a balance and service attached.

title: Great app but with a big bug
review: Won’t let me watch any show or movie. I tried updating it but it doesn’t work. I don’t see the point of an app that lets you watch movies and shows but doesn’t let you watch anything. Whenever i want to watch something it says “Oops something went wrong with watching”. Ive have open and closed this app many times and it still doesn’t work. This app was working just fine until today and it really frustrates me. If this keeps happening i plan on deleting the app. If you can tell me what’s wrong and how to fix it, it will do me a great favor. Other than that I don’t see myself watching Disney+ until its fixed. It was a great app in general and I love how you keep adding more movies. Ive got to experience movies i missed in theaters because of this app. Again i really do love this app and i hope you can fix it so i can use it more.

title: Pretty good
review: I’ve been using Disney+ on my iPad since December and, overall this app is absolutely great. It has all the movies/shows for me to watch everyday. There is no bugs to me for to complain about its a BIG step up from Disney now. Plus Disney+ has all the classics like Aladdin, Cinderella, and much much more. So that’s why I give this app a 5 star rating. Disney+ has ALL of it. It’s got Star Wars, avengers, and marvel. And ya, but that’s only small parts about why I like Disney plus. Disney+ has an adult profile, and a kids profile. The only difference between them is that the kids profile has PG movies/TV-PG and G movies/TV-G and adult profiles have all the way up to PG-13.(or if Disney owns R movies (which I doubt) that’s basically it for this review.

title: I need an answer
review: I used the free trial already and so my brother had gotten the subscription for a month so he put me on his account and while I was eating breakfast I had to update my card info I didn’t really think much about it until I went into my bank account and saw that Disney plus charged me for using buy brothers account that had a whole 3 weeks left of a subscription so at this point I am already ticked off because they charged me while using my brothers account which had a paid subscription and now I want my money back because I have used this app in like a week so I’m hoping that we can work something out and hopefully get my money back and you guys can take the subscription off of my account so I can go back to my brothers also I didn’t use the app for a while so when I went back to see my account I noticed that I wasn’t in my brothers account which made me very furious. Thank you for your time.

title: Great app, needs some changes
review: I recently got the app on my phone and the selection of movies and shows is definitely enough for one person, especially if you are a fan of Disney movies, however the app has some bugs and glitches which need to be fixed. Occasionally while watching, the show or movie will stop playing and send you back into the home page, and at one point, it deleted my continue watching folder, which was rather frustrating. So far it has only happened once, and I have faith it won’t happen again. These are minor and easy bugs to fix, and are tiny inconveniences. I would without a doubt recommend the app and Disney plus to anyone who felt interested in the content on the platform.

title: Gripe
review: It’s so cool but it’s missing some stuff. I love all the content and don’t mind waiting for some things like infinity war. But as far as I can tell there’s no play back feature. So I normally have to find where I was in the movie if my app closes. Also sometimes the video closes and goes to the main menu at random then I have to find my place again.
