Also the audio on the movies like captain marvel goes in and out and sounds like it is under water sometimes. I thought it was my headphones but it did this on all my devices at the exact same time. Tv, computer, and phone. Finally it would be nice to have a continue watching section like what Netflix has. So you can see where you are on everything you’re watching. Honestly though I feel like these will all be fixed soon, it’s just frustrating to pay $70 for something that doesn’t work right.

title: It has everything.
review:
Seriously. There isn’t a show or movie we have thought to look for that isn’t here. And that’s not even talking about the 70+ things that we had forgotten all about until we saw it again in the menu! Shows from our childhood are all here, ready for us to share them with our kids!

Anyone complaining about the slowdowns or crash issues, remember that it’s a brand new service, and millions of people are hitting it all at once. Disney will take care of it. They don’t know how to have a bad customer experience. I am sure they are even more upset that there are crashes than the people experiencing the crashes are. Disney doesn’t do bad customer service!

title: It’s very frustrating
review: Overall the app is decent but not when it won’t load. I have been using the app for a while now probably 5 months and i use chrome cast to cast to other TVs and it buffers all the time and it’s not my internet connection. Even downloading the movie/ series it still buffers every 3s and no longer allows you to watch anything and when you leave the app or turn off your device u were using it causes a major restart of the app and no longer gives the controls for the TV like volume and options to disconnect or pause. it gets very frustrating to the point of me having to just unplug things to actually get it to disconnect because the controls no longer allow proper disconnect options due to the app restarting and requiring you to refresh from the home screen of your device multiple times.

title: Love it....but it has some problems
review: I love this app and it is great on my tv!!!! I love that I have access to all the movies I grew up with and love and can not share with my children! I don’t love how it performs on an iPad. My child has a lot of problems navigating it. It tends to push her out and completely reload, not saving the spot where she was on the movie. I would love a section of movies currently watching or a watchlist slide under each persons page. I love the child guide however, Moana isn’t on it??? That makes no sense to me?!?!? The app ( on iPad) moves all over the screen and I don’t know- just seems flaky! I feel like it could be A LOT  better and more like what is available on other streaming apps. I have most of them and Disney has a lot of learning in that area.

title: Buy this
review: First off if you don’t have this app than I don’t know how your living. This app has all the Disney shows, movies, and shorts! I love it. And on the plus side you can download stuff! Like imagine your on a plane 18 hour flight, have nothing to watch, no internet! Oh wait I downloaded my favorite Disney movie of all time on Disney plus! Problem solved. My whole entire family loves this app (Including my teenage siblings and parents). This is like Netflix but ALL Disney. So if you travel a lot (like on ✈️planes) and you love Disney, then this is the app for you. I especially love the downloading part because I travel a long distance every year so it’s great for me, and maybe for you! So my result:BUY THIS APP NO QUESTIONS ASKED!😁

title: great !
review: disney is my life and childhood ! watching all these princess movies and tv shows brings me back to when i was a little kid in front of the television.  this nostalgic feeling is all ive been getting, with the decade ending and all.  watching these tv shows from the early 2000s and 2010s, helps me not to forget the memories ive made in the past.  for example, jessie, girl meets world, boy meets world, good luck charlie, pocahontas, and more ! i recently purchased a projector to watch christmas movies on with my family, and watching disney princess movies was a great way to create new bonds.  we were able to just sit there eating snacks for hours, laughing and crying.  my mom and i recently rewatched moana from disney+, and all the memories began flooding in while i devoured oranges and popcorn.  i remembered how my mom cared about me so much that she would take me to the movies whenever a new cartoon film came out, and how we would sit together eating popcorn and nachos at the theatre.  disney+ helped me to not take those moments for granted.  disney+ does have tiny bugs to fix here and there, but overall, i highly recommend for its price.  thank you :))

title: Good but not great
review: The content itself is awesome and only going to get better as the other things Disney owns but are on other platforms(like some of the newer Star Wars movies on Netflix) will soon have the contract over and Disney can bring them back to their streaming service. My main problem is the app. There are some minor bugs and the main problem is your watchlist. Like most streaming services, there is a list for you to add everything you want to watch too easily access it, but this one has an issue. No matter what platform you are on(IOS, Windows, and Xbox are what I’ve used), you cannot remove something from your watchlist. This makes your list cluttered with things you’ve finished, and is a nightmare for people with OCD like me.

title: Great app!
review:
It’s has everything you can want from Disney. If it doesn’t have it currently it’s nice that when you search the movie or tv show it tells you the date that it will be on the app. 

Only issue I hope they fix in a future update is the rewind function. 
There’s no option for a “start for the beginning” so you have to hold the button down to rewind it. It sounded ridiculous to complain about it. But let’s be honest we’re us to this function by now. 
But it’s mostly bothersome with the TV shows. It has auto play so when the ep is over and credit role. It changes it mid way through to the next episode. Which is amazing! Just when you go back to play the same ep it picks up in the credits. Sometimes it goes to fast that you can’t catch it soon enough to rewind it the ep (if you’re on an ipad) and then if you watch the ep that plays after before it’s just more credits, Kinda a loop of credits. 

It’s amazing app over all despite this minor issue I hope they will fix in an update! The app is still new so don’t blame them for still needing some work. It is however still worth the money. It’s my new favorite go to app for streaming tv.

title: Disney!!!!
review:
I'm super excited for the Disney plus and of course everyone is sleeping in. So I thought I would make the profiles but the app is having issues with that. I tried making one profile and I don't think it registered I made it and I can't make anymore it says it can't connect or something. So I can't wait to watch all the movies but I'd like to make profiles especially for my kids.

Edit: I want to add, some movies didn't play at first but I found one that would so after watching a movie I'm feeling like more and more movies will play ok and and now more parts of the app are working but there are still some issues with it. So if anyone's having issues, just keep trying. I think there's just a lot of people excited for it on launch day lol.

title: Disney+ is a plus!
review: I am pleasantly surprised with the release of Disney streaming service. It’s a great app. Runs smooth, the content being streamed is very high quality. That’s usually a pet peeve of mine, a choppy app. C’mon it’s Disney, they can hire the best app developers in the world. I usually have trouble streaming other apps using my data on my phone. But Disney+ works great. The best part is if you have a 4K tv, you don’t need to pay a extra price to stream ultra HD content. It’s all inclusive. The ONLY problem I have. And I cannot believe they didn’t think about it, is I am unable to continue watching my shows and movies. Once I exit, and play it again. It starts all over. Then I have to fast forward where I left off.

title: Confused
review: I’m confused as to why it’s allowing people to make multiple accounts with the same email address. Makes no sense to be able to make an account for the basic plan and then make another one for the bundle with the same email. I figured it would automatically change my choice when I clicked to sign up for the bundle not make a whole other account with the same email. Now the app won’t update from the basic subscription to the bundle subscription but when I go to the website to sign in, it has me for the bundle subscription but is saying I have two accounts. The wait time to solve this issue over the phone is ridiculous!! No help what so ever.

title: Wishing for more options
review:
I’m giving a pretty modest review for multiple reasons but I have 2 main issues. The fist being that there are so many things saying “coming on this date” and there is a lacking of shows and movies that Disney owns because it is considered “to adult” but they can have The Simpsons? I believe there should be an option to have the full spectrum of Disney owned movies. The second thing I dislike is when fast forwarding or rewinding it glitches a lot.

-Revise additional issue-

Some of the shows such as “Andi Mack” are missing episodes so you can’t watch it unless you’ve seen the first few episodes already. Just very confusing why it is that way. Other things such as movies say “coming soon” and will say when it’ll be added but it’s just an inconvenience to have to wait so long.

title: Disney content 5*s, the app not so much
review:
Don’t sleep on the app for sure, because all the Disney stuff you’ve ever wanted to watch is on this thing. The content is well worth the inexpensive subscription cost.

The app itself still needs some work, although as of version 1.4.4, it has fixed lots of issues, like keeping track of where exactly a video was left when paused and device closed and reopen the app.

It needs a watch history for the account and better parental controls for curating and filtering things. Very Netflix-like, and I have the same gripes with Netflix’s “helpful” content organization. Still, the major hitters like Marvel and Star Wars and Pixar are easy to get to, since they’re permanently on the top of the start-up UI.

title: Couple new suggestions to mickey mouse shorts
review:
First of all. I like watching every movie made by disney for all an incredible low payment in total hd quality and almost no buffering. Secondly, I love the mickey mouse shorts. No episodes are bad and everything is good, but I found a flaw. While every short is on that series, I still couldn't find the christmas special, and the halloween special of mickey mouse shorts, even the outside of M.M. shorts and I still can't find it. Maybe later, could you add these missing episodes to mickey mouse shorts? I loved the halloween episode. Anyway, like your app

Update: Problem with screen while watching a movie. The screen zooms for no reason, blocking sides on the screen, and I don't want that. Please fix this. I already responded to you about this, so this is a second time. Thank you

title: A couple of glitches.
review:
First let me say . . . I love the content!

I’ve had a couple of problems since it began.

1. I first noticed with the Mandalorian – the shows would start, kick out and restart two and sometimes three times before playing through. 

2. I watch Lab Rats and am into the second season. When I finish watching an episode, I’ll let the next episode just begin and back out from there to the main Disney+ menu then ultimately to my Apple TV menu. When I return to begin watching a Lab Rats episode where I left off I am almost always taken back to the beginning of Season 1 – Episode 19. Weird. 

3. I’ve also noticed that when watching Lab Rats and hitting the menu button on my Apple TV I’m taken out to the Disney+ menu and not to the Lab Rats episode menu. I’m not certain if that’s right or not, but it seems as though I should be taken to the episode menu. This is a particular nuisance when I want to resume watching the episode of Lab Rats I where I left of and have to fast forward through Season 1 –Episode 19 to get to the episode menu. 

Many thanks for your time and consideration.

title: Great, but not the best.
review:
The movie/tv content is fantastic. However someone hacked my account and there’s stuff i never watched and no one else but my wife uses it and she uses her profile and she said there’s shows she never watched showing up. 
There’s no way to force logout, also there’s some tv shows I tried to watch but did not like and it stays on continue watching and I can’t remove it. There should be a option to remove things from watch history or remove shows you don’t want to keep watching or a option to remove from continue watching. 
Sometimes when you click add to watchlist it will show a check mark and then when you want to remove it from watch list the check mark is gone and reclicking and unclicking it does not remove films from watch list. 

Other than that once all this is worked out it’ll be a great contender.

title: Great idea, mediocre execution
review:
It has a lot of content, but it’s really not ready for release yet due to all its problems. 

1- Missing Features: their UI is clunky and requires too many clicks to get to things. Also if I want to see details on a movie or add it to my Watchlist I have to click on it, opening a new page. Going back reloads the previous page, losing my place. This makes it difficult to browse through content. Not a big deal, just an annoying QoL thing. 

2- Buffering Issues: I recently watched Guardians of the Galaxy, which has a runtime of 2 hours. However, it took 2 hours and 30 minutes to watch because it kept pausing to buffer so often. That’s just sloppy. And every movie I’ve watched so far has had this problem where it needs to buffer forever. I’ve never had this problem with any other streaming service like Netflix or Prime Video. 

3- Sound Too Quiet: in quiet scenes, I can’t hear anything, even with my volume turned up all the way. I’ll turn my headphones to full blast and still can’t hear what’s going on. This is not a problem for me with other streaming services. 

Basically, this app has a lot of promise, and all the Disney content is amazing! But they need to fix a lot of things in order to make their service worth it.

title: Absolutely love! But needs a bit
review:
This app is amazing. Disney + is something I have been watching non-stop. Everything is neatly organized, it plays well, and the movies and shows are great!

However, there are a few things that need to be edited. First, the very common issue, the currently watching section. This is needed, because sometimes it is a bit of extra work to search for the movie or show you are watching.

Second, Disney + needs to add the recent live action movies. Such as The Jungle Book, Beauty and the Beast, Aladdin, and The Lion King. Toy Story 4 and Descendants 3 are also missing. I don’t understand why they are not there, because the live action Lady and the Tramp is, but whatever. These are some of my favorite movies and it would be so much better if they were on the app.

Third, there needs to be some way to tell how far along you are into a show or movie. It is a bit frustrating not knowing how far you are into the movie. There needs to be some way to tell.

Fourth, there is no fourth! This is a very great app, so much work was put in to it. I plan to keep using Disney + in the future!

title: Look out Netflix! Disney has done it again!
review: I just got done watching Episode 1 of The Mandalorian and I just had to write a review for Disney+. I was a little worried that there would be huge issues with downloading Disney+, logging in, and streaming video on release. The types of issues that usually happen when a service has a huge demand. I was surprised that there were no such issues. I breezed through every step as if I was using a time tested service. Even while watching The Mandalorian, I didn’t have any buffering or video quality issues. It streamed flawlessly! I can not wait for Episode 2! I am looking forward to seeing what Disney has waiting up their sleeves in the future!

title: Still lagging
review: I don’t know how many updates it’s going to take for this lagging to be fixed but I’m literally just wasting my money monthly on this app and I don’t even watch it because it continues to lag. Updates have been made but none of them has fixed problem like what are those updates even for ? The app works on a cellular device but on a Tv it’ll play what I want to watch and then freezes a scene randomly but the audio still plays. I’ve looked up videos on how to fix the issue and people have been having the same problem I have and the videos I watched were 5-7 months ago and still the problem consists so I restate my question what are those updates even for ? My WiFi is definitely not the problem either unless you must have to have some type of Verizon 5Ghz WiFi just to stream princess and the frog.

title: Still love it, but needs some help!
review: I have been watching Star Wars on it and would have to step away for some time to where it turns off, so when I come back I can see under ‘Continue Watching’ the movie I had been watching so I click on it thinking it will take me to the part I left off, but it doesn’t, it starts allll over! And it’s kind of a bit annoying. Considering when I do fast forward through it all to find the space I left off I can’t tell where I’m fast forwarding to, due to there being no pictures displaying the parts I’m fast forwarding through. So, please please please fix this for me and many others! It seems to be working with the TV shows but hasn’t been established with the movies. Thanks so much!

title: The best app
review: Omg Disney+ is the best It has everything Disney I love it so much ever since the day I got it it has all of my favorite TV shows and movies and I can’t even find them on Disney+ now so Disney+ is seriously the best and after you have you have to buy this it’s so good it has all the Disney movies it has all the Disney TV show it’s so so amazing especially love the Jeff Goldblum show it’s so fun I only wish that they would be a new episode of Pixar in real life every week just like all the other shows but this app is still the best only thing I play oh me I only have five apps on my iPad it because Disney+ it’s just like everything I need so you have to you have to get this app because it is the best.

title: Great service, but app could use some improvements
review: I love this service/app overall . The selection of movies and shows is incredible, I was wondering if they plan on adding “ The Three Lives Of Thomasina” in the future? Also they need to add the option to resume or watch from the beginning . I don’t like having to rewind to go back to the beginning. I know if you watch through the entire thing including credits that it will restart but even Netflix has that option to restart the show or movie.  Also a section to show what you have already started watching would be nice. It’s also hard to tell what you have already added to your watch list without going to your watch list. Other than that I love this app.

title: Please do us all a favor and add these shows NOW!!!
review: Hear me out, Disney+ is the best! It’s great and has such great quality and volume. The one thing that disturbed me quite a bit was the fact that you guys do not have the ICONIC show(s) Austin and Ally, Dog With a Blog, and A.N.T. Farm. To be honest with you, the main reason why I got Disney+ was for those three shows and many more of course but my main priority was to rewatch Austin and Ally and it really disappointed me how you did not add that show in when I’m pretty sure everyone else who got Disney+ was expected to have that show on here. So if you could do us all a favor and please add Austin and Ally, Dog With a Blog, and A.N.T. Farm on Disney+ please, just to satisfy us. It’s the LEAST you can do!

title: Needs some improvement
review: First off, this app is amazing and the tv shows and movies on here are incredible. However, I don’t know if there is just something wrong with my device but whenever I download a movie or episode and am in a location where there Is no service and I try to watch what I downloaded it pauses as if what I am watching wasn’t downloaded. Also, there should be an option where you manage the devices on the account because people have access to my password who I regret giving too which is a mistake on my behalf but there should be an option where you could control the devices signed in to the account. Thank you so much! And I hope you take this into consideration with the new update.

title: MAGICAL! but one glitch
review: Overall, this App is By far the BEST Disney Movie/show HUB I have ever seen, This is MUCH better than DisneyNOW.  There is one Slight Mishap however, This Glitch only Appears on an Apple IPad (as far as I know) This glitch happens when you Use the “Picture in Picture” Feature when you Feel like texting your Friend while your Show is Still Going. Well when I use the feature, It works, but, When You go back in the App, it only Takes it to realize after 5 seconds to realize “hey! I should go back to the Home Menu!” It Just Crashes into the Home Menu. Yeah, this Glitch is Really A Pain but, Again, it’s a Really Good App I definitely Recommend Downloading this!

title: Kids Profile
review: I pay for this subscription specifically for my daughter. I love the format of the kid profile but there are a NUMBER of movies that she loves that do not show up on her profile. Most specifically, Moana. Why in the world would that movie not be included on the kid’s profile? I have also found it difficult to search for certain things. For example, there are six tinker bell movies on the service, but no easy way to search for all of them. Searching tinker bell doesn’t bring them all up. There should be a collection like there is for frozen. This makes searching soooo much easier. Adding more of those collections would really improve the experience. Overall this service is great, but was of use for children should be a driver for the experience on a Disney service.

title: Selection is great, app compatibility is not
review: Love the selection of movies and shows but the app compatibility is horrible. Disney has chosen to not support older iOS versions before version 11 which is a very bad decision for family friendly apps due to older devices being reused as child devices once they are swapped out for newer devices. Due to the the timing of Apple stopping support for iOS updates this will cause devices to not be compatible with the service, resulting in a real cost that is much much higher than the competition streaming services. Personally, we have two iPads that cannot be updated past iOS 10, all other competitor video streaming apps work with the exception of Disney+ that was supposed to be “family friendly” but this policy seems to be exactly the opposite causing the need for additional expense and increased waste since a new device would be needed and the old would be thrown out.

title: Needs more shows / movies
review: Okay so I’ve been on Disney plus from time to time but can’t use it much because of my schedule. Whenever I go on it I don’t find some shows / movies I look for. Like Toy Story 4 and I was going to watch Gravity Falls but there is only one season. There is a limited amount of movies and it is missing the new ones such as The Lion King real life. I think that the Disney movies that are in theatre should be on Disney plus a month after they come out in theatres. Like Frozen 2 I had to go to the movie theater to watch it. I don’t mod going to the movie theater but I wouldn’t want to go to the movie theatre every time I want to watch Frozen 2. I paid for a year of Disney plus and because I’m paying I goalie have more options in the app.

title: So many movies!!!!
review:
I love that Disney has set it up to have different categories. And I love that all my favorite movies are at super accessible now!!! There’s so many great movies on here and I’m excited to be able to watch them. 

For some critiques I just want to say a few things. I would love if it come up with a category to finishing watching a movie you started instead of having to go find the movie/show and start it from there. I also think that they should try to make it to where you can watch something on one devise and finish it on another so that way u don’t have to fast forward through the movie/show you already watched. 

Other than those some things I love the set up and can’t wait to have a binge night or week lol 😂

title: A couple of requests
review:
Already love the service, and I’m sure the bugs will work themselves out so I’m not too concerned. I do have a couple of requests for future versions of the app. I would like for there to a “continue watching” section so that it is easier to find and pick back up the shows I had to stop for whatever reason. The other request is to have a watch history log of some kind for at least profiles marked as kids profiles. I know it’s a family service, but there are still some things even on the kids profile that I would prefer my kids not watch yet until they get a little older and I haven’t seen a way to keep tabs on that. Thanks.

Edit: for some reason closed caption being on is a default setting and I would prefer the default to be off.

title: Long Live Disney  💕 💜 ✨
review: I got the app expecting a fairly large selection of movies. So I wasn’t surprised to see the large selection of movies when I first opened the app, however I recall the moment, (as insignificant as it may seem), when I saw the tv series “The Little Mermaid Series”. I just started crying because I absolutely loved that show when I was younger and it brought me back to a simpler time in my life. After further inspection of the app, I came across many other shows including Ducktakes (1987), Hercules the series, Soy Luna, phineas and Ferb, Gravity falls, The clone wars, and so much more! Thank you Disney! Sincerely for making such wholesome and wonderful content for all to enjoy 😊. May Disney live on for centuries to come!!

title: andi mack
review: Disney+ is great app i’ve been watching movies all through quarantine. I also like that they have some disney channel shows. i don’t have cable at home so disney now doesn’t work for me. but i wish it had newer shows that they have on disney channel like the owl house i’ve been trying to find something to watch that on. The shows that are on disney+ some of them don’t have all their episodes. for example i was about to start andi mack yesterday but when i go and click it it only has episodes 11 and 12 instead of starting with 1,2,3,4,etc. it was the same with all the other seasons too. i’ve coming back to see if the app has updated but when i does it doesn’t fix the bug. thank you

title: Bug Fixes and Features Needed
review: Sometimes when we play a movie, the app will change the Audio from English to Dansk. It will also randomly turn the subtitles on. Super annoying. Also... if we don’t finish a movie one day and two days later decide to watch it from the beginning, we have to drag the placement button all the way to the beginning or end to restart it. There definitely needs to be a ‘play from beginning’ or ‘restart’ feature/button added. Also- volume needs to be adjusted for all movies and shows. Some are super loud and others are super low volume. Some also change throughout the viewing. Otherwise- we LOVE Disney+ and can’t wait for other movies/shows to be added.

title: Poor customer service
review: Seen I was being charged twice for a months subscription so I asked to have it refunded. I was told by the customer rep that I should just cancel the subscription I just paid for to avoid the charge that was going to hit my account the next day. So I listened even after telling her that was not going to work and I was right. I was charged 15$ so I went back and asked for a refund just for the extra charge. 7.95 was supposed to be in my account 3-5 days after and I never received it. So I repeated and asked again for the 7.95 back but got the same response and no money. Now I’m upset and ask for the whole 15$ and it’s been two months since I was supposed to receive that refund. 3 talks with 3 differ customer reps and no money. I didn’t even watch anything on the account since I had to cancel the subscription! Customer service is a joke and I will NEVER use Disney+ again.

title: Great Content - But Not Everything
review: It is a really great service and functionality. Lots of wonderful titles. However, I nearly laughed when I clicked on one of the titles to watch it (Mary Poppins Returns) and it says “Coming to Disney Plus January (Date) 2021”. Lots of things are on there like this so can be frustrating when you go to a title and it says when it is coming to the service months or years from now. Lastly, it’s annoying when you don’t know if you’ve watched an episode or title. It doesn’t mark it or tell you if you’ve watched it - hence when I was watching “Recess” I forgot where I left off. Overall - great first initial launch but again, hilarious the titles on here that you can’t even watch for months or years from now.

title: Great, I love it 😍, But one question...
review: Ok, to start I am ten years old and I love Disney plus. My mom got Disney plus almost about 4 weeks ago for us to watch things like the nature shows on it. But I found that it has a couple of other cool shows on it too. Though, I go to my friend’s house sometimes (who also has Disney plus) and she shows me cool movies/shows on it and when I go home to try and find them on my Disney plus, they don’t show up at all! ☹️ For example, a couple of days ago she told me that A WRINKLE IN TIME was on Disney plus and I know it is because I saw it on her’s. But I tried everything to find it and couldn’t. When I searched it on Disney plus it said “no results found.” I would really like if you could fix this. But overall I Love, Love, Love 💗 Disney plus. Thanks so much for reading.

title: Amazing.... but login is faulty
review: The app is amazing.... I’ve been binge watching old shows from the 90’s and movies from old times like Snow White or Pinocchio.... it’s amazing getting to see my childhood shows and movies and now I get to watch newer movies or live shows from old cartoons lol.... the 1 issue I’m dealing with is the login, every time I login the server tells me it’s having issue trying to connect to my account so Id have to delete and reinstall the app for it to work until I exit out and later on it notifies me it can’t connect to my account, so it’s like a repeat after repeat process... it only happens on my phone but not on my consoles, other than that this app is amazing😁😁😁

title: Disney+ Do better
review:
Yall need to GET IT TOGETHER. 
After Adding the shows/movies I like to my watchlist, I only displays about 10 of them and then lists them over again. So my watchlist only has what it wants basically, Being that only a few things that I added to the watch list are listed.... and yall also need to add the Shows/movies that are missing. What the hell ?!?!?!? You dont make any sense, How do you guys have something called “Out The Vault” but leave the Vault filled with the shows/movies we Want to watch.... it doesn’t make sense. Shows like Jake the American Dragon/ or Legends of Tarzan / or my Favorite but I just cant seem to find it anywhere, Is a Lion King Tv Show but it is not named Timone and Pumba or that horrible show called the Lion Guard it was another Lion King Show that was just a regular show having all the characters in it. BRING THEM BACK PLEASE, ALONG WITH EVERYTHING ELSE YALL DID NOT BRING BACK EITHER. Like WHYYYY not make EVERYTHING available. I. Dont. Get It.

title: Great content but not a great app
review: Love the selection for the most part, though the catalogue of "Wonderful World of Disney" movies is notably missing, which I found pretty disappointing. The app often doesn't save your spot if you navigate away from your program for any reason; it will start over from the beginning so you have to find your place again. It also doesn't have a record of anything you recently watched or an "up next" if you're watching a series. The other annoying thing is it's not available on the older versions of Apple TV, so if you're like me and still using your original, you have to airplay all the content from another device. Overall I give the content selection 4 stars and the usability 2 stars. I suppose the price makes up for it somewhat.

title: Disney in English and Spanish
review: When I downloaded the app and saw many of the Disney classics from my childhood I was beyond happy. However, I was super excited to see that when I added the Disney app on my Spanish speaking parents TV all the shows were in Spanish. That is beyond a pleasant surprise!! It’s great that my whole family can enjoy the Disney movies and shows in both languages... tear, tear. I purchased Disney movies digitally in the past from other streaming providers and they are only in English so to have both languages is amazing!! I’m sure since Disney is global they might offer other languages as well just haven’t checked since I don’t speak any other. Enjoy watching! Disfruten las peliculas!

title: One problem
review: I would recommend this app, and I have to many people. But there is one request I have just for the convenience of me and the other subscribers of Disney+. So basically, if/when I tap continue watching, on another service, it would take me to a separate screen. Say I have Mickey Mouse on my continue watching, and there are lots of episodes to it. If I want to select another episode I have to search up Mickey Mouse then tap on episodes and more. If you were taken to this screen where you could choose episodes, (Netflix does this) it would be great. But overall, quality content and much better UI (user interface) than others.

title: Almost perfection...just missing 1 thing
review: I love this streaming service. Me being a 90’s baby, I already started watching all the classic Disney Channel Original series/movies. HOWEVER, please add a “Continue Watching” queue!! It’s needed!! It would make this service perfect. I find it necessary in all streaming services. I hate having to search and hunt for the episode I left off on. It’s troublesome to have to remember which episodes and movies I started. This would be a super helpful addition. I’m actually quite surprised Disney would forget(or more-so, choose to forgo) this feature in their app, especially having had some of the biggest/smartest moves and business deals in the industry.

title: Nice, but needs additional features
review:
I’m enjoying some of the movies and tv shows that became available with the subscription for this app. 
I took a few stars off due to the missing features I would expect from a streaming app. 
There isn’t a “currently playing” list, allowing me to quickly return to shows I was watching. That means I am forced to search by title more frequently than I’d like. 
There isn’t any indication that I’ve already begun watching a show. If someone else watched 30 minutes of a movie, and I begin watching it, it starts at the 30 minute mark. I’d like the option to resume watching or start at the beginning. 
Because Disney has a _lot_ of animation, I’d really like an option to choose between animation or live action. Even if it were a toggle, it’d help significantly.

title: Video keeps zooming in on iPhone 7
review:
A few days ago the Disney + app started blowing up the image of a movie from its normal widescreen aspect ratio till where it fills up the screen and I can barely see the subtitles.  I found tapping the screen with three fingers gets the image to go back to its normal size, but if I close that movie and come back to continue watching, the movie is zoomed in again and I again have to tap the screen with three fingers to get it to zoom back to normal. 

At first I thought that my phone’s zoom setting was on in the accessibility settings, but it was not turned on. Plus no other video app on my phone is doing this.   This is only happening in the Disney plus app. I verified that my wife’s iPhone 7 is also zooming in the image as well. 

Very annoying

title: Can’t play downloaded video via hdmi
review: Good content but my biggest gripe is the inability to use an HDMI cable to connect to a larger TV and play already downloaded content. When I go on trips, I like to download videos to my iPad ahead of time and bring an HDMI cable to connect to the hotel TV (bigger screen for the family to watch a movie). However, I’ve discovered the downloaded content has a digital content protection program that won’t allow downloaded content to be streamed to a TV via an Apple lightning to HDMI adapter. Yes I could use the hotel WiFi, but it’s really not that fast and slow internet affects the quality of the movie, hence why I download it ahead of time. So until these restrictions are lifted from content that’s already downloaded to the iPad, I can’t give this app 5 stars.

title: Had it for months, rarely able to use it
review: The content is amazing but I can RARELY get the app to work. (I’ve successfully used it maybe 4 times since its release.) I don’t have WiFi, only unlimited cell data, and it constantly tells me that there’s no internet... even though my other streaming services work just fine. I tried downloading the shows when there’s wifi available to watch later, and it still doesn’t work. Tried logging out and logging back in. Tried deleting and reinstalling. Nothing. So I basically have to go to someone’s else’s house or loiter on public WiFi just to use something that costs $6.99 per month. Thankfully, Verizon is paying for my subscription for the year... and after months and months of a broken app and terrible service with no fixes, I won’t be renewing it on my own dime.

title: Disney Plus Bundle Rip Off
review: So I went to get the bundle for ESPN+ and put in my information. Well since the Disney+ account is under my wife’s email and not my email I don’t qualify for the discount and have to pay full price, even though I’m the one that has the Verizon account that qualifies us for a 1 year free subscription and pays for the account.  Then when I called for some assistance I was hold, on and off for about 10 mins with the call lasting a total of 30 mins only for a supervisor lady named “Jay” to tell me “well since you just created an account under your email it’s in our system now and can’t change it.” So now I already paid for it upfront (because apparently they don’t refund or pro-rate) and if i want to get the bundle i have to repay for it under my wife’s account. And the help screens that appear when you try to sign up give ZERO details on how to properly sign up. It just says SIGN UP.

title: Good, but some bugs need to be fixed
review:
The variety of movies and tv shows on this app are great . But this app is missing shows like Mighty Med, Gamer’s Guide or even my personal favorite Aaron Stone!

That’s not the bugs however, I’m sure they will add them in time. What I would love is a better processor for when I skip back on a video. When I press the button to skip back ten seconds, the pause and skip buttons vanish and are replaced by the buffer icon. Which can only be fixed by dragging the cursor to the position. I would also like the ability to view your watch history and a more obvious way of showing which episodes of which show you watched. Like Prime Video does.

I would like those fixed, but it’s still worth it.

title: Love it but something is missing!
review: I love this app and that I get to introduce my kids to the best movies like Swiss Family Robinson and the Apple Dumpling Gang and all the old Mickey Mouse cartoons. Those were the best cartoons! I wish there was a “continue watching” option and also playback mode. I don’t always remember where I was and I would like that as an option. I like how I can pick and choose what my kids watch. However, I’m disappointed that they are going to censor all the old movies for racial and discrimination things. I use those as teaching moments and I firmly believe we need those in life. I can pause the movie, talk about what they said or how they acted, discuss a better way for that situation to have been handled and then continue with the movie.

title: Not compatible with any smart tv older than 2016
review: I was so excited to download the app on my Samsung 2015 curved 4K smart tv just to find out that you have to have a 2016 or newer. I love Disney, but not enough to go out & spend a couple thousand dollars on a newer smart tv just to watch it’s awesome programming on top of the monthly subscription. Disney is sending an awful message to it’s fans. Apparently you have to be middle upper class to afford the tv models it’s compatible with. I could get it on my phone or iPad. But is the expectación that everyone huddle around a tiny screen to enjoy family programming? When you try to mirror it to your “antique “ 4 year old tv, it just freezes. I spent a couple hours troubleshooting it online (more wasted time) just to find out that Disney hasn’t even bothered to comment on the matter or clarify when the public can expect for it to become available to the average person.

title: Almost perfect
review: The content is amazing and has almost every Disney show or movie I could think of! My only issue is it can be hard to find them on the app. There aren’t very many categories and not all the content is on the main page. Also your watchlist isn’t on the main page either and the shows you add won’t stay added to your watchlist and keep disappearing. There also isn’t a continue watching category, so if I leave and come back it’s easy to forget what I was in the middle of watching when it disappears. Still, the content is amazing and it’s easy to use the search bar to find what you’re looking for. I love this app and can’t wait for them to work out the little kinks!

title: I really dislike the new Disney
review: I really dislike Disney I understand that you are try to appeal to the younger generation but please understand that I 14 I still have a lot of kid in me I just ask the you recreate the movies and tv show’s that we love such as “ let it shine ,wizards of waverly place and ,camp rock and many more “. I know you don’t care about comments like this because you have to much money to care about a kid but we all want to make the world better but without love and laughter and hope of happy life how can we live and make life better . And if by any chance you remake them please use that money to make good content and not have them end up like All That because believe it or not I cry thinking about my childhood being gone and I’m on 14 but think you for you time and good day .

title: Seriously underwhelming
review:
It surprises me that a major media corporation would be comfortable publishing such a poorly performing app.  Streaming media technology is sufficiently mature that any company should be capable of providing an app that remembers where a viewer left off, provides easy access to frequently viewed programs, and allows the user to intuitively add/remove items from the watchlist.

Additionally, the push by this and other companies to only allow access to content if the end-user compromises his/her network security by disabling VPN services should be illegal.  The premise that “we need to know end-user locations due to licensing restrictions” simply doesn’t hold up when companies create their own streaming services to push their own content (which, presumably, they have a license to distribute).  

Even though streaming media is in a sorry state, I would be ashamed if I had any contribution to this particular app.

title: Love/Hate Relationship
review: I love Disney Plus but I’d love it more if I could watch it. Despite all the apps and my Apple TV being updated, the Disney Plus shows will play with no problem on my phone but the moment I attempt to airplay it to the Apple TV it has an errors out about 60% of the time I try to connect it. Some nights it’s just not my night. Other nights I have no problem and it airplay’s without an issue. My Apple TV is the updated original version (so not the fancier newer model... don’t keep up with Apple TV generations. Mine might be gen3 or something). Either way, it’s inconsistent. I’ve checked my connection speed but it’s fantastic at about 50Mbps download and 40Mbps upload. So honestly at this point I blame the app as airplay doesn’t seem to have the same struggles with any other app.

title: Great, but lacking a couple things
review:
The app is great so far, and I hope it only improved from here, but I noticed a few things that take away from the viewing experience. The app lacks a currently watching feature and a tag on each video to tell you how far you are. Without a place mark in certain shows, viewers can lose their place when watching the series and that would be very frustrating. A good amount of shows are still missing from the platform that could garner more subscribers such as Pair of Kings, Dog with a Blog, Ant Farm, and many many cartoon shows. Without a diverse selection from properties that you already own, the app will soon get boring once people watch the few popular shows that are on the platform.
Other than that, this is a great app!

title: Things needed for improving the app
review: Disney plus has been great at first I was really upset that they were taking all the stuff from Netflix but the layout of Disney plus is stunning something they should add when the new update comes out is: a continue watching area. I hate that if I leave the app for a while and come back to finish what I was watching that I have to go search for it again that’s ridiculous and makes me irritated. It’s really a great tool. Another thing is all of the marvel movies should be on Disney plus not just the recent ones or just the iron man 1,2,3. But I think that overall Disney plus is an excellent app. Make sure u keep Netflix to tho.

title: Horrible Service
review: Disney Plus really shows how much they care about their customers through their customer service, which is very non-existent. I have sent in multiple emails and have tried their online help multiple times (waited over an hour all the times when the estimated wait was under 30 minutes) and have not had any luck or had any response on the email front and it’s almost been a week since I submitted my first email. The website is a joke since you can’t even update your information which is all I’ve been trying to do and get my service sorted out correctly. It’s very asinine and totally unprofessional how they are handling things (Apparently not at all). I understand they have a high call volume right now but seriously almost a week has gone by without any word from them and they say they will typically respond within 24 hours. Yeah what a joke!

title: Disney+ Pros and Cons
review: I absolutely LOVE Disney+. The only problem is language. I wanted to watch the new Mulan (which was awesome) with premier access in Chinese. Though the movie was filmed in China and there is a Disneyland in Shanghai, the movie was not available in Mandarin Chinese or Cantonese. If possible, I’d appreciate if you could fix this. Not just for me, but for everyone. That way more people can watch it from all over the world. Other than that, Disney+ has proved to be amazing for the whole family! We continue to stream on it and enjoy exclusive shows like the Mandalorian. Thank you for making an app that has access to so many Disney, Pixar, Star Wars, Marvel, Fox, and National Geographic movies!

title: Money grab without functionality
review:
I think the ratings reflect content more than the actual app. One of the leading media companies in the world, if not the leading by $$ alone, launches an app too soon in order to pump their stock and get baby yoda into the world before Christmas. Buffering issues galore and don’t tell me it’s my service speed. Lack of basic functionality of other streaming apps that have been around for years (resume play would be the most glaring missing option). Have to play to the end to rewatch something on Apple TV.  Even the search algorithm is flawed. I dub this rollout as rudimentary, and that still seems like a gift. I’ll fix it for y’all - Netflix...copy them. 
I’ll give a positive of the categories at top of page to delineate Star Wars from Disney, etc

title: I Love It, But I Have One Suggestion
review: Okay I finally downloaded this app and I freaking love it!!! The nostalgia of all of the old Disney movies, the old shows—god, I just started watching Kim Possible last night and I love it!!—and all of the Marvel and Star Wars content that will keep me happy for the rest of my existence! I ask only one thing, a Recently Watched tab. I would love to be able to just find what I was watching under a Recently Watched tab on the home page. It’d be slightly more convenient than going into my watchlist and finding where I left off. It’s a minor thing that I’m confident will be resolved in the future but I’m just grateful to be able to have this app!

title: Instant Classic but app needs update
review: I love EVERYTHING about this service. I grew up watching most of the content provided. It's nostalgia at its finest; I get to not only re-live my childhood, but I can now share this with my children and as well. With everything provided, the minor inconveniences of the app can be overlooked. There is no recently played or continue feature like other streaming services. I am currently watching a show where I have to go into my profile then to watchlist click on the show and search for the season and episode. Not the end of the world, but after a while, it will become annoying. For now, that is my only gripe with the app; everything else is magic that only Disney could provide!

title: AUTOPLAY ISSUES
review: My rating is based on the app itself, not the content, because Evens Stevens is gold. App needs a “continue watching” list. Also, if you rewatch an episode of a series, it ALWAYS begins at the end credits! I watch on an Apple TV and have to manually rewind each episode that I’m rewatching. Then I expect the next episode to automatically play, even if I’ve already watched the entire series, but nope. It stops and waits for me to press the “play next episode” button on every single episode if it’s been previously viewed. When I do hit the “play next episode” button, it begins at the end credits again and I have to rewind to watch from the beginning. Fix the autoplay function!! Seriously, I’ve spent thousands of dollars taking trips to Disneyland and Disney World over the last 20 years. You have the money to do better than this, Disney.

title: Heating up/crashing phone
review: Not mad since it’s so close after launch and there bound to be bugs but just to make devs aware that as soon as loading up a movie on here, my phone heated up like crazy (never happens watching any other media or on anything else) and then the screen didn’t sense my finger, so I couldn’t pause. Eventually I went home and nothing would load so I turned my phone completely off then on and it fixed it, but my phone is sill cooling off from it. Wondering if anyone else has had this issue. Other than that the app is pretty great, I love the theme and title choices, and all the oldies added on, will be busy on here for awhile ;)

title: Beware of the subscription
review: Download  Disney+  it's great but beware there is a subscription you need to buy to have access to it all but it has categories and a lot of fun movies and TV shows to watch you can decorate your profile and I think it’s Awesome 😎 I have it on my TV and I am definitely going to sign in when it’s done loading  also if you got Disney now then I think you might want to delete it because I heard that they are going to take away Disney now soon because of Disney+ I don’t know if it’s true but it could happen so do you wanna watch fun TV shows and movies made by Disney on Disney+ get it now for free with a subscription inside bye 👋

title: Really good app
review: I love the app there is only one problem with it you might be woundering why i did not give it four stars if there is a problem with it the reason why everything else tops my problem i am having is that there is over 100 shows and movies and there is all good kinds of choices i am a mystery and action type of guy my brother likes all kinds so what i am saying is that it has shows for everyone not just a guy who likes everything my problem is i have a ipad and it is a so little screen and sometimes when i click on it it moves to the bottem sides or top so i would really appreciate it if you could fix that

title: PLEASE Make a “Continue Watching” Feature
review: Love Disney+ so far! So much great content that I didn’t even think they would imagine to include like the Disney shorts. This app randomly crashes on me sometimes however, seemingly for no reason. This wouldn’t bother me as much (because it doesn’t crash on me too often) if there was a continue watching feature. Not only do I have to hunt down what I was watching, but I also have to figure out what episode I was in. Usually it will take me back to the place I was in in the episode but sometimes I even have to fast forward and look for the spot at which I left off. This is also the same issue when you voluntarily leave a movie or episode of a show; you have to go searching to resume where it was left off.

title: GREAT!!
review:
Honestly this is probably the highlight of 2019. Everything i’ve been wanting to watch is here!! Soo cool how they have all the star wars movies and Marvel!!!! This app for great for all ages. They even included national geographic, AWESOME! 

Only thing i wish for is the ‘currently watching’ option. That is definitely needed & useful with platforms like theses. It’s annoying having to search for the show all the time. Also, it would help if it marked watched episodes so we know where we are in a series instead of guessing haha we all know how we like to binge and maybe fall asleep haha. 

Overall, it’s a really great app and i highly recommend. This is where it’s at. Hope it helps xoxo

title: Not all inclusive
review: First off, there is a lot of great content on Disney+. That said, there are some things that it doesn’t have that is a little disappointing. Disney purchased Lucasfilm, but none of the Indiana Jones content is included, nor other Lucasfilm content. The original Clone Wars cartoons that appeared as shorts on Cartoon Network are not here, and I do not mean the Ahsoka-containing ones, rather the ones prior to that line of shows. American Graffiti and Howard the Duck, for example are missing among others. You can find National Geographic, but not ABC content, which is a Disney property. If Disney combined all their apps into one (Disney+, ESPN+, ABC), it would be the best service available, in my opinion. Still, my kids will enjoy the content it does currently have.

title: Concerns!
review:
I love Disney movies and was excited to hear about this new app! I love seeing multiple movies available to watch including the sequels. 

My concerns start when I see “Out of the Vault” which includes The Little Mermaid, Jungle Book, Cinderella, etc. Will these movies be taken off this app after so long? Also why limit the movies? I noticed the new Lady and The Tramp is available to watch, but where is The Lion King, and Beauty and The Beast? I would think since this is a Disney app, it would have every single Disney movie out. 

I’ll keep this about a month and see if any new movies will be added, but if not I will let the app go. I already have a lot of movies that I can just watch over without paying $8. monthly. This app just makes it a little easier and more convenient.

title: Decent for a first attempt
review:
Considering the work Disney put into this service and the many streaming apps that came before it, I expected more.  The app is clean, and the studio hot buttons are helpful, but is not without issues: 
- There is no way to see what you last watched or a way to jump back into the last couple items where you left off.  You have to recall what you were watching, find it, then go back to where you were.
- The Watch List is buried in the menu rather than being a category of its own, so it takes a few clicks to find.  
- The Watch List has no sorting capability, such as by title or recently watched.  It's hard to find anything.
- Any shows and movies added to the Watch List don't show the checkmark that it's already added when you revisit the show.  This makes creating the list impossible.  Titles are listed under several categories, so you will likely forget if you added it already.  If it's already in the list and you add it to the list again, it actually removes it from the list.

Fixes too the Watch List and a recently watched/unfinished feature are desperately needed to reduce the experience frustration.

title: Ehhhhhh
review: I LOVE Disney movies. I haven’t even been using this app for a week, and there are already issues with it. 1) I downloaded some movies to watch and I was half way through a movie when it stopped and I couldn’t keep watching. I had to exit the app and go back in and it was still not working. It let me watch any of the other movies I had downloaded, but not this one. 2) once I was finally able to finish the movie, it told me I had no downloads, which I know for a fact was not true. All my downloads were gone but were still taking up storage on my iPad. This makes me really mad because I had quite a few movies downloaded. If you could try to fix it, that would be amazing.

title: Love it but few bugs
review: I just love Disney++ and i am enjoying everything. I got issues with low volume when streaming to my Samsung TV, not matter what app i use(xbox,Samsung, iOS) the volume is very low. Also i would love to be able to go to next episode or previous one in the actual stream i think it needs more navigation features in the stream window. Also is difficult to see what was your last episode watched and would be nice too that you can see the episodes that you already watched marked, another idea is to have the movies for example Star Wars in order because i have to go back to home do a search and find the next movie that follows. But overall good fine job dev team!!

title: Amazing Content with minor layout issues
review: The shows and movies included with Disney plus are amazing, but here are a few things that should be addressed concerning the layout of the app. First and most importantly, a “continue watching” section would be extremely useful and make the app much easier to navigate. It would also be very useful to have a description of what each show is as well as casting information for it. Finally, I’m sure this will soon be fixed also, but there a still a few shows missing that I would love to see come to Disney plus. I’m loving this app and hope to continue to see it grow and develop into something even better with future updates!

title: Love everything but the watchlist
review: I love everything about this app but the watchlist caps you off at how many shows you can add to it and instead of telling it’s full or being able to add unlimited shows to the watchlist it just replaces and removes other shows without your knowledge. See I love the watch list because instead of searching through all the stuff I don’t watch I can just add it to my watch list and know that everything I want to see or love to watch is right there, but with it capping at how many shows you can add and auto removing others so you can add other is mehh so I think a simple small fix of being able to add unlimited shows and movies to the watch list would be awesome.

title: feeling: frustrated
review: This app keeps telling me “error 83”. Fix it. It hasn’t even been a week since I started my free trial. I was planning on paying for it anyways. Now I can’t even log in. Fix it Disney. I am highly disappointed by the lack of effort y’all put into this app. I was iffy about the fact that it doesn’t show you your recently watched and now this? I should be able to open this app and click on whatever I was previously watching to resume it. Now that this error keeps popping up, I can’t even log back into my account. I share this account with one other person, I shouldn’t have trouble like this. I don’t know what you want me to do. Your help section was not helpful at all whatsoever. Though I do appreciate the whole concept of Disney Plus.

title: Cool but needs few kinks worked out.
review: Disney+ is awesome and ik it just released and has some kinks to be worked out anyways. Some of the things ive noticed while using it, having a “continue watching” section would be awesome and for it to keep track of where I left off instead of playing from the very beginning of the series. Also just a little glitch or something when im scrolling to find something to watch, when i scroll through a category horizontally when i get to one side of my screen it snaps over to the other side of the tv and when you click into something to save it to your “watch list” and go back to keep exploring you have start back at the beginning.

title: I agree good but still needs...
review: I agree with all the reviews that it’s good but it still needs a little bit of work. Having a continue watching area would be so helpful. I accidentally closed the screen during an episode and then had to go searching for the series and then searching for the correct episode I don’t need to continue. I was frustrated and didn’t want to take the time to go through all that so I stopped watching. The episodes really should be marked as to progress so we are able to see which episodes in the series we have watched especially those that will continue to add new episodes if it’s been a while who the heck is going to remember where they left off.

title: Love it!
review:
I have been streaming Disney+ since the moment it was available, but since I have started streaming I have had a severe buffering problem. I cannot watch anything without the show or movie buffering at least 10+ times. I have yet to watch something and it play all the way through without lagging. I’ve talked to several people and some say they have the same problem and others say they don’t... 
Other than that, I absolutely love this app and the fact that I know have the opportunity to watch all of the movies I have been obsessed with since I was a small kid. If I could just get it to wear the content would stop buffering I would probably never get off of this app.

title: Amazing just one problem
review: I’m 18 , no one in the world can make me feel ashamed for loving Disney movies and tv shows , princesses and all the animal movies i don’t care I love it all , this app is amazing and has so much to offer I’m so excited to re-watch all the amazing movies of my childhood , there’s only one problem I have is that when I don’t finish a movie and have to turn it off , when I come back it doesn’t tell me where I left off I have to forward and find the part I last saw obviously it’s not a huge problem but I just think it would be better , also maybe a section that tells me the movies I’ve watched or need to continue watching.

title: Love It!! 😄👍
review: I personally LOVE Disney movies, and when my friend told me that the app was coming out, I was so excited!! About one or two days after the app came out, my family decided to download it. (we had been looking forward to this for a while now) We all love it!!! I have two very young siblings, and we cast Disney movies to the tv all the time. I normally watch it on my phone, so I can watch shows of my choice. I, myself, I have been looking forward to watching high school musical, the series. With this app, I don't have to wait until Friday to watch it, I can watch it whenever I want!! Thank you so much for reading this, and I recommend this app to everyone!!!

title: One thing that bugs me... A LOT
review: You see I love Disney+, it’s cool. They have tons of Disney movies that Netflix doesn’t have plus shows. They even have short clips. I have had Disney+ for a long time but, whenever I’m watching a show or movie, something happens. That something is that it switches on what side of the screen its on. Sometimes it goes upside down or sideways. Then it goes back after I try to fix it but it gets smaller than my usual screen. After that, it malfunctions and it kicks me out of the app. Disney, I really need you to read this, it has been bugging me for the LONGEST time. Please stop this mess and fix it. That is the only thing that I don’t like about Disney+. In different circumstances it is an amazing app. People should really get it and watch!!!😁😁😄😄❤️❤️

title: I love that I can watch my favorites of all time
review:
And enjoy new stuff too. However, I’m one of those people that likes to rewind a part over and over again to watch it over and over again and I don’t like that it is hard to do in all forms of the app be it a gaming console or from my phone. Also would love to have a favorites playlist and a watch later playlist to be an option.

And then there is the issue of it buffering on the gaming console apps like the PS4 or freezes but keeps playing the audio and then when it catches up the scene replays. Another thing is if I want rewind because I’m studying the scene as I sometimes like to do it’ll quit the movie by same “oops something went wrong.” It’s so annoying and I want this to be fixed very badly.

title: Love it. A few Bugs, needs more features
review: Overall I love it the app runs really smooth and easy to navigate. It does have a bug though on my phone if I loose my cellular network connection I have to restart my phone in order for the app to recognize any kind of network connection has been restored cellular or WiFi. Also it would be really functional and super convenient if the app had either a tab or a strip category for continue watching that way if you close out the app it’s more convenient to continue watching the video you were last watching (i.e Netflix) otherwise you have to search for it or refind where it was listed otherwise great job Disney overall a great app

title: Great App! But Please Fix Some Minor Bugs & Issues
review: Overall Your App Is wonderful. But lately it seems like every movie or show i watch just wont load correctly and it freezes and it is very irritating. This happens on both mobile and on my play station 4. Wifi and connection is all good just seems to freeze up. Audio will still play but picture is stuck. Also could you add a continue watching feature? And Maybe categorize the flow of movies better. Ill look through categories and only see certain movies and then when you search i see movies and shows i didn’t even know yall had. I also can’t seem to change quality on ps4 app. Please take this into consideration!

title: I hope there’s an update soon
review:
Big thanks to the Verizon partnership for the free year! I’ve already watched a couple classics and boy meets world is keeping me company during the late night nursing sessions. 
That being said, there needs to be a continue watching section for series. Even adding something to a watch list doesn’t keep the place. They have profiles but if there isn’t something keeping track, that’s kind of pointless. This is absolutely just an inconvenience but it’s a pretty big one. If you go to the watch list, the series you’re watching is listed but you still have to scroll and try to find where you left off and if you only watch half an episode, it restarts the episode. You have to physically move the watch bar to your spot.

title: Disney+ feelings
review: I am really exited about Disney+. It has so many movies that throw me back and I have no issue watching. But it is still new and I think it still has a few things it could improve on. I would suggest a section showing what you have recently been watching and haven’t finished, especially if it’s a show. Maybe adding a favorites section or a way to add to “my list” of things you’d like to watch. I would also really love it if they would add a selection to to captions when you pause the movie. I personally have very poor hearing and I have a hard time watching television without any captions. All around though this is a great app and I’m sure they will address things like this soon

title: Canceling Subscription
review: Honestly the app is nice and I enjoyed having it, but times are hard and I want to cancel my subscription. When I go to my account there isn’t a camel subscription option. I click on billing/payments and I’m redirected to another website that doesn’t even list Disney+ on there. Then I call the customer service number and they don’t even list a cancel option, they say if you signed up thru Apple go thru them. My Netflix is thru Apple and I could easily cancel/ resubscribe with no issues. I’ve never felt so trapped into a subscription. I’m currently on hold with customer service and I haven’t even spoken to a person yet and it’s been 20 mins. It’s like they want to make it hard so in the end you to give up and keep the subscription. This has completely made me not ever want to get Disney again cause they have made it so difficult.

title: I love this but!
review:
Okay, my family and I have been big Disney fans! I literally no longer pay for cable because of this app and netflix! I love that any movie imaginable is in here and that my kids get to watch what I grew up watching. 
My problem is that we will start the movie and I end up getting the “Oh No!” Something is in error messages either right from the start or right in the middle. 😭 I have excellent internet service on my phone, or even using WiFi... That gets irritating! I even checked if I needed to update my phone or app and everything is fine! I’m not hating it but it be nice to be able to just lay in the bed for a day and watch a kids movie without interrupting them..

title: Disney+
review: I love Disney+! But I mainly want to talk about how I wish more plays and musicals were on there. I know they put Hamilton on Disney+, but why stop there? I know because of the virus, I missed watching Dear Evan Hansen, and I was really looking forward to it, after reading the book and listening to the soundtrack. I would love for the people who run Disney+ to add Dear Evan Hansen and some other musicals/plays!! I hope you take my suggestion into consideration especially realizing that millions of people have missed plays they were excited to go to, and this would give them a chance to watch it, although it still would not be the same.

title: Love it but...
review: I really love the disney app, however I really think there needs to be more parental controls. A big one would be passwords to each profile. I want to be able to let my young kids watch their favorite shows without worry of them getting to the more adult or older kid content. My kids have learned how to switch profiles and have recently gone on to the Simpsons on my profile. I don’t think this is an appropriate show for my 4 and 5 year olds. So while I can set their profile to specific limits, I can’t control them switching profiles when I’m not looking. I think Netflix finally got it right with how much control parents have. I may end up stopping my subscription if I can’t be worry free of what my kids are watching. Please fix the parental controls! Should be a fairly simple fix!

title: my literal favorite app.🤍
review: Hey people that work at disney🥶😂. I love this app so so much!! It’s really cool that i can watch so many of my favorite movies and shows all in one place. Also i LOVE the download feature. So when i’m off wifi, i can watch a show i’ve already downloaded. (i do this a lot😂). And it’s really worth the price as well. And if that wasn’t good enough, there is legit no ads and it keeps you posted when something new comes out!!!!!! OOH one more thing, i love the fact that once a new movie comes out in theaters, you don’t have to wait that long until it comes out here!!! So all in all, the creators of this app are AWESOME and thanks so much!!🤍

title: Frustrating, but still have faith
review: For a company with so much money, you would think you guys would spend money on working on app functionality. This thing is so incredibly frustrating to use and if it weren’t for the content this would have a much lower rating. Watching movies and shows is unbearable, as they buffer and stop every 5 minutes, the app constantly stops showing I’m even playing anything at all, and I have to continuously close and reopen the app. As of right now this is really not worth the money, but I’m giving it the benefit of the doubt seen as how the app has not been out a super long time. All I’m asking is you use your abundant resources to fix this issue! PLEASE

title: Unable to Pause While Streaming
review: The app has been great and only thing I’m having an issue with is the inability to pause whatever I’m watching at times. There are moments when I go to pause and the pause symbol shows up along with the other actions, but there are more times when I click my phone screen to pause a movie, say I’m heading to the bathroom really quick, and all that shows is a circle circling around as if buffering. Even when I’m connected to the WiFi, the issue of being unable to briefly pause what I’m watching, continues unless I completely back out of the title I’m watching and then have to resume from the Disney home screen again to continue watching my title.

title: I love this app but
review:
The only problem I truly have noticed and kinda have a problem with is some of the shows on the app have some episodes missing or not in order which I know it’s hard to everything perfect and everything it’s just kinda annoying but I’m just trying to watch the shows and then it just skips to a different timeline and I notice it says it’s supposed to be next but normally it shouldn’t. Also I notice some shows don’t have a part 2 after a part 1, like it skipped in the timeline. 

I understand its hard because it’s such a big platform and people make mistakes I just wanted to say this.

title: Great app, but could be better
review: I love this streaming service and I’ve watched little else since I got it. My biggest complaint is when I try to re-watch episodes of the Madalorian. If I go back and re-watch the first episode, things are fine. Then afterwards it skips all the way to the most recent episode. But then when I specifically choose episode 2, it’ll skip (again) to the most recent episode. It did this all night and refused to play episodes 2 & 3. Granted I’d already watched them, but I’ve never had this happen with any of the other streaming services. Very, very frustrating. Fix this. If I click a specific episode, it should play that episode followed by the one after that.

title: Best thing ever! But..
review: Okay so I’m a huge fan of Disney, but when I’m watching something it sometimes glitches me out of the whole app, and have have a apple and its new, so I don’t think it’s my iPad, but I love all the movies on it, but I hate when the continue watching thing glitches out and I have nothing there, then I have to restart the whole series or movie, or even skip through it, most likely watch it again cause I love Disney- ok I’m off topic! But my sister has problems changing accounts, so she has to watch on my account, and it gets frustrating when she watches my stuff. This is a great app though and I will using this a lot more! ❤️❤️❤️

title: Great! But I have some problems...
review: So I love Disney+ I am your fan 4ever! Anyway, I noticed some problems though. First off, it always takes so long to load! Second, I find that not all marvel Star Wars, nat geo, etc have been like having big problems. Their good, but issues may very. First not all the good stuff is on it! Oh my gosh guys DEVELOPERS ATTENTION GUYS I LOVE THIS APP SO MUCH I WATCH IT 24/7 BUT I CANNOT STAND THE STUPID STUFF... Thanks. So I know I’m kinda sounding like a negative weirdo, but this app is awesome.. I can’t stop watching High School Musical The Musical: The series, Lab Rats, and The Mandalorian! Guys I wish all you good luck to fix this! Thank you so much and Disney+ 4ever! :) I’m not done yet. I have more. 24 hours later... UGH.

title: Disney+ is magical
review: Nothing beats the feeling of being a kid again. We grow up and often forget the good times of the past. This app offers that. I like having the opportunity of watch films I haven’t seen in 6+ years. Films of likes of Wall-e, Narnia, Herbie, etc. It is amazing to see the Disney magic of the past. I have honestly fallen in love with some of these movies. Watching them bring back warm memories. I can remember the toys, the house, the couches, and the food I had. I can even remember the play sessions I had. Disney to some extent has lost that magic that they once had. You don’t see films like that anymore. This allows you to re-visit the joys of the past.

title: Love it but needs improvement
review: I love that most of the Disney movies are available but there are things in the app that need to improve. There is no "currently watching" section. Everytime I leave the app I have to search for what I was watching and it's very inconvenient. Also there is no option to start a movie over from the beginning if you happen to be at the credits or just want to start it over from any point. I have repeat watchers in the house and they complain that they can't just start the movie from the beginning. First they have to fast forward through all the credits and then hit play. Other then that love the app. Can't wait until all Disney movies are accessible.

title: So amazing, but please address
review: The app and its content is absolutely amazing! Just left me wondering where to begin on my binge-watching! The only complaint I have about the app is the same as I saw some others write in their review: the app doesn’t visibly show where you left off watching. I started binge-watching The Runaways, and am frustrated that when I take a break between episodes, and come back later, I have to find the last one I watched. I get that you weren’t trying to make an exact duplicate of other streaming services, however, the masses are used to having the app show them where they left off. Seems a bit of an oversight to have left a feature like that out completely.

title: My Childhood One App
review:
Literally so overwhelm that I don’t know what to watch first! Thank you Disney!

This app literally can appeal to just about every age group with classic movies and shows, but even newer ones 😊 The reason I rate it a 4 star is because it’s a bit glitchy at times, I’m sure it will be fix soon. Also, I hope they will add continue watching on TV shows, it’s a bit annoying having to add stuff watch list and then go search through the list. Also hope they add a bit more personalization such as suggesting tv shows and movies on the front page based on what we’ve recently watch. Other than that this app is a god send for use adults reliving our childhoods and the young kids 👀

title: Amazing but tiny problem...
