You’ve swallowed up a ton of corporations and you don’t have Indiana Jones, maleficent, or sky high available for stream? Key staples if you ask me

title: Could use some helpful additions
review: The content is great! However, the app does not allow for you to “play from the beginning” once you have started watching a show or movie. Little kids watch everything over and over wether they finished it the first time or not. I’m tired of clicking the back button over and over to start from the beginning. Also, within the episodes of a show, there is no way to determine which episodes you have already watched. I click on what I think is the next episode only to realize we’ve seen it. So we click the next and the next. Could use some helpful updates. All the streaming services that I have used offer these features.

title: Suggestions/minor issues
review:
1. The television episodes are not in the correct order i.e. on Phil of the Future, the very first episode is listed as #10.

2. On having the option to skip the intro theme, it continues at the middle of the intro... maybe change it to let it pick up at the last line of the theme song or right before the episode starts.

3. I was watching a movie called Camp Nowhere and I watch with captions. But on this movie, the captions were at the top of the screen the entire time until I turned them off 10 minutes into the movie (not sure if you guys could fix this problem - if you can, that would be great.)

title: Seems deliberately impossible to cancel 7 day trial
review: Started my trial. Created an account. Received email confirmation of account creation. Tried to login to account to cancel trial. Couldn’t log in. Said credentials were not correct. Reset password. Received confirmation email to email address that account is based upon. Said reset was successful. Tried to login again. Said there was no account. Called customer support on app - wrong number and didn’t work. Searched online for customer service contact number. That worked. Said wait time would be 10 minutes. On hold for a rep for 45 minutes. No one ever picked up. Appears Disney wants to create success by getting trials started with no way to cancel. Guess I will have to use my payment provider to cancel trial. Magical kingdom creating “magical” success in streaming by forced trial conversions.

title: Continue Watching...
review:
My only complaint is that there is no ‘continue watching’ section and that shows don’t pick up where you left off. For example, I was watching That’s So Raven and stopped in the middle of episode 3 yesterday. I went and searched for the show a today (since there is no continue watching section) and clicked play... literally started at episode 1 again. This is going to make this really annoying for those of us who can’t remember what episode we left off on...

Other than that, the selection is amazing and I’m really happy with what this had to offer!

title: What’s not to like???
review:
I mean I’m 15 so still a youngling for you Star Wars fans out there... I love the app I mean like me and my family were Disney fanatics like we go to Disney 2 times a year at least but back to the point I mean like it’s always fun and enjoyable to watch the old Disney movies and the new one’s but the app is great with the ability to download a movie in under 5 minutes is so nice that way on the airplane your never and bored staring out the window. The features that Disney includes are amazing like the ability to watch whatever you want. 
Thanks for reading and:
 “See ya real soon”. 

Thanks Disney.

title: Continue watching
review: Love the app and I like that we can view what we are watching and continue it where we left off. But I do wish we could delete what we are no longer watching. For example we watch a movie and end at the credits. For that to not show up in the continue watching list we have to fast forward through the credits for it to no longer show in that list. Or even if we start watching a series for a show but lost interest, we should be able to get ride of it so we aren’t consistently seeing it in the continue watching list.

title: Mickey 🐭, ur gonna love these ideas.
review: I. Love. This. App. It’s just so great and here are some ideas I think ur gonna love. 1. I think u should an option to watch live channels because some people may no what to watch so they they just choose live t.v. . 2. I also think that when kids around and u wanna put on like Disney junior but they don’t know how to spell it there should be a microphone option too. And the last thing I wanna talk about is that u should some games up there to. Because I always want to play Disney games and just relax. And this coming from a kid so u should probably listen. And that’s all, folks.

title: This app is amazing yo
review: I’m currently on the seven day free trial as of yesterday and I probably have over 60 movies and series add it to my watchlist this app is crazy has all the great classic Disney movies and shorts but the only downside is that if you’re watching a series it doesn’t leave you where you left off at and there are certain movies and series like “Sky high“ “black panther“ “the avengers infinity war“ and many more that are on the homepage but aren’t available until summer of next year why not just take them off and have them available when they’re available… But other than that I’ve literally been on this app strong in the last 48 hours and continuing

title: !!!Caution!!!
review:
First let me start by saying I love the content and the overall design of the app. 

However, I recently had a need to remove someone from my account. I changed the password and they were still able to use it on the device they were already logged into. I spoke to tech support and there is no way to force all devices to logout and have to log back in.  I am very disappointed. My only option is to cancel and come back another time.  Most other apps similar to this do have an option to force logout. Its not a new technology and with lost devices and changing of them regularly in this technological world, it is an important need for everyone's account security.  Just changing your email or password should force a logout of all devices.

title: Almost perfect 1990’s throw back
review: This app has almost all of my favorite shows from when I was growing up as a kid the only issues is there are some missing for example the little mermaid TV series is missing a couple of episodes like I had to buy will the tail on the iTunes Store because it wasn’t listed other shows I hope Will be added soon include Aladdin on the TV series because without it we wouldn’t have gotten from return of Jafar to Aladdin and the King of Thieves and I definitely am not going onto Internet sites just to hunt down the diamond in a rough pun intended, plus where is house of mouse

title: Love the content, app could use work
review:
I really enjoy the content on Disney Plus and have subscribed since it was available. However, some content is missing (a few DCOMs etc) and the app leaves features to be desired. I really wish that I could skip to the next episode and also skip the intro on shows. On shorter runtime shows this can be especially annoying. Also, the load always seems to freeze at 00:00:20 no matter what I’m watching. I also have trouble when I disconnect from one device and connect to another device: the episode starts over instead of starting where I stopped. 

Overall, nice app but could use some improvement. Nothing a company like Disney can’t implement.

title: Apple TV app
review:
Content is great but on Apple TV there is an issue.  When a movie ends and during the credits it goes small screen when the recommendation takes over - if one goes into the movie again and makes it full screen again, the Apple TV remote no longer works.  Ie...you can’t pause, ff, rewind.  All one can do is wait for the movie to end or hit the home button.

Also, please don’t put shows or movies in continue watching when we only have the credits left.  Continue watching gets full with all these movies that have 3 minutes left because kids clicked out of the credits. 

Thanks and keep up the good work

title: No option to select episodes different series episodes from ‘continued watching’ section
review: On netflix, in the ‘continue watching’ section, you can click on the show title and I’ll bring up the series and all of the episodes. Sometimes I fall asleep watching a show, so when I go back into the app, I want to be able to go back to previous episodes. On Disney+, you can either resume whatever episode you left off on, or you have to do a new search and find the show and find the episode you really want. Also, you should add Richie Rich since you have the holiday movie. Also ‘My date with the presidents daughter’ ;) thanks!

title: Disney+ App
review:
Very disappointed first all adult Disney movies are not even on the platform not to mention all the marvel movies there not all on earthier also Caribbean movies there not all on either. sound quality is horrible! First all the marvel/ pirates of the Caribbean & star-wars movies should be in 4K ultra Hd with Dolby surround sound! there is no point in watching star-wars / pirates of the Caribbean & marvel movies with out the 4K! The sound quality through out the other movies is very poor too!  I Personally Love Disney movies and I do not like giving bad reviews! I felt compelled to do so! For Disney being a billion dollar company this new streaming launch is pretty awful! hopefully Disney will make a major overhaul to there new streaming app! 
First Disney needs to put all there adult Disney movies on!
Second the sound needs to be fixed
Third it needs be more user friendly 
Fourth offer picks from your own photo library instead of just the animated characters 
Fifth kids are not the only people that enjoy Disney movies 
Adults enjoy too if your going to have a streaming platform for adults too than cater to that not just your child audience
Love Disney please fix theses major issues so I can come back and be one of your consumers

title: Help is impossible, hope you don’t need it
review: I have tried to buy this service for days, and keep getting an “Unknown Error”.  Now that I have signed up, I’m in Colorado and it tells me I am out of service area, my IP is a Denver metro city, and the error tells you to contact service center. Now the true horrible begins, it takes me 10-15min to find a phone number, then I call and I am on hold for 13min, and it hangs up, then on hold 16min and it hangs up, then on for around 10 and it hangs up.  Finally I try text and I am at 17min, and it says I have another 9 to go, but that number keeps moving.  I have been looking forward to this service, but this is just too much work, and what horrible service! I get it is new, but I have never seen anything worse.  Disney should be able to have a solid product and service.

title: Sound cutting out?
review: So first I’d like to start by saying that I love what’s on the app and all the different movie and tv show choices but what I don’t love is that my speaker is messed up while using this app and only this app. I could have the volume on my phone on high and then the volume will just drop down to a very low volume all of a sudden. I’ve tried to see if it was my phone but discovered that my speaker only acts out when using this app, my speaker works fine with all my other apps so therefore it has to be this app messing with my speaker. Again love the content in this app but would love it if the volume issue could be checked out! Thanks!

title: Overall, amazing! C:
review:
So, I got Disney+ a few days after it came out and I’m so glad that they added a continue watching! The only problem I have now, is when I’m watching a series picture in picture while playing games. When I’m watching a series in picture and picture, if I finish the episode, it doesn’t continue on to the next episode and I’d have to reenter the app and close my game. It’s a problem because I play games like roblox which are online. 
         (P.S. It’s 5 stars because not many people watch Disney+ picture in picture so it’s not really that big of a problem.)

title: Perfect for any Disney fan, but...
review: I was so excited for Disney+ to come, and when I first opened the app I was overjoyed to see so many of my favorite wonderful shows and films in one place. My only complaint, however, is there’s no easy way to pick up where I left off. A few episodes into Recess, I realized it doesn’t mark episodes as watched. You have to commit to memory what episode you last saw, which might be a problem if you step away for a while or if you get far into a series. You just have to keep scrolling until you find where you left off. Other than that, great service. It will keep me entertained for a very long time.

title: Missing one MASSIVE feature
review: Very nice clean app, also wonderful that all of the Disney movies can be found in one place! My family loves it! The app would have 5 stars if it had a continue or resume watching section. It’s so frustrating to be in the middle of a series, and have to go through all the seasons and episodes to find the one to watch next if you happen to leave for a bit. With movies too, if I have to continue watching a movie at a later time, I have to search that movie title again to pull it up. Very frustrating and it needs to be fixed, people aren’t going to stop complaining until there is a fix in place!

title: Amazing but could use some overall improvements
review: First off, Disney + is amazing when it comes to all the Disney originals, Marvel, Pixar, and National Geographic. However, the app could use some fixes such as: having a start from the beginning option when watching something, have a continue watching tab to keep track of what you was watching last, a fix with streaming on VIZIO devices ( which is probably VIZIO fault not Disney), and being able to cast directly from the Disney app on my phone to my fire Tv. I have Disney + on my fire tv but when I try to cast from my phone it doesn’t work but connects to my VIZIO tv upstairs even though it’s not compatible ? It is great but has some technical problems already.

title: Wow!
review: They weren’t joking when they said that they were rereleasing everything! This streaming service is awesome. Even though it has it’s flaws and bugs it is still great. I still can’t believe that they even rereleased all 30 seasons on The Simpson’s. If you are a Disney, Pixar, Star Wars, Marvel, and National Geographic fan this is the app for you. This is, in my opinion, the superior streaming service out right now. Even with their original content like The Madalorian is still really cool. I can’t wait for the last season of the Clone Wars as well. As long as they keep releasing fresh and original content they will keep fans happy.

title: Must have app🤩
review: Update ver 1.2.2:  Now I finally get to watch my favorite Disney films, some which I have not seen since the days of VHS. Great Content, most in 4K HDR🤓. Mandalorian alone is worth the price. However the player still needs work. Scrubbing works just ok, but 10s jumps are hit and miss. Also, the auto play next episode feature does not work on many Disney Channel shows.  So for those that like to each the same shows over again, be prepared for some frustration. You will need to manually scrub every episode back to the start in order to watch it a second time. Otherwise you will just be watching the end credits again😢.

title: Best streaming app!!
review: Finally I have found the app that I wanted .. Disney plus is a very amazing app.. it provides a lot of those great movies and tv shows that we all love ,, also it provides content that is suitable for children, teens and adults the whole family can watch together ,, what I like about it is that you can pay through iTunes .. which is something that I hope for it to stay.. ,, and Disney is constantly adding new movies shows that we recommend.. so if you are looking for an app to stream nearly all your favorite movies and tv shows that’s the one 👍🏻👍🏻

title: Awesome but need to be all of Disney
review: I love Disney plus and it’s an awesome app but what about the rest of Disney. I would be willing to pay extra to add Disney now subscription as an extension of Disney plus. Disney now app is a great app especially for kids. Disney Now app features a lot of content that is only viewable with a subscription from a tv provider that are NOT on Disney Plus. Theses are shows and movies that I believe should be on Disney Plus. Two out of many examples would be Disney Junior and Pokémon. They are both shown on Disney Now (some requires a tv provider) but are not on Disney Plus. I don’t see myself getting a tv provider, because I’m use to and prefer streaming. Please allow content on Disney Now to be on Disney Plus.

title: Watchlist
review: Personalizing a watchlist on each account has been the biggest waste of time since the day D+ was released. Movies disappear from the list, though they have a green check next to the title, and you can only add a small handful of movies, or it deletes one in order to add another one. Watchlist should be nearly limitless and easily customizable. (I.e easily remove items from the list, selecting multiple at a time, and the ability to move items around in an order that is wanted, or at least have the ability to put them in alphabetical order or by release date) Three stars for this issue, and because of the never-ending playback errors that still exist, months later.

title: It’s almost overwhelming!
review: There is so much on the service, but it’s not organized very well. It bugs me that we can’t organize movies or series alphabetically or by release date, for instance. It would also really be handy to be able to organize our watch lists, especially with user-created categories. I’ve resisted putting too much into my watch list so it isn’t too unwieldy to look through. And an indicator on the thumbnail of something that isn’t currently available (or the ability to filter by that criterion, among others) would be very useful. I hope that more functionality will appear in the app soon.

title: Disney + is the greatest with one problem
review: When I write reviews, I usually say the app is amazing and I don’t really criticize what the developers have done but I only have one major problem with Disney plus. When I get on the app, it sometimes switches files and I end up having to watch stuff on other profiles. When Disney plus came out it has some problems but most of those have been addressed and I’m happy for that, but can you please read my review and fix this problem. Disney is the best app I have ever paid for and I would like my full streaming experience to be perfect.

title: Can’t verify email
review: Bought a year subscription the first day it came out. Weeks later, I still cannot verify my email because it doesn’t send me a verification email. No, it’s not going to my spam folder. I’ve sat on hold for two multiple hour phone calls without ever reaching anyone. And have received two responses, each a week apart, to my twitter inbox asking the same question, “what email is your account assigned to?” even though I’ve provided that information in the previous messages, and the response a week later is the same question. I figured there’d be some bugs to work through at launch, but weeks later I still don’t have a resolution to my issue. It seems Disney is raking in enough dough that they don’t feel it necessary to take five minutes to resolve this customer’s problem.

title: Could be better
review:
I love that Disney finally has their own app with most of their movies and shows. I am still waiting for them to release everything but I’m sure that will come in time. 
My biggest problem with this app is that when I have to stop watching a show or movie and come back to it later it doesn’t start where I left off. It starts over and I have to find my spot. This becomes especially challenging when my kids are watching a show and I don’t know what season or episode they are on! 
So as soon as Disney decides to add that feature as well as a continue watching section (like Netflix) this app will be perfect.

title: It’s an amazing app but …
review: There’s stuff missing. Ok so this app is so amazing I love it I have so much fun watching all the cool things but ... there’s some cool and awesome shows missing that we love so much ... I know there might be more missing but I searched for Ant farm and Austin and Ally and nothing shows up ... o didn’t search for more but I would love that u put the og’s on here ... you will make my dream come true … also like the newest movies are missing two like decedents 3 ... not that new but it’s recent ... anyways hope u guys in the future update the app and in the update more shows and movies will appear from our childhoods and now ... hopefully u see this and have a bless ... bye 👋

title: Why?
review: Great content. My 21 yo, 19yo, 16yo, and myself absolutely love watching all the old Disney shows we all grew up on....Except their absolute favorite The Proud Family, and my favorite Disney Princess movie Princess and the Frog. Is there a reason these Black shows are not available? I know there are other Black shows available, but my girls grew up on Proud Family and were disappointed it was not available. Yes, I know they are all old in kid years. And I’m probably too old to want to be a Disney Princess, but Princess and the Frog gave my Black daughters a Black Princess to look up too and want to be for Halloween. I know my review will probably get lost in the many reviews. I still hope to see Proud Family and Princess and the Frog on the app real soon.

title: Eh
review: It’s pretty good so far but some movies it just shows me trailers and I can’t watch the ACTUAL movie and it keeps narrating EVERYTHING?!?  it may not bother other people but It gets on my nerves more than the lady with her kids watching “KiDs bOp” like it will be like “Ariel kisses Sebastian and sits him back down” and stuff like that. And it’s like everything I watch so far. Sometimes it talks over the characters voices so the. I can’t hear anything that they are saying and it makes me super mad so idk if I want to use this app very much anymore so I might just go back to using my old dvds 😂 bcz they at least don’t have a narroratir . But otherwise the app still works okay. Mine freezes up somethimes.. but it can still work pretty good u guess

title: Some bugs but great to have
review: Ok so, I’m finding movies I thought I would never get to watch again cause I literally could not find them online or on disc. It’s amazing. The app it’s self has some issues. Movies are shown multiple times in a row like 3 animated Alice in wonderlands next to each other instead of other shown in that category. There is no continue watching category so you have to search the show you were watching every time you wanna find it. It’s also difficult to get on in certain places. Error codes pop up saying it not available an a certain regions it should be available. But the quality of shows and streaming is great. I’m excited to watch the movies of my childhood

title: Starts series over from beginning every time Urg!!
review: I have used Disney plus for a full day now. It has several glitches, but the buggiest issue is when watching a series it doesn’t sync between applications ie different TV’s or iPad and it doesn’t pick up where you left off (like Netflix) - it starts you over at season 1 episode 1. That’s ANNOYING! Also I have had to save to my watch list on each TV, iPad, or iPhone we have. It didn’t sync between all of them automatically. I realize they will fix and work out bug and issues in the days to come, but please, please, please fix the issue of starting from where viewers ended their last view vs starting show or movie over from beginning.

title: A Few Launch Issues
review:
Was excited to rewatch some cartoons, but several (DuckTales, Phineas and Ferb) are out of order, which is a problem for a series with season-long story arcs. Plus some shows (Gravity Falls, DuckTales) do not show all the episodes when you open them, forcing you to watch or fast forward through an episode then pick “See All Episodes.” This does not unlock them permanently and you have to do it again if you are planning to watch any out of order or try to skip to the latest episode. I also managed to blank out the home screen, no idea how.

Very content packed, but needs some fixes! Hopefully the lower rating will alert them to the issue so we can all enjoy these shows!

title: Great App
review: It is a really great app. I wish Sofia the First was on it. That is one of the greatest shows I’ve ever watched. Please please please consider adding it because it is literally the best. I was a girl in the village doing alright. Then I became a princess overnight now I gotta figure out how to do it right, so much to learn and see.  Up in the castle with my new family, in a school that’s just for royalty. A whole enchanted world in waiting for me. I’m so excited to be Sofia the first! I’m finding out what being royal’s all about. SOFIA THE FIRST! Making my way it’s an adventure everyday. SOFIA. It’s gonna be my time. SOFIA. To show them all that I’m SOFIA THE FIRST!!!!!!

title: Disney+ is great, but loads slowly sometimes
review: I have had this app for a few months now, and I have loved it! I really enjoy watching all of my old favorite Disney channel series on it. It brings back some great memories from movies I love!! The only thing that bothers me with the app OCCASIONALLY is that sometimes it takes forever to load when you are in an area with not the best WiFi. That is not the type of thing I would dock a star for, and I definitely recommend this app to anyone looking for a good app to watch movies and shows on. I love everything else about this app! Everything!

title: Great movies, app is junk.
review: First off we are rating the app not the service, so all the reviews talking about the service and movies are in the wrong place, this is about the app... The app takes a minute or two to open and load the page and after about 15 minutes of not being in the app I have to reload it and reconnect to the chome cast even though it is still play. The worst thing about it is even if the movie says “resume” or “continue watching” it starts the whole movie over if you connect before hitting resume, if you resume on your device and then connct to your tv it works fine. Disney+ does not care and has yet to address the issue which has been going on since the start. Need to get the people from netflix to make a proper app since I have no issues with that one..

title: Why can't I get full screen on my iPad?
review: I find it a little strange that I can't view anything in full screen.  It doesn't even auto rotate depending on how you're holding the iPad.  I thought maybe a setting was off, but there isn't one to adjust.  When I stream from other apps, the screen adjusts accordingly.  I hate watching everything in a little box on my 10" screen.  Makes no sense using an iPad with this app if it won't take advantage of the device's screen size.  At least if it rotated, that would have been a little better, but it doesn't even do that.

title: Love it!
review:
Definitely love Disney plus! It works great on my phone connected to the tv via hdmi adapter. I love the content. The app is clean and pretty simple to navigate. I’ve seen others say it and I’ll say it too. How do I know what I’ve watched and not watched? We need a continue watching section and a way to tell if we’ve started playing something or finished it and where are we in it?

Also, we need to find our watchlist easier than going into the profile and clicking a few things. It should have its own place on the front screen near the top much like Netflix. 

Otherwise, I love the experience and content. Works better than Apple TV+!

title: So much to watch!
review: Giving this 5 stars! I had my doubts about how awesome this streaming service was going to be, didn’t realize it was going to have so much to watch. I spent my first night after signing up, picking out movies and shows that I want to watch with my kids, movies I used to watch on VHS, and shows that I haven’t seen in almost 20 years. It’s been a good blast from the past! Missing some Disney junior shows that my youngest would definitely love, but I’m going to give it time for it to come up, can’t be disappointed in all that we have to choose from in the mean time!

title: I Love It!
review: Really good app. My sisters and I love all the shows and movies, especially since we grew up watching them. My dad is watching the National Geographic shows. We really like it and the deal we got with Verizon. But I have read through some reviews and I agree with some. Like adding a continue watching list. And I have seen all of the TikTok’s that it’s a war between Disney+ and Netflix. Both are really good apps. I love both. I have no problems with this app and I am really enjoying everything. Ultimately, the only flaw that should be fixed and added is the continue watching list. That is why I put 4 stars and not 5. Thank you Disney for this app. 💝💝💝💖💖💖

title: Continue watching.
review: ***Edit**** you fixed the “resume” watching when you click on the show or movie, but it isn’t up front or lost somewhere easily seem. I have to try to remember what I’m watching, and what episode or season I’m on when I’m watching a series. Super inconvenient. The app is almost perfect. The only thing that is missing is a “continue watching” feature. Even though whatever I’m watching will pick up where I stopped watching, I have to go back to the menu to go back to it. And that is especially frustrating when I am watching a series and have to remember what episode I left off at. Please fix this. TIA

title: Love it but sound really needs to be fixed
review:
I am a huge Disney fan and have been looking forward to the Mandalorian since it was first announced.  Overall lots of great content and I was surprised by all the good non-traditional Disney shows that are available.

Now for the reason I only gave 3 stars.  The sound is not consistent on any show, on any platform. I have to turn the volume all the way up to hear normal speaking conversations but then turn the volume down in the action scenes because it gets way too loud.  Watching on a plane with sound isolation headphones, even with volume turned all the way up, I couldn’t really hear the quiet conversation parts of Guardians of the Galaxy and Mandalorian.  Disney... please fix...

title: Good, but could be improved!
review: The app has gotten more user friendly since it’s start, but I am still noticing some things that I think would make it better. The first thing I have noticed is when I pull down on my phone screen to check a message or something, the show/movie continues to play instead of pausing, like the Netflix app does. The second thing would be that the fast forward/rewind 10-second along with the pause button only come up sometimes - when they aren’t there, it’s a circling ‘loading’ signal even when the show/movie is playing. These are just a couple of the very ‘nit-picky’ things I have seen that could make the app better!

title: It’s a Very Nice
review: Impressed with a lot of what I’ve seen here. I appreciate how much has been opened up from the Disney vault for our viewing pleasure. I’ve also made good use of the download functionality for when I’m on the go to conserve data, so that’s nice. There’s good value for the money here. I’m glad I got a year free from Verizon to get me started. I personally anyways haven’t yet experienced any technical difficulties with the app. I just wish there was a share functionality so I could use Facebook or Messages to share my favorite shows and movies. I want to spread the word about Togo, loved it! 👍

title: Love it
review:
Let’s just get to the point I love it but I have one thing so I stay up to 12am to see the new mando ep but it wasn’t out it is psychological Friday so I don’t see why this would not work just a little heads up for any one but any ways it’s cheaper then Netflix and I love it mandolin was good an in Disney and I love how the new ride (rise  of the resistance) just wanted to give some props it’s worth it go buy it now I love my friends love it my dad loves I love it and you should too it’s not very good AT THE START because you don’t really know any shows but mandolin but after a little and you start exploring
Shows it’s amazing

title: OMG what the heck this is the best thing that has ever happened to me
review:
Omg I love this so flipping much. Like before, I watched Disney Now and it didn’t cost me anything but you had to UNLOCK an episode if you wanted to watch it. And that, was very hard. And also, you could only unlock, like, 2 episodes once a month. The struggle, was real. Look, I may just seem like wuss wagon here, but it hard. Like, I wanted to watch camp rock, but I couldn’t because I hadn’t unlocked it. So I went to Apple to watch it, and guess what? IT SENT ME BACK TO DISNEY NOW!!!! But when Disney+ came out, I was crying. I mean, you can watch stuff that isn’t even out yet, like lady and the tramp live action. Also, don’t forget mandorlorian! (Baby yoda, marry me) sure, it’s 6 bucks a month, but that’s an amazing deal. I’m so excited for new episodes this Friday for MANDELORIAAAAAN! So yes, this app is AWESOME. 

A dream is a wish your heart makes.
Quote Cinderella

My dream already came true. Thank u everyone who works at Disney, for making something huge.

title: App is fine, extremely difficult to cancel
review:
I signed up for the free trial via my iTunes account - the app worked just fine! However, I decided the content wasn’t worth it for me. The issue I had was cancellation. If you sign up on phone like I did, it is very difficult to cancel! You have to go through the iTunes app (which did not work on my phone, so I had to use my laptop), login about 6 different times, and the instructions to cancel on Disney+’s FAQs are still inaccurate. I had to contact Apple support and “report a problem” to even have the option to cancel.
Overall, the app itself is fine, but do not sign up through your iPhone if you think you may not use it!!

title: Love it... but
review:
I am obsessed with Disney plus and the future things it will bring. But I find it a but uncomfortable that it doesn’t have a “continue watching” feature. It would make it for the viewer so my so much easy to continue watching their favorite shows. So far we have to search the show we want to watch. I also would like to add I’m not aware of every programming it may offer since the home page always shows the same programing. Please mind adding a “because you watched *xyz*” type of feature that can show other shows or movies that are within your interest.

Much love and continue the good work.

title: Great Content but app needs work
review: They have great content but the app needs work. When watching a series it always starts me like 5 episodes behind from where I stopped watching. Then I have to fast forward that episode just to get to the episode list. It should start you at the episode list instead of it streaming right way.  Same thing for movies. It starts me off where I left off even if I finished the movie so I have to rewind like a vhs. Which is very annoying. My 5 yr old is very techy and is able to use other streaming apps on her own but I had to teach her that she has to rewind in order to restart the movie.

title: Amazed initially. Looking forward to improvements.
review:
It’s fantastic. 

Need everything Disney has ever done. Organized into better categories. When I can easily bounce between animated, classic movies, new stuff like the Mandelorian, and series like Zorro, I’ll pay $20 a month. Just give me everything Disney ever made and I’m sold for life. For now, I’m an in-and-out customer. Put it all there, get rid of the Vault, and I’m done. 

Or, if you’re gonna keep the vault, at least give me an option to purchase while it’s out of the vault. I want this to be a thing I pass down to my kids when I have them.

title: Absolutely love but there’s one problem
review: I downloaded the app when it first came out and it is absolutely wonderful!! However, one problem has caused me great sadness: every once in a while it will sign me out and I can’t sing back in! It tells me to call customer service when I try. This happened two days after I first downloaded it, I canceled my subscription and signed in with a different account. For a while, it worked, until today when it happened again! I just want to know what that’s about. Otherwise, it’s fantastic, keep making original series and I will keep throwing my money at you, Disney!!

title: Great streaming service
review: I love Disney+ but their some features that need to be added like for example on Netflix right after you finish watching an episode a little red line shows up which it shows you that you watch that episode already and on Disney+ it doesn’t I sometimes forget which episodes I watch because it doesn’t show a blue line on continue watching it shows a blue line that shows you where you left off at also another issue is that some movies are not available to watch some you wait a while to come out for example some are releasing in 2020 and other in 2021 why is that

title: Decent but one major complaint
review: Love that Disney has put all of their titles in one place, making it so easy to access all of your favorites. My one major complaint is that if you log out of the app, all of your items downloaded to watch offline disappear. My daughter accidentally logged out of her app right before a 6 hour flight and the movies she had downloaded to watch while on the flight no longer were there when we logged her back in. This might seem trivial but we were then unable to download anything as we were at the airport. This is a feature that should be fixed

title: Love it, but bugs need fixed ASAP
review: I love Disney+. I love having all these Disney movies at my fingertips for my family to watch. Especially the older ones that they have never seen. However I keep running into the same issue of getting kicked out of a movie we are watching and then when I go back and try and click on it...it won’t open and it’s not just that movie. I can maneuver through the app but can’t play any movies. I usually wind up getting frustrated and exiting out and coming back hours later but I shouldn’t have to do that with a paid app. Please fix soon so we can continue to enjoy the Disney+ app.

title: The app needs work. Content 🔥
review:
I know it is new but ... the app borders on annoying *now less annoying* 

Going from things like Netflix, xfinity and even AppleTV ... to this leaves a lot to be desired. Your Watchlist isn’t easily accessible, it’s under your profile. *edit/updated* they are making improvements!! “Continue watching” was added! Makes it much easier to watch a series Mandalorian is amazing!! ... 

 It’s easy enough to restart something from the beginning however the only option is to “resume” then start over. 

I love that Netflix pauses play when you are trying to turn off/on subtitles. Disney+ drops down this fog screen that blurs your view and whatever you’re watching continues to play. At least if you’re going to continue to play it shouldn’t cover the entire screen .. like xfinity. 

I also noticed that there are recommendations now as well ;) ... it’s getting there. 

The interface itself is honestly beautiful. I’m loving the content. Hopefully it only improves from here.

title: Great idea but needs work!
review:
I love how much Disney+ offers! And I’m happy that the developers have added the “continue watching” feature. But it’s annoying that there’s no “view all” option for different categories. You either have to remember all the movies you used to watch, or hope that a movie shows up in the suggested list of another movie. 
For example, I didn’t see ‘Heavyweights’ in the list of 90s movies or throwbacks. It wasn’t until I watched ‘The Sandlot’ that I saw ‘Heavyweights’ in the suggested list. There should be an option to view ALL 90s movies, not just some. Or ALL Action/Adventure, not just a few. 
Maybe simplifying the way you categorize the movies will allow you to do this.

title: Finally!
review:
So excited it’s here and this will replace my other subscriptions. I love it, the content, the layout and especially for my daughter to watch all her favorite shows. 
My only issue that I found was and don’t know if it’s just me but there seems to be a glitch on any series when switching between seasons where it doesn’t update the episodes instead it’ll show the previous ones when just browsing and it seems as if I have to remember where I am in a series especially if you didn’t start at episode 1. Other than that I absolutely love it!

title: Idea for Disney+
review: I like this entertainment app with companies that Disney owns. I usually like Disney apps where dreams can come true. But this one was epic enough that it became No.4 in Entertainment. Here’s why I’m writing this : so 11 days ago, I had a note in my mail app from My Disney and it said something about new updates, exclusive offers, new movie trailers, and birthday messages. Then, I saw that four of the companies Disney owns that I know weren’t on Disney+. So here what you should add, you should add Lucasfilm Ltd, ABC, Freeform, and ESPN. I don’t if it will happen or not, but I bet this will happen in an update soon.

title: Fix the download playback issues!
review:
I live in a rural area without internet so I heavily rely on going in to town to download shows on my iPad  and then watch them at home via a lighting dock connector to my tv. Getting content this way has been very difficult during the pandemic, but has been made more frustrating by the fact that when doing this I get playback issues. 

Downloaded episodes or movies will play fine on my iPad alone, but as soon as I connect it to my tv via the dock connector I get  the “oh no, something went wrong playing X”. But it will play fine on the iPad when the connector is removed. Please fix this! I enjoy the content available on the app but I’m rarely able to use it because of this issue!

title: It’s great, but some content needs to be added
review: I’ve been using the app since a day or two after it came out and I can say that so far it’s been great. I like that it uses my default subtitles that I set on my iPhone and iPad. But there are things that can be added for all of the movies and the big addition has to be director’s commentary. I expected to see it at launch but it wasn’t available yet. There are some fantastic commentary tracks for Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars that aren’t available to view yet on Disney+. Once these are added I can’t see much to improve on, because overall the app has been and is still fantastic.

title: Needs “Continue Watching” List
review:
Love love love all the content on Disney+! Completely brings my childhood back.
Only problem is if I close the app and go back in, there’s no “Continue Watching” list. So i have to search for the tv series I was watching. I also have to figure out which episode I was on as there is no red bar like Netflix to show that you finished an episode or where you left off. 
It’s also a problem for my son as he can’t always remember which episode he left off on since he can’t see a red bar and pressing the play button goes back to the first episode. 
Please fix this and it will be absolutely perfect.

title: Money Scheme?
review: After using our subscription for about a week, our Disney + account was cancelled without notice even after paying for the subscription for an entire year. Calling customer service was pointless as they only said that we would have to pay the full amount we already paid for the year long subscription AGAIN instead of restoring our account status or refunding. I’ve heard of the same thing happening to other people as well, so I wouldn’t bother paying for an account if they just take it away from you a week later. The only reason this has 2 stars is because the app worked fine and had great content, it’s unfortunate that such a large company would fail to rectify this issue.

title: Great family streaming service
review:
My entire family loves Disney+ !! We constantly find new movies and shows to watch. I am a huge fan of the Disney originals as well. Like Noelle, and Mandalorian. (Baby yoda will melt your heart) for anyone that isn’t giving this streaming service 5 stars is just not patient enough. They’re a new streaming service and still working out all the kinks and btw they’re doing great with releasing new updates. I know you all remember when Netflix first came out and oh boy it’s been a long road. Give Disney+ the same chance you gave Netflix. That’s all. 

Stay weird, enjoy !

title: Missing key features
review: The app looks amazing. The content is extensive and presented well. The app functions flawlessly and presents video in extremely good quality. I also like the fact that you can create accounts. However, there are 2 key features that nearly every other streaming service offers that Disney+ has left out: 1) a continue watching que - if I have to leave a video and do something else for a bit, it takes awhile to search for what I was watching again, and 2) there is no “watch list” I can create in order to easily find shows or movies I want to watch later. These really should be no-brainer features included in any streaming service

title: Service is fantastic.  App is subpar.
review:
For a release like this, with the resources that they have, I expected so much more from Disney on this App.  It’s like they purposely left off several of what have become key features of streaming platforms.  Things like a Currently Watching tab, or a way to start a movie over that doesn’t require a manual “rewind” of the movie.  For shows, it does not keep your place in the series; you either have to remember the exact episode, or roll through several of them.

These are all simple things.  If the app wasn’t so clunky, everyone would give it 5 stars.  Really, most people who have given it 5 stars, are only grading the content, rather than the app.

title: App needs improvement
review: It’s getting pretty annoying when I need to find the show every single time to watch it! The show or the movie does not appear for me as “Recently watched” theres not even an option of recently watched!! Thats insane thats one of the most important things to add on the app! I literally have to go to the search bar every single time to watch the show I was watching or the movie I haven’t finished watching. Also sometimes when I click on the show that I am watching it takes me right back to episode one! And I don't even remember where I left off. This app looks so simple and doesn’t even look like they put a lot of work into it, hopefully a new update will come so it can fix all these problems.

title: put the tv episodes in order!
review: I have to start off by saying I love this app. I watch something on it almost every day. The only reason I am leaving a review is so that hopefully someone who works their will see this because the show I was watching the episodes were not in the right order! In Austin and Ally Season 4 episode 19 and 20 should be switched! *spoiler (I had no idea when they had got engaged, who was running the music store, since when was Trish and actress, etc) I had to go back and rewatch it cause I was so confused 😅 so it’s a great app just I would appreciate it if the episodes are in the right order! Thanks

title: Watchlist
review: For how much I'm paying for the service, the app is pretty limited. The most annoying pain point for me is that my watchlist doesn't show all the items I added to it. I thought this was just a TV app glitch but unfortunately it seems to be a problem with the Disney+ interface. It's like there's a limited amount that you can add before it disappears from the list. I have to manually search for a show/movie I might've added to the list a month ago. It'll show a check mark signifying that it's in my list but when I go to my list, it's not there. I rely on the watch list for easier access and filtration to things I actually want to watch.

title: Great content, awful video player
review:
The video player needs to hide it’s controls when you pause, or know the difference between swiping from the bottom of your screen and actually trying to skip. Really, very annoying to be watching Gravity Falls or Pixar, looking for easter eggs, pausing, and having the skip and pause buttons in the way. Also annoying to pull up control center, to change brightness, volume, headphones/speaker, and skip to the end of the movie the 13th time. I leave the app to change volume. 4/5.

Actually, can we just have Apples built in video player? That’s what I really want

title: No “Currently Watching” Option
review:
The app is great, and has all my favorite shows, but I think a “currently watching”/“continue watching” list should be available on the main page of the app. 

there is a watch list, which works just the same, but when you click on a show there is no play button that will pick up where you left off. you have to scroll down to the episode you last watched. netflix has a button that says “resume S1 E15” which makes watching a tv show much easier

maybe i’m just being lazy, but the app could stand to have more shortcuts. other than that, it’s great

title: It’s a good app but...
review: It’s awesome having mostly every Disney show/movie made in just one app. It’s just not worth what your paying, you don’t really get every single movie/show Disney has put out or if it’s there episodes are missing. You should really consider adding in a lot more content. I see a lot marvel movies missing, Disney XD shows are missing, episodes of Disney shows. If you see people spend there money on this you should really consider what you advertise because it’s not on the app. They advertise so much stuff and not even half is actually there. Some say coming soon, but aren’t even on the app. What is this really?? It just looks like disney is trying to make more money.

title: Disappointed with “Offline” viewing
review:
First, we love the app and the availability of the old Disney classics!  “Offline viewing” would seem to make it useable for us without unlimited high speed internet availability at home.

Our thought was download content to a phone when in an area with good signal, and then at home (with poor internet service) to airplay to an AppleTv over our WiFi.  Air playing offline Disney+ content that is already on a phone apparently will NOT play directly from the phone to the AppleTV on WiFi , but downloads the movie AGAIN over the internet To the AppleTV.  We do not have enough data or speed at home to do that.  Was the Airplay play feature of Disney+ intentionally designed that way?  

The same appears to be true when casting from the phone to a smart tv.

Bottom line: if I don’t have a high speed unlimited connection, I cannot watch an offline previously downloaded movie on any Device other than the device it was downloaded on.  Pretty hard to have a family movie night watching it on a phone.

title: Disappointed
review: I love the content Disney+ has, but I’m really disappointed. We unfortunately live in a rural area where we can’t get good internet, so I was really excited to discover you could download Disney+ content to your device. It worked great for my kids, because I could download things to their tablets for in the car. However, lately things have NOT been wanting to load. Sometimes I have to restart the app, sometimes I have to restart their tablets, and sometimes that doesn’t even work. Even thought they are DOWNLOADED, so there should be absolutely no reason that they won’t load. It has caused many a tantrum, and serious disappointment. If it does it much longer, I will unfortunately be canceling my subscription.

title: Love Disney+.....but.....
review: The content is GREAT! Would LOVE to see some of the Touchstone Pictures movies on here! Wonderful World of Disney classics with Walt Disney on here! As far as the App. If I check something to add to my watch list it adds it but if I go back into the movie I just added it’s no longer checked as added and that gets confusing making me wonder if I added it already or not, it should stay checked till I remove it....if I leave the app. and then come back I would like a “currently or recently watched list to go to so I can get back to what I was just watching faster. Other than those small things....the App. would be ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️!!

title: Great app but needs a few major things
review: The Disney plus app is great. A real blast from the past. There are a few major features that are missing such as a “currently watching” or a “continue watching” list. I would like to see “my personal favorite” list on the home screen instead of having to click on my profile to find my list. There needs to be an indicator bar showing you where you left off and there needs to be an indicator knowing what episodes your watched. I noticed there are duplicates on my personal favorites list. Also I noticed if I try to take a screenshot, the picture is black screen instead of the actual picture showing.

title: Love It, But Needs Some Tweaks
review:
I love Disney & this app is wonderful! However, I do wish that there was a currently watching/continue watching area where I can pick up where I left off instead of having to type in or find what I was watching. 
Also, when I search on the app for all movies a-z, it only shows about 15-20 movies. And even when I break it down to a specific genre, it only shows a small portion of all the movies I know are on there. And it does the same for TV shows as well. 
I know the app is new and upcoming, so I’m not expecting it to be perfect, but if these two things could be considered, I think it’d be 5 stars!

title: Disney Rocks!!!!
review:
Everything that Disney owns at your finger tips for an incredible low price, what more can you ask for? 

I am a parent in his 40s with small kids, and until now I really couldn’t find the animated series that I watched as a small kid to share with them.  I loved the Gummi Bears, Tale Spin, Rescue Rangers, the original Duck Tales, and so many more.  Getting to sit down with them this morning and watch some of those shows with them before school, was like being a kid again on Christmas morning. 

Thank you Disney, don’t change a thing selection wise and you have a customer for life.

title: Group Watching
review:
I absolutely love group watching! It is fantastic how my family won’t have to count down from 3 to synchronize our viewings when my step-father is away. I love it so much, and that warrants an easy 5 from me! =‘D 

However, I dislike the exclusive nonsense around the new Mulan. $30 on top of a subscription? It feels like it exploits FOMO! I think it should have been released at regular online movie fronts (your iTunes, Google Play, etc...) like how Scoob!, Face the Music, and the Trolls sequel. I really hope you don’t repeat it for Black Widow. Either way, it’s stayin’ at 5 for me! Awesome work!

title: Glitchy
review: I love Disney, which is why my review is greater than one star. However, the app is not running as smoothly as everyone else claims it to be. I know the app had just began today, and I am expected the experience some minor glitches but it does get annoying. I have to close the app every single time and let it load again. Sometimes when I open the app, the brands are missing. Sometimes I only see “Disney and Pixar”. Then when I close the app they all come up “Disney, Pixar, National Geographic, Marvel and Star Wars.” Its very frustrating. Half the time the shows are missing too. I hope this glitch is fixed soon, I really don’t want to have to do this every time I want to watch a show.

title: Great app but loading and crashes
review: I love this app!! Best Disney idea ever BUT ever since day 1, the app on my iPhone won’t load and my internet connection is strong. Or it’ll just crash and close it out on its own and I have to go back into the app and find my show again. I’ve tried it on my Chromebook and it glitches and shuts down. And that’s with a strong connection. Please fix bugs. Or create separate networks for certain regions so an abundant amount of people world wide can be on at the same time. I watch it after work and at night and it keeps crashing but rarely crashes of I use it during my lunch break.

title: A+!!!
review: I love Disney+!! It has everything; you want National Geographic?They have it!! You wanna watch some classics from when you were a kid like ducktales? They have it, along with the reboot, so you can compare! But, I mostly got this for all the Star Wars stuff, ‘cause I’m a huge fan. And they have nearly every single show and movie, including the mandalorian, which stars the most adorable baby alien ever(gizmo never stood a chance), Baby Yoda!!!! Who doesn’t wanna watch him do cuteness all day! And now, they even have the X-men films that FOX made, along with the whole. entire. show. of. the. Simpsons!!!!!! A++ Disney!!!

title: Great content but......
review: Some of the movies are censored for no reason. For example the animated beauty and the beast is missing a whole scene! It’s the scene where the enchanted objects clean the castle and sing the song “when we’re human again.” Why would an innocent movie like that be censored? I’m paying monthly for this app so that I can watch all my favorite Disney movies all in one place, but then chunks of movies are missing. If you can’t offer a complete and original content then I can watch all these movies online or buy the DVD’s. Please fix this problem as soon as possible.

title: Amazing App
review: This app is amazing. It has all the classics. I like that once you pay for it you get everything else free! When you are in a rush to get a movie it has a bunch of different categories to choose from including action/adventure movies. I also like that they actually update the app with what’s new. Since COVID-19 is out and when you want to watch a movie you can’t go to the movies to watch one but this app makes it possible so you can have fun while being at home. All in all this app is worth a 5 star to me. Keep up the good work . Thanks developers!

title: I’m a little disappointed
review: I was so exited for Disney plus, but then it was not what I expected. I was lead to think that everything Disney was on here even all the shows from companies they own, nope. They don’t even have all the Disney shows, they select what is on there. Also there are no rated R movies either so no Deadpool even though it’s Marvel. Lastly it’s pause/play  system is really finicky on my phone. I’m sometimes just randomly kicked out of watching a show which I do not enjoy. But, overall I have to give it a three stars because I have enjoyed watching the old tv shows that were available. I just wish there was more control in the hands of the consumer.

title: Account Control Options
review: I gave my disney+ password to my (at the time) boyfriend and now that we split i changed the password thinking it would log him out but it didn’t. i know on netflix they give an option to log all devices out of the account when the password is changed and i think that should be something highly considered. when logging into the account at a friends house or something we should be able to log them out since disney+ only allows 4 profiles to be made. it is important that account owners are aware of who is logged on and when they can log someone out.

title: Great App
review:
Thank you for an easy to use app across multiple platforms. I truly appreciate being able to browse your movies and other content quietly and peacefully without those annoying auto-previews that Ne*fl** and Pr*** subject us to. I do like to watch a movie all the way through, credits and all, so would prefer not to have the viewing screen minimize at the end. 

I use your service on Apple TV, Roku, Firestick, Webos on LG television, iPhone app, Mac and Windows. The features and usability are fairly consistent across all these platforms. I am hopeful that you will add new content in the future.

title: Disney+
review: My family and I love Disney+!  My family has a short-attention span, so whenever or wherever, we can pull out our phones and with a touch of a button, we have the #1 rated app for entertainment at our fingertips.   Disney+ has been a huge blessing for us.  Me and my husband our able to watch movies from our childhood, and my kids have picked up on very appropriate, kid-friendly, and funny shows for their age groups.  Not to mention, you can stream from multiple devices all in one account.  Thank you for everything you’ve done for us!

title: HDMI adapter not working
review: I’m enjoying the Disney+ content so far, I love having the option to watch all these movies whenever I want. That being said, it’s a real bummer that the HDMI adapter screen mirroring functionality doesn’t work. Often I’ll get audio going to the TV but no video. I have no problems with all of my other screen mirroring supported apps but for whatever reason it doesn’t work with Disney+. I wish it did as I have no other way to watch movies from the streaming service on my TV. I would recommend the service to anyone but the app’s lightning to HDMI adapter screen mirroring functionality doesn’t work well.

title: Where was I?
review: I agree with others. The content is obviously awesome! I think it’s categorized well. Easy to navigate. But I really hope they add features like saving where you left off in a show/movie if you leave the app. I also hope they add the ability to see what you’ve watched, particularly in a series. My daughter likes Jessie. There are 4 seasons. One show will start right after the other, which is great. But the next day, when you go to that series, you have no idea where you left off or which ones you’ve already seen. Please get this remedied on the next update. It would make life so much easier!

title: Disney+
review:
I love Disney+, I’ve had ever since it came out! Now I do admit I think there should be more Disney series or more stuff that comes out more often. I generally love how Disney did this with Marvel, National Geographic, etc. I also love how people who don’t go to the movies a lot can just get Disney+ and watch all sorts of movies and short clips that they missed out on. Especially if it’s no longer in theaters... 

        My favorite series is from Disney and it was really disappointing that they didn’t have it. I hope they put more series, short clips, movies, etc. in Disney+. Overall Disney+ is AWESOME!

title: A great app, but a small problem!
review: I have enjoyed watching some of my early childhood favorites such as suite life of Zack & Cody and Good luck Charlie. Although these great shows bring back a lot of nostalgia for me there is a small problem. If I shut off the electronic I’m watching these shows on off, then when I come back the show does not leave off where I had ended. Thus leaving me stranded upon a wide array of episodes not knowing where I had left off. I believe that this issue can be solved with one quick update. Although this small issue can be very frustrating I am very thankful for this app and the entertainment it brings!

title: Awesome! But needs a few tweaks....
review: Like most other reviews say, the content is top notch! Keep it coming! The apps for iOS & Roku (and others I am sure) need some more sections. Def need the app to remember where I was inside a given show if I pause and come back another day, but also needs to remember what was the last episode I watched of any series so I don’t have to work it out each time. Also need a “what’s new” section so we know when new episodes of series (ie; Mandalorian, J Goldblum, Forky, Imagineering, Pixar in life). Maybe as someone else mentioned a “Continue watching” section?  Keep up the good work and keep that old content coming! Thank you

title: Amazing!
review:
Disney + has so much amazing content on there however, like one of the reviews mentioned. It doesn’t have a “Continue watching” or “Currently watching” section which is a bit annoying because you have to go back to either the search menu or to your watch list to find the show or movie you were watching. It does pick up where you left off once you find it though. 

 Disney+’s original show The Mandalorian is such an amazing, fresh, exciting, and different show that really sets the bar for Disney+ original shows.

Over all the app and its contents are great! I recommend it hands down!

title: Great App - But Missing Element
review:
The app is obviously amazing if you are a Disney fan. Great movies and such. I know there are some current infringements on some titles due to contracts with other streams and will be late to release, which is fine. 

However, unlike other streaming apps, this currently does not offer “Currently Watching” or “Continue where left off” for the iOS system. This is super frustrating especially when I’m streaming from my phone and have to close out due to something happening and then attempting to return to the title. So frustrating... I know with feedback, this is something I am sure you will implement.

title: Great App! Some Adjustments Needed Though.
review: This app is really good they have all my favorite shows and movies there are just some things that need fixed. I love the app don’t get me wrong but if I watch it on my phone then it will cut out part of the screen so I can’t see the captions and so I can’t see most of the scene. I have also been waiting for this one movie to come on and they said that it would be on Disney+ July 17 and it still is not on there. I have checked everyday multiple times but have still not been able to find it. Otherwise it is an amazing app and I really do use much more then Netflix.

title: Amazing but one slight inconvenience..
review: I was super hyped for Disney Plus and it didn’t disappoint. I got it the day after launch to try to avoid bugs and glitches and it has worked totally fine for me. It has all the content I could ask for. There is one problem— I wish it would be able to stream on a 2015 LG tv. It only is available for the 2016 models and higher. I got it on my Xbox, so I can still watch it on the TV, so I’m happy. Just a little annoyed that I would have to go buy a roku stick or something if I wanted to be able to watch it from the tv itself.

title: There a problem with loading this one tv show
review: The Disney the owl house I had been waiting for 2week now for it to load and I’m tiered of waiting I’m all ready behind and the series finally is coming out soon so please fix this I really want to watch the show but it won’t load .also this is over all a great app and am I the only one with this problem? because it should be fix by now and it nothing on my end it something with “Disney end and quote on quoting my Dad “ so it over all it great app  with a few misshaped so can you fix it Disney .

title: Why Disney+ is the best
userName: Fortnite please let me get in
review: Disney+ is at 60% of being more popular than prime video the only way they could get to 100% of being the most popular tv app in the world is if they get is if they put in the loud house  in there app in unrelated news prime video is the least popular tv app  in the world. It’s more  ore of an app you buy stuff on anyway prime video has a pretty low bar there bar is at 10% that is pretty low but at least it isn’t at 2% unlike kodi but who cares about kodi everybody is mainly focused on Disney+ and prime video. This is ghost girl and video gamer signing off .

title: Love the Content and App works well!
review: The content that you can get on Disney+ is absolutely fantastic, everything from Star Wars to Pixar, to your favorite classics, Marvel and National Geographic! I use it all the time to watch content I love! And also, the app works great! It is never laggy, and it’s very intuitive so it makes the experience of watching what you want a breeze which is very important for a streaming service. Also works great on all platforms! I like watching on my computer, but it works just as well on my iPad or Phone if that’s what I want to watch on. Great job Disney!

title: Love app but needs privacy fixes
review: I honestly love this app and how I get to watch my favorite childhood shows! This app is very easy to work around but does have some minor things that I would change. First of all is that there is a thing going around that people can hack into your account and steel your money. If I were Disney I would definitely fix this. And last but not least is that one of my favorite childhood shows A.N.T farm isn’t on there. I don’t know if it’s just something Disney forgot or if they just haven’t added it yet, but I’m kinda getting impatient. Overall this app is great it just needs some fixes!

title: Good
review:
I know this is a new app in all,but there is a concern;ummm!Im 10 and i like to watch Elena of Avalor,buuuut I CANT WATCH SEASON THREE;YOU HAVE TO PAY!!!!!!😡💵Every DAY i see if SEASON THREE is for FREE,but guess what;IT’S NOT!!I’m glad you have other fun movies and shows like Tinker Bell,Monster Ink,Finding Dorry and Finding Nemo!😉☺️And Finding Dorry is for FREE!!!!!
I used to have Direct TV,and i was sooo sad to lose it!!!I was sooo sad!I losed all my movies and shows,but then we got Apple TV!And i didn't like it till My mom and dad got Disney+!!! I watched stuff like disney Junior and  The Sound of Music and Annie!But i saw on Dis-ney+ you have The Sound of Music and Zootopia and stuff that i used to have on dIRECTV!!!And please put the new movies in for free!!So,this app isn’t that bad,except for the Elena of Avalor stuff;so I recommend to get this app!!!oh,i forgot!!Please add annie Please please please!!!

Things to work on...
•Free season three of Elena!
•Add Annie 
•Make new movies FREE!

I love watching it on my iPhone 7 and my iPad!!And on my TV!!! So congrats!!!😘😘😘😘😘😘😘😘🤪🤪🤪🤪🤪🤪😝😝😝🤪🤪🤪👍🏽💕💕💕💕💕💕❤️❤️❤️❤️💕💕💕💕♥️♥️♥️♥️♥️💕💕💕💕❤️❤️❤️❤️♥️♥️♥️♥️!!!!Bye!!!

-Kory(nickname is Spunky)

title: So far so good
review:
So far I am not seeing the issues the people have been complaining of.

My only complaints are:
Better categorization with the option to view more movies/shows

Better searching 

As for these two, it’s frustrating to not be able to find a movie that is available until you see it as a recommendation from another one. Even searching for the title will yield nothing, but there it is as a recommendation.

Other than that, I’m disappointed that the list of movies/shows isn’t more robust. There are many films not released on here yet (Like Song of the South? We can keep Splash Mountain in the theme parks but not place the movie in queue so people can make their own decisions about this movie?) Not to mention some movies that are searchable but won’t be available for another three years? Like the original Adventures in Babysitting?

Other than that, it’s been surprising to go through the current list and discover movies that I didn’t realize were Disney releases.

title: Over playing
review: Love this app however we are constantly having issues with the app overplaying in the background. For example you go to open the app and it automatically starts playing whatever you were last watching in the background, you can view it you can’t see it, it’s only the sound. If you try to put on another movie or show or even click on the same show it then plays both shows, the original with only sound and the second with viewing and sound. Super frustrating, it will stay like this for days. So you can’t use the app at all

title: Age Issue
review:
I love this app so much. It’s great to be able to go and watch all of the disney classics and rewatch all of the MCU movies, but there’s one really annoying issue. 

My brother and I share an account and we are both unable to use the account because he’s a minor. Why can’t 17 year olds use Disney plus? There’s nothing that minors shouldn’t see on this app...it’s literally disney. I’m disappointed that we’ve been barred from this account just because we’re under 18.  

Why even let us sign up if you’re just going to keep us from using the app later on?

title: Will be great with a few fixes and additions.
review:
The content overall is great! A few more old shows/movies could be added, but I’m sure that will happen. 

One inconvenience is the absence of a continue watching/resume option. They could also add “watch again” and “because you watched ___” sections. Another inconvenience is that I cannot even log into my account while I am at school unless I use my mobile data (I am a college student). Obviously, I cannot do this on my Tv or my computer. 

Other than that, I am pleased. I just hope the login errors get fixed and that I can stream on campus wifi again.

title: An App Made From Dreams
review: I have always been a Disney geek. This app is my dreams all mixed into one beautiful scene! I love this app because I grew up watching Disney movies, Disney cartoons, Disney shorts, and Pixar films! My family is addicted (just like me!), and my mom got me into old Disney shows like Hannah Montana, and Lizzie Mcguire! I think this app is 100% appropriate, and great for a family movie night! Theres nothing that needs to be changed at all! It's perfect! Also, if you have verizon, you get Disney+ free for a whole year! What a great deal! Well now I'm bored and I might catch up on the Raven's Home series. Lights, camera, Disney+!

title: I will always love Disney no matter my age!
review: When I first heard about the Disney plus app i was so excited! I will always be a Disney fan as long as i live ! The ONLY negative thing i do have to say about the app is that it does not have a “continue watching” option. I work 6 days a week so it’s hard to watch full episodes at once or definitely even a full movie. its just a little disappointing that when I squeeze in my disney time i either have to remember or write down what episode and how far along i was on the tv show. As well as how far along i was into the movie. Other than that I genuinely do enjoy Disney plus <3

title: The amount of stupidity in the reviews is absurd
review: Most of the bad reviews are from tech illiterate people who can’t figure out how to log in, mad that they have to pay for it (it’s $7 a month people come on), or mad because their phones are too old and out of date to use it, and half of the people leaving bad reviews can’t even spell properly. This app needs the “continue watching” feature and the ability to start a previously watched episode from the beginning. Other than that it’s great and works amazingly. Thanks Disney!

title: Minor changes!
review: Love this app and it’s content! Would just love, like everyone else is suggesting is a “Continue Watching” area in the app, so shows that i watch and don’t finish can automatically appear in the app. Also for movies & episodes for shows to have an indicator or marker as to where i left off. I can’t tell what episodes i’ve already watched off of the title alone sometimes. (A bit disappointed at the fact that older animation shows from 2006+ aren’t included in the app yet. like Brandy and Mr. Whiskers, American Dragon: Jake Long, The Buzz on Maggie, Dave the Barbarian, and even Fish Hooks. But i’m hopeful that they will be included sooner or later).

title: I love it!
review: I honestly really do love this app and I’ve already lost myself in old movies and shows, but if I could pick one thing I don’t like. It’s how you don’t have a currently watching option when you sign on. And instead you have to find the show or movie again and hope it’s in your watchlist. I don’t know about anyone else but I like to just watch things and give them a try and sometimes I don’t add them to my watchlist and then I have to find them again. But all in all I love the app! As an avid Disney Lover I’m excited for this app and happy to use it! :)

title: Great selection needs work on resolution
review:
Love this app first of all. But definitely need some tweaks. Does not seem to save where you have left off on movies or shows so if you have to turn it off for any reason then you May have to start the movie or show over. 
My biggest complaint is the resolution on some of the movies and show. Like “Toy Story” “Frozen” and a few other. The colors are very dull and dim. Not anything like what it should Look  like. Even after changing the resolution on my tv to dynamic it still in not right. Almost pastel looking. If that would be fixed then o would have no complaints. Great app overall.

title: Love the app!
review:
Honestly, I love it. Only downside is that the mobile app is very much different compared to streaming on my Xbox in terms of use. For example, it would be nice to have like a pop-up menu bar where someone can get to their Watchlist faster or target seeing Movies or Series. Something to add in general would be like a ‘Continue to Watch’ category on the home screen. That would make it so much easier to find what I last watched.

I totally understand that Disney+ just launched and, there’s always some kinks to work out in the beginning. I’m just really glad that it’s here and I’m looking forward to see what unfolds!

title: The Simpsons cropped
review: I’ve always loved Disney+ from the moment I went on the site and when I saw the Simpsons I was very VERY excited. but I saw that the old/good episodes were cropped. I know that Disney said that they would fix this problem in early 2020 but it is early 2020 and in March. I would like to see a update for the app soon for this and other problems. Most People came to Disney+ for the Simpsons (or the Mandalorian) but I know that most people and I are disappointed about this I just hope you fix it soon or when you make Disney+ in the uk please give me a response to this please and if you do thank you

title: Great except a few small things
review: It’s a great service besides the initial launch problems - I’m annoyed that there isn’t a way to filter out the things that aren’t available yet; only to click on something and see “Coming 2021”. I’d rather be able to see a date sorted list of items that are on their way to the library. The other thing, is that there are several Disney series that are available on the platform, but not all of their seasons are available - I understand newer Disney original series going week to week, and I’m all for that (I hate binging). However, I’d like have access to all seasons of, for instance, the original 90’s Duck Tales, and they only have Season 1.

title: Just got this up and I am so excited!😃🤗🥳
review: I am so so excited to finally use it and I can’t wait to! It will be so fun I love some of the shows I already looked at the you know like the stuff that like you know where you can buy it I already looked at it and it looks so amazing! I already watched a few shows and it’s like mine blowing that is why I am giving this five points like you know five stars and I’m so excited for to watch a lot more I watch so many already like I got this up actually like about yesterday but it’s OK I still really really like it!

title: Great but needs a little more
