review: Growing up as a major Disney fan, I absolutely love Disney+. It really does have a ton of shows that are from Disney or companies from Disney, but there is a flaw. Today I searched for some old Disney shows that I remembered, but they weren’t there. This happened with 2 Disney XD shows, Mech-X4 and Mighty Med, also with some other Disney shows such as Dog with a Blog. I know that both Dog with a blog and Mighty Med were really old Disney shows, but older ones than those can be found on Disney plus. If there is a reason why these shows aren’t on Disney plus, please let me know, but if there isn’t, can you please add them?

title: App and Website are a little frustrating
review: I love that this is finally here. But I’ve noticed that there are little glitches in both the app and website. Once I’ve finished a movie or show, it will not leave my Continue Watching list. I’ve tried everything to get them off and they just won’t. It’s really frustrating and it’s getting crowded. Makes it harder to actually find the shows and movies I’m  still trying to watch. This actually almost makes me want to get rid of this because of how frustrating and difficult it is being. I’ve tried getting help from the support on both the app and website and nothing works.

title: Love
review:
Update: Now with this issue fixed I am completely in love with this. Thank you Disney for listening to us. 

I love the shows, and the unbridled access to things we haven’t had all in one location before. However, I don’t like that in order to continue watching a show I have to hunt it down. And after finding the show I then have to find the episode I’m on. I also don’t like that there is no indication of what has and hasn’t been watched. Otherwise I’m in love with Disney plus. Just makes it harder to watch full series of something.

title: The struggle of being active duty..
review: So I’m not sure if anyone else has a problem with this but I am currently over seas and if you’ve been in any branch of the military you know it can get pretty boring so you turn to your device and me personally I love my shows and when I heard of Disney+ I was so excited because it sounded so perfect with all the things I love to watch in one place so of course I got it immediately and it worked fine to take my money but as soon as I go to use it it’s not available since I’m over seas... I’m not sure if there is any way to even fix this or help but I know I’m not the only one who is suffering out here with it just staring me in the face every time I open my phone... if anyone reads this thank you for taking the time I hope something can be done

title: Essential if you have Apple TV
review:
After watching Mandalorian On Apple TV I decided I wanted to rewatch with my kids. The problem was that there was no way to rewind the episode, and even after letting the credits roll all the way to the end, selecting the episode would just start it with 14 seconds remaining. Siri wouldn’t rewind it. Using the Apple remote wouldn’t rewind it. There is no option for “start from the beginning” on the Apple TV Disney+ app. 

Fortunately, I recalled that I had started watching a movie on my phone and the Apple TV app picked it up where I left off on my phone. I was able to open the show on my phone, restart it there, and it restarted it on the Apple TV. Yay.

Now if only either app had a “now watching” or “resume watching” list, a playlist, or some other ease of use features that are standard on other streaming apps - yes, even at launch. 

As far as Disney+ is concerned, it is absolutely worth it. The selections are great, and right now Mandalorian is worth the price of admission alone.

title: Beautiful App, Great Content, terrible UX
review:
It's a given that Disney produces quality. The content is exceptional. The visual design of the app is impeccable. The biggest issue is with the user experience.

On mobile:
You're unable to access the scrubbing bar to proceed to a given point without having to battle the 10 seconds forward or backward function for far too long. A simple tap on the lower 1/4 of the screen should make it visible.

On all platforms
There's no easily found "continue watching" or "watch again" section that allows you to resume a series/movie you've started without having to search it again. On Apple TV that's rather annoying.
When watching a series again you have to manually rewind each episode, which is exceptionally annoying on mobile. The app continues at the auto skip point each episode rather than starting over at the beginning.
When you run into an episode you're not interested in a simple "next episode" function would be much easier than having to go back to all episodes.

title: Lots of potential
review: I tried the app and I fell in love with it. It had all of my favorite Disney shows and movies in one app. When I started using it a little bit more, I noticed how the show I would be watching would constantly need to load even though I had a really strong internet connection. I also noticed how when I would finish watching a specific episode, there was no way to tell I had already watched it. It would’ve been helpful if it had some sort of way of telling you that it was already watched. Overall, however, I am excited to see the app grow and fix these minor errors.

title: Love it
review: So I don’t normal right a review for no app. But this app I love love love love love it!! There are so many old movies and tv shows I grew up with. Back in 1987 and on, I have looked and looked for the move that I watch in elementary school, and the book I read. WILLOW, they have it on Disney plus. OMG I CANT BELIEVE IT!! Thank you so so much Disney, for bring back a movie I loved as child. Please keep bringing new content too it. Any think this is not worth the 6.99 After the free 7 day trial. You going too end up keeping it. I have gotten rid off a few other app. All I need is my Disney plus App. Thank you so much

title: Netflix.
review: Does anyone else notice how it’s set up a lot like Netflix? I love everything on it, but you can’t really see everything on it either, unless you know it’s there, just like Netflix. The only difference I found, is the fact it doesn’t have a continue watch section, where it saves your progress in a show/ movie and lets you access it quickly. I love Disney, and all the shows on it, but it’s sometimes a hassle when you want to watch an extra 5 minutes of your show as you get ready, but instead spend the five minutes looking for the show, episode, and place you’re at.

title: Great app, but one minor issue I’m starting to notice
review: It’s a great streaming service overall, but there’s one thing that’s been bugging me, regarding the aspect ratio of certain films. For some reason, some of the movies I’ve watched on the app tend to zoom in out of nowhere, and I don’t know how it happened, nor do I know how to fix it. Doesn’t say how to fix it in the settings of the app itself, or even in the phone settings. Reset the app, nothing worked. Shut off my phone, didn’t work. None of those methods worked, so if this is a minor glitch that’ll be fixed in a future update, then that’s fine.

title: Virtual Queues are terrible
review:
Virtual queues sound great but are actually awful. Four of us continually reloading the queue page right on time failed to get a reservation twice in one day. It would be better to let the people who really want to ride stand in line than making us punch useless buttons like monkeys only to be told that the incredibly high price we paid to enter this park was insufficient to secure even the right to stand in line for an hour or two for a ride. 

The help also needs work. Many obvious questions are not answered, such as how to link my ios app to my bracelet when my wife bought the tickets. I had to send a help email for which I still have not received a response.

Not up to Disney standards.

I absolutely love Disney plus. I use it all the time. I watch it in my room by my self. I watch it with my family. I watch it with my friends. I watch it everywhere I go. One thing that disappointed me was that on Friday when the shows come out, they don’t come out right when it’s 12:00. Me and my best friend stayed up on Thursday night so we could watch our favorite, High School Musical: The Musical: The Series, but when the clock turned 12 we went straight to Disney plus. We were disappointed when we saw that no new episode was out. But other than that Disney plus is amazing and worth the money.

title: Thrilling Content but No Casting
review: I love Disney+ and just watched Endgame today but lately, the day following the activation of my account, I have been confronted with consistent buffering, long wait times, and difficulty showing it on my TV via the Chromecast. I have to turn off my home internet to watch a full movie without buffering or interruptions. I am really considering deleting the app once my free trial has expired. Please send me a number or offer me suggestions on what to do to fix the problem. I was really hoping on doing movie time with this with my family.

title: Good, but missing seasons.....
review:
So, I just finished watching girl meets world, and when I get to season 5 of boy meets world, it’s missing!!! Then I searched up boy meets world, to just see if I could change the seasons, but It won’t pop up! I missed an entire season of them going to college, mr feeny retiring, topanga proposing to Cory, and them having a baby! I even tried clicking on the series name of the recently watched list, and it shows me a blank blue screen!  I thought y’all deleted it, but how could I watch it if y’all deleted it? Please respond or see if you deleted it! Thank you for reading this review

                      -the kid who’s upset with Disney

title: Obviously life-changing, but...
review: Don’t change a thing about what people say is great about this app. The options, colors, controls, graphics, easy-to-use user interface, etc is fantastic. That being said, Disney Plus really needs a “Continue Watching” section, as people have said. Also, it would be nice to pause a show or movie and be able to resume watching where you left off after closing the app. Much like the other streaming services, we should be able to resume where we left off. Also, it would be cool to have the option to sort our “Watchlist” into sections...I have spoken.

title: give us some new updates. hate the interface.
review: the app is buggy. when casting a show on tv, It buffers at least 2-3 times during an episode. Finding where you left off in a show is complicated. It often starts the episode all over again, instead of going to the part i left off. Wanting to pause or rewind the episode is another issue. sometimes i can’t even pause it right away because I have to exit the app re open it, let it load and then the pause button eventually pops up. By that time i have to rewind then pause. I love the shows they offer on disney plus, and the movies. i just hate the interface. hate it.

title: Kids able to delete all with no recovery
review: We spent hours downloading Disney movies for a 15 hour international flight. Somehow, the app, which I’m willing to bet is used 99% by kids, has an option to delete all downloads with no recovery option without the requirement to even enter a passcode. So now we have a 15 hour return flight and we are unable to redownload movies since Disney Plus is not available internationally where we are vacationing. An app focused primarily on young kids as a target audience should have some safeguards so a 4 YEAR OLD CHILD is not able to delete all with a single button. If the app developers trust my kid so much, I recommend they include an option for my 4 year old to empty their bank account with a single button and no option to undo the action.

title: Enjoy using the app but needs some features down the line.
review: I really enjoy using this app! The layout of it is good, easy to navigate and also like how they sorted some of the categories. I haven’t had any issues with playing any episodes, but I just have two complaints that should’ve been in the app since launch. Why doesn’t this app have a “continue watching” feature like Netflix does? It’s really annoying having to look up the show you’re currently watching and select the current episode you’re currently on.

title: Great But Not Really
review:
I love Disney+ it’s really good because it has my favorite movies but I don’t know if this happens to anyone else but whenever I download something and I just delete disney+ from my history I guess, I come back and they are gone
Which makes me really upset 
And also I skip a lot and when I do it won’t let me skip or just click off the movie then I turn off my phone and it keeps playing which is normal but then I click the pause button and it still keeps playing then my phone just lags. Then I go back to Disney+ to turn it off again and it just closes the whole app.

title: Disney+ is awesome!
review:
I only have two things.
1) a continue watching feature would be really really nice!

2) *and this is more of a preference* I love how a lot of movies have BTS content in the extras tab. That was a pleasant surprise. I also love how seemingly all the Disney and Pixar Shorts are available! However, I wish they would put the short under the movie it was released with. Like “Mike’s New Car” and “For the Birds” with “Monsters Inc”. Not even exclusively with the movie. Just linked to it, so you can watch the short independently if you so choose. Even listing the short(s) released with the movie in the info tab. That would be incredible.

title: Download keep disappearing???
review:
This is gonna be a great app, just 2 things I have issues with, 1 I’ve downloaded 3 movies and they keep disappearing. This is my 3rd time downloading them. I’m not sure if they’re only good for 24 hours or not??? It takes a very long time to get them downloaded also, but this I think will improve over time. 
The 2nd thing is, I don’t see they have a ‘continue’ watching. I think that should be at the top of the app, so it’s easier to just jump back in and finish watching. 
Those 2 little things are the only ‘issues’ I have. I just think it would make it more convenient.

title: Super excited
review:
This app is amazing and I’m so thankful that you guys came out with it. My whole entire childhood is on here basically. I’m definitely gonna be binge watching everything lol. 7$ a month is totally worth it. Netflix is cool but they make you pay more to let you watch on several screens vs Disney+ they give you 4 screens to watch at the same time.

Although you guys need to fix a few things, such as a currently watched option. Having to find the show/movie I was watching before is a bummer. You need a “Play from the beginning” as well.

title: Only one complaint
review: The only complaint I have is that a lot of music on the soundtracks to shows and movies from before a certain year in the 2000s has been replaced by generic stock music. For example in the Picture Day episode of Lizzie McGuire This is the Story of The Girl was replaced by generic techno music that sounds completely out of place. Did disney lose the rights to the music or did they just feel like saving a buck by not getting them again if the licensing has expired? The major one that gets me is that Relating to a Pyschopath by Macy Gray was replaced by an upbeat jazz instrumental that completely ruins the mood of the scene

title: I love Disney+ but here’s some thoughts.
review:
Dear Disney+,

Me and my family love Disney+ but we don’t find a lot of our favorite childhood TV shows on there that are not on Netflix anymore. Like for example my 10 year old daughter was very disappointed when she was binge watching all of her favorite childhood movies and she didn’t see the Mickey Mouse Halloween movies or Christmas movies of all the of the short clips. She has loved those movies ever since she was 3. She also said that they we’re not on Netflix anymore so she didn’t have anywhere to watch them. Also my oldest would like to find some of his favorite childhood shows to.

title: Currently Watching List
review: I agree with a lot of people. I need a currently watching list, where you can actually pick up where you left off. It’s frustrating when you have little kids and they want to continue watching the show but it keeps restarting every time you exit. This is also equally as frustrating for adults too. I would definitely prefer to pick up where I left off in my shows or even movies. The app is great over all and offers a lot of Disney shows and movies that we all grew up on. Now, I can show my kids and hopefully they’ll love it as much as I did growing up.

title: Gravity Falls Glitch
review:
This app is great! All the classics! But there is an issue; and I don’t know if imm the only one with this issue. I’m calling it the Gravity Falls Glitch. I will click season 2 of Gravith Falls but it shows season one, while saying it’s in season 2. Eventually I was able to figure out how to watch season two episodes, which is skipping through the last season 1 episode and going through the episodes, but I cannot watch my FAVOURITE episodes! The finally! I loved those episodes, but they aren’t there! This doesn’t happen to my brother who uses it on iPad to! Please fix this!

Thank you in advance, 

 llamaparty5000 (sister chose my name. And it has a spelling error.)

title: Bar far the worst built app I’ve seen in recent history
review: This doesn’t even feel like a Disney Product! The app has any number of errors. Not only is there no “app” for older model AppleTV’s (Third Generation Model), there’s no way to add it which forces me to AirPlay content. This is wonky at best and constantly loses its connection. It get an “oh no” message as if they know it has problems but aren’t willing to do anything about it. I also cannot use my iPhone in any meaningful way while using AirPlay and streaming content from the app. The hierarchy always falls to what I’m currently doing on the phone and the app will not play in the background. How long did you have to work out the kinks? A couple years! This is the best you could do?

title: Highly Upset
review: I was so excited for the launch of this app and got it pretty much the day it was released. The app worked great for the first day and after that it had stoped working. It said it couldn’t connect and there was a problem with my connection, I uninstalled the app and reinstalled it to try and fix the problem. After that whenever I try to sign in now it won’t allow me too, and it tells me to call customer service. But whenever I do i sit on hold for an hour to and hour and a half and end up having to hangup because I have other things to do. I never was able to use my free trial, and I’m now being charged for the monthly subscription and it won’t let me sign into my account to unsubscribe from the app. I’m paying for something I can’t even use.

title: I LOVE IT
review:
First of all, ahhhhhhhhhh!!! I’m freaking out! I love this! At first I wasn’t really thrilled for disney to make their own steaming service for some reasons, but putting that aside, my love for Disney and it’s shows made me subscribe. And let me tell you, I didn’t regret it! For the price, it’s worth every single penny. Just hopefully they don’t start raising the fee for it. Now for some few suggestions, I agree with a lit of people that have made them here already. Please add a “continue watching” option. And broader that suggested selection. Thanks! For now that’s all.. 
All my love, THANK YOU!!

title: Request an edit
review: Want to start off with I absolutely love your product!! You have my favorite movies! But it doesn’t save your place in a movie or show, so trying to catch up on shows is challenging. The two  examples I have is I was cooking while watching, and was toggling between this app and Pinterest. Pinterest wasn’t working again so I closed all my apps, when I went back to Disney+ it was like I haven’t watched anything. And it happened on the TV I was watching a show eating was I was making and turned it off to go back to my phone and watch while doing dishes and it was like I was never there.

title: Awesome app! Just a few issues
review: I love everything about this app it has everything I love and more. The only thing I have a pretty big problem with is having no continue watching section that has all the shows you have been watching lately, this is a pretty big issue seeing has I don’t always have the time to watch all of the show or movie and it’s a pain to have to re-search for the show. Other than that I have no issues with the app it’s absolutely amazing and I love having every Disney movie at the tips of my fingers!

title: Great Content, just one issue that bugs me
review: I really enjoy using this app. I adore the Disney content offered here and would highly recommend this to many of my friends and family. The one issue that bugs me is the screen. The films are usually wide screen, which for some reason fill in through my phone or TV and cannot see the full film and subtitles. If there would be an option to make the film wide screen to full screen(vise-versa as well), or simply fix the bug that it automatically turns full screen, I would greatly appreciate it and rate the app a full 5 stars

title: searching for movies and shows
review: I love all the shows and movies Disney plus has!! However, whenever I use the search bar, when it is not exact, it doesn’t show anything. Whenever I have a specific movie or show, I try to type it in. It never works because it is not exact. For example, Austin & Ally. I have to use that EXACT wording, not just austin and ally. Or if the movie is two words, I have to capitalize the second letter of the second word. Like come on son, just let me watch my movie without having to type it exactly. you could do a “do you mean:...” or just show what movies when I don’t use the correct capitalization or other things.

title: NEEDS TO BE FIXED !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: I would give it 5 stars but It’s so annoying when I try to rewind and it gets stuck on the buffering thing like the movie or whatever will still play but I can’t press the rewind or fast forward button or the  pause button because it’s stuck on buffering and I get kicked out sometimes, also I have a great network connection but it still runs really really slow Sometimes, it’s ridiculous, but over all it’s amazing to have all the childhood memories come back with this new app so I recommend downloading it, even with all the bugs it’s worth it.

title: Awesome app with some flaws.
review: Disney+ is an fantastic app, but with some flaws. It used to work with my Ipad’s keyboard, but now it doesn’t respond to it at all. I would like it if you could fix that. It would also be great if you could make it so the videos we watch don’t disappear after only three days of not watching it, and make My List able to hold everything we add to it instead of just a few. It would also be great if you could add Disney’s Dog with a Blog, that was one of my favorite shows to watch when it was on TV.

title: Big flaw on disney. Be aware
review: Today I discovered a big flaw. Customer service was able to correct it. Someone hacked our account and changed the email and password. The issue is, when they changed it, my other devices still worked as usual not showing any indication of passwords or emails being changed. I feel they need to implement a 2 factor authentication. I do love the app however, due to this i will be showing 2 stars. Aside from that, 5 star. Now i have to cancel and start fresh. Work it cast members!!! Have a magical day

title: Not what I was expecting
review: I like watching Disney movies not totally a Disney fan but like watching them not sure if this would be the best app to watch all the Disney movies but it would be nice if they were a little more newer releases more often maybe if the price was a little bit lower it would possibly be a good price or have kids and maybe it would be more beneficial and having Disney+ definitely could do better with the app also it would’ve been nice to have a genre on the home screen to surf through the movies and TV shows a little bit easier it’s not totally user-friendly I think it could be better on that end as well

title: Can’t login to other devices but the app on the phone and lot of error
review: So 2 weeks ago, I subscribed to Disney+ through iTunes and the login would not recognize my subscription on any other devices! I try to talk to Disney support and they were not able to find my subscription. Called iTunes and they were not able to cancel my subscription or help me to log into any other devices 🤦🏻‍♀️but  I could watch movies on my phone. Then I tried to download movies and start AirPlay on my tv, it always says error. Sometimes I would watch movies on my phone and it says “error”. One of the most frustrating streaming app that I have ever paid🤬😡 do not Subscribe to Disney through ITunes! iTunes and Disney both got a problem with this app and I’m very disappointed.

title: Kind of Dissapointment
review: I purchased yet another streaming service but this time when I heard the name Disney it bought back memories and my childhood. I love that some movies like Gatta Kick It Up and True Confessions made the cut but I was really hoping to see everything in the Disney vault. Movies like Rogers and Hammers Cinderella and shows like Pepper Ane, that truly bought you back to the roots of Disney did not make the cut; and let’s all admit it’s truly heartbreaking. I hope they add everything soon and most of all keep as much as they can. This is the TV we grew up with and if they can offer us ticket into the Disney Vault then let us have it all.

title: meh delorian
review:
Disney Minus is more like it. Minus the endless amount of time you will spend in live chats with support services that say, “be right back in 1 or 2 minutes” only to not respond again after staying in the chat for 30 minutes hoping for a response. 

The Mandalorian was good. But paying $69 to get hacked and forced to repeatedly explain the issue is a first world problem I’m not very interested in having. Two nights in a row were spent dealing with this and now we have supposedly had an “account takeover” that’s not a hack, according to your wonderful chat person. Even though they took time to lengthily explain that somehow passwords from old accounts were compromised and sold on the dark web. 

Ummm ok. That’s a hack. Don’t give me condescending PR BS please. Just help me resolve my issue. Thanks Disney!

title: Why Disney
review: So I have one question and complaint. so why isn’t ant farm one of the best Disney shows ever to exist not on here???like that was most kids child hood. That show was the best and I expect the app to have like it says all the Disney movies and shows yet Netflix,Hulu,sling,and prime don’t have ant farm so I go to the Disney app thinking it has everything and what don’t you have ant farm and it’s not like a show that had one season and wasn’t a hit so if you would PLEASE CONSIDER adding a few more titles ant farm being included sorry but I gave up on punctuation ...  otherwise the app is good 👍🏽

title: Offline Download Disappointing
review: One of the major reasons we decided to subscribe to Disney+ was to use offline viewing of downloads when we are traveling.  We were disappointed during a recent vacation in Fiji that our son was not able to view the downloaded videos.  We got a message that Disney+ was not available in Fiji.   We didn’t expect to be able to stream there, but just wanted to watch the downloaded videos. We made sure that the iPad was completely disconnected from the internet, but it still didn’t allow viewing offline.   No problem doing the same with the Netflix app, but not with Disney+.  Disappointing!

It’s FANTASTIC!!! We have the app on all iPhones, our Samsung TV has the Disney+ app. As far as easy access to everywhere we need it I give it 5 stars! The app is gorgeous! Beautiful colors and layout. Easy to find stuff. I see several things missing I was sure would be on there. The new Aladdin movie for one. I’m sure it will all be on there eventually. MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT that I ask you PLEASE FIX ASAP is that it doesn’t save your spot like Netflix does!!! You have to go in and look up what you were watching and try and find where you left off!!! That’s a big 👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼 If it weren’t for that one thing I would rate it 5 stars.

title: Ugh
review: Honestly don’t even want to go to Disneyland anymore I’m so frustrated with Disney plus 😂 but for real.. I’m on my second all day phone call with no one picking up. The app doesn’t work and they’re going to charge me when I can’t even use the app. At this point I just want to cancel my subscription but I can’t because they won’t pick up. If they wind up charging the people who can’t use the app nor get ahold of people to cancel I can see a huge lawsuit happening. And also if they KNEW that chrome cast wasn’t going to work they should have warned people. But also it won’t let you airplay so it’s just double bad on Disney. I was super excited for this so I’m pretty bummed. Wish it worked. But I’m pretty close to going full extreme psycho and banning Disney from my home 😂 so frustrated. Send help.

title: Great Content but Need to Work on Features
review:
Great Content. Missing some TV shows like House of Mouse, The Tarzan and Jane TV show - not the movie, but maybe they will phase those in after HD-ing them. 
I’m not sure if it is just me but I would like a “recently played” or “continue watching” list. I was watching Lady and the Tramp and was slightly put off by the fact the movie began from the beginning, not where I left off. So I had to scrub to where I was in the movie. Or a “resume” or “start over option” for films would be nice. Also an option to view scenes. Like a scene selection option rather than scrubbing the entire film.

title: So there’s a glitch... (I think)
review:
Oki so I LOVE Disney. So I got this app. And I experienced some thing... first, I wanted to watch Shazam. (Cuz I like that movie 🤩) and I watched it. The next day IT WASNT THERE!!! Now I don’t know if this is a glitch. But I don’t understand why Disney plus only had a movie for ONE DAY. Please at least add Shazam back to Disney + also I have a request. Could you pleaseee add Black cauldron to Disney + I REALLY wanna watch it!!! I know your trying to hide this movie from the public but... could you add it...?😁

P.s please if you respond don’t take legal action against me for mentioning black cauldron. 

-Ava Apple game critic (or at least I think I am 😜)

title: Excited but disappointed
review: Signed in originally at 2 am when I got home from work with no problem. Set everything up on my Roku and IPhone. Went to launch it on my roku this morning and it say that I need to check my internet connection. My WiFi is fine, other apps are launch easily. Tried my iPhone and same error message about WiFi, tried it just on my data, same issue, yet all other apps on my iPhone launch fine. I know this is the first day of the launch and all but disappointed that I’m having issues on the first day. Love the content when I can get on but hate the fact that the second time I try to get on I have no luck.

title: Nice!
review: It has been really nice to watch movies that I loved to watch as a child!  My children have been enjoying as well.  One thing I don’t like is that we wanted to watch some of the newer movies and they are not available.  I guess I was hoping that if it were a Disney movie we would be able to watch it including the new remakes for example we wanted to watch beauty and the beast (2017) and it wasn’t  available.  Little disappointed because I thought there were going to be more movies then there seems to be. Maybe it’s more movie access then on my phone.  Idk.  But over all I like it!

title: Have a request 🙂😊😃😁
review: I love Disney + because it is a fun way to watch all your favorite shows and movies it is really good  this is my number one and go to app to watch I am bummed that you need internet for this app but I am just grateful that  the developers made this  I totally would prefer this app I love it so much and also has some throw backs   So the request is can you please make this a  app that does not need internet  if you do this would be the best watching show, movie, app in the world 🌎 so please please make this a  app that does not need internet

title: Great but one glitch
review: Me and my family love the app because of all of the throwback shows and amazing movies that are available to us now. The only problem is that while we are watching anything every few minutes it seems to freeze, the movie or show gets stuck on one image but the sound continues. It fixes itself after a few seconds but it happens very frequently. At first I thought it was my TV so i put it on a different one in another room and the same thing continues to happen.

title: Where’s the representation?
review: Now Disney+ is an amazing app as you can see I gave it a 5/5 but I’d just like to state to the public that there is little to no black reproduction. I am an African American women with a family and #1 there are only two black females and no males on the section of the app where you can pick your profile picture and #2 the fact that I know there are more than two African American characters that they can make an option of. I just think that Disney+ should add a bit more representation in there profile picture.

title: No Capability to Select Seasons/Episodes
review: I would really appreciate the ability to see past, current, & future list of serial episodes. Currently there is no capability for that and it is a big disappointment; no matter what platform I’m on (phone, computer, or Roku-like device). For example, if you accidentally let the app auto play through the next episodes because you left your steaming device for a real would need, there is no way to go back to select any season and/or episode that I’ve found . If there is, then Disney+ should add a help menu with this info or update all apps. If not, Disney+ needs to add the capability soon. If this capability is not available soon then then Disney+ apps are all  handicapped and not worth using for serial entertainment.  Just saying.

title: Needs an update desperately!
review: I like to cast streaming services to my tv from my iPhone and there is something wrong with several titles, and strangely they are all the “popular” titles. They don’t cast!!! They work perfectly fine in the app, but when I try to cast, the Disney logo and movie title show but it just sticks to buffering. It is not a problem with my chrome cast because other than this it works perfectly fine for other streaming services. More strangely, “less popular” titles on the Disney plus app can work on the app and can cast successfully. Why can I not cast everything?! I am currently on a trial and if this doesn’t get fixed, you can count me out.

title: App is not mature
review: Devs, please add a Feedback button so that we can guide you to fix all the terrible design/UX problems. Both the desktop and iOS app have some serious issues especially if you compare it against more mature apps of a similar function. I see that a few issues have been fixed, which is great. What hasn’t been fixed is the watchlist and an adequate way to stop and resume. I have a feature request. Please give us recommendations for age groupings. There are plenty of adults who have purchased the service. You can recommend engines/widgets at a personalized level instead of just individual films. Eg trending adults vs trending teens. Or co-view adults vs teens. I would align with the adult trends more than teenagers

title: Best movie app ever!!
review: If your like us and just don’t have the money to buy movies you really want to see I highly suggest getting Disney plus. It’s free to download, all the movies on it are totally free, and all popular movies made by Disney or came out of the theater go directly on Disney plus for you and your family to enjoy!  One problem would be that if your tv is older then 2016 it will not work so I suggest getting it on a iPhone,iPad,or computer. This is the only problem when it comes to Disney plus otherwise it is totally awesome and amazing!!😍

title: Great but not the greatest. Disney fix this!.....
review: Yes, this app is great because it has all the movies & tv shows I grew up with and that makes me happy by the fact of watching them all over again but I think this app has a problem and it has to be fixed as soon as possible. I’m watching whatever series and suddenly the app closes and it’s terrible. I have to open the app again and search what I was watching and see it again ('cause idk why it repeats again) Overall I like Disney + a lot but I really think Disney has to fix this issue cuz it’s annoying most of the times. And if it’s not fixed I will have to cancel my membership. That’s all. Thanks.

title: A little frustrated..
review:
Love this app EXCEPT for a few things that I REALLY hope they fix. Number One - A Currently Watching list. Every single time I go to watch Hannah Montana I have to GUESS where I left off because if you click on the main title it starts you at the BEGINNING OF THE SERIES AGAIN!!! Super frustrating. Issue Number Two - Movies and shows keep disappearing from my Watch List. I just tried to re add Frozen SIX TIMES. Every time I opened the app it was out of my Watch List queue again. 

Disney or whomever created this app. PLEASEEEEE fix these issues. I’ve been waiting a long time for this app along with millions of others.

title: Just a few things
review: I absolutely love this app! I have been dying to go back and watch the originals, and now I can! Only a few things that could be fixed though. First, as I have seen many people say this also, there’s no continue watching section. It is a little bit irritating to go and have to search for what you were watching last. Second, the most recent movies like Aladdin and the Lion King aren’t on there. Now I know, it’s probably because they’re fresh out of theaters and the amazing team is doing their best to get them on there. Other than those 2 things, this app is AMAZING!!!!!

title: I love it but
review: I love how I’m able to watch old shows and movies that came out when I was younger but when it comes to watching the tv shows, I don’t like how u have to look for the correct episode to continue watching. I would try to just hit play but it would just take me back to the first episode. I think it would be best if a continue watching list is add where it shows which ones your watching (obviously) and  where it allows u to continue watching where u left off instead of having to look for the episode u left off. I hope this made sense, but all in all I love the app.

title: Not working
review: I was very excited about this app, me and my friend were going to go half and when i tried to log on all i get was "we are having trouble connecting to your account" and then eventually it said "disney plus is not available in your region" when people from my state, city, neighborhood are getting on perfectly fine. At some point i even tried my other friends account and it said the same thing. I understand its a new app and there are going to be glitches but please fix it as soon as possible

title: Great but...
review:
Works fine. Content is immense. 
-But, many titles you have to do a search for them to see them as an option. They aren’t actually listed anywhere.
-But, if you watch part of something and leave to do something else, like ... work, when you return there is no place holding what you were watching. You’ve got to search it out, again. Though the app does remember and will resume where you left off.
For now, that’s what I’ve noticed. 2 movie and 1 show down. Starting another movie to fall asleep to. ;-)

title: BETTER THAN EXPECTED
review: When my parents were getting this I could have cared less until they told me about all the shows and movies they have. They have almost every movie or show by Disney it owned by Disney. Also like the feature to download so you can watch on the go. The fact that it became #1 in entertainment on the App Store in less then 24 hours is amazing. For only 6.99 a month it is really great for all of the content you get on this platform. You also get a year free with Verizon. I would rate this 100 out of 5 stars if a could!

title: Exactly what I was expecting
review: I wanted to be able to play my Disney classics for my daughter with out breaking out the DVDs and with out switching from one streaming service to the next and that is exactly what Disney+ provided. Like a few other comments have said, I am having a problem with my watchlist, but this is minor to me and not at all worth giving a lower rating. Oh I would also like them to add more of the Disney Pixar shorts. I love the short films they show in theaters before a movie and having access to them all on this site would be excellent!

title: I was excited...now disappointed
review: My family and I were really looking forward to this launch and paid for a year subscription. We have Vizio and Samsung TVs. The only way to get it on the Vizio is to SmartCast from my iPhone. So if I’m not home, my family can’t watch it. As for the Samsung, the app is only available on TVs from 2016 or newer. Mine is from 2014 and the app from my iPhone won’t let me use the screen mirror option for this TV.  I tried to use the Web Browser app on the Samsung, but the web page says “unsupported.” I also thought about running an HDMI cable from my laptop to the TV, but my laptop doesn’t have a plugin for that. This is very disappointing and seems like a rip-off. It seems like you can only use it with the latest and greatest tech gadgets.

title: Love but annoyed
review: I am absolutely in love with Disney +, it has all the shows and movies I want and it also shows trailers to coming soon movies and it is amazing, but it’s missing something. Something very very important, a “ continue watching” section!!! It’s very annoying have to search for your show and have to search more a guess what episode you’re on. So please please please Disney, in your next update please add a “currently watching” or “continue watching” or “keep watching” section! Please please please! I’m begging! Because I love love love this app and that missing piece is cutting it short from being perfect

title: Great app for all Disney needs from little kids to nostalgia nuts
review:
I know I’m late but Disney plus is a great app with so many classics it’s great for family time and has even helped me bond with my family and kept me entertained for many hours there dose seem to be some shows missing but compare it to all the great stuff we have it’s far out way that complaint 
It’s great for nostalgia you can see all of your childhood favorites like Bambi, finding Nemo,
Snow White, and Cinderella. All in all a great time and a surprisingly good quality for how little you pay.

title: Needs better parental controls
review: There needs to be profile specific, password protected parental controls. My 8 year old knows how to toggle on and off the button for the kids profile, so I can’t keep it safe for him. He has found the Simpson’s, and is pointing out inappropriate episodes where Bart is naked, or women are dressed inappropriately, and watching them over and over again. He is watching marvel movies that I’m not yet comfortable with him viewing at that level of violence. I monitor him, but when I walk away to do dishes, or take a shower, or clean up, he will go back into a show. I’m not happy that Disney plus has not taken care of this setting to make it safe and appropriate watching for our young, impressionable viewers.

title: Always room for improvement 👍🏾
review: I love Disney+ but I think there is always room for improvement. There is only two things I don’t like . One thing is the cast, so I was watching stargirl and I was wondering were the cast was? I mean the girl who sings has an amazing voice but I did not have her name or any body else’s. The second thing is Andy Mack. Andy Mack is one of my favorite shows but once I saw it on Disney plus there is only 2 episodes in the first season???? Like we’re da rest? Also it scramble up all the episodes so I can never find them. I do recommend this app for Disney fans but please read this.

title: AMAZING!!!!!
review:
For starters, I haven’t written a review on anything in YEARS.!!! This was well deserved Disney, you guys truly deserved this. I have not seen so much of my childhood in one place for a very long time. Now I can show my two year old sister what I watched as a little girl. I literally cried because I was in such awe when I saw some of my old favs in this app.!!! My parents were totally shocked, they could not believe their own eyes.!! I am so excited to watch my favorite shows and movies again. I truly can not wait to get out of class!!! #stocked 
#disneyrocks #disneykidatheart

title: Fantastic
review:
This app is doing great. Negative reviews talking about customer service or what sounds like, personal equipment issues. This app has ALL the Disney stuff!! I love this app! I don’t think I could watch everything they offer within the first year! This is awesome! And it’s available without paying for a cable subscription ($55+) 

Customer service will get better! It’s been a small number days since opening. Give Disney a break! Lol Customer service workers need constructive criticism too. 

The app is great! Works great! Picture is great! Movie list is fantastic!

title: Almost perfect but....
review:
Soooo I love this app and I think it’s amazing how there are no adds (which is very rare) and how there are so many options to choose from. I only have a fewww complaints. First, on many movies (like the live action Beauty and The Beast) we have to wait until October to watch it on Disney plus. I understand that this could be like that for many reasons, like copyright and such, but they are adding new movies and new tv shows, but we have to wait until October to watch something from 2016. But I love Disney and I always will, just could you address this please? 

Thanks so much

title: Great choices and extras as well.
review: I really like this app. For those who buy DVDs to get the extras will like the fact that this app provides them as well. A good feature is it turns my watch into a remote control for pause and 10 second jumps. I use it via my html adapter on tv and it can also use my older Apple TV box, but only for the movies themselves, not the app display. Originally I had a problem with aspect ratios but it turned out to be a setting on my tv. Digging out my tv remote provided the fix. It was strange but not the apps fault.

title: Really great! But...
review: I love this so much! I’ve watched a lot on here already and has a ton of shows for everyone. I think it just lacks a couple of options. Like they have collections of movies and shows, but there’s no way to save those unless you add each thing individually. Not a big deal but it would be nice to be able to just an “add collection button.” When I first got it I had some sound issues or screening issues like the screen would go black but the sound would continue, but I haven’t experienced that recently so I’m assuming that’s fixed. Really great though!

title: Wonderful, but...
review:
Love the availability of movies, TV series etc. But I do think we have room for improvement in the app itself. Unless IP is the issue take a few pointers from the Netflix app. Need not be identical but similar visual tweaks would be helpful; read on. 
First I agree with others that a “currently watching” section would be great. 
Second, why can I not visually tell which episodes I have watched or started from those I have yet to watch when looking at a list of episodes?  This is incredibly annoying. 
Third, where is the option to “Resume” vs “Start from beginning “ when revisiting a show/episode?
If I pre-screen a show and return later to watch with my children, it starts where I left off. On the AppleTV I need to Pause>flick-left all the way back to the left, then need to press “Play” in order to “start over” unfortunately half the time an error occurs which requires me to back out and try again. 

Cannot wait for the update.

title: For Mando Only...
review: I have all of the MCU and Star Wars Blu ray / Digital collection, so except for a few shows - the only reason why I subscribe is mainly because of The Mandalorian. I watch Mando thru my iphone and airplay it on my smart TV (which is truly annoying) because Apple made sure that 3rd gen Apple users won’t get Disney+ app update we deserve. I hope Disney+ urges Apple to include the app on Apple TV 3rd generation. Also, like Netflix I hope Disney+ adds the check list feature after watching a certain episode so we would know if we have watched-it a show or episode already. So a check box is necessary. Lastly, Disney+ needs an autoplay to the next episode feature.

This is AMAZING I have no bad things about this app. I’ve always liked the Parent Trap (Lindsay Lohan) but every time we watched it we would rent it because it costed so much and we did not want to pay 20 dollars on the movie. But now we have it for free! Disney+ also gives you TV shows never seen before to anyone who does not have it, like the Mandalorian! It’s another reason to buy this. The Mandalorian is a great show and if you have Disney+ check it out!

Personally Disney+ is amazing!! But if it’s not for you don’t feel pressure to do it! 

~Emmie~

title: Missing something
review: So far it’s been okay, the one thing I noticed that might improve the app is that at the moment it doesn’t keep track of the episode someone already watch. Adding something like that could help. And maybe getting a page that has information on up coming movies and shows that will be added to the app could help as well. Overall i like it. Though there’s so many to watch I don’t know where to start. Just found out Cinderella had third movie after watching it I feel like they should make a tv series about the original Cinderella

title: Currently or continue watching.
review: I completely agree with every five star rating about this app out there. This is an amazing opportunity and it is fantastic that this is an option. The one and only super super important change this app needs is a continue watching column. It is essential that Disney+ adds this feature. Every other streaming app and site has it and it would create a 100% awesome customer experience. This is the only, and I mean the only reason my review has 4 stars instead of the 5 five it would have if the continue watching feature was added.

title: PLEASE UPDATE WITH A CONTINUE WATCHING LIST
review: I absolutely love Disney + and have been waiting since the announcement date. I’m so so happy with the shocking amount of shows listed. But I’m really struggling without a “continue watching” list. Currently watching Wizards of Waverley Place and I have to try and remember which episode and minute I was on last and got so frustrated that I just started the whole episode over. Same thing happened when I was watching Inside Out earlier this week, I had to fast forward to where I last was. Please please please fix this soon! I know I’m not the only one with this complaint!

title: Love the content-but needs some fixes!
review: My little one loves the Disney junior shorts, especially the little nursery rhymes. The first time you watch it does the normal streaming thing where the next “episode” automatically advances to the next one when the credits roll. BUT the problem is-if you go to watch them again-there is no option to play them from the beginning and they all start in the last 10 seconds of credits! So please fix that if there is less than 30 seconds left the default should be to start from the beginning!!! Also-I would love a currently watching or pick up where you left off feature.

title: 10 stars for the heart of it! Some functionality issues...
review:
This is indeed the greatest thing to happen in the streaming era.
Disney has not only fulfilled childhoods of today but childhoods of old. The nostalgia is almost TOO much!
The heart of this app deserves 10 stars.

There are just some functionality issues:
There’s no ‘currently watching’ or ‘resume’ feature. That’s the biggest and worst of this app’s shortcomings. Quite unbelievable, honestly.

When adding a movie to the Watchlist, the green check does not stay checked. I spent maybe an hour adding stuff and began thinking ‘didn’t I already add this??” I started to notice content I definitely added were not checked and thought I’d spent all that time for nothing. I checked my Watchlist and everything was there thank goodness, so it’s a small but significant error in the UI. It makes it hard for me to know what I’ve added and what I haven’t.

Still new to the app, but those are the three glaring fails of the app.

title: App needs work
review: The app runs fine in a nutshell but there are small features or fixes that can make this app potentially better or even perfect. On the ipad, it just isn’t on par with Netflix’s small features and “perfections.” Disney+ app tends to close when the video is in “picture-in-picture” mode, although this is not recurring all the time. No “continue watching” or other easy and quick access to it on the menu page for videos/shows you want to continue if you had to take a break midway. An actual working “auto play next” episode would be nice. Just a lot of small things that could be worked on or incorporated.

title: Love it! But so many glitches
review: I love this app and expected there to be some glitches with the release. But I figured it would be a good idea to share them. First it was taking forever for things to load and things I added to my list were taking awhile to to show up. Then when I exited out it wouldn’t let me log back in. It tells me it’s having trouble connecting to my account and to reenter my account information and try again. Did that it’s still not working. I’m so very very excited for this and really hope that the bugs get fixed so that I can start enjoying it.

title: Some movies and shows listed not playing..
review: I have downloaded the app on both my iPhone and Fire Stick. On my phone it is not letting me create a new user profile for my kids it says there is a connection issue but my WiFi is intact. On the Fire Stick, when clicking MOST of the shows it does not give you an option to play them after you’ve clicked on the show, it just displays a screen saver of said show, also on certain movies it says media not available even though it right on the screen. I don’t think Disney quite thought through this release.... I would rate this app with more stars if the the show my kids wanted to watch were even able to play but they aren’t...

title: good but not complete!
review: First of all, I LOVE this app- such a good idea. However it is still missing many shows and movies such as ANT Farm, 16 Wishes, and Dog with a blog. Where are they at?! Another slight complaint is when i’m watching on my computer and i’m finnished watching a movie, I have to watch all the ending credits so the move can exit my continue watching. I tried just forwarding it but still doesn’t work. I would like it to be able to return to the home page before the end credits without the show still under the continue watching section. But over all such an amazing app!!

title: I love this app
review: I love this so much I watched a load of stuff on here like the one and only Ivan ,jack ,the suite life of Zack and Cody(ps when this show started I was born)Hamilton and etc.  But I really want to watch new stuff on Disney + like spider man or more marvel movies I also think since you made this app  it  would be cooler if you made another app with Nickelodeon on it if u do this I will be so happy also if I had enough I would donate your company I just have to get my money out but first I’ll ask my mom or dad maybe I’ll donate you today!! I love this apppppp!!!

title: Love it! But.....
review: On the PS4 we have issues streaming shows and movies. We will start a show and the screen will freeze with the audio continuing. Then the loading circle will pop up, and the start back where the video froze. Sometimes on the PS4 the show will jump ahead like 10 seconds. The audio will jump ahead 10 seconds and the video will follow looking like we were fast forwarding. Other than that I still use this more than any other streaming app because of the content.

title: Good job Disney+
review: I love Disney+ because I get to watch shows that I’ve never got to watch before and you don’t have to be patient when the ads play in the middle of the episode you are watching and It is less confusing trying to make an account on Disney+ then other tv shows and movie networks and you don’t have to unlock episodes like you do on DisneyNOW and disney+ have all the episodes of the seasons on a show and a bunch of exciting releases I’m so happy Disney+ exists and I cannot wait for more releases in the future bye

title: Add the Quality Shows Please
review:
I personally wanted Disney + for the movies and a few shows that I enjoy. When I opened the app I was intending on watching movies and my 3 favorite shows, the trifecta of perfect television Mighty Med, Lab Elite Force, Lab rats. I personally can’t sit through any movie because of my lack of attention span, so I was excited to binge watch my favorite shows. My quarantine dream was to
 immerse myself in the cinematic perfection that is Disney XD, imagine my dismay when I found out that Mighty Med was not on Disney +. Mighty was my personal favorite out of the perfect trio. I cannot watch Lab Rats Elite Force with out BOTH of its riveting sequels. I cannot rate this app anything higher than 1 star without the full trifecta of perfect television. Please answer my demands and the four other stars with come shortly.

title: Just a couple ideas
review: I LOVE Disney+ but there are things I hate about it also. I hate that it doesn’t have auto play so I don’t have to unlock my iPad and reconnect to continue streaming to my Apple Box. I also hate that it doesn’t have a “continue watching” feature so I have to remember what season and episode we are on with every series we watch. And if they added Nickelodeon programs too it would be 100% and I could cancel all my other subscriptions. These three things would improve the quality of Disney+ and bring even more customers in. Overall 7.5/10.

title: Horrible Customer Service
review: I’ve had several issues with the app; however, the 2 star rating is because of the customer service received. I purchased during cyber Monday deal and I did not receive the discounted amount. That is false advertisement. I called and was on hold for about 30 minutes. While on hold, I hear a message that they are not able to take my call because of technical difficulties. I called a 2nd time and after 15 minutes, my phone disconnected. I then went online to web chat with a customer service rep. They told me that I have to pay full price because of the free trial even though I purchased the yearly subscription during cyber Monday sale.  Shame on you.

title: Billing issues
review: Signed up for Disney+ app and while I was signing up, it asked for a credit card number. Then, I see I was charged twice, once with my bank account associated with my ApplePay and once on the cc it asked me for during sign up. Contacted Disney+ and they said that I needed to contact Apple. When I called the number for Apple, I received an automated response that did not resolve the issue. I called Disney again and they said that they had no way of seeing how I paid. Now I am in a dispute with my CC company trying to get my money back and make sure that I am not stuck with a recurring fee both on my bank account and my CC. Super frustrating!!!!

title: Amazing but...
review:
There’s only two issues I’ve come across:
1. Recently watched listed, but I think many people have mentioned this. 
And 2. On the tv version I went through and selected all the movies and shows I want to watch later, on the app version (yes same account) I can not find that list at all. Plus once you add a movie normally the + will turn into a ✅ and no matter how many times you come across that movie it should still have a ✅ so you know you already added it right? Disney plus doesn’t do that. It always has a + so I keep forgetting I’ve already added it

title: Missing shows/movies
review: I love this app overall and it’s such a great idea that all the original Disney shows and movies are here, but one thing missing is a bunch of shows! I am so tired right now and I just wanted to watch Austin and ally cause it was my favorite show ever but it wasn’t there! (not gonna lie, started tearing up). So I kept searching and found that the proud family, enchanted, sky high, sunny with a chance, and a lot of other classic shows/movies. It’s just a suggestion and I really hope to see it soon. Okay, got to go watch Halloween town!!

title: Great Service but App Needs Work
review:
I love the content that is on this app. As far as content goes this is already my favorite streaming service. So many things that I actually want to watch. 

When it comes to the app, it needs work, which is not to be unexpected at this early stage. They need to add a currently watching section to the home screen. Search needs a huge upgrade. Lastly, they need to improve the syncing between devices. I’ve switched devices mid-movie and had to find where I was at, it wasn’t automatic. This happened several times. 

Overall I love it so far though!!

title: Love it!
review:
Overall, I really enjoy and love Disney+. I think that it is so awesome that all of the old shows are back. I have been wanting to rewatch so many of these movies and series, and now I can!  
There is one that that I would like to suggest for them to fix. I would love for when I am watching a series for it to be included in a continue watching list. I would also like for my progress in a series to be saved. I don’t like that I have to go through ever episode to figure out which one I am on. (This reason is why it is only 4 stars.)
I am so glad that Disney came out with this!  It is so amazing!!

title: Love it but,,,,
review: I love Disney+ it is an amazing streaming service all except for not having a continue watching. i cant always watch a whole movie at one time, and remembering what episode i left off on is a difficult task. a ‘continue watching’ would make this review go to 5 stars! i love all the movies and shows! i also think they should have it a little more organized. ‘Disney Princess’ section ‘DCOM’ section ‘Live Action’ sections, etc. with all those movies/shows in those categories. i understand its brand new and has some kinks to work out but definitely needs a continue watching section!

title: Pretty good
review: Ok so I love it for the most part. I read a review saying they couldn’t watch it on their tv, but it must be an older tv bc I got it just fine on both my tv’s app stores.. that being said, the only complaint I have is that when I start watching something I can’t pick back up where I left off. As another person said I’m sure this will get resolved at some point, it’s literally the first day! My son is super excited for all the movies! We did try to find the air bud movies which aren’t all there yet, but I’m sure they will add more in the future. Can’t wait to watch all the movies!!!

title: Just Needs Some Tweaking
review: The content is Fantastic but needs some tweaking to the interface. When you are watching something it only allows Pause/Play, FFWD/Rewind. There should be options for some type of chapter selection, when fast forwarding or rewinding it should show a picture of the scene it will be on and closed captioning. There should be an option to turn this on or off and to have it where certain profiles can choose to use this and others not to based on their preference. Also it would be good to be able to organize your Watchlist.

title: It’s great!
review: I honestly love Disney+ it has a lot of Disney shows and movies obviously I personally love it it’s nice choosing what I want to watch instead of going on a channel and watching thinks over and over again but on mine I don’t know if this is for everyone else’s but when I watch a show and a intro pops up it says skip into way to early and if I push it, it won’t end the intro so it’s only 3 seconds it will go kind of to the middle so please check out that bug and I can’t wait until the new movie “Scoob!” Comes out on Disney+ over all it’s great just need to fix that one bug.❤️

title: Wow just wow
review: I’ve been waiting for this app my whole life and didn’t even realize this is what I wanted. As a DDH I was worried that it was some how going to be a few updates before it started running smoothly but it has been a total dream. Easy layout and 100% family friendly. People complaining that there isn’t enough ‘original content’ must not remember other streaming sites beginnings. There is sooo much too watch that by the time Disney+ starts pushing more content we’ll still need more time just to get through the vault.

title: Impressive Launch
review: For the launch of a new service I am very impressed with the effort that was put into the design of the app and how well it performs even with the launch traffic hype. This service is jam packed with content for every age group and in my opinion is the new best overall streaming service. I will say there have been a few minor issues like my watchlist not loading properly but I am sure these issues will be worked out and are overall not an issue for the overall performance of the platform.

title: I will upgrade to 5 Stars when.....
review:
I will upgrade to 5 stars when app developers add a feature to remove "continue watching" shows/movies, easier. There needs to be a "Remove from 'continue watching' " or a "delete from watch history" option. 

In irder to remove shows and movies, i have to fast forward through them in hopes there isnt 5 seaseons of a tv show. For example, I spent over an hour fast forwarding through every episode of Lion Guard just because my niece decided to watch 1 1/2 episodes on my account. ALSO whats up with not having all the Marvel movies?

title: the world needed disney+
review: I love Disney+. It’s great. I love that u don’t have to go out and buy like 7 Disney movies just to have one movie night with all ur friends when u can just get on this app. I love that they have like a bunch of Disney channel shows too. I’ve been watching Lizzie McGuire that is my absolute fave show of all time bc I watched the movie with my friends when we were really little! I just wish y’all could add movies faster bc it said on a website that frozen 2 isn’t coming until June or July but it may be wrong idk. All I have left to say is: hey now, hey now, this is what dreams are made of! 😂🥰

title: Downloading
review: So I’m watching gravity falls again and I’m downloading them and watching them on my phone. But when ever I’m done with that episode it deletes it after and gives me no indication that I’ve already watched that episode. So when I go to download more episodes I have know idea where I left off. So I’m trying to remember the last episode I watched so I can download the next episode and not download the episodes I’ve already watched. It’s annoying, and also whenever I watch a movie and it ends, it will still be on my continue watching even thought it’s at the end credits.

title: Great on wifi but deletes from Kindle
review: I love the service when connected to WiFi. But when downloading to my kids Kindle the downloads disappear. If this app is only to work with iOS that needed to be stated upfront. I have an external SD drive, have formatted, and have my app set to download to the external hard drive. But we get on the road and my son has nothing to watch for a 5 hour car ride.  Trying to trouble shoot and the downloads are still taking up space on the external SD card but I cannot get to them. Only option is to download again when we stop somewhere with WiFi. I do not have this issue with a competing streaming app.

title: loading issue bugs
review: other than the small freeze/pause between forwarding and rewinding every time, there is a problem with the rewinding feature. whenever I try to rewind using the 10 second time stamp, the play/pause button disappears and I’m left not being able to rewind or play/pause the video. also, the sound cuts off for a few seconds until I fast forward again. overall, the app is a little bit laggy at times. it wasn’t like that at first but now it is. just a couple of small bugs that I’m sure could be easily fixed. other than that, great variety of shows to binge.

title: Doesn’t work well, you can’t send from phone to TV, it became Disney -
review: I was excited to get it, not anymore. I started watching Star Wars at night, after 20 min it stopped and showed loading circle and never came back. Today , Christmas - we started watching old cartoons and quality is so bad. They should remake them, plus later we started watching Spider-Man cartoons and the screen went black , you can hear the sound and black screen. I will be deleting the app, my 6 yrs kids even recommended deleting, they not ready for market with the app. I can’t believe it, we just started watching another show and now screen is green. It works on phone but no option to send to TV like Netflix has. Disney + is Disney -   . So much money and so much time.

title: What needs to be improved?
review: Disney+ is great for Disney superfans and those who aren’t huge fans. There are probably improvements on Disney+, but for now it’s fine. There’s already a currently watching and recommended section. What else do we need? The main reason I used it was because Phineas and Ferb and Crash and Bernstein which was removed from Netflix. I really only use it to watch The Simpsons and some other stuff. Speaking of which, some episodes of The Simpsons should be TV-14, but they say it’s TV-PG. This should be fixed. That is all. But I’m sure there are more bugs to be found.

title: Not worth it
review: Disney + sounds like an amazing idea, if it would work. It worked for the first week and now when I open the app it says connection error, yet I have full bars and can stream on AppleTV+. So I deleted the app and reinstalled it and now it wants me to contact customer service when I attempt to login. I’m seriously considering canceling my subscription, which is a bummer! But why pay for a service that never works. I would not recommend anyone to start a subscription with Disney + until way later on, so Disney can work out all the bugs, if they can. I would recommend getting AppleTV+, a way more well structured streaming service from a very well structured company. At least Apple knows how to create a more than sustainable streaming service.

title: “Currently watching” would change my rating to 5
review:
FINAL EDIT: They’ve added “Continue watching!” FINALLY! Woohoo! Review went from 2 to 5 stars.

EDIT: Have become significantly less interested in Disney+ as the days go on. I forget where I left off or with what I was just watching, and without a “Currently/Resume Watching” function, it’s getting useless. Have found myself back on Netflix the past few days just occasionally surfing over Disney+ for nostalgia (in the content). But haven’t gotten hooked yet. PLEASE add this feature.

ORIGINAL:
Content is great, with room for more (Muppets section was surprisingly sparse for example, and limited Marvel movies for now while contracts expire), but without that “Currently watching” or “resume watching” feature it is extremely frustrating to constantly have to re-navigate to that gem you find by accident and started watching. Please update that first!

title: Needs work
review: The app has good content no doubt. But the fact that they didn’t think to put in a continue watching or watch again is ridiculous. You have no way of knowing what episodes of what show you’ve watched. You have to guess and hope. My other huge issue I have is the fact that they listed title on the app just for you to click and see it won’t actually be available for over a year???????? Why is it showing up then? What was the point in that? I was close to uninstalling and cancelling the subscription when 4 movies in a row were not actually available to watch. Just take them off.

title: Great Content! Good UI! Save for a few things.
review:
I love the content, the app UI. The only thing that’s frustrating is not having a continue watching, recently watched, etc... the main reason why, if you navigate away from the app for even a short time; the app closes in the background. So now you have to navigate to find what you were watching. 

It wouldn’t be a big deal if there was a Continue Watching and the Watchlist is buried in your Profile page. Having the Watchlist on the menu bar would be helpful as well.

Aside from this, Disney+ is one of the best streaming apps out there with some of the best content. Excited to be using it!

title: Great content, app needs work.
userName: Dr Who Loves Me, Who Loves Me Not.
review:
Like others have already said, there is either a size limit to the watchlist or there is an issue with the app tracking titles you try to add to your watchlist across devices.

I spent about an hour going through the app finding all the content I wanted to watch and adding titles to the watchlist. When I went to look at my watchlist it was disappointingly small, at least a third of the size that I had spent an hour selecting.

Only a few issues with the loading circle when switching between titles, initially I thought it was an issue with my wireless and the iPad, but it also does it on the Xbox with a wired connection, so there is something to the app having a buffer/preload issue.

Otherwise everything is great, absolutely love the breadth of content they have on offer. So many wonderful gems that haven’t been seen in a long time and exciting new content make the subscription a great value.

title: Quality app
review: This app has consistently been reliable from the beginning. And they don’t break stuff when they post app updates. That’s huge in today’s world. Sure, they’ve been a little slow to add new features to the app to bring it up to par with other streaming apps, but a more cautious pace of updates and changes helps ensure quality, and I support that. Contrasted with, say, Apple’s approach of dumping a hundred new features into a software release and believing that the release can be of high quality.

title: One little bug
review: Great app! Loving everything about it. The only issue I keep seeing is the visual will freeze every time a notification comes up and the audio keeps going. So, I have to exit out and go back in and hope it works. Usually it does. However, some movies like the black cauldron and the Sword in the stone stopped loading and wouldn’t play anymore. It was very frustrating. Just a little issue to help out with the overall enjoyment of the app. Just really don’t like his finicky it is. Thanks so much!

title: Buggy But Good
review:
A few times when sitting down to watch The Mandalorian, the Apple TV app said it couldn’t connect. Disappointing!

When skipping back 10 seconds on the Apple TV, the loading spinner remains onscreen half the time. Pausing and playing again clears it, but it’s very annoying.

There’s a similar defect on the iPhone app, where if you tap to bring up the controls and hit the skip back button, the controls are replaced with a loading spinner. Content continues to play, but whenever you attempt to bring up the controls again, the spinner is still there.

title: Great App!
review: I love Disney+ because of the multiple shows I get to watch. It has been great. It would be nice to have a “continue watching” list but I know it takes some time to fix problems. I have only run into one problem. When I log in, it tells me to contact customer service but nothing more than that. I’m still on the free trial and I’ve only been able to watch Disney+ two out of the five days I’ve had it because of this issue. Customer service was contacted but nothing was resolved. Disney+ is overall a great app and I can’t wait to see how far it goes!

title: AMAZING but...
review: I LOVE Disney Plus it is so awesome, you could watch hundreds of movies or tv shows in there just with a click, and don’t forget great downloading features. I do have one question though I noticed that on the show Ravens Home it only has two seasons on Disney Plus. When I went to go see on DisneyNOW (another app for watching that Disney made) it has four seasons which confused me and I thought that would be on Disney Plus also. Hopefully they get all the seasons so people can enjoy them!! Thank you hope you get back to me!

title: Best time           People are being mean to this app but it is so good
review:
I love the app because you can watch Disney movies without having to scroll forever but one thing that I would like y’all to do is to put descendants three on there

The people that have given the app a two and one star  rating didn’t know how to sign up but if it makes the makers feel better for the truth tell them that the only reason they gave those ratings is because they are jealous that they don’t have the money to make an app like this one

title: Huge Issues...almost not worth it
review: I love that there is so much variety from classics to new age shows and movies.  I agree with other reviews though. There needs to be a “Recently Viewed or Watched” option. Also, there is a lot of issues with shows and movies lagging, or not playing back. The screen freezes while the sound continues. Keeps telling me there is a problem with what I’m watching. I’ve close the apps, restarted my devices, uninstalled it then installed it again, checked my internet connection is good and now I have to wait on the phone for over an hour to get any kind of help. Extremely frustrating! Please fix. Would love to be able to give it five stars.

title: Room for improvements
review: I want to start with the two things that I was surprised to be missing from this streaming service: a ‘continue watching’ category, and the time stamp bar on the content you’re watching to indicate how far into the program you left off watching. With so many streaming services out there, I don’t understand how Disney could have missed including this on their platform? Anyways, aside from that, there is great content in this platform with more to come! With those two issues I mentioned above aside, I would certainly recommend this app and I can’t wait to see the content that’s in the line-up!

title: Amazing work
review: This truly is amazing. I love to how there is such a wide variety of movies and shows on here. This seriously brings back so much memories. However, there does need to be some changes. The app would be a lot better if 1)you added a “currently watching list” like Netflix. This can help prevent people from forgetting what episode or what movie they were watching. Plus there’s a bug to where I’m unable to remove movies from my watchlist. Yes I can add it to my list, but not remove it however. Also, add the watchlist button on the bottom so it’s more convenient for everyone instead of having to go to settings and clicking that.
