They now have full seasons of other popular series, which were missing when they first launched.  There is enough programming to keep me entertained for a long time, I’m looking forward to watching!

title: Unusable
review: Completely unusable to me. All I watch on NBC is Dateline and it’s on there but there’s no air date for the episodes.  To find the most recent you have to use a different app to look up tv listings, take note of the episode title, come back to peacock, search for dateline and then scroll through all the episodes hoping one matches the episode title you’re looking for.  You can’t even search by episode title. Why is there no way to scroll through listings in the app and press play. Or have the episodes listed with most recently aired first? The season and episode number don’t mean anything when they’re not aired on TV in that order. I’m going back to using the old NBC app and hope they don’t discontinue it.

title: Good start but not great
review:
The app is functional which is great there are just some functions I wish they had;
1. They don’t have a recently watched list. I got this to watch parks and rec. and I don’t watch the whole series in one go do a recently watched list is helpful for that
2. I cast to my chromecast for most of my watching and it doesn’t automatically keep on playing the next episode. I can not find an auto play button either so it’s just annoying to have to play the next episode everytime. 

These are just two of the major problems I have with the app if they were fixed I’d give 5 stars and most of the time they will fix in time just frustrating that streaming service do not have this a launch. 
Besides that the app works great has amazing selections and the ads aren’t so many that I just want to delete the app, I probably won’t go to paid but it’s still a great way to watch things that aren’t on other services.

title: Bad app. Good content
review:
Impossible to binge if you’re casting. Every episode requires manual intervention. So, unlock the phone, find the app, scroll to the show, change from 100 episode list to just the next in series (otherwise you side scroll through every episode in every season), and continue watching. 
If you start an episode midway you get a pop up just as you’re pressing the cast button and you end up pressing ‘start from beginning”. It seems they didn’t test the UI. 
Also, audio gets out of sync with every episode. Rewind will fix it for 20-30 minutes. 
I’d rather not cast but Peacock doesn’t exist on any of my other devices.

title: Horrible Livestream  Broadcast
review:
I tried watching an EPL live soccer game and it was extremely frustrating and a very poor experience. The streaming would frequently freeze and restart with delay. I would get a goal notification and two minutes later see it happen. At times the video would freeze by sound was working. Several times I had to close and reopen the app to unfreeze. And finally with 10 minutes left I couldn’t open the stream no matter how many times I tapped the program. 
It’s a shame they removed the EPL games from NBCSN network to make it exclusive for peacock. 
I will watch the rest of season on a European broadcast using my VPN. 
I would never pay for this poor quality service.

title: Great
review:
Started using this through Xfinity since day one. Worked flawlessly. Liked that the CC mimicked my customizations I made with Xfinity. 
Since September 10th. this app through Xfinity has sucked. It doesn’t connect and when it does it buffers endlessly. Now gives you a message that says it’s a third party app. When it does work it stops after every episode. And now the CC looks like crap. Hadn’t tried to AirPlay or Cast with the iOS app but I tried AirPlay tonight it obviously didn’t work. It was a great app through Xfinity but now it’s ehh. Please undo what you’ve done and stop trying to fix what wasn’t broken. Now it’s broken.

Update. 
Realized it was something on my end with the CC and found out we were experiencing internet issues last week. Still don’t like that you can’t AirPlay. Luckily I have a TV to Cast with. 
Bumped it from a 2 star to 4 star. 
Will add the extra star once AirPlay works.

title: Content great. The app needs some work
review: The app is pretty good but there are some weaknesses. There is way to make a watchlist. There is a continue watching list but it does work right. If I cast a show from the continue watching list, it will play from the time marked on the continue watching list, but it will not update the continue watching list to my new progress. If I finish a show and try to go to the next episode using the continue watching list, it will return to the same place as before.  To watch the next episode, I have to search for it. Peacock also lacks a means to give feedback other than app reviews, Hence I wrote this review.

title: Good price but need major work
review:
I like how premium plus is only 10 bucks so far but WHY do you have random episodes missing from a series?! It’s just crazy and infuriating. I can’t move forward because episodes are missing and there is no way to get them other than purchasing them on prime video. Out of 20 two somewhere in a middle will be missing. For each season. Madness 🤬🤪😩

As far as the appgoes, please incorporate previews of what you fast forward or rewind to, so it’s easier to tell where to stop. 

Peacock for shield also needs work. Remote buttons aren't corresponding properly.

title: Simple but yet a long way to go
review: I watch the premier league games on this app and I watch them with AirPods on. Every time this disconnects, the game pauses and it does not have a play button anywhere on the app to resume. So i have to close and start from scratch every time. Also if you switch apps to text and then try to open the app back up, it kicks you back to the main menu, even if you never closed this app. Other than that, it looks nice and I like the idea of switching to any game I want. (Games that show off air aren’t really off air, their menus don’t update quick enough to tell you a match has started).

title: Works well, but needs more
review: The app works well and does what it needs to. I love the free tier. The functionality of the app could use a little more work though. Taking a cue from Netflix, I would love to see this app allow the user to remove movies/shows from the continue watching list so that shows I’ve just started don’t remain if I decide I don’t want to continue them. This is just one small example of the lack of user experience oriented features that this app currently exhibits. Hopefully in a few weeks or months they’ll add more features to enhance our viewing experience.

title: Garbage App
review:
I downloaded recently and signed up for a subscription to watch Premier League. This in it self is a travesty because apparently no games are available on cable this season. Now to the app... every time i want to watch a game i have to re-download the app and sign in with all my credentials. This is because when i open the app it is stuck on the last game i watched and there is no way to back out of it to the main menu.

So to summarize: Premier League is now only available on Peacock and not via cable so thats not good. I have to pay minimum $4.99 a month to watch games now, not good. And the one that grinds my gears the most is that the PEACOCK app doesnt even work, not good at all. Come on NBC please fix this.

title: Disappointing
review: I pre bought this streaming subscription for a free app, and already felt dumb for that. Then on launch day I realize we can only watch from our phones. My house has 5 iPhones, 3 fire tablets, 4 roku TVs 2 fire sticks and a 2012 Vizio, and we can’t watch this app. I bought a cast app to get my iPhone to cast to my tv and peacock still wouldn’t cast, everything else from my phone did, until I opened peacock. We used a HDMI cord from the tv to to a laptop and got an error message. We knew our living room tv was old, we had no clue it was a 2012 until trying this app. Now I feel like I need to buy a different tv or a Apple TV box to watch a free app that I paid for. Thanks for making me feel stupid peacock.

title: Good Content, Needs User Profiles
review: I like the content Peacock has to offer, but the fact that it doesn’t have user profiles is an issue. It needs that urgently. It also needs 4K (for compatible shows and devices) and mobile downloads. To the issue of user profiles, once they do get released, there’s going to be a bunch of content on one person’s profile that the whole family had watched for the past month (or however long it takes for them to release this feature). So there also needs to be a way to edit watch history as well.

title: Easy to sign up, impossible to cancel
review: We got this to watch Yellowstone. Easy to setup and they gladly take your money each month.  They even provide a button to start your subscription on their home page,  HOWEVER bait and switch you by making it almost impossible to stop your subscription.  There is no way to really “cancel” your subscription.  You can mail a letter in via snail mail (seriously, can’t believe that’s even an option in 2020) Frankly, this should be a crime.  I would avoid the app or business with them until they make it easy to cancel or else you will be stuck with paying the monthly service without the ability to cancel.

title: One of the worst apps I’ve ever used
review: This is by far one of the worst apps I’ve ever used. In fact, I am not sure I can even go as far as saying “I used” the app because it kept glitching. I tried casting to my tv, as well as using several different platforms (Vizio, Xbox, and other platforms it is listed as compatible with). I am sure the content is lovely but it won’t play. We got it to play a movie at one point and got the whole 2 minutes of ads clear as day and then it froze and went back to the home screen. We tried again thinking it may have been a problem on our end, checked the WiFi, and all the tv connections, and it happened again. NBC do better.

title: Poor Streaming Experience
review:
I signed on for Premier League games. Two games in and the user experience is poor. As bad as twelve to fourteen seconds of “live” play then buffering. When the net delay is minutes the app drops to cast ready, on restart there is a time warp to current. Pass for first weekend of PL reasonable to the expiration of the 7-day trial reasonable. Looking forward to upscale of capabilities to remove air-quotes from “live”.

Week 2: Update... 1 up to 4 stars.
No delays today. It looks like they have wrung out the issues since last weekend.

title: All I care about
review: Is watching the EPL live.  And these muppets apparently have the rights to it but I have no idea where to find the games.  I have logged in to the premium subscription, and they have my cc details.  But they are too busy putting “funny” comments on their website about whether peacocks can fly and how many eggs they lay and what i really want to know is which games they are showing this weekend.  But the search function is so poor you cannot find anything.  You can me watching something, go and search for it and there are no results.  Peacock YOU ARE MUPPETS.  Muppets.  It defies belief that something so important could be left in the hands of such a bunch of toss pots.  Sort it out.

title: Very Disappointed-need to work out the AirPlay kinks out
review:
I have an old Apple TV so I couldn’t download the app on it. So I downloaded it on my iPhone X and was ready to stream a movie. 
It connected to my Samsung pretty easily and I watch the first part of the movie until a commercial kicks in. It disconnected and then started a whole new set of commercials. Then the movie started playing in fast forward. Super fast forward. So I quit the app and did the whole thing again. Same thing. I did it again!! That’s three times now of 5-7 minutes each time. 
I then quit and I’m done. 
Bad user experience. Need to QA and figure out commercials implementation across platforms. 
Kinda of sad for such a large app.

title: Lots Left To Get Right
review: If you are going to charge for a commercial free tier it has to actually be free of commercials. When video is viewed on a late model iPhone with no home button the home “line” at the bottom of the screen never disappears. Video is too small with too much letter boxing and no way to fill the screen via zoom for a larger image. App design is too complicated. Need “Browse” to be default view and Watchlist to be one of three main buttons via bottom navigation. I tried to submit the above as feedback but there was no easy way to do so via the app or via the website even though I tried - just ran into a useless chatbot offering pretend customer service.

title: Love this app, really free
review: Ok so first off- I really love this app. I love the fact that it is actually free... some streaming apps advertise to be free, but only the app download is free and access any material you have to ‘pick a plan’. With Peacock, you can just opt to watch commercials.  Lots of my favorite crime shows... the biggest issue I have seen with the app- on PlayStation 4, when watching a tv series, the episode will randomly stop 3-4 minutes early, it will continue to play when you go back into the episode however it is semi- frustrating...

title: Super disappointed
review: So far I’m super disappointed in this service! Paid the $5/month - so I knew there would still be commercials.... however every time it gets to a commercial break it goes back to the 16 min mark in the episode - then when we try to move it back to where we were it makes us watch the commercials again - then it sends us right back to the 16 minute mark so we can’t even get through an entire episode that we’re trying to watch!! I think we’ve seen the commercials 85 times each!! It’s taken us an hour and a half to watch an hour long show!! Very frustrating!!!!!

title: Meh
review:
Every time you open the app you have to go on a wild scavenger hunt trying to find your watchlist. It isn't listed in the top menu or bottom menu, it's just where ever they feel like dropping it today. How did this possibly get approved? I assume NBC has an entire team working on this, and nobody caught it? Or did you possibly some how think this was actually a good idea?

With the website you can at least bookmark the watchlist page, but I have an older iMac that just isn't powerful enough to run this website. It plays video. Computers in 1999 could play video. What could you possibly be trying to do that makes this website so bloated it can't even play video???

title: Where is the 0 stars option?
review:
I find the approach of exploiting cable/streaming subscribers who already pay for NBCSN by holding them hostage to also need to pay for peacock premium in order to watch the majority of premiere league coverage to be absolutely sickening. You’re double-dipping in the midst of an economic crisis.  I went from an almost universally positive opinion of NBC Sports to the complete opposite, and I’m not alone. Way to go, I hope it was worth it.

Also, I have some feedback on user experience that I would normally share to help improve the experience but I really have no desire to help this greedy little venture of yours succeed in any way so I’ll keep it to myself.  The gist is...it’s not great.

title: I want this app to be great!
review:
Very excited for this app!!! At first sight.... great content, great looking UI...  just frustrating to use. 
If watching a multi season show, pressing the more episodes button takes the user back to season1 Ep 1... time consuming and just novice like. 
Also, how about a homepage? Bookmark link?  
And most of all...I really thought the Last thing a paying subscriber would ever have to ask for is “play in the background”  
I’m sure it’s a work in progress and I’ll stay as long as possible!

title: Garbage, don’t waste your time our money!
review: I downloaded this app with great hopes and looking for original content. Well during the trial you don’t have access, the original content only stuff that is already provided by many other apps. Therefore, I wanted to drop this before the trial ended. Well here is where it got bad. There is no way to drop from the app or the site! They don’t have any contact number available. Then they funneled me to a chat but the chat is with a bot with preprogrammed responses to pick from, they don’t have the respect to chat with a real person. Then they have the gall to send an email request for feedback on their customer service! Freaking ridiculous!

title: Incredible content! How is this free?
review:
I can’t believe that all of my favorite content is finally free! From all of the timeless classics I loved growing up (Saved by the Bell!!) to iconic shows like 30 Rock (my fave), Peacock has so much to watch.  

I can’t wait to dive into all of this content. I have tons to get through even before The Office drops in 2021! 

I’ve been so excited for this app to release (saw the advertisements everywhere) and it does not disappoint. I literally can’t not watch.

title: UX needs a lot of work
review: I enjoy the content available on peacock, but the app on Apple TV is horrible. It doesn’t skip forward/back 10sec when clicking left/right on the remote; it doesn’t interface with Siri (e.g. hey Siri go back 10 seconds) to show closed captioning; doesn’t highlight a border or otherwise indicate what episode your cursor is on when scrolling; the time elapsed/duration bar while watching a movie stalls (e.g. stops counting at 34:31 even those 2:08 movie length); much more. Right now it’s only useful for basic functionality—click play and let it go. Literally *anything* beyond clicking play is not intuitive.

title: Broken Login and Bad Password Management
review:
After spending a while trying to login on the Apple TV and later iOS, I gave up and uninstalled the Peacock app on all platforms.

On the website, you can create a long password. Peacock doesn’t say the limit, but that limit is definitely longer than what the Apple TV and iOS apps will accept. Good luck logging in.

I tried changing my password, by Peacock doesn’t appear to like password managers. The website makes you type your password to verify to verify the one you’re using. This is bad security. Period. Peacock apparently wants you to choose a password you can remember and type. Numbers and letters are good. So, if you want to use “Password12,” then Peacock is your jam.

What makes this even worse is that, when you’re logged in to the website and choose the option to reset your password, you can’t simply do it from your account settings. Nope. Peacock will email you a magic link. Plan to invest even more time.

I’m not willing to invest anymore time in this.

title: Basic Updates Needed
review: Please update to allow fit to screen and picture in picture features.  Even shows in 4:3 format on an iPad screen should already fill the screen but it’s a small box in the middle of the screen (someone formatted the original format into a 16:9 format).  Picture in picture is available on almost every video app and has been an iPad (and soon iPhone feature) since 2015.  A flagship app should have at least these basic features (and flagship features).   Navigating to browse content is also a little clunky, especially in terms of video topics.

title: Terrible App!
review:
The content on Peacock is great however the app is absolutely the worst. It never returns to the correct show when continuing to watch. It doesn’t allow us to go to a specific episode either. If it’s there somewhere I can’t find it. It doesn’t allow skipping the openings of shows like every other app n the world does. It doesn’t allow skipping to the next episode like every other app in the world does.

Have considered upgrading to the $9.99 premium package but they warn that there will still be adds. Why? I thought we we would be paying to get add free content. Seriously hesitating to upgrade because all the app’s problems will still be present.

title: Terrible App, terrible service
review: Peacock is hot trash, it’s the worst of all the streaming services I use. They never put up the Premier League replays on time, and when they are finally up they don’t work. You can’t pause live tv even though I’ve had that option on cable for 15 years, you can’t rewind either. If you want to watch a specific episode of a show you have to click the first one and click through each episode as it auto plays until you get to the right one. I hate this service. I hate it so much. It is terrible in browser and as an app. If I wasn’t forced to have this to watch Premier League I would never ever ever use it again.

title: It’s a good streaming service for Xfinity owners
review: So if you were one of the people who got Peacock Premium for free then you gonna love it. It has Live TV and you don’t have to pay extra because it’s Live TV (finally). The UI looks pretty good and it works for the iPhone Notch Screens and for the newer iPads. It has good content like Shrek and Parks and Rec. More content are coming soon but the content right now is pretty good. Overall it’s a good way to start a streaming service.

title: Paying customer at premium - many issues
review:
Still have ads on most everything. No way to skip ads if it crashes in the middle and you need to jump back to where you were.

But the worse problem is that you can jump forward at all (it’s treated as jump back 5 seconds). And you can jump back but to go back a minute takes 20 or 30 quick clicks in the pause play menu while selecting the timeline.

The interface is horrible, un-intuitive and archaic. I paid for the discounted 1 year but otherwise I’d have cancelled due to the lack of functional jump forward/backward 10 or 30 seconds feature.

title: Faulty with chrome cast
review: It is not easy casting this app. It disconnects in the middle of the show, and casting issues is something I never have to deal with. If you do not catch the next show flag at the end of the episode you have to go back into the app and find the next episode. You cannot binge (you have to select every show it does not continuously play) and that’s what streaming is known for now. Not very user friendly and lots of kinks but good show offerings with short commercials. After watching the giant streaming company’s for years it’s easy to see this app has a long way to go!!

title: 5 Stars
review: I see a lot of negative reviews for this app, but personally I LOVE it. It actually is free and the movies and shows are actually good. There is “premium” which some things, you do have to pay for. But that’s like most streaming services, not everything is free. Free content is still A+. App layout isn’t the cleanest I’ve seen but it is still functional and easy to find things. 10/10 recommend to everyone.

title: Older ChromeCast support please
review:
The app is great but I would like to bring attention to an issue with connecting to the older model ChromeCast. 

The device shows up in the app and tries to connect when triggered. The TV screen (on the ChromeCast input) then turns black like it’s trying to connect but after a minute of black it reverts back to the ChromeCast home screen. On the phone the ChromeCast icon shows it’s not casting. 

It would be nice if a ticket could be addressed by IT to fix this. I am excited to use Peacock on my TV!

title: It’s a new app
review: Peacock is actually pretty good for a free streaming app that isn’t even a week old, yes the display could use some touch ups and it would be nice to have multiple profiles under the same account, but these are small details that can be updated in the future. Many people are complaining about its features but it hasn’t even received its first major update. I think it’s quality for how new it is.

title: Good service. Terrible app.
review:
I mainly use this app on Apple TV, and while the overall layout and menus aren’t bad, the fact that this app doesn’t use standard Apple TV playback controls makes it an absolute nightmare to use. 

I frequently use the left / right click on the trackpad remote to jump back or forward 10 seconds, but since the app uses their own playback controls instead of Apple’s, this doesn’t work. So while every single other app I use on my Apple TV works one way, this app doesn’t, which makes it so painful to use. 

I’d they’d just standardize that with the rest of the system, my rating would improve significantly.

title: This is a nice streaming service with lots of good content
review: This is a revision of a previous review. The app has added the ‘watch list’ and ‘continue watching’ under the ‘Browse’ tab. This makes it much, much easier to use. I like the content of the free version and will most likely pay for premium. I look forward to new shows being added. It is a nice new streaming service.

title: Can’t watch on Samsung, Poor Interface, search play
review:
This app has so many faults for NBC’s big push. Bought it to watch Premier League Soccer, not compatible with Samsung TV, no app for tv. Must get a Chromecast to cast and watch. WHY?!? I am paying to watch and want this in my big tv. 

Also so hard to find the shows. What is Channels - Trending - Browse? Why can’t I favorite my channels, then I pick Premier League and no games listed just the pregame shows. What the hell??? How hard are you going to make it to find games. 

Such a poor design - nbcsports app was so much better organized. Really really really backwards and poor.

title: Problems from the start
review: App has has major problems since it launched. At first it wouldn’t cast to my chromecast. It would connect for 1-2 seconds and then drop even though other apps on the same device have no issue. So I waited...several weeks. Now it will cast and I can start watching  something, but the video freezes every couple of minutes. The audio keeps going and I can get the video back if I hit the 10 second back button, but having to do it every couple minutes makes it unusable. Can’t wait for this app to get lined out since I have paid for a full year of the service..

title: Underdelivered is an understatement
review: I’ve been excited about getting service for a couple of months now since I love the universal monster movies and nbc sitcoms of years past.  I pre ordered the top tier package ($50 a year more the other package) because I hate commercials.  First movie I try to watch, Brewster’s Millions and there’s 3 minutes of commercials before I can even watch this movie that came out 30+ years ago.  I am livid and I want my money back.  I’d almost forgive an occasional commercial if the selection of film and tv wasn’t so terrible.  I should have never spent money on this app, it’s clearly the worst streaming platform on the market.

title: Great for an app that’s just been launched!
review:
There’s a ridiculous number of complaints being written for a free app, just out of the box. 
The quantity of free streaming shows is very impressive.  NBC could have easily made this a fully subscription application, but chose to include a limited number of ads and make it free.  No doubt that current complaints about lack of ROKU support will be addressed in a future update.  
This is definitely a winner....thanks NBC!

title: Doesn’t connect to my chrome cast tv
review: I wanted to watch my favorite show on my tv, and when I saw that the app supported chrome cast, I was extremely excited...until it didn’t fully connect and couldn’t play the episode, so I wasn’t able to watch anything from the Peacock app on my television. I know this is a new app and all so I don’t want to be harsh, but I hope this could be fixed in the next update. Other than that, I really enjoy the content this app has!!

title: This app is terrible
review:
Here it is. I have enjoyed some of the content. For example, I wanted to watch Battlestar Galactica again. But the user interface on the appletv is so horrible that I watch anything on any other streaming service first. The simplest thing, a brief rewind because you were away too long in a commercial is practically impossible on the appletv. Not because you can’t, but because the typical back ten seconds / forward ten seconds does not work. You have to use the app scrubber which has almost no control. 

I could go on, suffice to say I skip this app in favour of watching anything else. Fix your stuff, NBC.

title: Subtitles
review: Dear Peacock. I tried to contact you by going to the website and clicking help, but your bot was in no way able to provide me the answers I needed. I actually want to tell you that your subtitle in the series “The Capture” on episode 1 was out of sync. I just wanted to tell you that and there is no way I can leave a suggestion anywhere or contact you to tell you that. Maybe you can hire me to quality check your subtitles ;) hehe. The series is interesting BTW. ^_^

title: Unfortunate
review: I would have liked to start watching shows on Peacock, but unfortunately, they’re not on ROKU, and they don’t work with my older version of Apple TV.  The only way for me to watch is on my iPhone 11, and unfortunately, I want to watch on a tv screen.  They’ve also arranged it so that you can’t screen mirror the Peacock shows from your iPhone to the older Apple TV.  All of my other entertainment apps work perfectly well with screen mirroring.  I guess NBC isn’t as serious about entering the streaming business as the other big players.  I’ll be sticking with the other guys...

title: Peacock needs to allow users to opt out of auto play
review: It is an incredibly tedious thing to have to find where you left off in your watching history. Peacock gives you perhaps 15 seconds before it streams the next episode. And it will keep streaming until it’s played every episode. So when I go back to keep watching a show, I don’t know where I am, all the episodes have been marked played while I was sleeping. And you’re lost.

title: Not great, could be better
review: Just discovered Peacock and free streaming is awesome BUT there are definitely problems to be fixed. So far what’s bothering me is 1) When an ad starts to play you can’t seem to change episodes? Hit the back arrow and it takes you back to the home screen, hit pause and the ad pauses, and there’s nothing else you can do. 2) discrepancies in play history. When I back out of an episode, there’s no guarantee that next time it’ll start where I left off. 3) maybe I just haven’t figured this out, but how do you fast forward and backward??

title: Worst of any streaming app.  Who would pay for this?
review:
It begins with less than smooth multi step process of associating with your cable carrier account.
After that it buffers a lot (when others don’t)—the ‘Continue Watching’ is there sometimes—and other times it isn’t. 
Often just closes/crashes. It doesn’t support Picture in Picture. 
Also often when you see something featured you can’t just click on it to view it-no ‘watch it now’ and you have to type title into search to bring it up and watch it.

title: Terrible😡😡😡😡😡😡
review:
I can NOT believe this app is still available in the app store😡😡😡 I downloaded this app to enjoy movie and shows and this is how it operates??!!!!?!! I am VERY disappointed and can’t express my hatred toward this app because have u ever had a dream that, that, um, that u had, uh, that u had to, u could, u do, u wit, u wa, u could do so, u do you could, u want, u wanted him to do u so much u could do anything? I would like to add that I think this app does have good features and quality content.

Thank you

title: No ROKU Or Background Listning
review:
I am tired of more and more streaming services fracturing our wallets and attention. However, I love some NBC/Universal content a lot. 

On Mobile I would use this app IF it allowed for background listening. If I want to listen to a soccer match, tv show, or news while I do something else or even work, I can’t. In 2020, every streaming platform needs background listening support in their free tier. How else am I even going to spend enough time in the app to realize I need it?!

But my family watches content on ROKU on three televisions. So, without ROKU support, Peacock is useless.

title: No mirror/airplay and have to continuously search
review: I was super excited by the price and content of this streaming service. However since spending some time streaming I am not happy with a couple things. I am not happy that you cannot mirror/airplay to your Apple TV from your phone, sound will come through but video will not which seems to be a problem several people are having. Also, unlike with other streaming services, I have to constantly go and find the show I was watching and the episode. It does not have a continue watching feature that pulls up when you open the app.

title: Basic Features
review: Missing Profiles for family, the Playing Interface on Apple TV is finicky at best and refuses to pause at worst. Scrubbing through a show is almost impossible as there is no preview box. The selection of content is decent but most of what I want to watch can be found on other streaming services I’ve already signed up to use. Which leaves the only content I want to watch on the app locked behind the premium account. This would be fine and I’ll consider upgrading once user profiles are added and the bugs are fixed.

title: Peacock EPL COVERAGE IS A RIP OFF!
review: Obviously NBC is after a money grab.  No premier league mornings can’t watch a game I missed until they post replay at 9:00 that night just spend money on dish and record game watch at your convenience  in 2020 how does a company as big and powerful as NBC not allow for immediate viewing of a game, ridiculous.  If anyone at Peacock reads this you have to know not only is your product have technical issues (streaming issues) but the way you have set up your EPL games is unjust, and unfair to us EPL fans, wish you’d do better but I have no faith that you will.

title: Play on Roku
review: I would buy the paid version if I could watch on my Roku. Thanks for the free version. I really enjoy the shows you let me watch for free. Please make a auto play option. I like to be in control of my shows. I fall asleep at night and several episodes have done played. I like the option to stop all episodes on their own without me having to hit cancel. Having profiles would be nice on the Roku too. Thank you!

title: Garbage
review: This app is complete garbage. Not only is it not available on almost all the most popular devices, they actually make you pay for watching premium content that you have to jump through hoops to watch. The app itself is poorly organized and almost impossible to find anything. I had to stream from my phone to my Chromecast and the buffering was almost non stop and unwatchable. They really need to make this better and available on all devices like Samsung TVs and Rokus before you ask to charge for premium content. Disappointing.

title: Love it now
review: Changing my review from before. Sorry for the hate. But freakin love this app. The quality is awesome and even if you miss a premier league then you can still watch the whole game in replays. And it’s handy. You have the app on the phone so you can use it anywhere. Hope the monthly price stays the same. App does needs some improvements but in time I am sure you guys will nail it. Satshriakal

title: The news section needs work
review:
Obviously, it is great that a free version is being offered. I was hoping for better access to news stations... more content compared to the NBC News app. But, there are still only highlights for the MSNBC programs. Worse, you can not see their title or what date they aired. The automatic playlist is an irritant.

Please, add full MSNBC shows... I would be a paying customer if that was available. Add dates for all news related programing. Do not have sections that begin to play before you choose what you want to watch! Add a preference to turn off autoplay.

title: Not IPhone X and further compatible
review: The app lacks so many features that I like to use with my newer iPhone. Not only is it impossible to fully zoom it in, there is about a centimeter gap at the bottom of my screen that’s just black for no reason. The fact that it doesn’t resume episodes at the right time is also very aggravating. And where many other streaming apps have the capability to go to home and still be able to watch it while scrolling in a smaller box ,this app completely lacks that ability

title: It’s okay, needs work.
review: The library selection is vast. The UI needs work to better navigate through the offerings. People are complaining about the limited support on their smart devices like roku, Apple TV, etc. I will tell you that you people need to get a chromecast and stop complaining. You bought an device you think you can get everything on. Sorry but casting came first with Chromecast. So go pick up one for $30 bucks and you’ll never have to worry about an app not being supported.

title: Horrible interface
review: The interface of how you search for shows, you can’t view live TV, trying to search through multiple seasons of a show and the overall layout is difficult at best. It was not well thought out and you can tell they saw how everyone else didn’t it and said we want to be different. Mission accomplished you are different. There is a reason so many of the TV app all do it the same way because it works. You accomplished in being the worst TV app I have and I subscribe to must of them. I hope that you review these and make the necessary changes soon.

title: I’m changing my review from 2 stars to five
review:
I was one of the first downloaders and I admit, I wasn’t too happy. But after about 10 days or so the app really got good, and I’ve been binge watching some old shows I grew up with.

One minor complaint. I’m watching on an iPad, and I wish there was a volume button on the screen like Netflix has. 

I also wish you’d have all 20 seasons of “Law and Order” . I love Lenny Briscoe.

title: Great movies and shows
review: The free content available [to cable customers] is great! The app features a multitude of programs to satiate war/history buffs, like myself. Along with virtually countless dramas and comedies for the spouse and the little ones won’t be left out either. My only critic is the platform/visual (GUI) set up of the app itself. For example, the "My Watchlist" tab is non-existent nor is there an actual "Home" screen. All-in-all this is good app even tho it needs some visual edits.

title: Can’t Watch
review: I paid for this a few months ago.  At that time it stated that it would be available on 2019 Smart TVs.  After I signed up for the most expensive level of no ads they must have clarified brands.  So my Samsung TV is a no go.  No problem.  I have Airplay2 on the Regular NBC app so no problem.  Except that there is no Airplay2 icon when playing a show on the new app.  So I try screen mirror.  It will play the ads at the beginning just fine but then when the actual show plays, the tv goes black but the audio is still there.  Ugh. So they will need to fix this or I will cancel and dispute the charge.

title: Don’t complain if your not paying
review: It has soo many good shows and movies for free, it was just released so of corse it’s going to have a few things it will need to change as it goes on but since I’m only using the free version I don’t have the right to complain about that. (Though it’s not much) as someone who can’t afford streaming services or cable I appreciate this app very much

title: Terrible UI on Apple TV
review: Content is great. But the UI on Apple TV is horrendous. Why does it not use the normal playback controls that basically every other streaming app uses? No left/right click to skip backwards/forwards. No simple “click and swipe” to scrub through the timeline. Instead there’s a clunky and unintuitive way to do this (without a thumbnail of the content as you’re scrubbing) and no good visual indication if you’re even in scrubbing mode or adjusting some other setting. It’s really terrible.  Just clicking play mostly works but even then it is pretty flaky.

title: WON’T EVEN LET ME CREATE AN ACCOUNT
review: I have tried to create an account but it won’t let me! It continues to say I already have an account even after I created an new email!  When I try to contact an agent it glitches and I can’t see the chat!   It is ridiculous!  This isn’t the first time I have try to make an account!  I had trues online and in app!  I deleted the app and re-downloaded it.  It never helped! I tried on my computer as well as my phone Incase it wasn’t compatible with my device and it still never changed!! I would greatly appreciate if you would solve this problem!! Thank you in advance!!!!

title: Disgusted
review: NBC has the audacity of having Trump do his Town-hall “debate” while still being infectious. NBC catered to Trump’s complaining and will put this on at the same time Biden is doing his Town-hall all for ratings and Ad revenue. Trump is a coward for not debating Biden per the agreed schedule and NBC are a bunch of cowards for placating to Trump. I will watch Biden on ABC and I hope Biden buys an ad telling people to switch over to a reputable station to watch a real presidential candidate.

title: Sad, inadequate, not worth 1 cent
review:
Limited Premier League content
Premier League Coverage split across three separate platforms. 
No guide function
Can only see programming one hour ahead
Locks up to black screen often
NO portrait mode so you can scan channels while watching
NO background viewing or audio
NO picture in picture
Search function is useless. Type in Premier League get zero results even though its on in 44 minutes. Type in Soccer and only get Womens Soccer as a result without any of the other games on the service

Yes it is a streaming service. A service of mystery, no sole source for Premier League, we were forced to get this useless service with less coverage and features if we wanted anything more than 1 game a week. 

Instead of a nimble, accessible streaming service with robust search, guide, and at least as much coverage of EPL  as last years Gold we have a mishmosh of shows with no easily navigated organization. Its Crap. 

Sad.

title: Room for improvement
review: The app itself is more or less fine, however for my personal main usage (streaming premier league) it’s not very good. Navigating to the game you want to watch can be difficult (grouping/categories unclear). Once there, game replays are not immediately available. Games do not have rewind controls or play/pause. Finally, there seems to be no way to AirPlay the game to a nearby TV. There’s a big opportunity to make this the go-to PL experience. NBC Sports provided line-ups, statistics, and all of the above, so this is a major step back in experience.

title: Confusing Controls on Apple TV
review: For a user paying $10/mo, this is a poor quality app with lots of superior alternatives. The playback controls on the Apple TV app are very awkward and confusing, Peacock app shouldn’t reinvent it’s own controls when major apps like Netflix and Prime use Apple TV’s native controls and gestures for selecting subtitles, scrubbing (rewind and fast forward), it’s very difficult to scrub to a specific time when you can barely see the extremely small timers on a large screen.

title: Annoyed and Disappointed
review: I have Apple TV on my iPhone and downloaded this Peacock TV app. It’s my first time doing so, so I do not have an account. However, every time I try to sign up, I keep getting the same error message that “we’re having a problem” blah, blah, blah. I’ve tried restarting my phone three times and still get the same error message. It’s a waste of time advertising an app that you can’t even log into. I tried to contact the “Support Team” pertaining to this issue but didn’t get anywhere with that either. I would love this Give app 0 stars but it won’t allow you to do so and still post a review #VERYDISSATISFIED

title: Not so good
review: You would think that a big company like NBC would read, respond and fix the complaints about this app.   The app opens and plays on my iPad.  When I try to mirror it to my TV through an Apple TV generation 3, I am able to see and hear the ads on my TCL TV, but when the show begins I can still hear the audio, but my TV screen only shows the last black frame of the ad with “0” showing on the countdown timer.   The show continues to play on my iPad screen but does not mirror to the TV.  Very frustrating and disappointing.

title: Can airplay commercials but not actual content
review:
Like so many others have said, we tried to stream this via “airplay” from a phone to our Apple TV. The commercials played fine and then went to a black screen with only audio for the actual movie. 
We then tried to play it from the website on a laptop and it started the first commercial and froze. This could in part be a slow connection, but after that the site only said “An error occurred,” “Content not found,” etc.
We still haven’t seen Psych 2!
Please fix.

title: I think this a good app
review: I really like this app if your a mom there’s some kids shows this is a good app I don’t know why people are putting 1 stars but I give this a 5 if you don’t like it witch I don’t know why you wouldn’t like it but if you don’t like it then delete it for me this is a good app my favorite tv show is fail army or something but can you put some more movies plzzz

title: Annoying Interface
review: Gorgeous interface that drives me nuts. I’m on a paid plan, but when I open the app I don’t see “continue watching.” Have to click to Browse (?) and then I only see the last episode in progress. If I’m not sure it’s the right one (I’m binging so maybe fell asleep or got distracted) I can’t read the description there, I have to click back to series then toggle to the current season and scroll to find the episodes I’m on. How has every other streaming app figured out a better way to do this? Doesn’t seem hard.

title: Limited Device Streaming
review: Peacock is not currently available as an app on Samsung TVs. In an effort to still view the new Psych movie on our tv, we downloaded the app on both an iPhone and Macbook to mirror to the tv. The app is viewable on the TV as well as the ads before the movie. But as soon as the movie begins, the video cuts out, rendering it completely useless. We still watched the movie on the laptop, but it’s frustrating to see so much hype over this app and not even get to use it on our tv. Very disappointing.

title: Commercials
review: Soooo I had seen multiple commercials for this app anddd I was like I might as well just try it. I was pretty interested Bc every commercial said “watch for free” and I just wanted to try it out to see how “free” it really was. I had also gotten it Bc I wanted to watch a new show that was based on a book I had read in high school. I started the series and absolutely loved it but then got on to watch episode 3 expecting it to be free, but it wasn’t.  I’m reallyy disappointed Bc it was a really good show. I just think that if you say “watch for free” I expect it to be for free.

title: Missing and incomplete seasons
review: I really wanted to like this service. I had been waiting for this service since it was announced. My biggest complaint is that they don’t have all the seasons of SNL. They start from season 23 and even than they are just the best of not even full seasons. They did the same with Law and Order. They started from season 8. Who in their right mind wants to start in the middle of the series. I will say though the most positive takeaway for me is that they do have Law and Order:CI which is awesome. NBC and Peacock needs to fix these issues.

title: Consistently Bad
review:
Can’t join streams from the beginning. No spoiler-avoiding features. Categorization of content is virtually nonexistent— you just have to hope you can browse successfully via their featured interface at the time needed. No way to easily see schedules for leagues. Search literally just doesn’t do anything.

All the problems from the NBC Sports App and now you have the privilege of paying $5/mo (with ads!) for it. Fantastic. So glad this terrible app is the only way to watch the sports I want. Broadcast the games on a normal channel so the proper tech companies like Google can do your job for you, please.

title: Sound and scrubbing need help.
review: Sound is always way too loud or way to soft going into a commercial and coming out of it. Either the show is too loud when the add is over or the add is way too loud. Happens every time on Apple TV. Idk about other devices. And they need to fix the forward and reverse controls for Apple TV remote. There’s no going back or forth 10 seconds like they have on all other app and trying to just scrub back and forth is terrible. Just make it like Netflix.

title: chromecast won’t connect
review: One star review to report a bug. Chromecast fails to connect on iOS so I can’t watch any content with my family on our tv. It says it’s connected in the app, but the content continues to play on the phone while the tv says Peacock ready to connect. It won’t even let me disconnect from within the app. I have to force close it out. Chromecast works fine in other apps, I tested before posting this review. It’s especially frustrating since there isn’t a fire stick app yet. If the app is the only way to watch content on a larger device via chromecast, this has to be a priority.

title: Great new option
review: Peacock tv/ app on iOS and ps4 platforms has been a great new option to watch older shows that simply are not available anywhere else for free. However, the only mention of improvement is to fix the playback and autoplay functions. Every time I fast forward or rewind on an episode or movie it always seems to get stuck and not play. (This is not a connectivity issue) I eventually give up and go to another app. Please fix

title: Needs some serious bug fixes
review:
Episodes never resume where you left off, you have to select subtitles every time you use the app, it takes forever to cast to Chromecast (which has never been an issue with any other app), and, worst of all, it doesn’t autoplay the next episode while casting. 

These are all pretty basic components of literally every streaming service in 2020. It’s kind of crazy that they can get away with this all while charging $12 for no ads and full library access. Disappointed, but my hands are tied because of my need for its content!

title: Great But Still Needs Some Work
review: The service is amazing. Love the service, the app just needs a few bugs worked out. It occasionally crashes, but other than that, my only complaints are and I really hope they add these features, the ability to add channels to a list of favorite channels that you can quickly navigate to, and an easier way to find your watchlist. You can add things to your watchlist but it’s cumbersome to actually find the watchlist itself.

title: Major buffering
review: My family and I got peacock to watch a few specific shows that they took from other streaming services, and the one we started watching is great, love the content. However, we can’t get through a 45 minute episode in less than 75 minutes due to constant buffering and loading. Needless to say there’s a ton of bug fixing that needs to be updated and done so viewers like my family and I, can enjoy watching our shows without buffering every 10 seconds and getting very angry.

title: It’s brilliant!
review: Idk why all the negative comments. Yes, the UI is different but it’s simple. Touch each button, try it out.  You do need decent internet service, but my internet is only one grade up from basic and it works perfectly. If your having trouble with buffers or unable to watch a complete movie that your internet, not this product.

title: I like it, but they have a long way to go before it's really usable.
review:
Things that still need to be fixed include:
1- varied streaming quality from one minute to the next
2- autoplay randomly turns off
3- formatting of profile in app is wonky so not everything is visible
4- watchlist disappears and reappears randomly
5- watchlist doesn't necessarily track where you are in an episode
6- if you finish an episode, but autoplay isn't functioning, then the app will replay the same episode you just finished when you try to watch the next episode
7- the episode tray that appears beneath the minimized episode screen should automatically scroll to where you are in the series, especially since it ends up beinghe only way you can successfully navigate between episodes. Right now, you always have to start 1.1 and scroll to where you are

title: Premier League Gold Pass User Oblivion
review:
It is totally understandable that forcing a bunch of users into one app will come with challenges. I can imagine the look on the respective project manager’s face when the “idea guy/gal” announced the executives thought his/her idea to eliminate all the various content subscription services and merge them into one was “added value!” And here we are.

I cannot find any of the content I want, easily. The app does not “remember” what I like and I can’t seem to identify what I like. Each time I log in, I am flooded with content I do not want nor have ever wanted. 

And I pay actual money for the “pleasure.”

title: LOVE IT
review: i love it !!! it has some of the shows and movies i’ve been wanting to watch for awhile . like i wanted to watch the harry potter films again , because i’ve haven’t seen them since i was younger and they had EVERY single one . i finished watching the last one today & completely sobbed 🥺. amazing , highly recommend if you want to watch all harry potter films.

title: Not a good replacement for NBC Sports app
review:
Okay, sure, you can stream premier league games and replay them just like before. But that’s where the similarities end. You can’t customize which teams you follow, view league scores, or even get notified when your favorite teams are about to play.

It’s really lacking in that regard, and that’s disappointing, considering there’s no alternative for US consumers.

Side note, no portrait mode viewer? Why not allow that and show stats below the stream?

title: Thissucks99
review: Once you make an account the app is probably fine. When you need to make a password to create an account it is extremely horrible. It doesn’t tell you the password requirements, and you can’t edit what you wrote you have to delete every time so I ended up spending nearly 10 minutes trying to create a password I could both remember for this useless account and also would fit the requirements. In case you were wondering the password I went with is the title of this review. So if you’re looking for a password thissucks99 will work.

title: $5 a month for shows nobody wants to watch
review:
Yay finally I can pay hard earned money for reruns of such steaming piles as everybody hates Chris and psych. Literally the worst tv shows in history and you’ve got the nerve to charge money. If I wanted to see reruns of Frazier, I’d hang around the lobby of a nursing home. Oh boy! EVERY Mary Kate and Ashley movie!!! Reboots of shows nobody asked for coming soon??!! 

 I basically signed up to watch ap bio season three, binged it and forgot to cancel my trial. Oops. Guess I’ll keep flipping through every few days, finding absolutely nothing of value, for the next three weeks until my cancelation is active.

title: Needs a lot of work
review:
Content seems like it’s there but it’s hard to get to. Lay out makes little to no sense. I have a very hard time finding the things j know I want to watch and an impossible time discovering new things. The trending page seems to serve little to no purpose and the browse section is populated with a nonsensical hodgepodge of things put in no discernible order. And the search functionality never helps. But I’m glad NBC was able to buy an Editor’s Choice award from Apple. 

Smells like Seeso all over again.

title: Pathetically Useless on Apple TV
review: This is a total joke of an App. Only using because forced to to watch some EPL games. No opinion on other content. Every. Single. Time. the app hangs, has poor controls and is generally a challenge. To make it worse next time I try to open the App it either hangs or has other issues and refuses to come off last item played. I have to literally delete app, reload app, sign in again to get it to do anything. The worst app of all the hundreds I have tried on Apple TV. I am now using an illegal stream of EPL rather than out up with this rubbish.

title: You have a problem...
review:
So I started watching with The Capture. 
I use subtitles when I watch as I have a hearing issue. The problem I’m referring to is with the subtitles. I don’t know yet if it’s a system wide problem, but the subtitles have about a 2 second lag behind the spoken word.... very, very distracting. Please look into this. There’s no way I’m going to  pay for a subscription if this is an ongoing issue. When this gets resolved I will give it the 5 stars I think it deserves.

title: Terrible device to tv casting
review: If your plan is to watch on a device and cast to tv then be prepared to be set back a whole five minutes. roku does not support this app so all roku users, sorry but youll need a different streaming device. not compatible with playstation either so for those with a ps4 as back up to a roku, sorry. i have found the app on my xbox however. all hope is not lost. but if you dont have an xbox then idk what to say. maybe hook up your laptop to a tv via hdmi. which is a bummer. in a world of wireless, it would be a bummer to have to resort back to a hardwired connection. users beware.

title: Awful app and business model
review: This app is complete garbage.  If it’s based even remotely off the NBC Sports app how did they screw it up so badly.  I understand that this application isn’t just meant for sports fans but visually and functionally the NBC Sports app was far superior.  I only downloaded this application because of NBC’s decision stream some EPL matches on peacockup, however, it’s a complete disgrace to split content/matches between NBC Sports (which cable subscribers have to pay for) as well as then charging them again to watch content/matches on this app.  Zero stars for me (unfortunately I have to hand out one)!

title: Premier league warning
review:
Definitely not spoiler free. Games are very hard to find when looking for replays. No real sort order, terrible menu navigation. Can’t find content I want in the sea of junk I don’t want. 

Replays for the PL are supposed to be available after 9pmEST. Which I know is ambiguous on purpose but it is after 10pm and still not all games are uploaded. With 8 years of rights to the league, you think this would be seamless by now? B/R Live had the champions league for one year and they had a spoiler free mode, easy menu navigation, and very easy to find/timely replays.

title: It’s okay, I guess
review: I know that this app is pretty new and all, but it’s missing a few key features. It doesn’t support picture in picture, which is a pretty big deal, and the app itself is pretty hard to navigate. It’s kind of disappointing that they took Parks and Rec and other good shows off of Netflix to show off the new Peacock app, when there isn’t really anything to show off. I hope future updates will make up for it.

title: Please add 4:3 aspect ratio
review: Peacock has a lot of content that predated high definition. As such, it is difficult to watch content that is originally formatted for 4:3 aspect ratio that has not been upgraded to HD because there is no way currently to enlarge the screen on the iOS iPad app to fill the screen for those shows. Please add this feature. Best of luck with the new network.

title: Inconsistent Quality, Hard to Navigate
review:
To be fair, i don’t have an interest in this app beyond live sports and am being forced to use it because NBC is moving their cable coverage largely behind this second paywall.

More than other streaming apps, however, I’ve found the quality to vary massively, and I’ve noticed it’s also consistently over a minute behind the streams that social media posts from other countries are watching (based on reactions to events). Far below the quality of ESPN+ and Fox Sports as well as Hulu/Netflix type apps. Really frustrated and disappointed.

title: Sorry EPL fans - You’re screwed
review: So if you want to watch certain EPL matches you have to purchase the premium version of this garbage app. It doesn’t cast to smart TVs, it can barely stream HD content consistently via the latest generation Apple TV. What project manager signed off on this app going live when it is clearly not ready?? Unfortunately, if you’re looking for other options for specific matches there aren’t any....welcome to EPL Peacock hell. Note: The best work around for Apple TV users is to download the app to your Apple TV and play from there...still buggy but better than nothing at all

title: Another App increasing lack of security
review: I was beyond excited for this app to arrive.  I pay for premium cable and I expected to be able to log in to this app to use that experience.  This app requires a separate log-in & password.  One more item that can be hacked and exploited when there isn’t a need.  Yes, I understand the shared experience across platforms concept, but if I choose not to exploit myself and the data NBC wants on me, when I already pay a premium to my provider...then why should I create an account. FOX tried this, then allowed for no log-in... why can’t Comcast?

title: The ads mess up everything
review: Great content. However, the ads mess up everything. First, when you leave the app and come back it (even for a minute) it makes you watch an ad again. Two, the ads are just the same ones repeating over and over (which doesn’t help the company because it makes me associate their brand with an annoyance. Lastly, it used to be one ad per episode and now that I updated the app today, it’s three per episode. To which I must remind you, are the same ads over and over. Such as; Target, Suburu, Magnum Ice Crea, etc. really annoying...

title: Clumsy UI choices and Gotcha Tactics
review:
First, the weird UI. Signing in to your Comcast account for the mid tier is not intuitive. The resume, settings, and other common account options are buried in odd places. However the WORST UI flaw is the white app swipe bar never leaves and the video playing back doesn’t scale fully to the height of the phone. 

Second, you’re going to be bombarded with ads. The first day, a show will have 1-2 ads. The next few days, 4-5. After about a week, every ad break is used with 2-3. Ugh.

title: Expansive library for free
review: I have Xfinity Internet and get Peacock for free and for that I really cannot complain. I am using the Peacock app on Apple TV and in comparison to other reviews, I actually like the interface and have not had some of the issues other reviewers experienced. Peacock provides a substantial library under the free edition for Xfinity users. Very happy so far!

title: Not quite there
review: When it’s time for commercials the app will freeze and need a restart. The menu bar when you’re watching something isn’t efficient... when you try to fast forward, if you aren’t careful you may accidentally select “more episodes”, which is frustrating. Peacock, please enable the ability to click 10 seconds forward/back, and clean up the menu bar during playback.

title: Peacock is a waste.
review: I paid for Peacock Premium to see Premier League games, but they barely play any. Sure, I’m happy since they play a lot of Liverpool games, but they don’t play all of them. Also, I would like more games generally, not only Liverpool. I watch Premier League every morning for excitement, only to find out their are no games I can watch from Peacock at that time or at that day. If there is, it’s likely I can’t watch it because I am busy at that time. The only up is that they stream more Liverpool games.

title: Great streaming service but needs work
review: I love using Peacock but it’s extremely glitchy, it needs lots of work and it glitches out often especially on the online website. The closed captions also need work as well. Sometimes the closed captioning will freeze but display more. Other than these few glitches i highly recommend using this streaming service. I look forward to what the future holds for Peacock.

title: Layout needs work
review:
I’m trying to figure out the point of the page that the app opens to? I think, though of course your want to be original, it would be helpful to have some kind of layout similar to other streaming apps. That would help the majority of people who do (pay for) other apps to navigate yours.

Bonus points for putting ads at the beginning of what I’m watching though, so that they don’t interrupt. I do appreciate that!

title: No binge options?
review: I have the option to cast to my TV which is nice bc my smart TV doesn’t have the app, however I need to use my phone to select a new episode every single time the one I’m watching ends, it doesn’t just immediately play through the series and proceed with the next episode. Also, the interruption of the ads throws off the syncing of the audio with the video and by the end of the episode the audio is like 2 whole seconds ahead of the video and it looks like it’s dubbed.

title: Terrible execution driven by a executive who doesn’t understand the digital space
review:
The app itself is bad, they try to push “live tv” down your throat, but why do live tv when you can stream on your the me?  This defeats the purpose.

It doesn’t support roku, or Samsung tv... which is where I stream from....

Also, as a English premier league can’t, instead of streaming all games available like they used to for $100/year nbc sports gold, they now stream some games under peacock and some games under nbc sport... great idea to make things more difficult to consuming....

title: ADA non-compliant!
review:
Deaf already excluded from much in the hearing world. COVID-19 mandates of social distancing, especially masks block the “lip-reading” that most hearing people expect Deaf to do, being misinformed or out of masked benevolence.
Frustrating is the ruling that CC’s be provided on Audio-visual media, with loopholes. I hope it is not a loophole, but there are no CC available or being displayed, and there is nothing in settings for them either. Could there also be descriptive technology coded into the app for visually-challenged/blind, though I sight is fine, I think of the Deaf-blind/Blind-Deaf and the immense isolation and exclusion they may face every day.

title: Ok bit no local channel support.
review: While I like the live view section there seem to be a minor irritation and one larger one. The small one is, that as an NBC Nightly News consumer, the “on demand” section didn’t make clear by day/time, which is the latest version recorded and how old it is (series number and episode number are irrelevant to me). The larger one is that for $5 I can’t even local NBC channel and got the local news! That’s pretty basic guys.

title: Doesn’t support overseas military
review: Sadly, this app apparently doesn’t support U.S. military and government civilians and their families stationed overseas. It would have been great to view NBC/Peacock’s content and get a piece of home (that’s different from that provided via the Armed Forces Radio and Television Service). I’ll keep the app for my occasional visits to the States, but I’m disappointed the developers didn’t think about the tens of thousands of Americans stationed overseas - 50,000+ here just in the Kaiserslautern (Germany) Military Community. Maybe someone will figure out APO/FPO/DPO mailing addresses can be used to verify American eligibility for Peacock content.

title: Good content
review: Good quality movies. About 3 mins of ads play at the beginning of movie with no interruptions during movie. Reminds me of the old day movie theater. I hope they continue this format. I won’t tolerate ads in the middle of movie even for free. It’s a nice alternative for when those paid streaming service are lacking new content.

title: Happy IOS 14 customer
review: Not a single complaint in IOS14. Thanks. All i need you to work on is in an update for sony PS4 and appleTV with the captions. The subtitles font xolor is white and it need to be an option to have a black background option. Once a white background, you cant read anything and also please add more Spanish lenguaje or Spanish caption. Thanks

title: Horrible
review: I hate this app I pay for cable and it won’t let me watch the game on the Cable I pay for because they want to force me to download this app that only seems to work on my cell phone and is not compatible with any of my Samsung TV’s that we’re purchased In 2020 or through the App Store from my cable provider. 0/10 would not recommend. It would be nice as an option between cable and the app but to not broadcast the game on your cable channel in order to force me to download and watch from the app seems like a predatory practice.

title: I love it, but you’re Tech Team needs to work the kinks out...
review:
My brother loved it and recommended it to me.

I really enjoy the content, although there seems to be an issue with AppleTv. I cannot rewind, if I pause it to scroll back, it sometimes glitches out and starts a WHOLE movie over. I want to enjoy this, and I’ll still keep watching... but there are some kinks ya’ll need to work out 😘

title: The Librivox of streaming
review: If you are downloading this app because you dont want to pay for Netflix I would tell you that although free Netflix has a far better catalog of movies and tv. However you have to pay for Netflix. Some of the highlight of the app are reservoir dogs, et, parks and rec and psycho however I have not fully explored the app though. I would recommend getting the app

title: No help
review: I downloaded this app on the iPhone 11 (a compatible device) and when I went to join it said there’s a problem and it will not let me join. When I try to contact anyone for help all I can get is an automated chat telling me to email them but to email I have to log in! Somewhere in the mix up it’s telling me I have an account so I tried to sign in only for it to say “that email doesn’t match their records” and to join, but then I’m back to square one where it tells me there’s a problem when I try to join and to try later!

title: Live channels lineup and no NBCsN
review:
Good concept trying to get on the streaming demand... lots of work to develop. Not very user friendly. Also channels lineup is so irrelevant, an option for an individual preferences would be great. i,e,. If I’m only interested in sports I should be able to watch live sports. I paid for the premium content I guess there is no difference than the free version, other than no commercials 

For sports you only get to watch highlights no live matches 

NBCsN channel is not available to watch any given day only some very random channels with outdated content

title: Not ready
review:
I tire of these releases of “alpha” apps that barely work using frustrated customers as testing guinea pigs.
Tried searching for a movie. It displayed the search results half under the header. I managed to pull it down enough to select it, but it was a hassle. Then clicked on “Watch” only to be told it doesn’t play on my iPad (up to date). On Apple TV, the app will play the movie BUT no FF or Rewind! And when paused and restarted later, started at the beginning! Total waste of time. Don’t bother with this app until they’ve had another year of development.

title: Good content but app itself needs work
review:
Had trouble logging into the app from Apple TV even though it worked fine on the web. Discovered that support is minimal. Figured out that I had to manually type in the login info. Apple’s auto fill just messed it up. The controls are wonky too. Couldn’t fast forward or go backwards. Just didn’t work. For me this app is just not ready. On the plus side great content. 

Part2: After using it a bit longer, I downgraded to 1 star. The controls are just wonky. This app is half-baked. Not ready for prime time

title: Sub par service
review: I’m writing this ill review because I downloaded this app to watch a soccer game. The game kept kicking me out. Checked my WiFi on one of those upload/download speed websites and it was running fine. Then used other streaming services like espn+ to check to see if it was still just my internet but those apps ran fine. Idk man, if you have another way of watching a game I would go with that and stay away from this app after my experience. Good luck to you.

title: Commercials Appear Mid-Sentence
review:
When watching original content, the commercials occur right in the middle of the dialog instead of at the indicated locations. So suddenly a conversation is cut short and later there will be a short blank space where the commercial naturally should have occurred. 

Haven’t noticed this with old tv shows being streamed but with two original content shows on two different platforms the commercials show up in the obviously wrong places.

title: No full screen on 11 Pro and lots of ads
review:
I’m glad I didn’t pay for the service as the app stayed in 2010. It doesn’t go full screen on my 11 Pro. Would look better if I used an iPhone 6s but what’s the point of having a bigger screen iPhone if you can’t use the extra screen estate.

The free version is TERRIBLE. It kept playing ads for what felt like an eternity and the movie hasn’t even started yet. And that’s on top of it not going full screen on newer iPhones. When are you gonna learn?

title: Streaming does not resume at the right spot after the commercials
review: I am losing my mind. I am not able to watch a full movie or episode. Once commercials starts, I pray for the streaming to resume at the right spot. Every time the content starts from the beginning or from previous commercials. When I move the slider to the right place, the commercials start again immediately, and they kick me back to the content I already watched. I can’t believe nobody has the same issue. It happens consistently for me with 3 different iOS devices.

title: Good app but  some shows from the old sprout channel I think should be put in the kids area
review: I was thinking, in the peacock kids area, the channel can put shows from the old sprout channel there the same with the other kids shows.  You know, shows including the good night show, the Chica show, Astro blast, Barney, Nina’s world and many more of these shows from the old sprout channel.

title: Pretty buggy
review: Bought this exclusively for law and order.  It’s very buggy.  Won’t connect for chrome cast til after three or more times.  Drops all the time.  Subtitles don’t work half the time either but will randomly pop up.  Also No auto play which is infuriating on casting.   Also I’m here to stream. I’m not hear to watch your live stuff.  Put the stuff I’ve been watching and recommendations up front.  Not the trending.  Will probably drop this stuff nice I catch up with svu

title: Really really bad
review: I don’t want to have this app, but NBC has forced it on me by moving all Premier League to Peacock without bothering to make apps for roku or even a working one for my computer (like... why can’t I use a second monitor and watch?). This app might work for streaming shows, but for live sports it’s horrible. No pause in full screen, no way to rewind or save my place, search doesn’t work, consistent freezing... absolute trash. I can’t understand how a company as big as NBC created such a bad product. Please please please keep the NBC Sports app for sports, it’s less bad.

title: Great App!
review: I love this app! Content, i.e., original programming are of excellent quality. User interface is well organized, and so much to choose from. I’m liking this so far. I will update after about a month after fully embracing Peacock. Oh, I did take advantage of the of the special, so I have premium for a year. More to come!

title: Slow interface
review:
The interface on this app is incredibly slow. It takes a while to get each new page to load, which is really frustrating. Additionally, you can’t ever view your watchlist, so you have to search for the show you want to watch every time you open the app. And because the interface is slow, it takes a long time to get to the show you want to watch.

The video player also doesn’t permit you to use picture in picture mode, which is irritating

title: A painful exercise
review:
So, I wake up to watch an EPL game on TV, only to find that it’s streaming on Peacock instead of NBCSN... so I figure I would attempt to give it a go only to be blocked from setting up an account without any remedy insight. 

So not only is the app unusable until I can setup an account, I discover that I also have to pay on top of my current subscription for NBCSN. 

Come on Fam, this isn’t worth all this trouble. Would rather just watch for you to post the highlights online for free than jump through painful hoops just to pay you more.

title: What’s the point NBC
review: I used to wake up on Saturday morning, turn on my TV, and watch Premier league. It was nice and easy, I typed in the channel and it showed up on my very large TV. But not anymore. Now I have to sign up for the stupid app, register and hope to remember my password, then I find a game and suddenly I have to have a “premium “subscription to watch. And then I have to watch on a 10 inch iPad. This is not progress. I’m not going to pay NBC for a cable channel, plus an app, in order to watch the same content I used to watch on my TV. Do better.

title: Worst of the streaming platforms
review:
It honestly is really annoying how underdeveloped this is
Constant issues with casting to a Vizio TV everything from the show randomly stopping and the “ready to cast” screen reappearing, to ads breaking the entire stream, to the baffling fact that casted shows don’t auto play to the next episode and this last point is mainly baffling since if you’re watching within the mobile app the shows DO auto play 
The search function in the app is strange as it has no back button
You have to force the keyboard to disappear before you can return to other portions of the app
The strange lack of other profiles although that could just be greed 
Literally only have this app for Psych and after I’m done rewatching it and watch the new movies I’m done with this app

title: Pretty good... but some shortcomings
review:
There’s a lot of great content here. The linear channels are perfect background entertainment. The app is thoughtfully designed and easy to navigate.

Sadly, Peacock’s Apple TV app doesn’t play well with AirPlay. You can only turn it on from Control Center, and you won’t be able to control volume from the Apple TV remote.

The video player is a proprietary design that doesn’t offer standard Apple TV features like the “10 seconds back/forward” gesture on the Siri remote or the captions button on the Apple TV Remote app.

The app also doesn’t make use of Apple TV’s Top Shelf feature, so it doesn’t reside in my top row of apps. If they put their Channels up there (like Pluto does), I’d put Peacock in the top spot on my Apple TV home screen.

title: Fix Please
review:
