- Lightning connector to HDMI just shows black screen on TV. I wired connection to my TV should ALWAYS work... my phone is my only source of streaming.
- Searching via search bar needs work. I had to scroll and scroll to find my game.
Example: i search Tottenham, who has a live game currently playing.. and no results. I type ‘premiere’, as in the premiere league, as in arguably one of the biggest leagues in soccer, and get: no results.

Cater to your soccer fans. That was a grueling first day trying to watch live games.

title: It’s OK, but...
review:
It definitely needs an update. Some suggestions are:

1) Airdrop support, because it’s not downloadable on my Samsung Smart TV yet.
2) Alphabetizing ability; so you can see the list of movies / TV shows in order
3) See All feature from the beginning; “See All Movies”, “See All Shows”, etc...needs to be next to, or at the top of, its category, so we can easily scroll through all of that category.
4) Home button on every page, so we don’t have to constantly press the back button to get back to the home screen
5) “Free” section; make it easy for those who just want to enjoy the free perks of the app. Tip: look at VUDU’s format.

That’s all I could think of at the moment. If I think of anything else, I will update this review.

title: Commercials, expensive, not intuitive
review: I downloaded this to continue watching Parks and Rec. The commercials are excessive; like REALLY excessive. The next episode won’t play unless you manually select it and it takes you all the way back to the top of the season so you have to find the episode you stopped on. I would upgrade to ditch the ads but it’s $10 a month which seems pretty high for this service. There’s potential but I don’t expect to see it.

title: Awful
review: Binged all the Brave New World episodes for free. This is the absolute worst streaming service I’ve ever experienced. Episodes kept buffering each time an ad came on or sometimes in the middle of a scene and then I would have to restart the shows. The quality of the streaming was terrible too. Often fuzzy and unwatchable. If this is the quality of Peacock’s streaming service for free, why would I ever bother to pay for it? Only reason I gave 2 stars was because I like the story and actors.

title: Cant watch the show, only commercials
review: Trying to cast the app onto my tv, the connection stops almost every time I would get to commercials. Then when I tried to reconnect, I had to start from the beginning of the show. I tried to skip ahead to where I finished and had to watch a zillion commercials and then it would not let me get any further. It kept repeating and taking me to past clips I had seen. I could never see the whole show.  It wasnt just my phone. The exact same thing happened with my husband.

title: App crashes when trying to select episodes
review: While the content of this app is promising, it is extremely annoying when I attempt to watch a show and click “episodes” tab to select which season/episode I want to watch, only to have it crash back to my device home screen.  This happens with multiple shows on the Peacock app across multiple devices (phone, tablet, TV, etc.). This needs to be fixed ASAP as it is a hallmark feature of any good streaming app, but one that is currently lacking in yours.

title: Would love to view content but can’t
review: I was very excited to watch Psych 2, but I cannot get the app to cast to my tv, or stream from any of my devices (Apple devices or Samsung tv). The app isn’t available on my Samsung tv, and it will not cast from any device (and we can cast other apps to the tv no problem). I’ve tried for an hour, and then started reading some of the reviews and realized I wasn’t the only one having issues. I hope they get these bugs worked out, would really like to view the content...get Gus “Silly pants” Jackson on the case!

title: Poor UI control design
review:
When viewing a series info screen, tapping anywhere (picture OR description text) causes episode to start playing. Makes it difficult to scroll as you have to touch and hold before sliding finger. If you lift finger too soon like in a fast swipe it starts playing episode. 

In browse screen while exploring content to add to watchlist, rudely started playing commercial with no means to stop or mute the sound. Blaring out for everyone around me to hear.

title: Not as good as a VCR
review: Subscribed only to watch (English Premier League) sports. You cannot Pause, Rewind, during live games. VCRs and Betamaxes had more functionality. There is no option, in case you join a game late, to Start from Beginning if the game, or show (supposing it applies to all programming) already is airing. In the case of EPL games, they do not become available until a few hours later to watch. I don’t know how long, but not within a 1-2 hour window. And the Search function is limited. Please bring this app up to 2020, if not 2015.

title: Worth the 4.99
review: I like the idea of watching the older classic tv shows, tv was more family friendly years ago and this network has many of the good shows, I would like to see more shows like Simon and Simon, Perry Mason, Spenser For Hire, Rip Tide, Donna Reed and shows like that added to their library. So far no complaints

title: Not the right move for soccer
review: NBC Sports was constantly preaching how proud they were to provide a means for Americans to be able to watch soccer and to continue to expanding the game to a market where the audience is lacking. With Peacock, they take away this opportunity and crush many people’s passion for watching soccer bright and early in the weekends. I do sincerely hope his isn’t a long term approach because I will not be paying for yet another strain service. I’ll find other means of streaming the games that don’t include me digging further down into my pockets.

title: Not Good
review:
Not a good app it is included in a Cable subscription for 4.99 let me set up
and now after a week it will not let me sign in and Comcast it’s charging me on my bill says account not found email and password does not exist going back to my other paid apps that are better and just having on certain devices makes A really bad inconvenience for people acting like all they use the phone for us to watch movies and TV shows will call Comcast and have it removed and never use this app again..

title: I paid thinking I would get more...
review: I was so excited when this streaming platform was announced thinking I would have access to shows and seasons I don’t have access to on other streaming platforms. I immediately selected one of the the pay options assuming I would “unlock” the other shows and seasons and I am so disappointed that the seasons and shows are still so limited. I do plan on canceling and removing the app because it seems pointless.

title: I only got this app for a tv show
userName: this game is so fun i love it
review:
I only got this app for my favorite show Parks and Recreation and it is only showing here so that’s why I downloaded it. I really hope that you can remove the adds though. And it says that every thing is free but you have to pay for certain shows and movies. 
SO DON’T BE FOOLED ITS NOT ALL FREE!

title: No option to turn off autoplay
review: I turn on a show before bed every night which helps me sleep. It used to be on Netflix and I would be happy to pay for peacock after it moved except there is no way to turn off autoplay. If there was an option to play one episode only, I would happily pay for the ad free version, but since it auto plays with no way to turn it off I will be resorting to other ways to access this show

title: So many errors
review:
Compared to other streaming apps, the casting and streaming ability is horrendous. Cast will shut down at seemingly random times, the stream takes an unusual long time to load, the app is a memory hog and is slow to react to commands, won’t stay connected to the cast if you need to make changes, and once an episode finishes it doesn’t automatically proceed to the next one.

Don’t waste your time and money until this is a smoother experience.

title: So poorly designed!
review: The developer that designed this app lacks the ability to picture what the user wants. More over, there are mistakes such as the timing of a live event. For instance, a premier league game that is scheduled for later on is shown as started 30 min ago.  Coming events and the time of broadcasting are hard to find, and I keep going on and on with other issues. The lack of organization of the is stunning. Sad I have to pay for this to watch soccer. I fully understand why some people stream games illegally.

title: All the worst parts of a TV service
review: NBC has rolled all of the worst parts of TV into this app. It’s hard to find specific programs, everything is divided into curated channels I don’t want to watch, and they assume you will tune into their feeds. I can’t find the Premier league matches I want to watch, replays are impossible to use, and I’m not interested in over 95% of the programs they are trying to push on me. There is no way I’m watching anything here, including the soccer I’d have paid for if NBC didn’t destroy their Premier League Gold service.

title: No selection. No speed. Too pricey. Look below...
review:
—From the people who stole The Office and Parks and Recreation off of Netflix— 

They have only a couple of shows and a very short list of movies. You get nothing with it, and if you don’t want ads, pay $9.99/month. On top of it, the service is extremely slow and isn’t compatible with Chromecast or other softwares of the such.

***Tell them no. Comcast, NBC, MSNBC, CNBC, Universal Studios, USA Network, and Xfinity are all one company and hold a monopoly on the media and entertainment***

They don’t deserve to have their own slow entertainment service on top of everything to steal two shows that everyone loves. They already pay little to nothing in tax dollars and are a menace to our economy. They’re just trying to milk you for cash with a small selection of TV shows—it isn’t worth your dollar and it’s a scam.

title: Very Disappointed
review: I had been looking forward to this service, every since it was announced, I even subscribed in advanced, as a big fan of The Blacklist, I was disappointed to see that not only did they not have seasons 1-6, they only have the last 4 episodes from season 7.  I understand this on the free NBC app, but for the life of me I can’t understand it on a subscription service that owns its own content. Had I know this in advance I would not have subscribed, and if it doesn’t improve I will most definitely will not renew.

title: Great content but needs a few patches
review: I downloaded the app for the live soccer games, but when using a Chromecast to display to your TV, it will stop casting to your TV about every 15 minutes which is very frustrating. It also runs the live game delayed by 4 minutes instead of real time. I’m excited when this gets patched up along with several other issues others have mentioned.

title: Not bad really
review: Despite all these bad reviews, it’s actually not that bad. Maybe things got fixed with the update, and while it is a little slow, it’s not unbearable. I don’t even mind the ads, it has a pretty good selection choice especially for Halloween coming up. Although one downside add the ability to connect to a smart TVs please!!!

title: Awful Platform for Sports - NBC Sports App is a much better experience
review:
The login process is unnecessarily complicated and error prone for users with access to premium through their cable provider. 

The streaming itself lacks basic features customers expect from a paid streaming service (no ability to fast forward/ pause during a game). Not worth the money for new customers. For xfinity customers, this just introduced another annoying hurdle to watch games on an inferior platform.

title: Poor app - worst thing to happen to EPL.
review: It took days to sign up due to a problem with the app. I finally got in and the design is not good. There is no easy way to see what is upcoming - only what’s next on a particular channel. Specifically, I don’t know what EPL games will be on later in the day. Plus, it appears I need to pay $4.99/month to watch any Premier League.  I already have cable and like 3 other streaming services. C’mon now. Also, Comcast/NBC/Universal still have beef with Roku so I can’t even watch on my TV even if I do pay for it.

title: Just paid premium
review: I literally just paid a premium and nothing will play more than just a few seconds before going back to the ‘watch now’ page. Example: on my Lg tv peacock app(which was already installed) I clicked on ‘watch now’ and the screen changes to a small circle turning then it’ll go back to the previous page. Doesn’t actually play the video. Please don’t make me wish I hadn’t subscribed to this service. Please fix today!

title: Good start, still some potential
review:
The UI is clean
The three tabs channels, trending, and browse are simple. 
Quick feedback
Browse is like your typical streaming service catalog, nothing new here
Trending has highlights/features, good in theory but I don’t think I’ve used this tab once
And channels is actually awesome and innovative!
24/7 programming w different genres 
I would say it’s a no brained to add a law and order channel, as well as movies channel. 
I think we are underestimating the demand for just opening up the app and jumping into whatever is on at the time. 
With the fairly deep catalog, peacock can offer the best of what cable was - and merge it with the best of what streaming is now.

title: Good and bad
review: The content is great, and the ads are pretty short, even for a free account. My longest ad so far was 90 seconds at at the beginning of a movie, and the rest was ad free. Interacting with the app on an Apple TV is pretty annoying so -1 Star for that. The remote lags. I don’t have any problem with other apps, but this one I do. I upgraded to the $5/mo. one purely for Premier League access.

title: Can’t turn off auto play on Apple TV
review:
Come on it’s 2020 it’s clear NBC is trying to show investors that they are streaming many hours of content by not allowing a setting to stop Autoplay like every other streaming service offers. 

Also the Apple TV version doesn’t allow jump forward to work w Apple TVA remote as it does w all other services. 

I like them showing live tv and trending. But these other user interface issues are just common sense

title: Good content, crappy video player
review: The video is framed strangely in landscape mode on an iPhone 11. The video is shifted up so that the white bar at the bottom has room and the white bar never goes away. That is very distracting and annoying. Apple’s player fills the whole screen with the video and the white bar fades out with the rest of the controls after a couple seconds. This is how it should be.

title: Still needs more content.
review: So far everything is good, but I hope peacock tv adds more live network channels and more tv shows. Because compared to other streaming services this has a small selection of content. I hope peacock you are listening to your supporters so you can thrive. Just add more network channels and tv shows please.

title: I’d give it zero stars if I could
review:
Horrible, awful app. Bad lagging, and 145 second long commercials. It won’t work at all with chromecast 1gen from ios. 

They make you watch tons of commercials, then the screen is blank. You go to trouble shoot and it restarts again forcing you to watch more commercials. Why can’t it work with first gen chromecast. I’m not buying a new one so I can watch this junky app that never properly buffers. I’ve never had a problem with my chromecast and shouldn’t have to upgrade it to watch this awful app.

title: Needs a lot of work
review:
Day 1: signed up for peacock service mostly for the EPL streaming service. However, the app freezes frequently. One has to exit from the streaming program, open something else, then return back to the streaming. This is extremely annoying. 

The selection of programs is just ok. Not great. Just the bare minimal. 

Overall, it will be hard to compete with other streaming services at this level of quality.  

Day 3: I cannot access today’s EPL games. They do not show up in the live stream options.  Either there is a bug in the program or NBCUniversal lies that all live sports events (which the studio is allowed to broadcast in the TV programs) are available through PeacockTV.  It does not matter what the answer is; from my point of view is unacceptable.

I will definitely cancel my subscription.

title: Not too bad
review: Haven’t been using it too long but it does have some wired aspects to it. It doesn’t continue playing shows so having to go back through and find the correct episode to play is a bit of a hassle, but as far as being able to watch tv for free I don’t feel I can complain too much. My hope is that it’ll only improve in time.

title: I’d recommend this to anyone!
review: Great app for a great streaming service at a great price. Was surprised at the quantity and quality of shows on here including some of my favorites like Psych, Monk, etc. Would recommend this to anybody. However only giving 4 stars since there are a few shows on here that don’t have the full series (even with premium).

title: Deliberately prevents screen mirroring to tv
review: I was going to sign up for their ad-free plan at $10, but glad I tested the app first. The app deliberately black screens if you connect an hdmi cable to screen cast from iPhone to your tv. First it plays the ads perfectly so they can get their revenue, then when your program starts, it goes audio only with a black screen. Really self defeating move on their part, because I consume all my streaming as iPhone-hdmi-tv, and I’m not going to watch an app that has to be viewed on the phone.

title: Horrible user experience on Apple TV OS 14
review:
First, apple tv has standard interfaces for selecting language and subtitle options. It is next to impossible to change these settings while using the Peacock App on Apple Tv

Second, any time a show is paused the App locks up. The only way to resume from pause is to reboot the Apple TV device, select the Peacock app, select the episode you were watching, then fast forward to the point you were at previously.

title: A good service, but awful app
review: This is a great service with great content, the app however is awful!  It is very buggy and does not function great. If I’m watching a show, and then close the app to do something else, and then go back to the show, I’m back at the beginning, not where I left off. The content is great, but the app needs some work

title: Needs a lot of work...
review: I have the $4.99 version and the app constantly hangs up going into a commercial and coming out of it.  So irritating!  Also, you need to have an independent icon for “my list” or “watchlist” whichever fits best.  I had to google where to find my watchlist on Peacock because it is that difficult to find.  I will update my review when you get these things fixed. Get to work!

title: No HDMI support?
review:
I use my phone and computer for streaming media at home, using the HDMI connections for our TV. Tried watching our first show: plays in my phone but the TV screen only displays the place/rewind symbols. Awesome, really going to enjoy using this app while feeding my newborn walking around the house...yeah.

Peacock won’t be receiving my business without being able to play on my devices with support for connecting to my TV...like pretty much every other streaming service available right now. Highly disappointed.

title: Great app but with some bugs
review: Saw an ad about Peacock and gave it a try, it’s a great platform with tons of classic shows and movies. The app itself however could use some improvements, a “continue watching” section, better search results, etc. Overall would recommend, I expect some bug fixes to come in the future.

title: Mixed Happiness
review: This app is easy to navigate and has a wide variety of movies and shows to watch. I would recommend this to other people that want to take their shows anywhere without using a sketchy website. One thing I don’t necessarily like is that it starts the episode over when you leave the app and come back.

title: Holding Premier League hostage
review:
App has horrible startup issues. Most of the time the app will not load. And if you’re lucky enough to have it load, the app is clunky and a challenge to navigate. I attempt to use app on several different devices and various wifi locations all with same result. 
NBC Sports Gold had some issues regarding Premier League but Peacock TV and Premier League is a nightmare. Please stop forcing us to use an inferior app to watch PL matches. I’ll pay the ransom $$ for you to release PL content back to the various NBC Sports channels!

title: Aleast ESPN has Bundesliga and Serie A
review: Kind of a throw back to the mid90s when I was a kid and had to beg my father to order RAI. Only one tv in the house would get it and every month you had to call the cable company to reinstate it. This app has successfully turned me into a much bigger Bundesliga and Serie A fan. I would say this is the worst soccer app on the market but (even though it’s overpriced and you have to buy a new tv or streaming device for it to work) BEIN sport still takes the cake on that. So peacocktv... the second worst sports app I’ve ever seen.

title: Come on nbc
review: Love how I can watch seasons of George Lopez now on my tv. However it doesn’t auto play. So every time an episode ends. I have to physically go in a press the next show.  I guess u can say “lazy” however all the other streaming shows can do it and when u have ur children watching curious George so you get some cleaning done. It’s annoying to go back and fourth in to the room to play the next episode every 20 mins.  On top of that takes a while to stream so I don’t think I’m the only one having these issues

title: Terrible support
review: Since launch I’ve been using Airplay to watch shows on my Apple TV, and this last update broke that functionality. Now it will only cast audio. I tried reaching out to their support but I just got jive about AirPlay NOT being supported. They intentionally broke it and refused to do anything about it. Terrible support and customer service! On top of that they won’t release it on Roku so your options are very limited for watching on anything but your phone. Good luck if you take a chance on this!

title: Lacks features we’ve come to expect of other streaming platforms
review:
- Cannot airplay to other devices after iOS screen locks. (And there’s no app for samsung TV) 
- the video doesn’t take advantage of the entire screen, so you’re watching video on a small portion of an already small phone or iPad screen. 
- picking up where you left off on a particular show is a challenge (but improved from earlier versions). 
- recommendations engine is, I assume, non-existent. 
- content is weak, bait and switch on “free.”

title: Mediocre, willing to see
review: Title says it all. It is fair for what I use it for, and would be willing to pay for using. Main problem and drawback for me is whenever I use the app to continue watching, the app either restarts me to the very beginning of the season rather than which other season I left off, or begins the exact moment I stopped, even if it’s the last minute of the credits.

title: Paid tier shouldn’t have commercials - no seasons 1-12 of Law and Order
review:
No paid tier should have commercials and this paid tier has way too many commercials. I can’t believe there are this many commercials for a tier I’m paying for.

Also, where are seasons 1-12 of Law and Order???

Seasons 1-12 of Law and Order are missing (even after all the press said the service would have Law and Order). Baffling. I signed up for one show...and it’s missing most of it.

title: Great app
review: I’ve been using peacock for about a week now and the app is great. I can’t relate to any of the bad reviews what so ever. So far the app is as stable if not more stable than Netflix. I was looking for ways I can watch Harry Potter without paying for every movie and this was a life saver! 10/10

title: Doesn’t work
review: Have tried multiple times since this app became available and it’s never worked on any device including a brand new iPhone SE 2020, iPad & Mac. Also doesn’t work on any of my fiancé’s devices either. Won’t even let us create an account. You would think a company as large as nbcuniversal would have the bugs worked out by now. This will be another one of those apps that I’ll just simply forget exists and enjoy one of their competitors that know what they are doing.

title: Should work better with Apple TV (4th gen HD) remote
review: I bought a year’s subscription (no commercials) when it was discounted and am happy with content. But no quick backup or fast forward by edge-pressing remote, no ability to turn on/off subtitles with three quick clicks of the menu button. Fingers crossed this will be addressed in the future. No streaming issues, though, on tv, iPhone or iPad.

title: Needs some work
review: It’s gotten pretty annoying that episodes start in the middle of the episode instead of the beginning as well as then I pause an episode then come basic to watch it later, it starts at the beginning of the episode instead of we’re I left off and occasionally will play a previous episode instead.

title: Poor interphase and connection
review: The only reason why i am paying for this service is because the EPL decided to screw us out of NBC. First time paying for a video streaming app that doesnt allow me to pause or adjust the quality of the video. What is the point of watching a game if I am going to miss goals. Make some changes Peacock

title: Horrific user & security experience
review: As an expert in web security, it appears that you have someone using best practices from 7-10 years ago that does not allow the use of copy and paste for password creation or 1Password autofill. Forcing someone to use a keyboard is terrible security practice (I’ll bet someone at the Helpdesk suggested this to prevent calls). The entire sign up process looks like it was someone’s high school web project. Not one person would pass my college class if they submitted this tripe. Do better.

title: Don’t waste your time
userName: C l a y t o n C
review: NBC needs to get off of the pay to watch things grind. This is ridiculous, the fact that I have to switch apps and possibly have to PAY to watch premier league soccer weekly. Premier league up until last year, and every year before that, has been free to watch. Now you’re taking games away from TV and just making us pay to watch free things. Premier league soccer is the only reason NBC even has my business, wish fox had gotten it instead of you all.

title: Needs to be Optimized
review: When you’re watching a video on the iPhone, you can see the home bar on the bottom of the video, the video doesn’t reach the bottom of the display because of the home bar, & you can’t even expand the video to cover the whole display, which you can do on every single other streaming service. This one needs a lot of work & optimization. It feels like a very unfinished product.

title: The app that could not deliver content!
review: I first heard about the app and got it installed as soon as possible. I was excited to start watching all the Chicago fire, med and pd shows.   Opened up the app and only the last seasons were on the app.   We paid thinking the rest would show up! Nope! Going to cancel that as soon as possible. If you don’t even stream your own shows what is the point.

title: App sabotages any attempt to view on unapproved TVs
review:
This app is horrible. It refuses to allow you to watch anything on a Samsung TV.

Try to connect to the TV’s built in chromecast? The app will exclude your TV from the connectable devices list.

Try to watch through AirPlay despite the janky aspect ratio? It will work fine until the moment a video starts at which point the entire screen will go black to prevent their shows from being mirrored on your TV

I can’t imagine this wasn’t coded in purposefully. Does NBC have it out for Samsung? Did they demand Samsung pay them for the privilege of a basic app function? Did Samsung refuse?

Whatever the reason, I only downloaded this app because it’s the only place you can stream Harry Potter. If they won’t let me watch it on my TV then this app is a garbage waste of memory on my iPad

title: premier league
review: I only signed up to watch premier league games. It works fine but the policy of not showing games which were not originally on Peacock until 9:30 PM is annoying and baffling. What possible reason could there be for not showing a rerun of a league game for 6 to 12 hours?  ESPN+ shows reruns shortly after game end.

title: Always loading
review: Please, get it together. I feel like this app could be great, if only it loaded better and could connect to other devices to stream. It’s not my internet, because other apps are working perfectly. It always stops to load, then never continues unless I close out, then start again. Cannot connect to TV to stream; It will continue sound, but stop video until inevitably crashing.

title: Could work but doesn’t work
review: Logged in no problem and browsed a bit from my phone. Then l tried to log on with my computer to watch something and it wouldn’t recognize my email and password. Then I logged out on my phone to see if maybe it was just not happy with two devises on one account, it didn’t work and I couldn’t log back in with either phone or computer. Tried to reset my password and still haven’t received an email to do so. Canceling subscription

title: Can only stream on app
review: I would pay for a better package, but if I can only stream on a device and not to the TV, then forget that... I’ll take my money elsewhere... You can’t even use a cable from the phone to hdmi... it has no problem putting their adds on the TV when mirroring, but as far as content, it will not work... I pay for streaming services to watch as a family, but keeping it to a hand held device, you’re removing the group activity and making it for personal use

title: Terrible
review:
Poor functionality, no ability to set favorite shows for ease of use, no automatic turn off so episodes just play forever, no personal settings for account preferences, and worst of all it doesn’t remember what episode you left off at so if you want to resume playing your series you’re always back at S1E1 and need to remember where you were. 

How does a company with so much money and who put tons of marketing out for this release such a poor first product ...

title: Disgraceful
review: thanks to the creation of peacock i can’t even watch premier league soccer unless i’m on my laptop or phone. yea you know that $1k+ samsung smart tv you have? well there's no peacock app on it so these degenerates have effectively taken premier league soccer off of my television even despite me paying for the service. unbelievably disappointed in nbc for this absolute money grab service that was created and forced upon us without being ready to accommodate the most basic viewing options like idk a tv?

title: Less than one star!
review: I would have given this TV service, or so called, less than one star IF AT ALL POSSIBLE! I have tried to download on Roku, obviously not available if you remotely try to find online, as well as, on my Samsung Smart TV. I have found NO WAY to throw the picture from my phone or computer to any other device, thus not allowing me to watch on any decent device! This television service, which has now seemed to hijack the US Open is completely ridiculous and obviously GREEDY!! DO NOT GET!!!!

title: Terrible app functionality and content
review:
The app functionality is garbage. How did anyone at NBC green light this for roll out?! Those individuals should be terminated. The search function can’t find things like Rachel Maddow. Can’t find things like meet the press. 
Also I have the premium version of peacock and I can’t watch whole episodes of Rachel Maddow just 2 minute clips. What garbage is that?! I’ve got a free trial of this app but I can’t see paying for this garbage functionality and availability past the free trial.

title: Decent App
review: I like that I can watch some of my favorite TV shows on here, but the movie selection is terrible. Also, at the beginning of the TV show it said that I would only get one ad, but I got like 5 minutes worth of ads throughout the whole episode. So after everything being said, I would say this app is worth the try, but it isn’t perfect.

title: Love the selection
review: Completely love that this service has a free option and that it has a huge selection. I hate though how difficult to navigate it can be, it doesn’t remember or have a space for currently watching and that in a middle of a season it becomes premium and requires payment to continue watching. It’s definitely a work in progress with good things but a lot of improvement to be made.

title: Needs MSNBC and ROKU app
review:
Looks somewhat promising.  Not a big fan of clips, however.  I’d rather have the entire episode available (I.e., Rachel Maddow).  ALSO, the clips have no date information so I couldn’t tell when they originally aired.  Until dates are added I won’t watch anything that’s provided in “clip” format.  MSNBC should be a channel option to watch live.

However, until the app is available on ROKU I won’t won’t watch at all.  I stream everything through ROKU.

title: Officially boycotting, but not voluntarily
review:
So we got peacock specifically to watch psych 2 and I was very surprised by the free library! It’s super nice! And I get that not everything is free. I honestly don’t mind that, it’s a business.

The 1 star review is simply because it’s nearly impossible to watch anything. No Apple TV app, no roku app, and no smart tv app. It only supports Comcast TV’s. So simply put I need to buy another smart tv to watch something with my family. Tried to screen mirror but it said that wasn’t supported (After streaming three minutes of Ads straight to my TV) 

Hdmi cable, said it wasn’t supported (After supporting another 3 minutes of ads) 

I would love to 5 star this because of the free library, but I can’t watch any of it with my family. So it’s a one star until Peacock can decide what it wants to be.

title: Underrated app!
review:
This app is so underrated. Its just hulu(with the having a premium to get more shows)but with one segment of commercials expanding from 30-60 seconds. Everyone feels the need to bash on the “extra paying” and the ONE commercial break but atleast the majority of it is free and its only top 60 seconds of your tome wasted per ep. 
UNDERRATED APP!

title: Not HDMI compatible!
review: I have never written one of these reviews before but this is just outrageous!  Not only is Peacock not available on Roku or FireTV, it is NOT HDMI compatible!  So I have to watch on my ipad and cannot stream to my TV! This is the STUPIDEST decision for a streaming service EVER! Just about EVERYONE uses HDMI cords to connect devices!  I cannot believe they are purposely trying to force people to purchase their “compatible” devices!  I have never, ever seen such irresponsible decision-making in my life! I refuse to purchase a new TV or new streaming device. 😡🤬

title: Back button goes way too far back sometimes
review: The back button says go back 10 seconds sometimes when I push it it takes me back the whole episode looks like your developers have a lot more work to do. Also re-making me watch commercials because it take me back that far is really shady that would make me not pay for the service because that’s just terrible development.

title: Awesome app
review: Amazing app! I’ve tried other live stream tv apps and the quality is usually awful and there’s always some lagging but I didn’t have any issues with the live tv with this app. They also have a great selection of movies and tv shows. Will use this often 👍🏻

title: Excited to get started, but...
review:
Very excited for this new service! I know it’s the night before launch, but I’ve already notice a couple nit picky things: 
1. No profiles? Even HBO Max caved in with these. Now you’re the only service that doesn’t have them. It’s manageable obviously but it seems odd. Hopefully that’ll happen sometime soon. 
2. I know it’s a coming feature, but I’m disappointed that offline viewing isn’t an option on launch. 
3. On my payment plan it says that I’m paying $100/ MONTH when I’m on an annual plan? I know this must be a glitch but I hope it’s not true! 

Excited to dive in to all those SVU seasons!

title: Xfinity’s On-Demand
review:
This service feels just like Xfinity’s on-demand service (plus Premier League), nothing more. Originals are extremely weak, content is just meh. I don’t see myself paying a dime for this. 

Really Comcast, what’s your goal here? Rivaling Netflix, or just dip your toe into the water? Feels like the latter.

Oh by the way, we should be able to watch at least full screen. Not only there are two huge black bars on the side, even the bottom of the picture is black. It’s like a quarter of the screen is empty.

title: Wonderful for watching our favorite shows!
review: We are presently enjoying the complete series Everybody Loves Raymond and look forward to many other shows in the lineup.  What a great selection of shows - and they all play with minimal commercials.  Thank you Peacock!

title: Shouldn’t have to pay money
review: I think it is absolutely ridiculous that you want people to pay extra to stream live sports when everyone else is streaming them for free. Not only are you making people pay, you also have removed the games from cable so you can’t even watch the game in your own house. You are making people pay for cable and have to pay again to watch something they enjoy. This is absolutely ridiculous.

title: absolutely horrible
review:
to my dismay, some of the best games of the English Premier league are now ONLY on peacock!
So i get their free app and find out that i can watch the games, but ONLY live. I cant watch a game that has already ended. I cant even watch the game from the beginning. 
OK , tell myself, this must be how they draw you in. So, desperate for the game, i sign up and pay for peacock PREMIER!  
So i think i'm set to watch the Chelsea game today. At three pm i briefly check in for 1minute and, YEAH, there's the game, but i still cant rewind and watch from the beginning. GRRRR

Now tonight i log in and... Can't find the game ANYWHERE!!  I tried everything. Browse, search, channels, ... nothing!  It's just not there!  So what the heck did i pay for?   

HORRIBLE service, Horribly confusing, awkward, interface, both for the app and the browser.

title: Cox User
review: Peacock solved my issue. I created a Peacock account on my Cox cable box, but I cannot seem to login to the Peacock app on my iPhone or iPad. When I try to create an account so that they are linked with the email, then I got an error message. Can someone please help? I cannot find anything on the Internet or the Peacock help page to resolve the issue.

title: Must’ve changed a lot
review: I see a lot of reviews saying it buffers, but it works completely fine for me. Now, I don’t use it for on-the-TV, but on my phone and computer and it runs great. It has amazing shows with what I would consider minimal ads, all for free

title: Great Content. Bad App.
review:
We paid for the premium package and it’s been a complete nightmare. I’ve never tried so hard to watch TV. Really disappointing. 
App won’t load. Or it drops the connection. Sometimes it requires restarting the device. We’ve tried using it on two iPhones (X and 11) and two iPads, as well as two different generations of Chromecast. Same results regardless. 
I hope the fix is in development otherwise we just wasted money.

title: Update
review:
I have this installed on my fire tv in fact both fir TVs.  The app was working fine.  All of a sudden I’m getting the message to update, which I tried and then I get the error message that the app to update cannot be found.

I started to get used to watching this app but now I’m getting nothing but problems.  I’ve done everything on my end so now I going to cancel.  I certainly wished that could be corrected.

title: Privacy policy is a concern
review: The privacy policy is at least honest about what they do and I am thankful for that as many apps will do it in secret and not warn the customer. However it seems that the app collects a bit too much info, if you compare what the app collects compared to a spyware app... it leaves little difference. It is too bad because I saw some shows that I wanted to watch on it but too invasive.

title: I love it
review: The only thing is I hope they will be adding more seasons to some of the shows like Songland and I hope they had all the voice seasons because I wanna rewatch all the seasons of the voice with out having to use a sketchy website overall it’s an amazing app

title: I like it
review: Not sure where all these bad reviews are coming from. I’ve had an easy time using the app and I’ve been able to watch some shows and movies for free that I can’t find elsewhere. I’m leaving one star off because I wish this app would offer Picture in Picture on iOS.

title: Just what we need when people are losing jobs another pay stream app!!!!!
review: This is ridiculous to all of a sudden spring up a streaming app during a pandemic where people have been losing there jobs and since of income, I guess that’s when greed really kicks in. They had nbcsports which would stream sports for free, but that wasn’t good enough they needed more money so now I gotta pay another 6$ a month because I wanna watch premier league. There’s a special place in hell for people like you NBC.

title: Glitchy
review: I downloaded this to watch the Dale Earnhardt Jr. show on abandoned speedways. Sadly I can only watch it on my iPhone X. The app constantly crashes on my iPad. With no Roku app it stinks to have to watch it on my iPhone. And no, I’m not getting an Apple TV or any other device to watch this channel. In this day and age when every network has a streaming service, it amazes me that this one is so horrible. Two stars because it does work well on my iPhone.

title: Paying for premium but can’t access it
review: Very frustrating experience !  I upgraded to premium plus on my iPad and it works fine .  I try to watch from my phone or my Apple TV and it insists I upgrade to premium again ,  then tells me I have premium and that’s where I am stuck !  This should never have made it past QA.  Oh and provide a way to get help instead of asking users to wade through your FAQs and still not find the answer.  Unacceptable and a collosal waste of my time !

title: Will the father of the 6 year old that wrote this app please stand up?
review:
And take his PC away.

Horrible.  Shame on you Comcast.  Guess just another F*&k up...

Developers that worked on this app, will have difficulties being a cashier at WM.  Just plain bad.  Content is a scam.  You can watch the current season of Yellowstone on the Paramount app.  On beandick?  No!!!  Subtitles are supposed to be 5 seconds late right?  So you can guess what they are saying!  4K?  HDR what??  Dolby Visi what??.  Atmos means you can hear stuff, right???  Paid for a year...  Shame on me...

title: FOX NEWS please
review: Very happy with the service and no price attached! I was able to log in and get a well designed guide that I could follow right away. The format is designed well and the visual is clear and bright. Appreciate the no charge service. If you carried FOX NEWS I would be willing to pay a very modest amount for a subscription to Peacock.

title: Extremely disappointed
review:
I have already paid over $80 for a year of commercial free NBC programming through the Peacock TV app. I am very disappointed. 

The app is NOT available on my smart TV or my TiVo.I am using the app on my iPad, but have found a number of issues. 

MSNBC series, such as the new Reidout program are not available in their entirety. There are a string of clips available, but I cannot find the series. 

Blacklist has only the last five episodes available.

I find the app menus and search very limited, disorganized and find it very difficult to locate programming. 

It is not possible to set up individuals so that programming recommendations can be customized.

I have just scratched the surface, and given that I paid upfront for a year to get the discount, I hope there is a 2nd release coming soon!!

title: Its almost good
review: The interface is super cool and simple but its not smooth its super laggy and when i touch one show it delays to show me the informations and its really confusing because when i touch the seasons it doesnt give me episodes and even when i touch the “free episodes” the episodes doesnt show up . I know that you guys just launched but can you guys fix this delay and lag? Thank you.

title: Major work need to be done on this app
review: Really NBC?? Really?? This is how you join streaming?? By creating a horrible app that doesn’t allow anything to load, sometimes content doesn’t come up, buffering is horrible, casting feature works horribly. This is not 2008, but this app makes it feel like that. You have a lot infrastructure to build to make this app worth using. I really hope you paying customers dont have the same quality of service

title: Premium content but poor user experience
review: Downloaded and purchased Premium ($4.99/month) to watch Premier League. Live streaming is glitchy and it appears there is no option to record. Unclear how quickly On Demand is available following a match and how long it stays available (maybe 24 hours?) I have no problem paying for premium content, but improvements are needed to the infrastructure.

title: Disappointed
review: Only reason why I downloaded the app is to watch Psych the movie. But saw there were many more things I can watch. I was so excited until I tried to airplay it onto my tv. Everything else on my phone or iPad I can airplay to my Samsung TV except Peacock. Plays first few seconds and that’s it. I can hear the show but there’s no picture. And no it’s not my TV because every other app I have seems to airplay just fine. Such a disappointing app :( hope they fix it soon.

title: Cannot stream to television
review: This app does not support streaming to Apple TV or Chromecast. I also cannot connect an HDMI adapter to my phone or computer and mirror the displays. It will play the commercials just fine, but when the actual show or movie begins to play, it only plays on the device and won’t display on the TV. I wasted an hour trying to get this to either stream from my phone or mirroring displays via AirPlay connected directly to an HDMI cable. Does NBC want people to actually watch use this app?

title: Found my Netflix replacement!
review: Better interface, better content, flexible and  affordable subscription options, and unique-to-streaming features (channels, trending content, live sports/news)! Couldn’t have asked for a better addition to my streaming roster!

title: Please fix this
review: I can’t play this from my iPad connected to my tv with an hdmi cable. I love the selection but I can’t watch on my tv. It played the ads perfectly then when the movie began - total dark. I tried on two different movies neither worked. Just dark with sound. Please fix in an update. Thank you!

title: NBC shame
review:
Protesting your decision to air Trump town hall at the same time as Biden already had his scheduled. Shame. I’m cancelling and will have to think seriously if I want to support such behavior in an entertainment provider. 

As for the app it is a bit clunky. Starting a stream often is super slow and switching to the episode list rarely works. Content is pretty nice but I’ve only had the app a couple weeks and am running out of stuff I want to see. Nothing much new being added.

title: Confusing Browse Tab and No Apple AirPlay
review: Browse tab is confusing. It’s not easy to find a show or game that you want. Having NBC, NBCSN, and this app makes user experience a mess. If the intend is to make users pay more for various services, then at least give them an option to centralize those services. Switching back and for between devices and platforms doesn’t help. Also, Apple Airplay does not work. Terrible.

title: Won’t connect to xfinity account
review: Says xfinity customers get a free upgraded middle version. Try to link the account and it says account linked to another email. What email? I’m the first to download app and try it that way. My mom just watches from her tv and it doesn’t require a login. Why bother having xfinity users create alternative accounts???? Shouldn’t we just be able to sign in with our xfinity account?? Definitely doesn’t compete with other streaming services at all.

title: Just can’t watch period!
review: I can’t get it to mirror to my tv with my apple adapter and a HDMI cable when every other app out there works. I can watch ads but nothing else. Until you guys get this on fire stick, it’s unwatchable. Don’t put out apps that don’t work!  Also very few things are actually free, only a few movies and a couple episodes of some tv shows. Hard pass on this for now! Note to developers: no one will spend money on an app when it only partially functions.

title: Will not play
review: Commercials plays without issues for the first few minutes. Movie will not play. Then I get an error not supported. Tried on computer also. Same thing great commercial quality.  Movie will not play get an error about using external displays.  So as long as you have a single display your good but running three displays only using browser on one it just will not play. Glad I stuck with the free and did not pay for this service.

title: Quick and easy, however…
review: The app runs very smoothly and was super easy to get going. However, when I went to cast the premier league game on my tv from my phone, the game strangely was 5 to 6 minutes behind the game in real time and even on my phone. This was strange and I hope it gets fixed soon.

title: Law and Order
review:
I’ve been waiting for Peacock TV for a few months excited to be able to watch Michael Moriarty in Law and Order. Tell you what, when you include ALL the seasons of Law and Order, I’ll pay for your app, until then, nope.
Otherwise, it’s a very nice streaming app. Watching on my iPad. I’ll give you three stars as I’m disappointed about missing seasons in shows offered.

title: Great service over all
review: Only thing I can see is when I watch it on my phone the video isn’t full screen. It’s like the screen is up a little from the bottom instead of filling up my screen.

title: Waited for this app ! But not good enough to add to monthly bills just yet
review: Just began trial & sadly will not be able to continue after it ends.  The tv shows run one at a time & having to go into the phone & app for every single episode is a bit annoying. But I’m sure it’s been noticed & changes will come. For now I will wait btwn 3-6 months after updates & improvements occur. Then likely become a lifelong customer

title: Yesterday’s news literally
review: Ok I like to watch the news,  but it only has the Nightly New from yesterday or later.  Who the heck watches yesterday’s news.  Good thing you can look through the entire catalog of shows on the app in about five minutes.  You can make a fast decision around keeping the app for more than a week. With all the shows NBC has programmed over the years I’m a little underwhelmed.  If they don’t up there game in a few weeks,  I’m on to the next app.

title: No to peacock
review: I thought this app would be okay because they advertise a large selection of tv. Well it takes forever to get something to play and it keeps shutting down which is very aggravating. Also after each episode you have to go back into the app and search what you were watching and maybe it will play, maybe not. Too aggravating to continue to watch. I’m glad I did not pay after the 30 day trial. Not worth the time.

title: Slow
review: So far the app interface is not that great. I have the highest internet speed but the app is slow and frequently freezes. Maybe it is because it is new and a number of people are trying to use it. Only wanted it since they took premier league of the sports channel which is annoying. Also, on Apple TV the screensaver will come on while watching tv in this app... so maybe fix that too.

title: Can’t watch an entire episode
review: After ever commercial break the episode would double back to a part I already watched. Had to give up and revert back to a different streaming service. I wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt and give it an honest effort, but I couldn’t even get through a single episode. To bring more context, I was Air Playing the content from my iPhone. I did try to Air Play from my Mac and that didn’t work either. Kept getting an error that way.

title: Underwhelmed
review: I was hoping it would be more like the cbs app with the ability to watch live local programming so I could cut other streaming services but unfortunately that is not the case and IMO that was a failure on NBC to not have that but I suppose when they own Comcast that’s what happens so they don’t lose Comcast customers. The programming seems pretty lackluster thus fafor such a huge build up, you get more programming on the original NBC app.

title: Watch live without subscription lol
review: This is what happens when you are a billion dollar company and hire developers without validating their background and not doing proper testing. I’m able to watch live sports just by clicking on the live channels without even paying a dime. Thanks nbc! 😊

title: PREMIER LEAGUE VIEWERS, DONT BUY
review: If you’re an avid viewer of premier league football and want a cheap place to watch all live games, you’d be wasting your money with this app. They market it as having all the live games with their Premium subscription but they only air one game a day. 205 of the seasons games will not be available to Premium subscribers. They don’t even choose the best game of the day, it’s like they don’t even care about the sport. Streaming the live game was always behind too. Its just a cash grab for nbc.

title: I open app, only see 6 colored dot!
review: I went to the Peacock website, created an account, installed app.  When I open the app, I see some colored dots bounce a couple times then the line up in a straight line and that is it!  Nothing else!  Checked device compatibility list. Says “Tablet devices iOS 11 and above”. Yet it will not run on my iPad Mini 2 on 12.4.6.  They already collected my email address.  Bet the spam they are going to send me will work every time though!

title: Not Real Happy
review: I recently downloaded Peacock thinking it might be a good streaming service to add to our options. I chose the free version to check the service out before committing to any paid plan. Yesterday, I started watching a series listed as free, yet today when I went back to continue watching, the show is listed as available only with a paid plan. Poor advertising and a bad way to draw people in. Not sure I will continue with this service or not.

title: Very disappointed
review: I've been hearing and hearing about Peacock on TV, and so have decided to check it out. Unfortunately, this app is not very accessible for the blind/visually impaired. I'm using this with the latest version of ios13, and with VOiceover enabled and am using a bluetooth keyboard. I am hopeful that since Netflix has improved accessibility, you all will as well. I am aware this is a pretty new app. Either way, I won't be able to check things out until accessibility is fixed.

title: Off to a great start
review:
Different content than the other guys, gives me a break from the norm. A welcomed distraction while I’m stuck indoors. Columbo’s googly eyes sure crack me up

Now please just give me volume control during the amped out loud commercials (you know we still have volume buttons right). Thats the only sour to your sweet.

title: Awesome content
review: It was first available only through the Xfinity X1 app. There is a lot of new content and I love the way it’s organized. Life is so much easier now that there’s an app so that I can take my sweet time searching the selections vs. hogging up the tv browsing endless with the X1 app.

title: Nothing works
review: I have had this for two weeks now and have not been able to watch one show or movie all the way though. I have bit the iOS and OStv and both have major issues the interface on both freezes and crashes way to often uninformed many other issues. I’m they have 2 more weeks and I’m canceling. That said the library of content is amazing

title: Add more tv shows like 2 broke girls and battle bots
review: There isn't enough choices the app is amazing but not enough choices on what to watch I love 2 broke girls and battle bots yet I cannot find either of the two may you please make an uodate with more choices of shows to watch

title: Best new app
review: I really enjoy I even think it’s better then netflix you don’t have to pay for nothing and my little brother likes it he really enjoys the shows that are there and thank you very much to the creator of this app it’s really good 5/5 rating

title: Not free if you have to pay premium to watch good shows
review: I feel like I downloaded this app for nothing. When I got the shock that I would have to pay premium to watch most of the entertaining shows. Do not be deceptive and say something is free when it is not, when I realize this I am mediately deleted the app. People don’t waste your time downloading unless you want to pay premium to watch shows. I already have enough streaming apps I pay for I don’t need another.

title: Premier League Games mover to Peacock?!?!
review: I think it is unconscionable to move the Premier League games to Peacock when it is not available on all platforms- in our house, we have Roku and Samsung. I have kept my Comcast service specifically to be able to see the games. Imagine our dismay today when 2 major games were only on Peacock. I even loaded all suggested apps and paid for the Premier level and attempted to cast and only got a frozen picture on the screen. So far Peacock and NBC get a grade of F.

title: Disappointment
review:
Well let’s start with $10 for commercial free viewing. I start the very first episode of an original series and immediately I am forced to watch a 30 second commercial advertising Peacock that cannot be skipped... REALLY??? Commercial free is commercial free, not some what commercial free....
Then the Apple TV app is laid out very badly. Not as bad as some, but just lazy design.
Let’s hope my opinion improves as I use the service or I can see a cancellation of the premium service and a deletion of then apps.

title: Peacock app doesn’t work
review: I register for peacock and have an account and I entered the same credentials and says my account isn’t found but does work on the website. I was only able to find the application on Apple TV but is not available on smart TV’s. You are not able to skip when your watching a show. I wish we can skip commercials and forward as an option. Another application not needed to watch my favorite shows

title: Free for nothing
review: I was excited to be able to watch The Profit episodes for free but it turns out I cant blow up the screen from my phone to my tv because I don't have internet. I normally use a lightning usb cable to watch movies from my phone which netflix allows but peacock doesn't. Its sad that majority of the ratings on the app are three stars. Especially when its free. Please update you features so I can revise my review.

title: Put the app on Samsung tv
review: The app works fine for me, but having to stream things on my phone especially premier league matches is not ideal. There’s no app on Samsung tv, and whenever I try to airplay from my phone to the tv I can only get audio and the screen is still playing on my phone.

title: Limited and disappointing
review: I downloaded Peacock to watch the English Premier League and have been massively disappointed. When I connect to Apple TV, the app does not stream the image. There are no re runs for me to watch at a later date nor can I pause the if I need to step away. These features are available on other streaming services where I could watch NBCSports. Overall, very dissatisfied with Peacock. Considering removing and not watching English Premier League anymore.

title: Worthless for the deaf/Deaf or anyone who uses captions
review: This is horrible. So glad I get it free I’ve tried to watch 3 episodes of American greed. The captions on American greed don’t work. They get stuck on one sentence for over 3-5 mins at times.  I’ve even turned them off and back on to try to get them to sync and it doesn’t. Don’t waste your time trying.  My phone is also set for apps to auto play but I guess this app doesn’t sync with iPhone accessibility features.

title: No pause feature, no search capability
review:
You can’t pause the channel while you are watching. Also, the show you are watching has no information- for example: SNL season and episode. 

Premier League games are not available right away- if you miss the start you can’t rewind to the beginning. Instead, you have to wait for the replay to become “available “.

title: Missing basic settings
review: Overall, the app is good but missing some basic settings such as changing the video stream quality since by default all shows stream at HD. Majority of video stream apps have the option to select SD or HD or UHD. Please add this setting to allow users the choice of quality and for those with monthly capped data usage bandwidth.

title: Accessibility issues all over the place in this app
review: Accessibility issues all over the place in this app. Once content starts playing in the channels tab, there is no way for a voiceover user to pause the streaming show. No way that I can seem to bring up controls for playing content i.e. start and stop. There is also no audio description setting either. If Netflix can do it and you want to be competitive then these issues need to addressed.

title: Log in issues and poor customer service
review: Do not get this app unless you have the patience of a Saint. I constantly have to try log in and always says that my password is invalid. I reset the password and it still shows error. Their customer care team said it’s because my email isn’t verified, yet I know for a fact it is. They have tried 3 times now to send me an email to verify it but yet I never received it. It’s a horrible service.

title: What a waste of effort
review:
Well too bad for the originals it had available to watch, which I enjoyed the free episodes and they got me to purchase the service.  Now I am stuck with a screen that has the dots just sitting there.  I was only able to watch three episode once purchased.  I have restated, attempted to log in on iPad (pop up says “unable to fetch data”), etc.  

I hope the shows get picked up on another service soon....very disappointed.

title: Amazing
review: I find this app to be of the highest quality. There are hardly and issues on it and it brings a whole new experience for viewing your shows check it out

title: Needs work
review: The content looks pretty good but I’m not the kind of person that wants to watch movies or tv shows on my phone so I have an adapter and a HDMI cable to cast or mirror programs in my tv. Which is something I can do with Netflix but apparently it’s not possible with Peacock. Sorry but I don’t think I will pay to upgrade my account just to watch things on my phone so I’m probably going to just delete the app.

title: Good app
review: Love the app it’s good for the price, I was looking for a particular show to watch (Yellowstone) to get caught up to current season and found it! The only draw back I have is I can only get the app on my iPhone or iPad, this app is not available on my fire stick, smart TV or Ruku. Only available on select devices

title: Some bugs with chromecast
review: Someone else mentioned the syncing gets messed up. Happens to me too. Also when trying to watch Days of Our Lives, every episode that does not have the airdate on top of the thumbnail will not go to my chromecast despite being connected. All the ones with an airdate on the thumbnail go to the chromecast fine. What an odd bug.

title: Fix the buffering already!
review: I signed up before it came out and love the selection but the freakin buffering is driving me nuts! This is 2020. I watch on my Apple TV and I have super fast Internet.  No other streaming app does this. Everything I watch on this app has to be stopped and restarted. Seriously fix that crap. I’m paid for a year so if this doesn’t get fixed I’ll be canceling this streaming app.

title: Absolutely LOVE!!!!!!!
review: I absolutely love this APP!!!! They have great tv shows & movies for free & even better ones with a subscription! & it’s only 4.99 a month! Less than half of these other tv & movies app!! Just loveeee! Wasn’t sure what to expect when I downloaded it but I’m in love!!!!!!! Thanks Peacock TV!!!

title: Content is fine, App is mediocre
review: The content Peacock offers is fine. Worth the price. The app is very basic. Has to buffer a while, even on a strong WiFi signal. Content often drops with cell signal.  Also, the search feature doesn't capture all the content and takes a while to search.

title: Terrible for Premier League
review:
Incredibly frustrating not being able to start a live match from the beginning, or be able to rewind or fast-forward. 

You have to wait until someone uploads the complete match to the App, which often takes hours from the time the match has finished. 

This App feels like a throwback to the early 2000’s. Definitely not worth the money we are all being charged for use of the App.

title: Utter Sh*tte
review: Im writing this review instead of watching the bloody football match like I was able to when NBCSN had the deal with Premiere League football. Now we’re stuck with this garbage that doesn’t let us watch the match even after upgrading to premium. And how much of a joke is this - after buying premium plus there’s still ads. You’ve gone mad. Fix this app or give it back to the good folks over at NBC that know how to broadcast properly, thank you!

title: Clearly needs work
review: I’m only using this app because NBC Sports is now essentially only showing Premier League on Peacock— which is incompatible with Roku- F-brilliant— so I’m relegated to watching on the iphone. It’s the biggest league in the world for the biggest sport in the world. It’s one of the main features of your service. Searching for content, results for “premier league” — “no results were found”— someone needs to find out what the fk is going on with your search engine

title: 21st Century? Peacock?
review:
2020 Update: And the new name is still old, since you don't even offer picture in picture. Good programming. Crappy App! Can't you afford to pay someone who knows how to create a competitive app? What about your parent company, Comcast? You know, the INTERNET company. Never mind. Their service is terrible too. Such a joke. 

2019: Come join us NBC! Apps are great now. Just hire someone who knows what they're doing!  Oh right, I remember... Comcast owns you... that explains everything!

title: Sports playback is riddled with bugs
review:
If NBC wants to move all EPL to this Peacock app, I am fine with that but the app needs to work. 

Quite frustrating experience this morning where the app forgot where I was in the match every time I swiped away to respond to an email or view another app. I also cannot for the life of me figure out how to fast forward. I expect that feature costs extra? Haha

title: This app is awful!!
review: It would not let me sign in for weeks and the best part it won’t let me sign in anymore I deleted this app this app is terrible!! Like what app does that and it’s not my Wi-Fi. I had to go to the website I don’t know why?? I mean yeah it’s free but it doesn’t mean it won’t to rip you off!! Even though you don’t pay for it. They just use you for reviews because they’re free!! And I would honestly want to give it 0 stars but it doesn’t work that way!

title: Won’t stop freezing
review: Every time I’m half way through the add, it freezes. I’ve tried several times, backing out and restarting what I was watching only for it to do it again. I’ve had peacock for 24 hours and even though it’s free, it’s not worth it in my opinion. They have a lot of issues to fix. Also, I thought peacock was supposed to Friends (could be wrong on my info), but they don’t have it which is really disappointing

title: Why do I pay for this
review: This stupid network doesn’t even show the games that are on. Didn’t show the first match of the day and I can’t find anywhere that they are showing the second game. If Chelsea is play you should show the game. America’s best player plays for them and they don’t have the game on. They should not be allowed to have broadcasting rights if they don’t show the games!!! Outrageous that they only plan to broadcast 4 games from match day 3.

title: Service is not user friendly, watchlist useless for sports
review:
Where is the “watchlist”?
We got this to watch Premier League but you have to search every time for the games and you can’t just add the program to the watchlist except individually but there is no “watchlist” anywhere? 

Someone posted it is embedded in the Browse menu item. Hm, odd choice

The user interface seems to be circa 2005, not dynamic and user friendly

If you could add the season or program to a real watchlist and you could just go there, the app would be better. I hope the watchlist feature is added soon, otherwise what’s the point? All other services remember your choices and are more searchable

title: Not able to view entire seasons
review: I like the app since it has Yellowstone but I am not happy about the fact that only season 7 of Chicago PD is available. You would think for $10 that all Seasons would be available as well as access to the shows on the NBC app as well. There are some good movies. Hopefully season 3 of Yellowstone shows up sooon

title: Garbage app. Tech support is a badly designed bot.
review: Trying to use this on my appletv. The app doesn’t save your watch progress. So if I pause and go to the kitchen for a few minutes, and come back and the appletv has gone to sleep, when I wake it, it restarts the episode. So I tried going to their site for support. There is Jack for articles and the chat for support, opens a badly designed bot that just walked me through the same articles that didn’t address the issue.

title: Disappointed
review: You’ve Already changed the best part of your service. At launch movies would play a single long commercial break at the beginning and then no more interruptions. Now this is no longer the case and watching movies with repeated interruptions is deal breaker. Please go back to a single commercial break for movies

title: Love it !
review: Easy to use. Signed up using the voice remote and got peacock premium downloaded it on my phone and was able to watch the same content. Easy navigation ! So excited to binge watch all the great content.

title: iOS does not show video on connected TV
review: I use a small screen, older iPhone and use a dedicated cable to view video on the TV. This service does not allow the video of the programs or movies to be passed through to the TV. It seems to be happy showing all the other functions of the app, and even the ads sometimes, but the content is not available. I cannot recommend this at all until that is fixed.

title: Love this streaming service.  One of the two best.
review: I binge watch a heck of lot of TV, way before COVID, and my primary source was always the streaming service with the smile from A to Z.  Now Peacock is on the same level and I love I have so MUCH more choices.  Especially Law & Order ans Law and Order Criminal Intent.  Bliss.  😊

title: Great Content, App still lacking features
review: The app has some great original shows. The Mehdi Hassan show is on point, but you can only add individual episodes to watch list and not entire shows. They episodes also don't have specific info in their descriptions, such as a short summary of topics covered and a list of guests.

title: Embarrassingly bad
review: Shameful that NBC Universal requires people to watch Premier league soccer on a tiny device when their app is not compatible with most Samsung TVs and most other TVs. So if you wanna watch Chelsea versus Liverpool today, get your reading glasses out and get really close to your iPhone. In addition the feed doesn’t work well so it’s constantly low quality and blurry. I will remember this in the future when I have a choice and I will not choose NBC Universal or Peacock

title: CONcast at it again
review: I shouldn’t be surprised at a piece of garbage, poor functioning app from the same company that disregards customer service with such distinction. This dud continually drops service, but to be fair maybe that may be due to the crappy cable connection provided by CONcast. Peacock disables Airplay or the ability to use a HDMI cable to broadcast to a TV. The kicker for sports fans is making customers pay twice to watch EPL. But I do have to give it to them for consistency in customer dissatisfaction.

title: Constant crashes
review: I like the service but the iPhone app doesn’t work well at all. The app crashes very frequently.  As I am watching an episode, in a few minutes the app will shut down completely and when I re-open it and go back to the show, the last point where I watched is not saved. I would really like to see this fixed.

title: No log in!!
review: Since September 1st cannot log in on IPad nor Apple TV, or not recognized directly through peacock tv directly. Paid, big mistake for promotion, for a year. After trying for about 24 hours the site does not know who I am. I cannot even get in to get a refund or make sure I am not charged next time around. Cannot find any info as to what the problem is either! First and last time for signing up for promotional offerings!

title: Not recommended
review: My neighbor tried this and didn’t get any further than signing in and couldn’t figure out what to do so we took it off of her phone. Not clear instructions not clear directions and no where could I find a menu to get you to the actual TV programs. I was going to sign up and I don’t need any more difficulty in my life and I definitely couldn’t show her something that I couldn’t figure out myself. Needs a lot of work

title: App needs work content Ok
review: There are problems with the playback, especially their live offerings like soccer. No pause, no rewind, banner time out is way too long, and so many others. Quit having people write apps that probably never use it in the first place. There are tons of video apps to sample, and obviously someone here wanted to do it a bit different, and ultimately ended up with a worse experience overall. Content is OK, but fix the app shortcomings please

title: Peacock
review: peacock is actually really good and i recommend it , it shows alot of good movies WITHOUT ANY MISSING FILMS , and i actually really enjoy using peacock. one problem about it is that there’s adds but it’s fine , but other than that I actually love peacock!!

title: Terrible App. Had to buy to watch Premier League soccer
review:
The app just isn’t seamless, especially for soccer. For starters it made no sense to even have to pay for this app in addition to paying for other apps to watch premier league games that aren’t on peacock. Some games are on here and some aren’t. The search function is terrible - I can’t even type premier league to find games i have to type the name of the teams paying. 

Not satisfied at all.

title: Chromecast audio syncing issue
review: The app casts fine to my Chromecast, but after a few minutes the audio and picture no longer sync up, so I constantly have to start and stop whatever I am watching. The content is not great either. I don’t think it’s worth paying for until they fix this major bug and add more shows I can’t watch on other streaming services.

title: Excellent so far.  Just one question:
review: I looked at the website and it looks like I can upgrade to premium very easily from there.  But since I signed up via the app, is there any way to upgrade within it rather than via the website?

title: Obviously not Netflix
review:
I downloaded the app because Parks and Rec got taken off Netflix. 

The app is fine for the most part but I hate that the default loading screen isn’t to continue watching whatever I was watching. Also, there’s no way to skip credits and there’s a decent number of ads. This is somewhat understandable but then what I’m watching buffers after...

title: “You don’t meet the United States Roaming Requirements”
review:
An American citizen, living overseas. The app will let me download it and set up an account and verify it before finally telling me that I don’t meet their roaming requirements. With absolutely no explanation of what those roaming requirements are. 

It’s 2020. There are more than 7 billion people in the world, most, obviously, not living in the U.S. How difficult is it to make an app at least communicate to it’s potential users who can and can’t use it?

title: Great shows
review: I loves the shows and movies peacock provides but my only problem is that there is no good way to browse. There’s thousands of movies and shows on peacock and I only see the ones that are advertised. I wish there was a better way to browse all movies and all shows.

title: Errors make it hard to watch
review: Whenever I stream any show at some point in the episode it stops and then it will go to the Ready to Cast screen. It loses the progress in the show. Another downside is the streaming gets out of synch with the picture as well in most episodes as well. Love the content just needs some tweaks!

title: Good content, app lacking
review:
I love the content, especially Larry Wilmore, but when I try to stream to my Apple TV,  the tv display freezes (iPhone displays fine at the same time) and the sound cuts in and out.

I don’t experience these issues with other streaming apps. 

  I’m looking forward to an improved app and more Wilmore!

title: Ads
review: It was easy watching my shows on Netflix/Amazon prime. Along comes this app which changes a simple show to include ads. I’d rather pay not to watch another ad. You don’t save the show I constantly watch on the main page which means I have to search for it each time. And I can’t minimize the screen to a pocket like with Netflix to answer a text or something. I should be upset that my show switched over to you.

title: App won’t open, good on PC
review:
So I downloaded the app today and it wouldn’t open. No colorful dogs or anything. I thought that was very curious..so I googled around a bit and found peacock people telling me to restart the phone and redownload the app. I did that a few times and still nothing.
