I even updated my phone from iOS 13.5 to iOS 13.6.1 and it’s still broken, but now I can see the dots sometimes. 

I have been using Peacock on my desktop, though. It has been working very nice so far. I’ve enjoyed watching A.P. Bio. and I highly recommend the show so far haha.

Anyway, hope the devs fix this bug and let me get to streaming!

iPhone 11 Pro Max
iOS 13.6.1
August 15, 2020 - August 16,2020

title: Awful Streaming Service
review: If you are thinking of downloading this app in order to watch live sports or other live events Do Not Bother. Spend your time looking for a free stream online and trust me your time would have been better spent. It is unfortunate that Peacock has access to so many shows and movies and even the Premier League because it simply does not work. If you are someone who enjoys a headache download this app, otherwise steer clear.

title: Not free
review: This app is not free sure you can download it for free and maybe watch one movie but most movies that you want to watch are not free and it’ll let you watch three episodes of a show and then not let you watch the rest which is messed up you have to have premium which cost money so their commercials are lying and it is not free it’s deceiving and disgusting people with low income want to watch these movies for memories yet it says they’re free but it’s not

title: They’ve got the right idea
review:
There are still some bugs to work out, but for the most part they have the app built. The bugs I’ve experienced so far are:

App doesn’t automatically play the next episode in a series, I have to physically enter the app and tap on the episode I want to watch next.

App doesn’t resume series when I hit “continue watching” in the main menu.

When casting to the tv, the app turns the cast screen horizontal instead of vertical like every other app. 

Other than this, no complaints. Great selection, love getting back into some old friends in terms of shows and movies.

title: App constantly crashes
review: The app constantly crashes. Also, it doesn’t retain accurate information about how far you’ve watched a show. You may be on season 1, episode 2, but when log in and want to continue watching from where you left off, it sends you to season 2, episode 12.

title: Shame on NBC
review: NBC is ‘my channel’. Lester Holt, Today Show, Chuck Todd etc. I was excited to try Peacock. I agree with most users re tha app being horrible and the lack of being able to watch it on a TV. I am 70 years old and my eyes can not tolerate looking at an iPad for extended periods and forget even being able to see on a phone. Shame on NBC! My experience, plus reading reviews & low ratings here, steer me to know I will not buy the app service. Big mistake NBC has made.

title: BS editors’choice app
review: Subscribed for live premiere  league football and end up just watch on the tiny monitor phone. Cannot Mirrored work with Apple TV to Roku tv. Well, I take it back it just had live sound no picture. It Needs a major improvement . Im thinking about to cancel  after 7 days free. Now NBC is too greedy to put most games on PeaCOCK tv and they will get bad feedback from live sport fans. And I am so sad it was editors’ choice app. How much NBC paid for it???

title: Bad Interface, Execution + Insulting to Soccer Fans
review:
Read most any other review to see how rough the app functions. 

I can’t believe the price gouging of English Premier League fans. NBC Sports was a great place for Americans to learn the game with great coverage and sometimes as many as 6-8 games a week. Now, they’re moving their best games onto the OTT platform on Peacock. It’s sad that to enjoy premier league, you have to subscribe to cable and a bonus service. 

Once again, it’s one thing if they put some of the lower tier games on Peacock (like they did with NBC Sports Gold, which is normal for sports fans to pay extra to have access to ALL games) but the first two weeks of Premier League have had their best matches on Peacock and not on NBC Sports. 

(Apple TV app is rough too)

title: Useless if it can’t be viewed on Roku
review: The app for the phone is okay, though the UI leaves a lot to be desired. But I want to be able to view this on my TV. I’ve watched a few things on my phone but would really like for my wife and I to be able to view it on television. It makes it worthless to me. Stream to TV apps don’t work for our smart TV. I’ve tried free ones and paid for some only to have to get a refund. Peacock, stream to TV or go the F away.

title: No HDMI support
review: Very frustrating- the app will not show the programs on a TV connected via an HDMI cable.  The TV will show the app sxeeeh with program choices and will play the commercials that precede the programs with the free version. However, when the program starts the TV screen goes blank and the program is not viewable.  Why not?  Makes no sense to restrict this; it is obviously restricted via the app as the app and commercials will play while the programming will not.

title: Waste of money
review: Unfortunately it has a crappy library of movies and shows, when you find a movie you want to see in HD 4K, it doesn’t play. It loads and loads and it stops at the main page, I tried resetting my device, checked my internet connection but wouldn’t load the Mummy movie with Brendan Fraiser, so annoying. I’m glad I canceled it during the trial. Avoid at all costs.

title: garbage. zero content.
review: I wanted to give this a try so I installed it and after three minutes I ended up uninstalling it because it was total garbage. There was no content so I decided to search for a bravo TV show which you would think would be on there since they are the same owners and there were zero search results. One of the most useless apps I’ve ever encountered and I cannot believe this is from a company like Comcast

title: Is NBC limiting streaming?
review: It’s bad enough that NBC is forcing me to subscribe to Peacock to watch more than one Premier League game on Saturday and Sunday. But when I try to play the game through Apple TV it only streams the audio.  Why would I be prevented from streaming? Support site is unhelpful when looking for a fix. The UX gives no personalization options so I need to search for sporting events when I want to watch.

title: Won’t cast to TV so it’s USELESS
review: Not sure what the point is with this app if it won’t cast to my TV. I have a 75 inch TV so why would I want to watch anything on my phone unless I was stuck in a car? The “regular” NBC app casts with no problems, Peacock doesn’t even have that as an option. I’ll check back once they update the app to see if they figured out and fixed this but until you can cast to a smart TV there is no point in me wasting my time.

title: So good!
review: This app is the No.1 steaming app for me. It works really well, plus it barely loads. If you are a Harry Potter fan like me, LISTEN UP! Once you make an account, you can watch EVERY SINGLE ONE of the movies FOR FREE! They are high quality, and don’t cost you a single cent. Please get! :)

title: Commercials
review: I use this to access the live tv channels, and the commercials are insanely loud. If I were to guess, the commercials are more than twice as loud as the shows. It is really annoying to have to turn it down, then back up every commercial break. I know that commercials tune up their sound on purpose, but I have never seen it this bad. Please fix.

title: Mirror?
review:
I really wish the app offered a mirror to TV option. I tried through my phone and smartTV and though it looked like it was working the TV just wouldn’t show the same screen at all.
I’m not saying to be just like Netflix/Prime/Hulu, but even the TNT app allows you to mirror your screen.
PLEASE FIX THIS! 
I’m looking forward to watching the new shows :)

Update: Still not possible to watch on your TV, unless you have an Apple TV. The screen mirror I usually use with my iPhone Does. Not. Work.
I will probably wait until their next update to see if they find a solution, otherwise it’s just too frustrating, I’ll stick with my more reliable streaming platforms.

title: Good
review: Although people have been saying the quality is bad... it works perfectly fine for me! It’s a bit annoying to go back 10 seconds if you want to but I would recommend. It’s free and it’s good quality for a completely FREE movie.

title: Awful
review: I’ve tried numerous of times to create an account and every time it tells me “An error has occurred. Try again later”. I’ve tried uninstalling it and installing it again, but same error message. Also have tried downloading the app and creating an account various days out the week and still can’t even create an account or see what’s on the app. Is their a block against apple users?

title: Can’t cast or use HDMI
review: All I wanted to do was watch the soccer game. I used to be able to do this from Roku with the PAID version of NBC sports app. But now they’re not streaming there but on peacock premium! The problem is you can’t airplay, you can’t mirror and worst of all you can’t even use hdmi out from your iPhone. Why the frack anyone would pay for this app under these circumstances is beyond me but this app should be avoided by all until this is fixed.

title: Disappointed
review: I fell for it. They said look at all we offer “FREE” and they had the show I wanted to watch. Super excited. Download app and start first episode of my show and go to move on to second episode and bam there it is. If you want to continue you must pay. So bummed. So not going to pay for all these. Deleted app was let down but my fault I didn’t look into it more. I’ll give them that there advertising was good they got me to try.

title: Painful to use
review: This app is painful to use. If you are trying to binge a show it constantly loads for commercials and if you go back to the menu it does not save what episode you just left. I have to search for the show I’m watching and the episode every time I use it. I also find the menu setup confusing. I do like the variety of programs.

title: Had High Hopes
review: I had high hopes for this app. Used it at my MIL’s house to watch endless episodes of The King Of Queens. Since she was an Xfinity customer it worked beautifully BUT when we tried to pair the app with our Samsung Smart TV it does not work. Airplay won’t work either. I even tried going on the TV’s internet to watch and it won’t work properly. This is insane! Why make, release and, promote an app that only select people can use. Please fix this.

title: More issues the longer you use
review: Only got the app for the U.S. Open and didn’t have many issues the first two days of use. Day three and I’ve had to restart the app five times in the last hour. Drops casting, lots of buffering, etc makes it a big hassle to use. Like the idea but wish this kinks had been worked out already.

title: Premium doesn’t work
review:
I am supposed to get premium through my xfinity plan. My peacock account shows I have premium through the xfinity account. Yet, when I go to stream anything (I only try to use this for EPL games since they are no longer on TV), it asks me to sign up for premium and won’t stream the game.

I sent their customer support an email and received a “did you turn it off and turn it back on” suggestion.

title: Programming
review: So when you first launched yesterday on opening day, apparently everything was free to watch, today it is showing you must subscribe to premium to be able to be able to watch some movies ? It was false advertisement when it said it was free then, never did it was said that you must subscribe to premium to watch a certain movie..

title: This app on chrome cast
review: So far it works good. Just that it needs to start playing episodes consecutively right after the other. I hate having to cast another episode manually over and over. Can y’all fix this cause I really like some of the shows here and I’d like to watch them without interruption

title: Love it
review: I love this app I am in college so I like to not pay for stuff and this app is great for that it has good shows my only complaint is that you can’t do other stuff on your phone while your watching its

title: Put latest episodes first
review: I got this app primarily to watch Seth Meyers. It’s pretty annoying to go to the show page and find the episodes in chronological order, with the first episode of the season listed first. You have to scroll through dozens and dozens of episodes to watch the latest. Why would you put the oldest first? Who wants to watch six-month-old political comedy?

title: No streaming to TV
review:
App doesn’t work with my Apple TV. Displaying on tv through Airplay doesn’t work for video either, only getting audio. Hooking up the iPad directly with HDMI adapter to tv also offers a black screen with audio only. Pretty useless app. And ‘free’ means you have to sit through tons of ads constantly or spend 5 - 10 bucks a months and still get to watch ads nevertheless.

And here comes the kicker. Received an email from Peacock saying streaming is easy as ever no matter what content you want to warch. So i press the stream now button which takes me to their website. I log in and when i press a show to watch it says content not available. LOL!

This app is so lacking and broken is it hilarious.

DELETE!!!

title: Really poorly designed app
review: The app design is really horrible. First, have to scroll through a bunch of things in a particular category to get to the browse all section. Huge annoyance. Next, can add things to a watch list, but I can’t find where said watch list is. Who approved this app design and layout?   This maybe would’ve been ok if this was the first streaming service out, but you’re late to the party and brought stale chips.

title: App is just okay - content is severely lacking.
review: I have a trial for Peacock. I will absolutely NOT be paying for a subscription when my trial runs out. The service is not even close to being worth the price. Comcast/NBC need to accept that they’ve fallen WAY behind the other media companies and don’t really deserve to have their own streaming service - unless it’s ~$1.99/month. Maybe people would pay that. ...But maybe not.

title: Overrated
review: This app is overrated as crap. The media made such a big show of its release and it definitely doesn’t live up to the hype that was created when announcing it. The biggest mistake is it’s content. It has no good movies, no good shows and not even good cartoons. I’m keeping it for now, as I’m hoping for them to add better stuff to it. Now I know why it was free, it’s complete garbage. Hopefully it gets a tune up.

title: Fix it!!!
review: This is the buggiest streaming app I’ve ever had the misfortune to have on my phone and iPad! There’s a lot of desirable content available but it’s annoying trying to get to work. Watching a half hour show can take 45 minutes to an hour with the constant buffering and other stoppages. It’s not my devices or my internet connection. I stream a lot of content and Peacock TV is the only one with these issues.

title: No Chromecast
review: Ok sports fans here’s the deal. When the first sign in screen came on I didn’t fill in nothing, I just hit enter. Then a 2nd sign in screen came up so I entered my credentials that I created weeks ago and ‘boom’ I got in. I then hit cast to my Chromecast 1 and it took a little while (seconds) and ‘voila’ it worked. So I’m watching ‘Dracula’. A b&w movie from 1931, 10 mins in VIVID color commercials, really spoiled the mood, shut it off. How much can a 90 year old b&w movie cost?

title: Lots of errors during playback
review: I frequently get the “Oops, something went wrong” pop up right after a bunch of ads play. Then I have to restart the video and scrub back to where I think I left off, and watch the ads all over again! And then sometimes it doesn’t play at the spot I scrubbed to, so I have to re-scrub to the right position and then watch the ads AGAIN. Ridiculous! Not worth it. Don’t bother.

title: Eh. It’s okay.
review: I say it’s okay because, it does give you the free movies and tv shows, but you still have to pay for premium to watch the rest of the movies and shows, and that to me is False Advertisement (I mean, I get why you do it) but you say that it’s FREE in ALL of your ads, but you still have to pay for the rest of it. 😤

title: Refreshingly good and free
review: I was pleasantly surprised when I downloaded this free app to watch “Psych 2” it is really free. No hidden costs yet and TONS of free content. I’ve found more to watch here than on Disney Plus which I was bored with as soon as the Mandelorian was over.

title: App won’t even launch
review: Haven’t been able to successfully launch the app even once. The whole app either crashes or freezes on a black screen. I realize this was just released but making sure the app actually launches should be a priority if you’re hoping for positive feedback about all the content you’re offering. Please fix right away, this problem should not exist at launch.

title: Premium won’t open after purchase
review:
I’ve tried three times now to purchase the premium option. Nothing happens. It’s a neverending loop going from choosing episode 2 of a series to going back to the purchase page. Then it tells me I already purchased premium and back to episodes and so forth.
I’d love to actually watch some shows on the premium option, so this is ridiculous!!

title: Thanks for making it a pain to watch P&R
review: The only reason I downloaded this was to watch parks and rec, because they took it off of Netflix to host it here. Fine. However, in ONE episode, there were 7 ads, 4 times where it froze, and the app crashed in the middle of the episode. I would pay the $9.99 for ad free, but you can’t expect people to pay you for the premium if you can’t even get it to work right.

title: Great concept
review: Peacock TV that’s great! It has a lot of the old shows that I like, law and order criminal intent, Colombo along with all of murder she wrote. I’ve had no problem watching the shows on my iPad and I am very thankful for the new Peacock TV streaming.

title: Add casting abilities & develop an app for Samsung TV’s
review: I downloaded the Peacock IPhone app the day it was released. Great content but I was seriously disappointed to find out that there isn’t a casting capability to broadcast to my TV wirelessly.  Please resolve this issue. Also please please please develop an app for Samsung TV’s. I noticed the app was released to every other provider except Samsung televisions.

title: Pretty terrible
review: App doesn’t use Apples video player so you cannot seek or skip back/forward easily. It’s worst on Apple TV because it’s fairly impossible to skip back just 10 seconds on a 3 hour sports video because the seeking is so sensitive. If it wasn’t for premier league, I would cancel my subscription because the video player is awful

title: Great job on app and outstanding content!
review: Kudos to developers for a user interface that blows away most of the new streaming services and doesn’t screw up the content. And the content is *really* good with old, new, and timeless classics.

title: Harry Potter forever!
review: I think it’s a great app except for the only reason I downloaded it was for watching the Harry Potter movies, and they are only on till the end of October. I think it should be free all year round but with adds unless you pay to get them removed with a premium purchase. But other then that I love it!

title: Can’t Register/sign in
review: I will not be reviewing the programming or details of this service because after multiple attempts I’ve not been able to log in. Having read the other reviews, I think I got lucky. FYI, the error message tells me to “try again later.” This is the same message I get from time to time on my AT&T app, so maybe NBCU/Comcast has the same untalented app developer as AT&T. Bye, Peacock. I never knew you.

title: Ruined the Premier League for everyone
review: We already pay for cable but now we have to pay extra for the games we should already have?! This is ridiculous, also immoral because of this pandemic we are in and some people may not be able to afford it. Also, some may not have smart devices or know how to use smart devices like the elderly. You guys are greedy and inconsiderate of others.

title: Bugs?
review: It worked great then I signed out and now it won’t let me watch the premium shows that I signed up for watched almost an entire series and now I can’t finish it. Keeps telling me to “upgrade to premium” and I already have it.

title: Not IOS like
review:
It is surprising that Apple approved this app for AppleTV.  The remote does not work like it does for other apps.  Closed captioning does not work by pulling down.  Cannot skip back or forward, nor see the timeline.
But worst is that Peacock allows one to add programs as a ‘Favorite’, but there is not a way to then see those ‘Favorites’.
I rarely use Peacock because it is so bad.

title: Horrible.
review: The app is so full of glitches that it almost makes it impossible to use. If you scroll, it freezes. If you tap a button, it freezes. If you try to pause and then play again, it freezes. I spend more time waiting for the app to cooperate than I do using it. It’s so frustrating. If this doesn’t get fixed I will definitely be canceling my subscription.

title: Solid 1.0 release, needs more features
review:
Please add to the pipeline the ability to soft-double-tap (if that’s a word) to enlarge older 4:3 content to 16:9 screen on AppleTV. 

All other quality streaming apps support this.

Also, why have more titles from the NBC app not been moved over? So many titles I watch there are not on Peacock yet. Why?

title: Fine to stream on phone, but...
review: I’ve had no issues streaming shows on my phone and it’s been a decent app in that regard. However, whenever I try to hook the phone up to the TV via HDMI cable, the audio comes up on the TV but no video. I want this app to succeed, but there certainly is more work that needs to be done before it’s a competitor in the streaming game.

title: Not really free
review:
I was going to give two stars to seem generous but then I decided to give it one stars.

They do not have free tv shows, movies, or anything of that sort. The only thing they have free is streaming and news. This app was very very misleading. I’d recommend that you’re better off spending more time on Netflix(which by the way offers a 30 day free trial instead of a 7 day free trial).

Thanks for taking the time to read my review.

title: Why the terrible custom TV UI?
review: There are perfectly usable player controls available on these platforms. Why try to reinvent them? I can’t ever seem to replay something I’ve missed, turn on/off captions, or easily scrub forward or backward if needed. Please remove the unusable custom controls and use the built-in player control APIs available on TV.

title: Apple TV app
review: Like the content. Commercials are short. Overall not to bad at all. But...  they really need to fix the controls. The forward and back controls are all over the place. Practically not useable. Which is a real issue when you miss something and you cannot rewind.

title: Needs improvement
review:
It needs to improve the aspect ratio. I open a movie and it takes up less than half the screen. Also, on the iphone x the bar to slide up to get home does not disappear when watching. 

These are definitely two of the biggest problems but the developer could easily fix them.

title: Long way to go
review:
Pause in the middle of a movie to watch something live, or to go out, it doesn’t remember where you left off.

Watched one movie, found another one to watch and the app locks up. This has happened a couple times now, end up having to exit the app then come back into it.

Not quite ready for prime time.

title: Greed
review: This is how premier league will drop interest in USA. The premier league should sell their rights to someone else, this is pure robbery, they make us pay cable so we can watch games now they charge again monthly to watch other games, what’s next? Paying even extra for derby games on top of the premium? Terrible!!! This American corporate greed have no end. Doesn’t matter how much money they have will never be enough!

title: Impossible to watch on TV
review: Tried to watch a movie but this app doesn’t seem to allow you to use Airplay. I don’t understand the point of an app that isn’t available on Smart TVs but will also not allow you to stream on it either. I’m not trying to watch a 2 hr long movie on my tiny little phone screen!! I really thought this would go without saying but I guess the NBC people need reminding...

title: AMAZING
review: So for years I’ve been looking for a streaming service in which I can can watch the HP series on and this one has them all. I love that it’s only short ads in between the movie and not long ads!! I haven’t tried the channels yet but I love the movies and can’t wait to try the original content

title: Terrible keyboard on Xbox
review: This is the worst keyboard design when viewing on the Xbox. You can not see where the cursor. I had to say out load which letter I was at while going left or right. So if I started on A and k was 2 moves to the left, I had to count. It took me 10 minutes just to log in. Then once your in the app it is the same thing! The designer needs to go back to the drawing board absolutely terrible!!!!!!!

title: Unbelievably Bad
review: I know this is NBC universal so who cares about creating an app that works. I signed up for Premier League games. You’d think instead of scrolling through the channels and then the programs within the channels to stumble upon something you’re looking for, there’d be a search option so you could, you know, jump to the team you wanna watch. Searches for Arsenal, Fulham, Leeds, etc. yield zero search results. Super helpful.

title: Very poorly working/ designed app
review: Needs a lot of work.   All it does is pause every few minutes to think, then come back with an out of focus picture.  No way I’d pay for this service especially with the streaming issues as well as all the other issues other people wrote about.   I’ll be deleting the app.

title: Needs an update soon
review: I understand it’s a fresh app but it would be nice if users could minimize their screen so they could use other apps at the same time. I would also like a separate page where all the shows I wanna keep watching show on their own instead of being mixed in with the others

title: Chromecast Doesn’t Work
review: I can’t get a cable box in my room and use chromecast on my tv to compensate. After learning that the peacock app was able to chromecast, I tried it out. It would never load the show I wanted to watch and eventually would stop trying to cast. Tried another app that chromecasts  and it worked perfectly. Just seems like Peacock is advertising for something they still can’t do. Kinda bummed.

title: Nbc has screwed up their sports coverage again!
review: Nbc has removed premier league soccer from their main channels today and are showing on Peacock instead. After failing to get Peacock running on my pretty new Samsung Tv (browser out of date message - you have got to be kidding!) - i downloaded the Peacock TV app on my iphone. That worked ok but there is no sign of the Barclays Premier League games today. This is the NBC Sports/Gold app debacle all over again!

title: Ok but cannot skip ahead
review:
This app doesn’t doesn’t let you skip ahead 10s, it only has the ability to scrub. Which usually causes issues if it’s anywhere near a commercial break it will start looping. 

Wish they used the skip feature from the api

title: Really?
review: The app needs to be updated within of being released a few weeks??  Really.  I was surprised all the episodes of the older shows are not available like the Carol Burnett Show.  I don’t want the peacocks news which is front and centered.  I want easy search and availability of free shows.

title: I wish I could give this negative stars
review: Peacock did nothing to fix the existing issues with streaming the premier league via Chromecast. If your planning on streaming the PL on Chromecast don’t waste your money it still constantly glitches and does not work. There is no actual support as well outside of an article trying to pin blame on your internet when the issues only happen with peacock/NBC Sports gold.

title: The app doesn’t work in iOS latest version
review: I tried  this app for I don’t know how menu times but every time I try to open the app close by itself any solution ???

title: Do you need a newer Apple TV for Peacock to play on it?
review: I’m not sure which generation mine is but I downloaded Peacock to my iPhone and iPad but I can’t find it anywhere on my Apple TV. I want to be able to stream it through Apple TV so I can watch on my big tv and not just smaller devices. Anyone have a similar issue?

title: Really?
review:
There’s no time out feature to ask if you’re still watching. So 20 episodes later I realize I left it running. 
Why doesn’t the player fill the whole screen? 
Who designed this? Why did they do that? Should I go download RealPlayer to make this work?
NBC, you’re a wealthy company, act like it. This app is trash. Hire someone better.

title: Doubt I’ll Make It!
review: This service is Ok. But, I fought I’ll make past the free 7 day trail. The selection is lacking and very hard to navigate. Whoever designed the layout/visual, did a very poor job. The channels and ability to scroll is behind other buttons. It’s just wonky! And doesn’t fit today’s standards of design!

title: It needs more movies
review: I just got the app I haven’t watched anything yet but I go to the search button and just search up some of my favorite movies and none of them are there so please add more movies like superhero movies in car and more comedy movies like Friday

title: Unreliable video player and live streams, bad controls
review:
Does not use the Apple TV’s native video player so you cannot use the side buttons to fast forward and rewind. Live streams have frozen video while audio continues in the background. The Apple TV screensaver kicks in IN THE MIDDLE OF VIEWING and I have not had that problem with any other apps.

Also, EPL match streams are in 30fps when industry standard is 60fps. This should not be difficult.

title: There was a problem signing up, please try again later!
review: I have tried several times over the last two days to sign up or sign in through my Xfinity account and tried a new account set up with the same error. “There was a problem signing up, please try again later!“ I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app on multiple iOS devices. Very disappointing!

title: Kloe
review: Hi I love this app I can finally watch all the Harry Potter shows and draco malfoy 🤤🥰 but anyways it’s all free and you all should try it it has all the shows that got taken off of tv and Netflix I highly recommend this app

title: Trump’s Network
review: I didn’t like the platform which crashed continuously in the beginning. Didn’t like the lack of choices as the streaming options were on continuous play and viewers were not able to pick a show and watch from beginning.  But now that they are all pro trump.  I will just delete. With so many choices I don’t need garbage and this application is part of a garbage dump.

title: Lacking basic streaming features
review:
Errors quite often but the biggest is chromecast has no auto continue so each episode you must go back in. How is this not a day one feature?? Would rather pay for no ads rather than premium instead

Continued playback issues, connection issues with chromecast, still no auto play/continue

title: To many titles on premium
review: Can you please let us watch SOME THINGS without having to pay? You can easily make lots of money on ads. Pleeeease dude. I was waiting for this for a long time only to find out that I can only watch select shows and even those have ads. It would be so much easier if it just ran on adds dude.

title: Using only because I am forced to
review: Premier league matches stream several seconds behind. And in 2020 these guys have decided that the way to move forward is by making things more expensive. This is the reason sounds like me have to go and search for illegal streams on the Internet. This is a bad user experience and product decision and I hope that someone elseGets the rights to Premier league very soon.

title: Content choices ok, streaming awful
review: Peacock is offering some good content, but streaming is unreliable. I am unable to get through even one episode without the app providing a buffering error at least 3 or 4 times. Still has a long way to go before it can even think about being a competitor amongst other streaming services.

title: Awful interface, impossible to find anything specific.
review: Literally the worst interface and navigation of any app ever. I want to watch the CURRENT English Premiere League and see the schedule but it doesn’t even appear when I do a search. Can’t look up specific teams either. It’s a shame that I can’t watch the EPL because an awful company has near exclusive rights and an impossible to use app.

title: Premium is just ok
review: I have the mid tier and there is totally no point of getting it. You get 2/3 of the content from the free service and it has the same amount of ad length. I know the original will get better as time goes on, but right now. It is definitely not worth it.

title: Background Play
review: This app would be outstanding if it could play in the background. The xfinity app does this and it’s a great feature. I can still listen to movies or tv and have some background noise while working on other apps on my phone. Please add this feature.

title: Decent content, Terrible App
review: This app still needs a tremendous amount of work. The fast forward and rewind functions don’t work on Apple TV. In order to get to the series page of something, you have to go hunt down or search for it even if you’re watching that exact show at the moment. Functionality is very poor.

title: One of the worst streaming apps
review: Bugs everywhere. I know its free but the state of this app is sad. When you resume watching a show, 60% of the time it won’t load. If it does load, there is absolutely no chance it actually resumes where you left off even if you choose to continue. Browsing the app is finicky as well.

title: UI Needs Work
review:
-When casting from my phone to the TV, every time it comes back from commercial, the audio isn’t matched with the speakers’ mouths, so you have to stop casting and restarting to fix it. 

-if you need to rewind/fast forward or turn on closed captioning, the screen automatically flips to the horizontal/landscape view which makes the user experience very awkward  and more difficult.

title: ITS GREAT
review: For something that’s free it’s the best. I love it already has all the classics that no other app has. And the format is great. I hope it stays free bc it’s worth it. Could always be better but nothing I’m complaint about right now.

title: SNL on Peacock is terrible
userName: This is not the real Dave Matthews
review: First you remove the stand alone SNL app where I can create playlists of my favorite sketches promising this new peacock app will be the new home of SNL. You launch with only a few seasons and now you technically have all seasons but they are cut down/edited episodes. And no option to create playlists of your fav sketches. Your SNL app wasn’t a 5 star app but it was very close. This app doesn’t do your best and deepest asset justice.

title: Who creates an app that can’t be airplayed or casted??
review: I waited all month to finally watch the Harry Potter series only to find out that Peacock doesn’t allow airplay or mirroring from my iPad or laptop to my apple tv! I have a first gen, so I can’t download that app onto the Apple TV. This is absolutely nuts. The interface isn’t terrible, the quality is ok. But??? I want to watch things on my TV not my IPad. Hopefully they recode that feature asap.

title: No AirPlay with Subscription
review: I downloaded this so that I could watch the Premiere League, only to find out you have to pay to watch live sports. But that’s not even the worst part. Not only did I have to pay, but I cannot watch the app on my TV because they don’t allow AirPlay, and have no apps for TVs or Firestick. Definitely canceling my subscription.

title: What happened to my favorite show?
review: I got this app for one show and one show only. That is my all-time favorite show American greed. Why oh why did you guys remove American greed from the app. I would watch the show over and over again. I am seriously considering deleting my app now. I don’t want to do that. Please bring the show back to Peacock.

title: Content Doesn’t Get Updated
review: Only use (or try to us) Peacock for The Dan Patrick Show. The shows aren’t available until the evening or the day after the show airs. It’s a daily show. So that’s not helpful. Also the show page doesn’t even have all of the past episodes. There are only episodes from 2 days. Please update the Dan Patrick Show so we can watch on demand right after the show airs.

title: Awful UX. Does not have the user in mind.
review: Awful app. Who designed this?! You would think with a massive organization like NBC they would be able to afford a decent UX designer. Good luck trying to find what you are looking for. Instead, content that the user has zero interest in is shoved int eh fave of the user. Previews play by themselves, no quick way to get to the content you need/want. Totally absurd. It’s a big fat pig with lipstick on.

title: Not ready for Prime Time
review: Clunky, fast forward is a nightmare no preview while you rewind or forward-it’s a guessing game in where to stop then forced to watch commercials once you get the area of the program you left off-even if you’ve watched the same commercials over and over while rewinding and fast forwarding

title: If it ever lets me sign in, I’ll let ya know!
review:
Don’t bother Apple TV users, no Peacock for you! After three reset passwords, this app only serves up login error messages - quite possibly the worst reality show ever! 

To be fair, I can access the app on a tablet or phone but honestly have never been a fan of holding a screen to watch a movie or binge shows. Maybe one day Peacock will let you watch on a flat screen, we'll see!

title: Bait and switch, crap app
review:
I thought HBO MAX was the worst and most overpriced new streaming app by these major media conglomerates like AT&T, CBS, Comcast, and Disney....

I was wrong. Peace is even worse. They're basically just rebranding the already free NBC app.

But Comcast has been blasting commercials about how Peacock is free--which it is for a limited amount of programming, which was already free through other Comcast apps. Then they have a paid subscription option for all the other content.

Which is fine... If Comcast wasn't running around advertising their app as COMPLETELY FREE!

It's official, these big companies are ruining streaming, and the wait of their subscription fees will implode of their own greedy weight.

title: Why
review: My problem is I expected the show to come out the day it was released and it’s not out can you at leased put it out in the next three days I’m talking about Madagascar a little wild

title: Let Down
review: This app has been a let down and disappointment since I downloaded it. The problem started with signing up. Place email and password in and receive a message of error. Never got a chance to see a movie, tv show or any kind of entertainment. Will never recommend to anyone. Deleting App and strongly thinking about changing my Comcast/Xfinity account.

title: Can’t access from mobile (iPad) app
review: I have Peacock Premium as a part of my Xfinity package and while it works perfectly fine when I’m at home in front of my tv, I cannot access my account on the mobile app. I’ve tried a dozen times and it does not work. Safe to say if I didn’t already receive this service for free through my cable provider, I wouldn’t sign up for it at all.

title: Just another money grubbing network...
review: Like the cbs app...just trying to pick your wallet...and on episodes that are three years old? Oh hell no. Sorry. Not one more penny from me...these network apps are a suckers game. Plenty of fantastic shows on Netflix and amazon...nbc doesn’t want to deal with them because they want to fleece us...then their shows can die on the vine. Next step...delete app off my iPad. Good riddance.

title: Great
review: I had no problems there was only like two commercials with great episodes. Also they have all of my show their with all of the seasons.

title: Not ready for prime time
review:
This app feels like a rush job. It was released before a smart tv app was available which isn’t ideal. It crashes a lot. The auto play for next episode only works for me if I open the app right when it’s trying to transition. It doesn’t keep track of where I left off on the main menu when I open the app. 

On the positive side the commercial breaks are short. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

title: Terrible Playback
review:
The video player will lose track of where you are regularly. Especially bad if you leave the app briefly or fast forward/rewind. Forces you to rewatch commercials to get back to where you were. 

Home screen is terrible. No way to continue your shows even though you’re logged in. You have to search for the show. Every time the app is relaunched.

title: Outrageous
review: I’m a big fan of the premier league the fact that I now have to pay for another subscription to watch my teams games is outrageous I don’t know who thought that was a good idea. Also the app runs slow has trouble loading and reverts me back to that last stop point and I can’t get it to play on my smart tv like every other streaming service can.

title: Ads ?
review: I paid for no ads with the premium package ,but I’m still getting ads during certain movies ,can I ask why ? Otherwise I love the app ,one of the reasons I bought is because it said “ no ads “

title: Not working! Great!
review: I was exciting about the content. However, with new update it doesn’t seem to work with older IPads on IOS12. It just dies every time I open it. That’s too bad. I guess I can’t sign up.

title: Airplay sound doesn’t work for Apple TV
review: I got this app and the premium to watch the sports... and found out it doesn’t work with Airplay (maybe I am doing something wrong??) so it is shame that the app won’t do the basic stuff ... fix it so we can have a good experience... also, the UX, isn’t great , it is all mixed up, you have a lot of things to fix if you really want people to stick to it.

title: Extortion
review:
NBC is trying desperately to prop up their poor attempt at a streaming service and app. 

Not only are they forcing soccer fans to subscribe and pay extra just to watch SOME of their team’s games, but they are offering a horrible platform to watch the games on. The app is awful. The fact that they’re pulling money the way that they are is awful. Everything about this is awful.

title: The Best
review: One of the best apps I ever use. I am greatly satisfied with this service. Watching the Premiere League is now made easy. I only wish if they can add tennis tournaments to it. Please keep the subscription fees the same.

title: Please add full screen!!!
review: For the live of god, add full screen to the app, it’s hard to watch in a small box with borders add the option to let people stretch to fill screen every single streaming app lets u view in full screen!  It should be one of the main features of the app when viewing its very distracting to have the border, con on devs!

title: Terrible on laptop
review: Works fine on my smart tv but when I watch something on my laptop and leave off in the middle of the show, it always starts from the beginning even when clicking resume episode. Gave up after 4 episodes and went back to Netflix.

title: Eat up all your data and not totally free!
review: I ask my husband to download this apps. He even pay for an upgrade and in 7 days, he used 70G. We never use half of that for the whole month in Netflix. My husband is on the road all the time and he watches netflix. So we decided to delete the apps and mine, too. Not free at all, only few episodes are free. If you want to watch all, have to pay.

title: NO FULLSCREEN MODE! TERRIBLE SIZE!
review: I like having the option to change the aspect ratio or whatever they call it. On this app you can’t take advantage of the screen size because IT DOESN’T CHANGE! I’ve been watching “Yellowstone”, which I’m surprised I enjoy. Unfortunately, the viewing size on my iPhone XS Max is do small! It’s a small 3G iPhone size screen! You can’t expand it to fill the whole screen! I ABSOLUTELY HATE VIDEO APPS THAT CAN’T CHANGE TO FULL SCREEN MODE! THIS IS A TERRIBLE APP!

title: Can’t Chromecast?
review: I like the offerings, but am frustrated because it offers a Chromecast link but won’t connect to mine. I don’t have issues with any other streaming service connecting to my Chromecast - just this one. I would watch a lot more stuff if the thing would work on my TV.

title: Freezes
review:
Freezes when ads should start. Sometimes you can watch something, most times you have to exit and restart the video.

Update: app still terrible, closed captions works when it feels like it no matter if you've turned it on from the beginning. Never works for the whole duration of a video, pops up then stopped randomly.

title: Awesome
review: This app is outstanding!! For it being free I gave this a 5 star because I appreciate them for making it free unlike other streaming apps such as Netflix this app is rlly good and it works for TVs two but u will have to on Xbox

title: Still buggy
review:
I will try again later, but for now I am tired of fussy with it. I tried to watch an old Cheers episode 4 times.  Each time it would play for about 10 minutes then stop.  I couldn’t resume so had to start over.

I will wait for the next update before trying again.

title: What is NBC thinking
review: Poor stream quality, streams are consistently about 2 minutes behind, the frame rate is awful, not easily accessible on many devices. 90% of illegal EPL streams have all around better quality which is absurd for a paid subscription. There’s really nothing good to say about this app. It’s a shameless money grab from NBC, the coverage was infinitely better when it was on cable.

title: Chelsea
review: I  like. The app but can you fix the email I have doing twice can doing only once. Please or putting on google or Facebook  or spectrum thank you

title: Mirror play
review: The app is easy enough to use, but there is no peacock app on my smart tv. I figured I can mirror play it up there to watch the premiere league. Well mirror play won’t work with video I only hear the sound. I tried other video apps and they worked fine. I understand its a new service but I don’t want to watch my sports on my phone so Im giving you a bad review unless its fixed soon.

title: Joke
review: "Best of streaming" is a bold claim. Considering most other streaming apps have better quality, allow you to perform basic tasks like rewind/fast forward on live events, and manage content by following leagues/teams/shows, that claim is flat or false. This isn't top 10 let alone "best". You can't just say things and have them be true... This is a joke, either deliberate or unintentional. Kick rocks

title: Waste of time
review: After loading the app on my phone, I’ve tried unsuccessfully several times on multiple days to enter my email and create a password only to get the same error message every time “sorry unable to connect at this time, try again later “. It’s frustrating and not worth my time and trouble. It’s a free app, I guess you get what you pay for!

title: Good but needs a lot of work
review: So I was promised an app with all of the best movies and tv shows of all time, unfortunately this is app turned out to be worst then Netflix, it had barely any good tv shows or movies. This streaming device has a lot of potential but it needs work fix the app then maybe I will start using it again.

title: Won’t play video thru tv
review: The app won’t play streaming video thru my tv when my iPad is connected via HDMI cable. Plays sound only, no picture. Fix this bug and I’ll bump ya up to 4 stars. Nice to be able to binge Downton Abbey episodes (even on a small tablet screen) without paying the pbs extortion fees on their app :o)

title: Good content, doesn’t work well on iPad (gen. 5)
review:
The content and quality is excellent.

HOWEVER, when streaming via my 5th Generation iPad via HDMI adapter, the video does not go to the TV, either in full screen or normal mode. This is the only streaming app that has this issue.

It works fine on my Mac Book pro via HDMI out though the Thunderbolt port.

title: Content good/Interface Bad
review:
As my short description suggests, I love all the diverse content on here. However the worst part about this is its availability across platforms. Not on Firestick, Samsung tv, or web browser on mobile.

Also you can’t use your phone > hdmi > tv. Not sure why because the ads play. This does however work from PC to TV. A bit inconsistent.

Hopefully this gets improved and becomes available on more platforms as well because it could be great.

I will be watching Psych Deux🍍 and then probably not logging on for some time.

title: One flaw
review: You can’t be the best streaming service if you don’t allow separate viewing accounts.  That is not available here (unless I’m missing something).  If I am wrong about the accounts, I will amend my rating.

title: Amazing app
review: I have been waiting weeks to download and finally get to use the app it’s awesome it has everything you could ever need in a tv app on your phone

title: You make it so hard to watch anything
review: You pull all your stuff from other streaming services to be exclusive to this one... ok cool fine whatever. But I can’t watch on my TV and I can’t play in the background? What am I supposed to do- stare at the phone screen all day? I really wanted to like this streaming service, but unfortunately you’ve got a LONG way to go to make it worthwhile.

title: Signing up.......a Serious Problem
review:
I’ve tried 5 times to sign up for the app.  I would use it a lot on my iPad, but after completing the process and checking all the boxes, a drop box appears with a message saying there was a problem, please try again later.  How many “laters” does the app need.?
Great idea, bad implementation!!

title: Garbage
review: Just like the other reviewer; I waited for the Premier League to return, only for the app to fail from the first go. Why do I have to pay for games, if the app won’t play? I used multiple devices plugged into multiple tv’s, and I only get a black screen. Does NBC expect us to watch sports and movies only in our phones? Sports Gold worked just fine, now we are paying more for garbage.

title: Great TV choices
review: First thing the picture is great and I do not have buffering like some other Services. I love this service .It will get better with programming it takes time.

title: I like this app 😎
review: I’ve really liked this app, ever since I’ve gotten this app 3 days ago 😊. I really appreciate that almost everything is free on there, and that the shows are very good as well 🤩.

title: Possibly the worst performing streaming app available
review:
If you are planning on using this app on your smart tv. Don’t bother. Can’t even get on demand shoes to load on great internet speed.  Literally spins for minutes then fails. 

If you only intend to watch on your iPhone it will probably work. 

But for someone who is willing to pay for the content, so far there’s no value.

title: Poor all around
review: The sorting of shows is a bit ridiculous because there’s thousands of them and it’s not a great experience. Same with channels. But, then once you do find something to watch, the stream quality is crap and you can’t chromecast or use apple’s device connection. I have to use my laptop to connect to my tv and stream the website

title: Needs work
review: It would be cool if we could go half/split screen when using an iPhone or iPad. I can’t multitask at all when watching and that’s irritating. Also I’d like to see more teen shows or sitcoms like Friends as it’s basically all news and talk shows on here. Movie selection is not good at all. Please fix bc Netflix is beating you

title: The channels are amazing
review: I no longer have to think about what to watch. Peacock is not just one library of tv shows and movies. It is different. The channels are super entertaining.

title: Can’t use this with my Apple TV
review: There is no option to broadcast from my phone to my Apple TV. This is a must-have feature for me. I personally find the app difficult to navigate to find what I want to watch. I am personally tired of having every streaming service app or service having widely different user interfaces.

title: Buggy as hell...
review: I’ve been watching Project Blue Book and about halfway through an episode the sound and video don’t sync up. Every time. Video quality also takes a while to improve. My internet connection is fine. None of this happens on Netflix, Hulu...NBC, you desperately need some bug fixes or I’ll never upgrade.

title: No 4K, premium still has ads
review: How does a mega multi billion dollar media company launch a flagship streaming product but some how not stream 4K HDR and Dolby Atmos is beyond me. You spend billions and still miss the mark. Oh well. Also why spend $9.99 and “still may see some ads”. Who are the stodgy old media execs running this product. Could have been great if it was more like Disney+, 4K, no ads, and lower price point.

title: Cast button doesn’t work.
review: Getting a blank screen on Chromecast when I cast from Peacock. Cast icon in Peacock shows as though it is trying to connect, but it never does work. I see list of cast devices fine since I have few Chromecast. Netflix cast works from the same device.

title: Stupid
review: Why try to enter a saturated market if you’re not even going to try and compete with others? Limited availability and no hdmi support. How is a family supposed to enjoy the service if everyone has to cram around a tiny screen? Whoever decided to launch such an incomplete service needs to be fired and not allowed to create things like this again. Completely unacceptable.

title: Only available in the US
review:
This app seems like it would be really awesome in terms of what’s available to watch, but it’s only available in the US...
I’m stationed overseas with the US Army, and due to this fact, I can’t access the website, or watch anything on the app.
I was really looking forward to watching Psych 2 because of my enjoyment of the series, but it got squashed by this.
Fix this NBC, don’t be punks.

title: Live sports at 30fps is unacceptable for a paid service
review: I honestly don’t know how a company like NBC is incapable of offering live sports at 60fps. The premier league games are borderline unwatchable. Other subscription services, such as ESPN+ offer live sports at 60fps with impeccable streaming quality for the same price or less. I’ll be cancelling my subscription until NBC can actually offer something worth paying for.

title: A Must Have!
review: Peacock TV has so many incredible shows, movies and live events that you can watch right at your fingertips! The app is smooth and looks beautiful.

title: “There was a problem signing up...”
review: I downloaded the app on both my iPad and iPhone. Tried to sign in with my regular email and a password at least 15 times on both devises. And I get the error message “There was a problem signing up. Please try again later.” No explanation of what the problem is; no suggested way to fix it. This is ridiculous.

title: Doesn’t work on my iPhone
review: I can’t log in using my password that I use to log in on my tv. When I try to sign in with another email, I get a message that reads “cannot fetch information”’ or “cannot sign in at this time, please try again later”. This app is terribly frustrating and apparently useless on my phone. Somebody do something about this bug.

title: Worst Streaming Service App
review: I cannot believe in the year of 2020 that this app refuses to let me airplay to my tv. No Roku app, no air play nothing. So I get to sit here on my phone and watch while looking at my black tv screen. Absolutely awful. Can’t even begin to imagine what big wig thought this was a decent excuse for an app while charging 5 dollars a month for absolutely awful placement of adds. Embarrassing.

title: Needs to display in roku devices
review: This is a good app but I wish it can be displayed on a Roku device and I wish some movies didn’t have to be payed for.  but it has some really good old movies that most apps do not have so point for that.

title: Still glitchy
review: The video and audio doesn’t match up when you are using chromecast. There is an obvious delay. I also don’t like that when you resume playing a show, it rewinds like 10 minutes back. In general, it’s difficult to navigate the app. Overall needs to work out the kinks.

title: Meh
review: The content is getting better as opposed to launch day but the controls on the Apple TV app are ridiculous and the app isn’t as streamlined as you’d expect for an app on 2020. If they’d utilize the native Apple TV controls like most of major streaming apps do they’d move up the list of the top five.

title: The Capture!
review: Loving the original programming, and the reruns. For the love of jeebus would you please make some way to skip the ridiculously long and labored title sequences?  The scan forward/backward interface is very touchy and not user friendly.

title: Commercials in a paid service!
review: What a joke, even with the premium package there are still commercials. It also crashes frequently and fails to load. Stick with any other of the ten paid streaming services you already have, this one is garbage.

title: So far so good
review: Content is good and streaming has been jitter free. The search function lacks the ability to search by actor/actress or director. Plus if it comes up not finding a answer there’s no way to return to main dashboard.

title: For some users
review: The app only lets you use iPhones and iPads so if you are watching shows Alone it’s great and if you have an iPad you can watch movies with kids.

title: No iPad PiP... Completely Unacceptable
review:
This app will never merit anything more that one star until iPad Picture-in-Picture is supported. This is one of the worst app-launch decisions I’ve ever seen. 

In 2020, iPads are much, much more than dedicated media consumption devices. Without the ability to multitask, Peacock will never get used on my iPad. It’s that simple. You won’t get any subscription fees or ad views from me on this one, NBCUniversal.

title: Content
review: I get that this is a free streaming service and I really shouldn’t complain but from what I can tell so far there are a lot of older movies and a lot of bad movies in my opinion. I would love to see bigger titles with 5 star reviews like Doctor sleep and more modern movies especially horror even if it was from the 80’s to 2020.

title: Just a suggestion
review: Downloading a movie/tv show... you can put that in your suggestion box... but anyways the app is good... got my favorite tv on there (two and a half men) so yea!

title: This app is horrible for watching Premiere league
review:
This App is a dumpster fire for watching premiere league compared to Fubo.

No clear way to schedule recordings. No clear way to record. No clear way to fast forward or rewind. No clear way to pause. Sometime it lets you; sometimes it doesn’t.
If you switch to a different app and go back to Peacock it doesn’t remember where you have left off. It also seems to be blocking attempts to beam to my television so my kids and I watch games huddled around a phone screen.  

It would be a great app if it was 2007 and an undergraduate computer science project.  Fubo TV is light years beyond this joke of an app

title: Not able to sign up
review:
Been trying to sign up for the app since it came out. Keep getting an error message after entering an email and password,

“ There was a problem signing up. Please try again later.”

This has been happening since the app came out. Tried deleting it and reinstalling but having the same issue.

title: NBC app is terrible
review:
Can’t sign in, no customer service available. I only want to watch the premier league, why fix something that’s not broken. NBC online service has always been awful.

Update: 
NBC sent a link saying they would like to investigate my issues, the link took me to the same dead end customer service portal I originally complained about. Terrible.

title: 5$ pay wall for EPL
review:
They put EPL games that were free last year with cable subscription behind a $5 pay wall for their app.  I know it’s not a lot but it’s ridiculous, I already had the cable subscription and if I want to watch extra epl games I have to pay. 

Why not just make a packet/ subscription with all EPL access people, including me, would pay to have all EPL games in one app.

title: Needs improvement
review: Layout could be improved by making it easier to see your watch list. Also, the fast-forward function could be better on AppleTV

title: Cannot login or signup
review: I was unable to sign up using the app, but I finally managed to sign up using my desktop browser and signing up on the website then using those credentials to sign on the app. Round about way but it worked.

title: Ads work fine, but not actual shows...
review: There’s no app to watch this on my Apple TV or my Samsung Smart TV. So I tried to screen share from my phone to my Apple TV. The ads played perfectly fine, but then the show stopped playing on my TV as soon as the ads were over. It was playing fine on my phone. Why is it called Peacock TV if you can’t play it on a TV??!?! Uninstalled.

title: Has room for improvements
review: The app is ok, but needs improvements to make it better. There are no controls to fast forward or rewind. This a basic function and it’s not even there. When watching on the TV, can’t even see how long till the shows ends. Can’t even back it up 15 seconds if you need too. This functions needs to be added ASAP.

title: Where's the back and forward 10 sec options?
review:
I truly don't understand why this app doesn't have a 10 or 15 sec fwd / bck option on Apple TV.

It almost a "must have" now days.

title: This app is a complete scam
review: Constant interruptions in the feed. Always blurry, another way nbc is trying to scam more money out of true sports fans. Can’t watch the game you love anymore without paying for these outrageous subscriptions. Shame on you nbc. if you want to justify paying for this joke, at least make sure you’re providing quality content and a good stream..

title: Any worse way to watch sports?
review:
I can’t believe I am saying this but I believe NBC wants peacock to fail. Looking for a soccer match? Try Browsing...nope. Try searching “Premier” for Premier League no results. Type the club name...hey you get an upcoming game. What about that replay you were promised after 9pm. Who knows?

Apparently, organizing the content on your app is very hard. Forget the fact that you can’t watch on Roku.

title: Picture doesn’t show when using AirPlay
review:
I tried to watch shows on my TV using AirPlay but picture won’t show. Only sound is fine. 
When there’s a commercial both sound and picture are shown on the TV. Ridiculous. 
Another scam to buy a device to stream their service.

title: Joke
review: This is the worst app I’ve ever had been forced to use. Well the NBC gold app was decent and allowed me to actually watch a game on my television. I now have to stream English Premier matches to my tiny smart phone. I’ve never been more frustrated. Why release something, make customers pay for it and not build in a feature that you could at least stream to a smart TV? NBC is a F****  joke

title: No Mirroring is a Joke
review: I downloaded and installed the Peacock app for the sole purpose of giving it 1 star and writing this review. The singular reason being the app does not allow for mirroring from your iPhone or iPad to a TV. This is an absurdity beyond comprehension. I’m sure NBC has a legit piracy or revenue loss reason for doing this, but they need to get over it and figure this out, turn it on and let us all socially isolate

title: Not able to stream to any device!!!
review: I have the app on my phone but I can’t stream with cable or with wireless mirroring to my TV. What’s the point to pay you money if I can’t use it? How is it possible to spend that much money for such a horrible service? Did somebody tell you that it’s normal to have issues in the beginning? They’ve lied to you. Unbelievable!!!

title: Fastfoward integration
review: Why do you not let people fastforward using the Apple TV remote? Why can you not fastforward on the iPhone/iPad? Seriously I’m paying for no commercials but I wanted to skip past the title sequence. However, I have to swipe up hope that I slide far enough ahead in the show to not miss anything. Just let me use the remote to skip ahead 10 seconds at a time.

title: Leaves a lot to be desired
review: We have the basic plan, so I’d don’t know if that makes a difference in the app itself or just in programming. That being said, the search feature is terrible, it suggests things that are irrelevant. There is no option for multiple profiles and no auto play.  The app itself is not very user friendly.

title: Ok but buggy
review: Decent content but the Apple TV app doesn’t support subtitles when watching movies. Could find no option to turn them on. Found an option for a live news broadcast in the app, but even when turned on, no subtitles.

title: Not great
review: I only downloaded this app to watch Psych 2 - which I did. However, it had two minutes of add at the beginning of the movie. That’s insane! I’ll probably just go back to any other streaming app now, no reason for that amount of ads.

title: Terrible User Interface
review: You can’t save the shows you watch anywhere and have to type them into to the search bar hoping they come up every time you open the app.  It’s a clutter of random content thrown at you on the home screen and nothing more.

title: ios app has annoying white bar on bottom during playback
review: Got it for psych 2. ios app has annoying white bar on bottom during playback

title: Disappointed
review: Giving two stars because of the exclusive Psych movie and extra AP Bio season but I use my phone to play context on my tv. Like many other users, Peacock does not allow for this. I’m not going to have my family sit around my phone to watch a movie. Might as well delete the app I guess.

title: Stole my payment
review:
I bought the premium subscription, which charged to my card, and it only gives me access to the free content. The trial period worked fine but when I actually paid is when it stopped working.

Update: It eventually allowed me to see premium content again but it double charged me. This app is a mess.

title: Hmmmm
review: I just signed up for Peacock Premium and noticed that live soccer match is not shown on Peacock. I have to watch it on yet another app “NBC”. I would have expected if I am paying for a service I can watch combined channels in one app as it is done on ESPN where ESPN+ is a link on the homepage, all in one spot.

title: You Lied
review: Peacock is supposed to be free I wanted to watch cleopatra in space but it’s premium I don’t know why you guys keep doing premium but it’s wrong whoever created premium needs to be really fired because Peacock is not free as a bird or the best streaming service the worst So You’re going to make an update to say that there will be no premium anymore so do it right now or else. 😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡😡

title: Never really use, because...
review: There’s some attractive content here, but I always stop watching after a few seconds because I keep forgetting there’s no picture in picture. Can’t multitask with? Then it’s of little practical use to me.

title: Awesome, if it worked consistently
review: Freezes a LOT with most recent version. Fixed if I minimize and then go back to full screen, but who wants to do that every 4 or 5 min??? I have so far enjoyed the content but can’t rake much more of it’s janky functionality.

title: Great, but need some improvements.
review: It's glitches up every now and then, but other than that it's a good app to use. It is on the rise of being a very good app.

title: Not as advertised
review: If you sign up for a trail of a particular plan, your trial will be for a better plan than you’ll be getting when they start charging you. During my trial for “premium”, I would have one ad during an hour long episode of a show. When my trial ended and they started charging me, that went to 5 ads each episode. Pretty sneaky, Peacock. Bad bird!

title: Great coverage of English Premier League
review: Love the extra games streaming live on peacock. Maybe add some Premier League games from past as well. It would be great if you could show Indian Cricket Premier League as well

title: Great Start
review:
Great selection.

But lags a bit and definitely needs Picture in Picture for iPad; otherwise great start.

Please continue to update!

title: Does not remember where you left off
review: Good content but if you leave to take a call it will not remember where you were and will go back sometimes even to the beginning and then you have to watch commercials just to get back to where you were

title: Garbage
review: This needs work. It’s as if they released the app as soon as could stream. Nobody thought through the functionality. Makes you get the app for certain games because they know fans will pay for this crap so they don’t miss out. They don’t offer play from beginning or ability to record. It’s extremely agitating.

title: Fix the scrubbing
review:
Every other video app makes it easy to rewind and fast forward on AppleTV and lets you click to go forward or backwards a few seconds. Not this one! Horrible. Peacock devs: try literally any other major streaming app and copy their functionality.
To be clear, I’m not referring to livestreams like some other reviewers but catalogue episodes.

title: Constant Errors
review: Cannot watch one program with the screen pausing, the quality of the video is constantly changing. Great library but you cannot watch it without cursing through the program. Also big soccer fan and now instead of using there NBC Sports channel, they are using the app half of the time which I explained above is useless.

title: Absolutely garbage
review: The constant cash grabs from NBC for money is ridiculous for sports. First I was able to watch premier league games with my cable subscription. Then they started charging $60 a year for nbc sports gold to watch all the games. Now they want an additional 5 a month to watch the games they have moved to peacock. This is more like poppycock. I guess I’m just done with it.

title: App is terrible.
review: This app is terrible. I find most NBC related apps to be poor in quality. Craps our ever time the channel takes a commercial break and you have to restart it. Does not work with the HDMI dock connect for iPhone. And streaming quality, despite good cell service or WiFi, is terrible. NBC is terrible with their platforms compared to the other major networks.

title: Watchlist
review: Love the content but on the app, where is my watchlist! Easy to add shows/movies but can't find it. Should be at the bottom with the browse, trending, channels. No problem finding the watchlist when you go directly to peacock website. Fix the app please

title: Too limited
review: I would like to love this... the problem is it isn’t supported on my Roku, Firestick or TV.  I would love to bring it up on my tv and watch shows I have enjoyed. That way my iPad is freed up... give me access in more ways and I’d pay for the ad free version.

title: Ummm, y’all need to figure
review: your editing out. In the middle of watching any of the “originals” and the “commercial” cuts will happen in the middle of someone speaking. What?! Or weird fade outs like a commercial is about to come on, but won’t. And what’s the point of paying for the app if you’re not going to have all the episodes of any particular show. Doesn’t make sense.

title: Disappointed with tv series content
review: I thought that because this is NBC owned, all seasons of popular shows such as the Chicago shows would be available, but it seems like only the most recent seasons are available and those can be found on other streaming sites.

title: Wasted potential
review: This app has decent content and a decent video player but the UI and UX is among the worst. It is nearly impossible to find a specific genre of show, and the scrolling is laggy. You would imagine a company this large would be able to create a semi functional app.

title: Mobile app is awful
review: Tried for 10 minutes to watch a live game since all premier league games can only be watched on peacock today. All it would play was endless previews for its own tv shows and never got to the game. Tried closing and opening the app multiple times and it would never play the only thing I wanted to watch. Thanks for nothing NBC.

title: Paid for Premium but can’t access episodes
review: I paid for the Premium at $9.99 but the application will not allow me to play the episodes. It kept asking to upgrade to Premium on all my devices. I tried to delete the Peacock app, re-install, still have the same issue.

title: Pretty worthless
review: No real shows worth subscribing for.   Putting Premier League on their Premium Tier puts a really bad taste in my mouth. They should put it on the free tier for now then reassess in a year or two when they get shows to justify the Premium service. CBS has Star Trek which I assume gets most of their subscribers. NBC just doesn’t have enough and are a bit late to the game.

title: Good content, can’t get it onto my TV
review: It’s got a lot of content, some of which you do need a paid account for. Brave New World is worth it alone. However I have to watch everything on my iPhone, cannot get it to work on Apple TV or screen mirror to Apple TV from phone.

title: You’ve ruined watching sports with this app
review: This is the first app review I’ve written I’m so frustrated w/ this app the the motivation behind it and pulling some matches here, others on NBCSN. Icannot pause play. I cannot fast forward or rewind to watch a play again. I can’t record games or skip commercials. It’s a disaster for enjoying soccer, almost as if it that was the intent. I’m furious.

title: Destroying Premier League in the USA
review: The app itself is poor- glitchy, late with a Roku version, no fireTV version, no airplay or phone mirroring allowed. The approach NBC is taking by putting previously available games behind a double pay wall is reprehensible. I pay for nbc sports than I have to pay again for peacock? You are making the game inaccesible for the average man. Your greed is disgusting.

title: Free US Open peacock streaming
review: I have watched 57 commercials about Peacock free streaming sign up now. I have signed up 15 different times and still cannot watch U.S. Open free golf streaming from  Peacock.... Boooo App Boooo.... i’m going to do my best to delete this Booo promotion of streaming to watch the US Open....something tells me I’m going to get a bill soon for something I never watched...Thanks NBC keep up the good work

title: Chromecast does not work
review: The content looks nice even though the ads are super long. Chromecast doesn’t work and just shows a blank screen. It’s also not available on Samsung TV. Please update ASAP so I don’t have to watch everything on my phone.

title: User interface
review: Best user interface. It just maybe add mire tabs. Best dark them with yellow in edge . Amazing. Free version will  dominate all streaming app. It’s revolutionary in streaming app with this free version and features.

title: Audio sync issues
review:
When the free app moves to commercials it has issues syncing. Also kept skipping the same minute and a half of a movie. I had to get past the jump point to be able to see a critical moment. 

Decent content, looking forward to more

title: New fave streaming service
review: It’s finally here! I’ve been counting down the days til Peacock was available. I’ve already started Brave New World, and the Ryan Lochte documentary is next on my list.
I dont know about yall but it works perfectly fine for me 🤩 I have a iPhone 11 and good WiFi and I could watch what I want with good quality 😄

title: Idk what to say
review: Everyone is saying how bad the quality is but it seems fine to me I was watching Harry Potter 3 and the quality is fine.

title: Get a samsung app
review: The fact that i paid for a year of service and cant project this to my Samsung smart tv is an issue. There is neither an app and the apple tv app doesn't work with this content. This needs a samsung app stat. I have every desire to support the content creators of the series in Peacock and yet the app and paid subscription has turned out to be an utter waste of money

title: Poor service and constant commercials.
review: Paying $9.99 a month for premium subscription does not give you anything better. Have the time screen is blank and live streams don’t launch with content. To top it all off, there are constant commercials instead of programming. Why charge a premium for a service that does not deliver the goods.

title: Airplay
review:
It’s 2020, why can’t this app stream to an Apple TV? Even my airplay won’t work with it....sick of companies enticing us with shows that we can only watch via their own private garbage apps. 
And now when I try to fast forward it gives me an add and puts me back to the beginning...
Fix it and earn some stars! You’re NBC....you can’t make an app that’s 5 star worthy?!

title: Idk yett it might be good it might not ill up date you guys inna week
review: I just downloaded this app i am sooo happy that it is working imma be using it alotttt! If anything goes wrong then imma delete that app 😠 and restall it 😛

title: Love the idea, but the app itself gets one star
review: Love the content- the selection of movies and shows and what not. Functionality of searching and browsing is nice. But I’m giving one star for the app because it doesn’t connect successfully with my Chromecast. The cast just is stuck while trying to connect and the tv screen is plain black. And then it fails.

title: Brand New User
review: Just got it and already am having issues. It crashes when I try to go to episodes, *sigh* I’m a bit disappointed. I’ll uninstall and try again later good luck to you guys! I still love this whole concept, it has a lot of my favorite shows.

title: Fix your app
